Policy: Law No. 434-VI “On social services”.
Policy_Content: This Law determines the legal, organizational and economic the basis for the provision of social services to certain categories of persons. Social service shall be intended a set of measures and actions taken to meet the individual needs of certain categories of persons, with the purpose of improving their living conditions and (or) expanding their opportunities to independently provide their basic individual needs, as well as to overcome a difficult life situation. User of social services shall be intended a person who is recognized as needing the provision of social services and to whom social services are provided. Social service providers shall be intended social service institutions, and also other legal entities, regardless of the form of ownership and (or) individual entrepreneurs providing social services. This Law applies to citizens of Turkmenistan, foreign citizens and stateless persons permanently residing in territory of Turkmenistan, refugees, as well as legal entities regardless of the form of ownership and individual entrepreneurs, operating in the field of social services. The goals of social services are: (a) promotion of equal opportunities for all members of society, aimed at strengthening social cohesion and preventing social isolation; (b) assistance to lead a decent, safe and creative life, equal participation in the public life of the state; (c) assistance to persons in overcoming difficult life situations, which they are unable to resolve with their own resources and available opportunities; (d) forecasting and prevention of the occurrence of difficult life situations; and (e) intensification of their own efforts of individuals and families, creating conditions for problem solving on their own. The main principles in the field of social services are: (a) ensuring equal opportunities for the use of social services; (b) targeting; (c) availability and accessibility; (c) voluntariness; (d) observance of the rights of users of social services; (e) provision of social services taking into account individual needs of users of social services; and (f) confidentiality. The state guarantees to individuals, families, groups of persons recognized as persons in need of social services, the possibility of using social services based on an assessment of individual needs for overcoming difficult life situations. Grounds for recognizing a person in need of social services are: (a) disability; (b) old age; (c) the consequences of an industrial injury and occupational disease; (d) loss of a breadwinner, loneliness, orphanhood, homelessness and neglect; (e) lack of a fixed place of residence; (f) forced change of the country of permanent residence; (g) victim of human trafficking; (h) consequences of violence or situations associated with a risk to life; (i) family trouble; and (j) other difficult life situations. Social services can be provided on temporary or permanent basis. This Law contains VI Chapters divided into 25 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state regulation and control in the field of social services. Chapter III establishes state guarantees in the field of social services. Chapter IV regards the particulars of the provision of social services. Chapter V establishes rights and obligations of users of social services and employees of the providers of social services. Chapter VI lays down final provisions.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 January 2022.

Policy: Law No. 435-VI “On the prevention and control of non-contagious diseases”.
Policy_Content: This Law determines the legal, organizational, economic and social basis for the prevention and control of non-contagious diseases. Non-contagious diseases shall be intended a group of health disorders, resulting from a combination of genetic, physiological, environmental and behavioral factors. Prevention of non-contagious diseases shall be intended a set of measures, aimed at preventing the occurrence of non-infectious diseases, elimination of risk factors for their development. This Law applies to citizens of Turkmenistan, and also, unless otherwise provided by law and international agreements of Turkmenistan, to those residing/staying in the territory Turkmenistan foreign citizens and stateless persons. The main directions of state policy in the field of prevention of non-contagious diseases and their control are: (a) creation of necessary conditions for life and health protection of patients with non-contagious diseases; (b) maintaining the necessary social level of vital activity of patients with non-contagious diseases at any age; (c) implementation of healthcare measures, prevention, early identification, treatment and ongoing checkup of individuals at high risk or the likelihood of non-contagious diseases to prevent health complications, reducing the need for inpatient treatment and expensive high-tech interventions, as well as reducing premature mortality; (d) ensuring equal access to the established range of services for healthcare, prevention, treatment and rehabilitation, palliative assistance and a set of basic, safe, affordable, effective and high-quality medicines and medical products in accordance with the legislation of Turkmenistan; (e) implementation of measures to improve the quality of medical care in order to prevent non-contagious diseases; (f) provision of primary specialized healthcare, including medical care on a free or preferential basis, in the order established by the legislation of Turkmenistan; (g) provision of patients affected by major non-contagious diseases with medicines and medical devices for free or preferential basis in the manner prescribed by law of Turkmenistan; and (h) scientific research in the field of forecasting and development of new methods of prevention, diagnosis and treatment of non-contagious diseases. This Law contains V Chapters divided into 21 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state regulation and control in the field of prevention of non-contagious diseases. Chapter III establishes organizational basis in the field of prevention of non-contagious diseases. Chapter IV establishes rights and obligations of patients affected by non-contagious diseases, and social protection of medical staff. Chapter V lays down final provisions.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regulation on the implementation of the Programme of support to primary agricultural producers in livestock due to difficult business conditions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Croatian Law on the agriculture, prescribes the implementation of the Support Programme for Primary Agricultural Producers in Animal Husbandry due to difficult business conditions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. Support under this Programme is granted on the basis of the Communication from the European Commission - Temporary Framework for State Aid Measures to Support the Economy in the Current COVID Pandemic 19, adopted on 19 March 2020. Measures in the implementation of the Programme are: Measure 1. Support in the cattle sector; Submeasure 1.1. Support for primary milk producers, Submeasure 1.2. Support for cow-calf cattle breeders and Submeasure 1.3. Support for fattening cattle breeders; Measure 2. Support in the pig sector, Sub-measure 2.1. Support for sow breeders, Submeasure 2.2. Support for fattening pig producers; Measure 3. Support in the sheep and goat sector; Measure 4. Support in the horse breeding sector; Measure 5. Support in the poultry sector, Submeasure 5.1. Support for the production of table eggs, Submeasure 5.2. Support for poultry meat production. Micro, small and medium-sized enterprise, among family farmers are beneficiaries of these measures.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, General
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force on the day after its publication in the Official Gazette (published on 3 December 2021).

Policy: Order No. 262/2021 approving the Regulation of the Incentive System for Companies «Promotion of Sustainable Bioeconomy».
Policy_Content: This Order approves the Regulation of the System of Incentives for Companies dealing with «Promotion of the Sustainable Bioeconomy», arising from the PRR allocation, which affects the investment TC-C12-i01 Bioeconomy. The economic and social crisis caused by the COVID-19 disease pandemic led to the adoption of a set of exceptional measures by the European Union (EU) and its Member States. In order to quickly respond to the main needs related to the recovery of EU countries, the European Council defined an expressive financial package aimed at supporting Member States in overcoming the socio-economic effects of the pandemic and in implementing effective recovery and recovery policies. promoting the resilience of national economies in a logic of sustainability. This Regulation, consisting of 21 articles and one Annex, creates the incentive system for companies "Promotion of Sustainable Bioeconomy", and aims to accelerate the production of high added value products originating from biological resources as an alternative to fossil-based materials. The "Promotion of Sustainable Bioeconomy" business incentives system is financed by the PRR, in compliance with the rules defined in Regulation (EU) 2021/241 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 12 February 2021, which creates the Recovery Mechanism and Resilience, in Regulation (EU) No. 651/2014 of the European Commission, and by the technical guidelines approved by the Mission Structure “Recover Portugal” (EMRP). The Incentive System for the Promotion of the Sustainable Bioeconomy applies to all economic activities that contribute to Integrated Projects in the following areas: a) Textile and clothing sector; b) Footwear sector; c) Natural resin.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act of 2021
Policy_Content: This Act authorizes funds for Federal-aid highways, highway safety programs, and transit programs, and for other purposes. Among others, it provides for climate change including grants for charging and fueling infrastructure; reduction of truck emissions at port facilities; carbon reduction program; congestion relief program; promoting Resilient Operations for Transformative, Efficient, and Costsaving Transportation (PROTECT) program; and Healthy Streets program. Additionally, it provides for Indian affairs, including environmental reviews for certain tribal transportation facilities; programmatic agreements for tribal categorical exclusions; use of certain tribal transportation funds; bureau of Indian Affairs road maintenance program; study of road maintenance on Indian land; maintenance of certain Indian reservation roads; tribal transportation safety needs; and Office of Tribal Government Affairs. The Act further provides for sport fish restoration and recreational boating safety; supply chains for clean energy technologies; hydrogen research and development; nuclear energy infrastructure; hydropower; solar energy technologies on current and former mine land; energy efficiency and building infrastructure; natural resources-related infrastructure, wildfire management, and ecosystem restoration; western water infrastructure; drinking water; clean water; Indian water rights settlement completion fund; wildfire mitigation; reforestation; recycling practices; bioproduct pilot program; modification of automatic extension of certain deadlines in the case of taxpayers affected by federally declared disasters; and rural minority business center program.

Policy: Decree No. 87/2021 creating the Oceanographic Institution of Mozambique (InOM).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 27 articles divided into five Chapters, creates the Oceanographic Institution of Mozambique (InOM). It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned InOM, as a collective entity of public law, scientific research, knowledge development, technology and innovation. The sectoral supervision of InOM is exercised by the Minister who oversees the areas of the sea, inland waters and fisheries and includes, namely, the following activities: a) approve the strategic lines and research policies; b) approve the Internal Regulations of InOM; c) propose the staff for approval by the competent body; d) carry out the performance control, in particular with regard to the fulfillment of the established purposes and objectives; e) suspend, revoke or cancel, under the terms of the applicable legislation, the acts of the bodies of the InOM that are contrary to the law and other normative and management instruments; f) perform disciplinary power over the members of the InOM bodies, under the terms of the applicable legislation; g) order the carrying out of inspection, inspection or auditing of the acts carried out by the bodies; h) carrying out inquiries to the InOM services; i) propose to the Prime Minister the appointment of the General Director and the Scientific Director of InOM, under the terms of the applicable legislation, etc.

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 122/2021 approving the Guidelines on Resilience to Natural Threats, Environmental and Social Safeguards for School Buildings.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order approves the Guidelines on Resilience to Natural Threats, Environmental and Social Safeguards for School Buildings. This Diploma establishes guidelines on resilience to natural threats, environmental and social safeguards for school buildings. It classifies the recurrent threats in Mozambique as follows: cyclones, floods, droughts and earthquakes. Technical measures to increase resilience to natural threats are applicable in school buildings in conventional or mixed material, under the following conditions: a) New constructions and extensions; b) Rehabilitation, consolidation or reinforcement; c) Post-disaster reconstruction. Resilience and environmental and social safeguards in school buildings aim to: a) Reduce the vulnerability of school buildings to the effects of climate change and natural disasters, integrating specific elements that improve resilience to recurrent natural threats from cyclones, floods, droughts and earthquakes; b) Guide the construction, rehabilitation, reinforcement of school buildings and post-disaster reconstruction, following technical standards that ensure their resilience against the most frequent natural threats in the respective area; c) Guide the construction, reinforcement of school buildings and post-disaster reconstruction, following standards and guidelines for environmental and social safeguards in order to ensure the protection of the environment and surrounding communities, as well as the protection of users.

Policy: Resolution No. 52/2021 approving the National Programme to Industrialize Mozambique (PRONAI).
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves of the National Programme to Industrialize Mozambique (PRONAI). This  Programme aims at contributing to the increase of national industrial production, in favour of the use of local raw materials, stimulating production, commercialization, and contributing to rural transformation and generating employment and income, in particular for young people and women. This will be carried out by increasing industrialization and productive diversification, as well as increasing the competitiveness of national companies, improving the trade balance, increasing exports and encouraging the competitive substitution of imports, increasing the GDP and the contribution of the manufacturing industry to the GDP. The result will be the increase in the labour supply and income of the population and the increase in the attraction of investments, which is structured around the contextualization, the analysis of the national industry, the industrial future, the strategy operational, financing models and monitoring mechanisms. The Programme is a Government initiative, to be implemented in partnership with the private sector, following international fund management standards.

Policy: Financial Sector (Climate-related Disclosures and Other Matters) Amendment Act 2021.
Policy_Content: The Financial Sector (Climate-related Disclosures and Other Matters) Amendment Act 2021 (the Act) amends the Financial Markets Conduct Act 2013 (the FMC Act), the Financial Reporting Act 2013 and the Public Audit Act 2001. The Act inserts a new Part 7A to the FMC Act which provides a framework to make climate-related disclosure mandatory for certain entities considered to have "higher level of public accountability" under section 461K of the FMC Act. These entities, defined climate reporting entities (CREs), are substantially publicly listed companies and large insurers, banks, non-bank deposit takers and investment managers, and are obliged to comply with certain record-keeping requirements and produce annual climate statements. The Act also establishes offences and liabilities.

Policy: Electricity Supply Act.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down the rules for the operation of the electricity market, production, transmission, distribution, storage and supply of electricity, rights and protection of final customers, methods and forms of public utilities in the transmission and distribution of electricity and the electricity market, principles and measures aimed to achieve security of electricity supply and regulates measures to prevent energy poverty and other issues regarding the electricity supply. Transposition and enforcement of European Union rules is laid down in article 2. The purpose of the Act is to ensure a competitive, secure, reliable and accessible electricity supply, taking into account the principles of sustainable development, and to establish comprehensive competitive, flexible, fair and transparent electricity markets. Electricity activities include: electricity generation, supply of electricity, electricity trading, energy storage, aggregation, system operator activity, activity of distribution operator, activity of the electricity market operator. Policy: Decree-Law No. 82/2021 establishing the Integrated Management System for Rural Fires in continental territory and defining its operating rules.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 81 articles divided into seven Chapters, establishes the Integrated Management System for Rural Fires (SGIFR) in the entire National continental territory and defines its operating rules. SGIFR is a set of structures, norms and processes of institutional articulation in the integrated management of rural fire, organization and intervention, relating to planning, preparation, prevention, suppression and relief and post-event, carried out by competent public entities in the integrated management of rural dwellings and by private entities in rural or urban land. SGIFR comprises the following intervention: a) Protection against rural fires, aimed to the safety and safeguard of people, animals and goods; b) Management of rural fire, aimed to the defense and promotion of the value of rural territories, considering their protective role by reducing the conditions for the occurrence and progression of rural fires. SGIFR is based on the principle of specialization of knowledge, using resources with adequate qualification and training for each of the axes of intervention above mentioned, ensuring the concerted action of all resources.

Policy: Updated Submission of Jordan's 1st Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC).
Policy_Content: This updated Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC) is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at (i) enhancing the Jordanian commitment to the international climate change governance system by raising its GHG emission reduction target from 14% to 31%; (ii) driving the post-COVID-19 recovery process into a lower carbon and more climate-resilient development pathway steered by national green growth priorities. Objectives and targets of this NDC document will be aligned with the Long Term Strategy (LTS) of the Government of Jordan to be developed through a new climate change policy for 2050. The document underlines the following strategies for a successful climate action (i) enhancing governance and institutional arrangements; (ii) mainstreaming NDCs in national and local planning; (iii) engaging the private sector; (iv) mainstreaming gender in NDC implementation; (v) targeting vulnerable groups in NDC implementation.

Policy_Content: These Regulations, based on the provisions of the Bulgarian Law on forests, determines the structure, functions, tasks and organization of activity of the forest protection stations. The Forest Protection Station shall be a legal entity of budget support/third-level spending unit with a budget under the budget of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food, a specialized territorial unit of the Executive Forest Agency (EAG). The forest protection station shall assist the executive director of EAG in exercising its powers in the field of protection of the forest territories from diseases, pests and other damages, including the use of plant protection products (PPP), such as: 1. render methodical and practical guidance, consult, give prescriptions and control over the protection of the forest territories from diseases, pests and other damages in its defined scope of activity; 2. assist the executive director in exercising his / her powers, ensure his / her technical activity and perform activities for administrative servicing of the citizens and the legal entities. The forest protection station shall be established and closed by an order of the executive director of EAG after coordination with the Minister of Agriculture, Food and Forestry. The forest protection station shall be financed by: 1. the state budget through the budget of EAG; 2. targeted funds provided by other financing institutions and organizations under programs and projects previously agreed with EAG; 3. donations.

Policy: State of Palestine’s First Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) - Updated Submission.
Policy_Content: These Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) is a 20-year nationwide multi-sectoral document aiming at including amendments and additions to actions than those proposed in the previous document of 2017. It is focused on climate adaptation actions, while not neglecting climate mitigation and the global objective of the UNFCCC and Article 2.1 (a) of the Paris Agreement. In comparison to the first NDC, the new conditional actions are gender responsive, time-bound, and contain measurable targets. in fact, the Palestine’s key climate goal is to reduce its climate vulnerabilities, primarily through increasing adaptive capacities, and, thereby, enhance the climate resilience of the national development process and local communities. The document follows a holistic approach: considering that the NDC actions in each sector have both positive and negative impacts on NDC mitigation and adaptation actions in other sectors, it has been developed a NDC Partnership Plan that  provides for development of NDC implementation action plans addressing the nexus between sectors, in particular  between: (a) agriculture, waste, energy, water, and food; (b) waste, water, energy, and infrastructure; and (c) transport and energy (particularly regarding electric vehicles).

Policy: Decree No. 74/2021 approving the Regulation of the National Fisheries Administration Commission (RECNAP).
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation of the National Fisheries Administration Commission (RECNAP). This Regulation, consisting of three Chapters, under Fisheries Law No. 22/2013, establishes, composition, duties and responsibilities of the National Fisheries Administration Commission (CNAP). The CNAP is the consultative body of the system of participatory management of fisheries resources at the central level, in which all interest groups involved are represented. The purpose of CNAP is to coordinate efforts for the protection, conservation and sustainable and responsible use of fishery resources and respective ecosystems. In particular CNAP is responsible to give its opinion on matters relating to: a) fisheries and aquaculture development policies and strategies; b) establishment and implementation of fisheries and aquaculture management measures; c) measures for the management of aquaculture, fishing activities and complementary to fishing; d) state of exploitation of fishery resources; e) strategies and mechanisms for monitoring, controlling and inspecting fishing and aquaculture activities; f) strategies for preventing and combating marine, river, lake and ecosystem pollution, including coastal areas.

Policy: Law No. ZRU-713 “On ensuring seismic safety of the population and territory of the Republic of Uzbekistan”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law is to regulate relations in the field of ensuring seismic safety of the population and the territory of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Seismic safety shall be intended the state of life security of the population and infrastructure facilities by state bodies and organizations in the field of seismic safety from the dangers caused by earthquakes. Seismic safety facilities by importance are classified into the following categories: I category - objects with a low hazard factor; Category II - objects with an average hazard factor; Category III - objects with a high hazard factor; Category IV - objects with a very high hazard factor. The list of seismic safety facilities by category is determined in accordance with the annex to this Law. The main directions of state policy in the field of ensuring seismic safety are: (a) improvement of the legal framework for providing seismic safety; (b) taking measures to improve the level of seismic safety; (c) monitoring and control of seismic resistance of buildings and facilities in operation, as well as leased into operation; (d) instrumental seismological  and seismometric observations on reservoirs located on the national territory; (e) monitoring the seismic resistance of reservoirs and other hydraulic structures located on the national territory; (f) introduction of modern information and communication technologies in this field; (g) improvement of scientific foundations and technologies for providing seismic safety; (h) implementation by state bodies of measures aimed at reducing harm to health and life of people and property of the population, as well as the risk of losses (material, economic and other) as a result of earthquakes; (i) development of research work and implementation in practice of modern methods of seismic hazard prediction, seismic risk and the probability of occurrence of earthquakes, as well as strengthening the seismic resistance of structures; and (j) development of international cooperation in this area. Natural and legal persons have the right to: (a) receive complete and reliable information about the level of seismic hazard in the relevant territory; (b) receive information about the rules of conduct in case of earthquakes and how to prepare for them; and (c) if necessary, to involve specialists to protect personnel and organization and teaching thereof for correct behavior during earthquakes. This Law contains V Chapters divided into 26 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state regulation in the field of ensuring seismic safety. Chapter III regards organization of activity in the field of ensuring seismic safety. Chapter IV establishes rights and obligations of natural and legal persons in the field of ensuring seismic safety. Chapter V lays down final provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Resolution of the Council of Ministers No. 120/2021 approving the action plan of the National Strategy for the Sea 2021-2030.
Policy_Content: This Resolution of the Council of Ministers approves the action plan of the National Strategy for the Sea 2021-2030. The Council of Ministers Resolution No. 68/2021 of 4 June approved the National Strategy for the Sea 2021-2030 (ENM 2021-2030), which is the main guiding legislation for maritime policies in Portugal. The ENM 2021-2030 aligns its guiding principles with the 2030 Agenda for sustainable development of the United Nations, with the European Ecological Pact, with the Integrated Maritime Policy of the European Union (EU), with the Common Fisheries Policy and with subsidiary policies, namely, the EU Biodiversity Strategy for 2030, the Prado à Prato Strategy and the Estrelado-Sea Mission 2030: Recovering our Ocean and Waters, recently presented by the European Commission. Additionally, similarly to the EU's Integrated Maritime Policy, ENM 2021-2030 incorporates all areas and sectors related to sustainable management and the economy of the sea. The action plan of ENM 2021-2030 includes 185 measures, 30 of which are considered emblematic due to their scope and high potential for multiplying effects. Some of these cover the following areas: Combat climate change and environmental pollution and protect ecosystems; Convert national fisheries by 2030 into one of the most sustainable low-impact sectors in the world, stimulating the allocation of subsidies to promote sustainable fisheries and the conservation of the marine environment; Investing sustainable food security; Facilitate access to drinking water; Promote health and well-being, etc.

State and public needs entailing expropriation of land plots include: (a) exploration and mining activities; (b) construction of highways and railways, airports, airfields, aeronautical facilities and aircraft centers; (c) construction of power systems and power transmission lines; (d) space activities; and (e) laying communication networks. Plots of agricultural land shall not be allotted for state and public needs. Policy_Content: The President, in order to provide additional support to business entities, operating in the spheres of public catering and tourism, during the coronavirus pandemic, establishes that starting from September 1, 2021 for a period until December 31, 2021 catering establishments shall be exempt from paying land tax from legal entities and tax on the property of legal entities; for a period until September 1, 2023, the accrual and payment of tourist (hotel) tax shall be suspended. Provide catering enterprises with the right to defer the repayment (payment by installments) of tax arrears turnover, income tax, tax for the use of water resources, land tax from legal entities, property tax of legal entities formed as of August 15, 2021, and fines and penalties on all taxes and fees, for the period from 1 January 2021 to 1 July 2022, in equal shares, no interest charged, with notice to tax authorities, without sending an application to the state local authorities.

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 81/2021 approving the regime and the amount of the deposit to guarantee the maintenance of the physical-chemical and biological conditions of the marine environment.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order establishes the regime and the amount of the deposit intended to guarantee the maintenance of the physical-chemical and biological conditions of the marine environment and to ensure the removal of works and/or mobile and/or fixed structures incorporated in the area assigned to the Title of Private Use of the National Maritime Zone (TUPEM) approved by Decree No. 21/2017. It applies to the National Maritime Zone and to all activities and uses subject to private titling, including areas under the jurisdiction of port entities. In addition, it aims to exclude activities that, by their nature, and, taking into account their object, focus exclusively on the protection of the national sovereignty or territorial integrity of the Republic of Mozambique. The amount of the guarantee is determined based on the formula V guarantee = M+R, where: a) The component M corresponds to the amount intended to guarantee the maintenance of the physical-chemical and biological conditions of the marine environment; and b) Component R corresponds to the amount intended to ensure, at the time of renunciation or extinction of the right of private use, the removal of mobile and/or fixed works and/or structures.

Policy: Resolution No. 134, s. 2021 of the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases.
Policy_Content: The continued implementation of proactive measures and restrictions must be put in place to slow down the surge in COVID-19 cases, stop further spread of variants, buy time for the health system to cope, and to protect more lives. Upon the recommendations of the sub-Technical Working Group on Data Analytics, the risk level classification of the National Capital Region and the province of Laguna shall be Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine beginning 21 August 2021 until 31 August 2021, without prejudice to the imposition of localized Enhanced Community Quarantine in critical areas. Likewise, the province of Bataan shall be under Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine beginning 23 August 2021 until 31 August 2021, without prejudice to the imposition of localized Enhanced Community Quarantine in critical areas. The local government units of the aforementioned areas are directed to improve their vaccination rates, their Prevent-Detect-Isolate-Treat-Reintegrate (PDITR) strategies, and their observance and compliance to Minimum Public Health Standards (MPHS).

Policy: Regional Decree No. 427-P validating the Procedure for the collection and exchange of information in the field of protecting the regional population and the territory from natural and man-made emergencies.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the procedure for collection and exchange of information in the field of protecting the regional population and the territory from natural and man-made emergencies. Information on disasters shall be intended information about events that led to harmful impact on human health and (or) death of people, material damage, violation of vital activities of the population or the emergence of a risk to environmental security, information that does not meet the criteria for information on emergency situations established by the Ministry of the Russian Federation for civil defense, emergency situations and mitigation of the consequences of natural disasters. Collection and exchange of information shall be performed by the authorized regional territorial bodies and municipal authorities in the field of protection of the regional population against natural and man-made emergencies and disasters. Depending on the purpose, the information is classified for operational and planned.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 724-P validating the Regulation on the use of waterbodies for navigation on small-size vessels.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the procedure for the use of waterbodies for navigation on small-size vessels, intended those which length should not exceed 20 meters and the total number of people on board of which should not exceed 12 people. Waterbodies on the regional territory shall be used by natural and legal persons for navigation on small-size vessels without concluding a water use contract or making a decision on allocation of a waterbody for use. The use of waterbodies for navigation on small-size vessels on navigable waterbodies and watercourses shall be authorized after the ice melts before freeze-up, and on non-navigable ones - after the flood waters decline to freeze-up. Navigation on small-size vessels shall be authorized after state registration and technical inspection thereof and subject to compliance with technical requirements set forth by the vessel’s manufacturer.

Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 8 articles and three Annexes, approves the Investment Directives for the Environment for the period 2021-2025. This Resolution approves the Investment Directives for the Environment relating to the periods from: a) 2021-2024 for municipal projects; and b) 2021-2025 for programmes and projects of the Central Administration and those presented by companies and civil society organizations. For the period 2021-2024, municipal projects that fall under the Multi-Year Public Investment Plan in the following areas are eligible for financing from the Environment Fund: a) Integrated management of urban solid waste; b) Environmental awareness; c) Basic Sanitation; and d) Animal Health. For the period 2021-2025, projects submitted by the Central Administration that fall under the Multi-Year Public Investment Plan in the following areas are eligible for financing from the Environment Fund: a) Basic sanitation; b) Integrated management of waste and hazardous products; c) Prevention of different forms of environmental pollution and environmental degradation and restoration of ecosystems; d) Wildlife protection; e) Recovery of Degraded Forest Areas; f) Environmental awareness; g) Strategic and action planning in the field of the Environment; and h) Environmental statistics and information.

Policy: Order MMA No. 414 establishing the Floresta+ Bioeconomy modality, under Order MMA No. 288 of 2 July 2020.
Policy_Content: This Order creates the Floresta+ Bioeconomy modality under the Order MMA No. 288 creating the National Programme for Environmental Services Payment (Floresta+), which will promote: recognition of the direct contribution of sustainable forestry management activities, whether timber or non-timber, for the protection of forests; the creation of commercial arrangements and encouragement of innovation to highlight, recognize and remunerate the environmental services performed by those who work in forest conservation; encouraging timber and non-timber forest production from native forests in Brazil, fostering innovation, structuring and development of this chain through Payment for Environmental Services; the incentive to pay for monitoring, conservation and recovery activities of native vegetation, enabling the guarantee of income, generating stability and incentives for the maintenance of forest areas; and entrepreneurial actions that have the potential to enhance the market for payments for environmental services. The Floresta+ Bioeconomy modality has as a guideline to encourage the bioeconomy focused on payment for the provision of environmental services, understood as a set of activities for the improvement, recovery, monitoring and conservation of native vegetation in all biomes. The strategic objectives of the Floresta+ Bioeconomy modality are: I - prospect reports, and research already available that demonstrate potential opportunities for the biomes, as well as carry out complementary diagnoses and analyzes to enrich the mapping of opportunities for the bioeconomy; II - mobilize, qualify and integrate agents of the bioeconomy, impacting sustainable regional development through payment for environmental services; III – encourage the registration of bioeconomy projects on the Floresta+ Platform to facilitate access by interested parties to financial resources originating from international cooperation, financing, aiming at boosting the bioeconomy; IV - foster the development of a bioeconomy component within the Floresta+ Programme Digital Platform; and V - recognize initiatives that generate added value to sustainable forest management activities, whether timber or non-timber.

Policy: Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) 2021.
Policy_Content: This Nationally Determined Contribution is a nationwide sectoral document that updates the NDC of 2015 by enhancing ambition by the State of Qatar towards reducing its overall emissions in response to the guidance set forth in Article 4.4 of the Paris Agreement. Qatar intends to reduce 25% of its GHG emissions by the year 2030. The document is intended for the following sectors: Energy including transport and downstream industries; building and construction industry, water management, waste, and infrastructure. To maintain development and sustainable growth, a national vision was adopted to diversify the economy. The key areas for diversification with mitigation co-benefits are as follows (i) Oil and Gas, to enhance energy efficiency as a key measure to reduce GHG emissions; (ii) Power and Water, to continue creating awareness over the issue of water and energy wastage, especially among the youth, and in reducing consumption of electricity and water per capita; (iii) transportation; (iv) Building, Construction and Industry to achieve a circular economy in the sectors by implementing recycling and re-using construction waste; (v) Research and Development focusing on key topics of sustainability in Qatar’s energy sector and in management of environmental, food and water resources and the impact of climate change on them; (vi) Education as a key player in the steering and implementation of the national long-term climate change strategies via research, technology development, policies and regulatory frameworks, monitoring, measurements, evaluation, and incentive schemes; and (vii) Tourism.

Policy: Ley Nº 2143 - Ley por la cual se dota a las Asociaciones mutualistas de identidad, autonomía y vinculación a la economía del país como empresas solidarias.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto dotar a las Asociaciones  mutualistas de un marco jurídico adecuado que garantice su identidad, su  autonomía, su vinculación activa a la economía del país y el reconocimiento por  parte del Estado como modalidades empresariales solidarias con fines de  mejoramiento social. Las Asociaciones mutualistas son  empresas de economía solidaria, de derecho privado, cuya naturaleza es sin  ánimo de lucro, inspiradas en la solidaridad, con fines de interés social,  constituidas libre y democráticamente por la asociación de personas naturales,  personas jurídicas sin ánimo de lucro, o la mezcla de las anteriores, que se  comprometen a realizar contribuciones al fondo social mutual, con el objeto de  ayudarse mutuamente para la satisfacción de sus necesidades y de la comunidad  en general, siempre en razón del interés social o del bienestar colectivo. Las Asociaciones mutualistas podrán realizar todo tipo de actividades  relacionadas con la previsión, la promoción, la protección social, así como  constituir y organizar emprendimientos asociativos para la producción de bienes  y otros servicios buscando el mejoramiento económico, cultural y social de sus  asociados y la comunidad.

Policy: Law No. ZRU-706 “On transport”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations in the field of transport. Transport activities shall be intended activities related to the implementation of organizational and technological operations for the transportation and servicing of passengers, baggage, cargo luggage, cargo, postal and courier shipments by road, rail, air, water or a combination of these modes of transport and other services performed on a contractual basis or other legal grounds. The main principles of transport activity are: (a) legality; (b) safety; (c) environmental friendliness; (d) availability and accessibility of transport services; (e) openness and transparency. The authorized state body, its territorial subdivisions, subordinate organizations are bodies of state supervision in the field of transport, which exercise state supervision over safety of navigation and operation of ships in accordance with their designation. Licensing and authorization procedures in the field of transport are used to protect the interests of clients of transport services, transport security, compliance with environmental, sanitary-epidemiological and other requirements. Transport organizations and carriers are required to plan, organize and finance environmental activities, conduct departmental and production control in the field of environmental protection and subsoil, ensure compliance with established norms for the protection of the environment and subsoil, rational use of natural resources and other criteria, regulating the maximum permissible loads on the environment and subsoil. For damage caused to the environment and subsoil, transport organizations and carriers are liable in the manner established by law.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Regulation on relevant instruments on the basis of which the inspection of a foreign vessel is performed.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Law on maritime navigation safety, determines all relevant instruments on the basis of which the inspection of a foreign vessel is performed. These instruments are based on the following (full list in article 2): 1) International convention on freight lines 1996 (LOAD LINES 66); 2) Protocol of 1988 to the International convention on load lines, 1966 (LL PROT 88); 3) International convention for the safety of life at sea, 1974 (SOLAS); 4) Protocol of 1988 to the international convention for the safety of life at sea, 1974 (SOLAS PROT 88); 5) International convention for the prevention of pollution from ships, 1973, with amendments to the Protocol of 1978 and amendments to the Protocol of 1997 (MARPOL); 6) International conventions on standards for training, authorization and watchkeeping seafarers, 1978 (STCW 78); 7) Convention on the International Regulations for preventing collisions at sea, 1972 (COLREG 72); 8) International convention on the calibration of ships 1969 (TONNAGE 69); 9) Seafarers' Labor Convention, 2006 (MLC, 2006); 10) Protocol of 1992 amending the International convention on civil liability for damage caused by oil pollution, 1969 (CLC PROT 1992); 11) International convention for the control of harmful anti-fouling systems of ships, 2001 (AFS2001); 12) International conventions on civil liability for damage caused by propellant oil pollution, 2001; 13) International convention on the control and management of ships' ballast water and sludge (BWM).

Policy: Decree No. 499 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On comprehensive measures to prevent reduction of vegetative cover in mountain and foothills around the Charvak reservoir.”
Policy_Content: In landscapes around the Charvak Reservoir, vegetation cover has been declining sharply over the last decade as a result of climate change. This process affects the strength of the soil layer and causes the amount of dust to rise rapidly into the air. In the context of global climate change, the number of recurrences of dangerous meteorological processes is characterized by rising dust and sand particles from the ground under the influence of strong winds in spring and summer and moving horizontally and vertically in its atmosphere, reducing visibility to 500 meters and causing air pollution. The scope of this Decree shall be to prevent deforestation of mountainous and foothill areas around the Charvak Reservoir, limiting anthropogenic factors affecting the reduction of vegetation cover, mitigating the negative impact of natural factors and climate change on the health of the population and creating the necessary environment for recreation with a view of increasing the tourist attractiveness of mountainous areas. The Government resolves to approve the Program of complex measures for the prevention of reduction of vegetation cover in the Charvak reservoir and the surrounding mountainous and foothill areas setting forth the following objectives: (a) to increase the number of local species of trees and shrubs in order to prevent deforestation of mountain and foothill areas and land erosion; (b) establishment of shelter trees to mitigate the effects of strong winds and dust storms; (c) regulation of livestock grazing areas and waste zones; (d) organization of large-scale scientific research aimed at studying the systemic factors influencing the reduction of vegetation cover; (e) ecology and environmental protection, public health; and (f) implementation of complex measures aimed at landscaping.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Decree No. 501 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the provision of specialized services in the field of hydrometeorology and environmental pollution monitoring.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes: (a) the procedure for providing general government operational and forecasting information to governmental agencies and organizations on the basis of joint programs for mutual data exchange, to natural and legal persons through the Open Data Portal of the Republic of Uzbekistan or the official website of Uzhydromet; (b) the procedure for providing specialized hydrometeorological information and services to all consumers using hydrometeorological data; and (c) the procedure for providing emergency hydrometeorological information in the form of information and notifications to the relevant government agencies and organizations through telecommunications, the official website of Uzhydromet and social media pages. The following main concepts are used in this Regulation: (a) general purpose data - the hydrometeorological data intended for the general use, provided to state bodies and the organizations, physical persons and legal entities according to these Regulations; (b) specialized data - information on targeted hydrometeorological and environmental pollution, which requires additional work and costs for storage, analysis, processing and presentation at the request of consumers; and (c) emergency (operational) information - information provided immediately on the occurrence of extremely dangerous hydrometeorological events that may endanger life and health of the population and (or) damage the environment and sectors of the economy and economic entities, the causes of their occurrence.

Policy: Ley Nº 2128 - Ley por medio de la cual se promueve el abastecimiento, continuidad, confiabilidad y cobertura del gas combustible en el país.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto incentivar el abastecimiento de gas combustible en el país y ampliar su utilización, con el fin de generar impactos positivos en el medio ambiente, en la calidad de vida y la salud de la población, además el acceso al servicio público, según lo establecido en la Ley Nº 1955 de 2019 que expide el Plan Nacional de Desarrollo 2018-2022 — Pacto por Colombia, Pacto por la Equidad. El Gobierno nacional, a través del Ministerio de Minas y Energía y sus entidades adscritas, dictará normas que garanticen el abastecimiento y la confiabilidad en el suministro de gas combustible en el mercado, como eje de la transición energética. Para efectos de incrementar la oferta, establecerá mecanismos que viabilicen y promuevan la producción nacional, siguiendo criterios de eficiencia, seguridad energética y responsabilidad ambiental. Para ello tendrá en cuenta la implementación de nuevas tecnologías e infraestructura disponibles que garanticen la protección del medio ambiente. No obstante, para garantizar el abastecimiento de la demanda potencial, los costos de la infraestructura de regasificación e importación que sea impulsada por el Gobierno nacional a través del Plan de Abastecimiento de Gas Natural y GLP serían asumidos por la demanda que se beneficie de la misma. Esto es, aquellos usuarios cuya disposición a pagar de mediano y largo plazo supere el costo de prestación del servicio que incluye, entre otros, el precio del gas importado, tarifas de regasificación, cargo para remunerar la infraestructura, tarifas de transporte, tarifas de distribución y comercialización.

Policy: Resolution No. 39/2021 approving the Strategy on the Concession of Areas for Oil Operations.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Strategy on the Concession of Areas for Oil Operations. The Strategy aims to regulate Petroleum Operations to ensure the continuation of systematic exploration for petroleum in the country's sedimentary basins, stimulating the national private sector to invest in petroleum exploration and production activities. In addition, it aims to promote foreign investment in exploration and production in the national territory, thus ensuring the good and efficient management of existing areas and potential resources. To achieve the objectives, the sector has identified a set of strategic options to be implemented, namely: a) define which areas are subject to public tender, simultaneous negotiation, direct negotiation and reserve negotiation; b) define the frequency of the licensing process for research areas and the respective procedures; c) define the areas subject to concession contracts for research and production or recognition; d) implement the division of areas as established by law; e) impact on the global energy transition, allowing for adaptation and mitigation of climate change; f) use petroleum resources to consolidate Mozambique's economic transformation.

Article 3 provides the list of official members. The tasks of this Coordinating Body are: giving an opinion on the proposal of the Strategy for the Protection of the Marine Environment and its constituent parts: initial assessments of the state of the marine environment, characteristics of good ecological status of the sea environment, with criteria and methodological standards for determining good ecological status marine environment, objectives and indicators for achieving and/or maintaining good ecological status of marine environment, marine monitoring programme, programme of measures for implementation, that is, maintaining a good ecological condition of the marine environment; giving recommendations and opinions in the implementation of the policy of protection of the marine environment, especially bearing in mind the process of Montenegro's accession to the European Union and the requirements of European regulations; sectoral coordination and harmonization of policies with the principles, goals and measures in areas of marine protection; making proposals of importance for the improvement of the protection of the marine environment; monitoring the implementation of obligations and reviewing reports on the implementation of the program of measures; monitoring the implementation of projects of importance for the implementation of marine environmental protection policy; coordination and connection of activities with the work of the Coordination Body for Integral coastal zone management of the permanent working group of the National Council for sustainable development, climate change and integrated management of coastal area.

Policy: Regional Law No. 194 “On the organization of environmental education and the formation of ecological culture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal foundations for the organization and development of environmental education and formation of ecological culture in the regional territory, and defines the powers of the regional bodies of state power in this field. Environmental education shall be intended dissemination of knowledge about environmental security, environmental information and use of natural resources in order to form the foundations of ecological culture, as well as informing the population about legislation in the field of environmental protection and environmental security. Ecological culture is an integral part of the universal culture, including moral values, norms of behavior, ways of interactions between people in the field of environmental protection, manifested in environmentally oriented behavior of people, awareness of personal and overall responsibility for the quality of the environment and high social importance of preventing the negative anthropogenic impact on environment. Main objectives of environmental education and formation of ecological culture shall be as follows: (a) improving environmental culture, educational level of the regional population, including improvement of professional skills and knowledge in the field environmental protection and environmental security; (b) formation of respect for the nature of the region; and (c) preservation of a favorable environment, biological diversity and natural resources. Regional state policy in the field of  environmental education and the formation of environmental culture shall be based on the following principles: (a) creating favorable  environmental education and the formation of environmental culture; (b) universality, consistency, complexity and continuity of environmental education; (c) focus on environmental education and ecological awareness for solving problems to improve the quality of life and health of citizens, preservation and restoration of the environment, resource-saving nature management; (d) openness and availability of information about the state of the environment; (e) consistency of actions of regional state authorities, bodies of local self-government, educational organizations, public associations, non-profit organizations and citizens;(e) consideration of regional characteristics, including natural conditions and resources, ecological situation, demographic situation, cultural and historical traditions of the regional population in the implementation of the regional state policy in the field environmental education and formation of ecological culture; (f) the use of historical experience in solving environmental problems of environmental education, as well as the experience of other constituent entities of the Russian Federation and foreign states; and (g) international environmental cooperation in the field of environmental education and environmental awareness in various forms.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Education,Environmental security,Public health,Local government,Public participation,Non-governmental entity,Access-to-information,International relations/cooperation

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-5200 “On additional measures for the introduction of the cluster system in the development of viticulture, state support for attracting advanced technologies in this field.”
Policy_Content: The President, in order to further develop viticulture and create in the country cluster system for growing, processing and manufacturing of finished products from grapes, supplying the population of the country with quality products, with widespread implementation of effective mechanisms of alcohol market regulation, increasing export potential and investment attractiveness of the sector, and also promotion of viticulture tourism (enotourism), to determine the main directions of development of the wine country: (a) determination of the most optimal areas in favorable areas for specialization in the cultivation of grapes; (b) development of grape cultivation as a national culture based on the national dehkan culture and values of our nation, formed over the centuries; (c) creating a value chain in the sector and by growing grapes in large areas by cluster and cooperative methods. as well as stimulation of storage, selection and processing of grapes; (c) expansion of exports by creating national brands of domestic varieties of wine and promotion thereof to new markets; and (d) scientific cultivation of grapes, development of scientific wine-growing schools in order to create new high-yielding seedless grape varieties, as well as the establishment of a close integration of science and industry. Starting from August 1, 2021 agricultural land plots (irrigated and non-irrigated rainfed lands) shall be transferred for planting of vineyards and development of viticulture on the basis of an open competition. The aforesaid land plots shall be leased for a period of 30 years based on the results of an open competition.

Policy: Law on Provision of Nationwide Fast-charging Infrastructure for Pure Battery Electric Vehicles.
Policy_Content: The Law provides for implementation of the EU Regulations regarding infrastructure of fast charging points for pure battery electric vehicles of classes M and N. According to the Law the Federal Ministry of Transport and Digital Infrastructure is in charge to provide comprehensive and need-based fast charging information and structure, determining the charging locations, number of fast charging points, the equipment and ancillary systems. The Law further provides for responsibility of this Ministry to define technical, economic and legal conditions for provision of the services through the contracts for supply, coverage, accessibility and performance of this service. The contracts shall be granted through tenders in several lots on federal or state bases. The Law further provides for the Ministry to provide every two years, starting from the year 2024, report on the area coverage, the operation and the technical equipment of the fast charging locations. The Law consists of 10 Articles as: 1. Scope of application; 2. Definitions; 3. Tasks of the Federal Ministry of Traffic and Digital Infrastructure; 4. Selection and assignment of contractors; 5. Ancillary businesses on federal motorways; 6. Existing infrastructure provider; 7. Authorisation to issue ordinances; 8. Loan; 9. Reporting; 10. Entry into force.

Se declara de interés público el desarrollo y complementación de la base gráfica registral, que es un sistema de información registral estructurado y organizado, constituido por la base de datos gráficos y alfanuméricos automatizados de predios inscritos en el Registro de Predios, a partir de la información técnica que obra en los títulos archivados elaborados sobre una cartografía base. En caso de existir discrepancia entre los certificados catastrales o planos elaborados por el verificador y la información de la base gráfica registral, prevalecerán los primeros siempre que la citada discrepancia no exceda los rangos de tolerancias catastrales aprobados por el Sistema Nacional Integrado de Catastro y su Vinculación con el Registro de Predios.

Policy: Regulation on the mandatory contribution for the promotion of agricultural and food products for taxable persons in the fruit sector for the period 2021-2023.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Slovenian Agricultural and food products promotion Act, determines the amount and start of calculation of the mandatory contribution for the promotion of agricultural and food products for taxpayers of the fruit production and processing sector for the period 2021-2023. Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 018-2021-MINAM ─ Crea el Registro de Emisiones y Transferencias de Contaminantes (RETC).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo crea el Registro de Emisiones y Transferencias de Contaminantes (RETC), como un mecanismo de gestión de información ambiental articulado al Sistema Nacional de Información Ambiental (SINIA), consistente en un inventario o base de datos de los materiales y sustancias químicas potencialmente dañinas a la salud humana, que son emitidas al ambiente y/o transferidas fuera del lugar de generación para su tratamiento o disposición final. El RETC tiene carácter informativo y no es constitutivo de derechos, por lo que no es limitativo para el otorgamiento de títulos habilitantes. El RETC tiene por finalidad facilitar el acceso público a la información sobre emisiones y transferencias de contaminantes, contribuyendo en los procesos de toma de decisiones en materia de gestión ambiental, mejorando la formulación e implementación de políticas, promoviendo la mejora en el desempeño ambiental y la competitividad del país.

Policy: Decision determining the maximum retail price of white wheat bread.
Policy_Content: This Decision determines the maximum retail price of white wheat bread, in order to prevent the occurrence of severe economic and social consequences, caused by the epidemic of the infectious diseases COVID 19. Maximum retail price is specified in article 2. Wheat white bread type (type 500) is considered bread with the following basic ingredients: wheat flour type 500, water, table salt, yeast, emulsifiers and additives. All companies, other legal entities and entrepreneurs engaged in trade with this type of bread are obliged to form related prices in accordance with this Decision. Supervision over the implementation of these indications shall be performed by the administrative body in charge of inspection supervision affairs, through performance of direct market inspection, in accordance with national legislation governing the application of supervision rules in the field of internal trade.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 023-2021-MINAM ─ Política Nacional del Ambiente al 2030.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba la Política Nacional del Ambiente al 2030, que contiene nueve objetivos prioritarios e incorpora nuevas tendencias, actualizando las prioridades ambientales y teniendo en cuenta el actual contexto global para enfrentar el problema público relacionado a la “Disminución de los bienes y servicios que proveen los ecosistemas que afectan el desarrollo de las personas y la sostenibilidad ambiental”, y de este modo garantizar el bienestar de la población. La Política se ha elaborado como parte de un proceso participativo y descentralizado, desarrollando interacciones a partir de diversas reuniones bilaterales y talleres virtuales con los representantes de las instancias del Ministerio del Ambiente, organismos públicos adscritos, sectores, gobiernos regionales, cooperación internacional y la sociedad civil que incluyó a las organizaciones de base social, comunidades nativas, comunidades campesinas y representantes de los pueblos indígenas u originarios del país.

Policy: Regulation on measures to prevent carbon leakage through national fuel emissions trading.
Policy_Content: This Regulation is enacted further to the Fuel Emissions Trading Act of 2019 with the purpose of certifying use of fuel emissions by business operators for controlling greenhouse emission, regulating sustainable economic transport and improve energy efficiency. Competent authority for implementation of this Regulation is the Federal Environment Agency. The Regulation describes conditions for grant of governmental aid to companies to avoid carbon leakage. The Regulation provides provisions on calculation of the emission annually, eligible fuel amount, competent companies, recognition of certified energy management system and climate protection measures. The regulation provides the right of investigation for the authorities over the companies applying for the state aid. This Regulation consists of 9 Sections and 28 Articles as: S1. General rules; S2. Eligible companies; S.3 Calculation of the aid amount; S.4 Business consideration; S.5 State aid proceeding; S.6 Retrospective recognition of eligible sectors; S.7 Special grading procedure; S.8 Data protection, data security; S.9 Other regulations, final provisions. Eligible sectors and sectoral compensation levels are listed at the end of this Regulation.

Policy: Supply Chain Due Diligence Act.
Policy_Content: The Act obliges enterprises with their head office, principal place of business, administrative headquarters, registered office or branches in Germany with at least 3,000 employees within Germany (decreasing to 1,000 employees as of January 1st 2024) to respect human rights by implementing certain due diligence obligations relating to their whole supply chain, including contractual partners and other (indirect) suppliers. Enterprises need to introduce and effectively implement an appropriate risk management system in the whole supply chain and across all key internal business processes. In particular, they must carry out a risk analysis and take preventive and remedial action. In addition, enterprises must set up a complaints procedure that allows those who are directly affected, as well as those who are aware of possible violations, to report human rights risks and violations. Enterprises must submit an annual report to the competent public authority on how they are meeting their due diligence obligations.

Policy: Law No. ZRU-701 “On licensing, authorization and notification procedures”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law is to regulate relations in the field of licensing, authorization and notification procedures. This Law does not apply to relations regarding: (a) the use of intellectual property objects, as well as entrepreneurial activities carried out on the basis of a complex business license agreement (franchising agreement); (b) state registration of business entities, transactions, rights and property; (c) accreditation, certification, standardization, metrology and technical regulation; (d) state environmental audit; (e) activities in the field of the use of nuclear energy; and (f) issuance of permits to natural persons not specified in Appendix No. 2 to this Law. The main principles in the field of licensing, authorization and notification procedures are: (a) legality; (b) openness of the activities of authorized bodies in the implementation of activities in the field of licensing, authorization and notification procedures; (c) priority of human rights and freedoms, legitimate interests of natural persons and legal entities, protection of life and health of citizens, protection of public safety and the environment; (d) transparency of licensing, authorization and notification procedures; and (e) implementation of licensing and authorization procedures on the principle of "single window". Licensing and authorization procedures are introduced in cases where the implementation of certain types of activities (actions) by natural persons or legal entities may entail harm to the life and health of citizens, damage to the rights and legitimate interests of natural persons and legal entities, damage to public safety and (or) harm to the environment. State institutions established by decisions of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan or the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan are entitled to carry out licensed types of activities without obtaining an appropriate license, provided that the implementation of these types of activities is provided for by decisions of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan or the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan. This rule does not exempt the specified state institutions from fulfilling license requirements and conditions. Licenses, authorizations and notifications shall be subject to registration in electronic form. Licenses shall be issued for each single type of activity listed in the Annex 1. Licenses can be model (simple) and individual. Licenses can be open-ended or, for certain types of activities, have the period of validity five years, in which case they can be extended at request of the applicant. The Law lists documentation required for obtaining license and authorization and establishes the grounds for the refusal of issuance of licenses and authorizations. Activities (actions) carried out in a notification manner include types of activities (actions) that do not require a decision by the authorized body to start activities (actions), but are carried out by accepting obligations by legal entities and natural persons to comply with the requirements established in legislative acts and conditions for ensuring state regulation, as well as keeping records of entities engaged in relevant activities, and exercising control over their activities. To carry out the types (subtypes) of activities (actions) specified in Annex No. 3 to this Law, it is required to notify the authorized body thereof. It is prohibited to introduce new types (subtypes) of activities (actions), carried out in a notification manner, not provided for by this Law. This Law contains 8 Chapter divided into 67 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards licensing. Chapter 3 regards authorization procedures. Chapter 4 regards the particulars of licensing and authorization procedures. Chapter 5 regards notification procedures. Chapter 6 establishes state control in the field of licensing, authorization and notification procedures. Chapter 7 establishes the procedure for appealing against decisions (actions) of authorized bodies in the field of licensing, authorization and notification procedures. Chapter 8 lays down the final provisions.

Policy: Act on the promotion of the use of renewable energy sources.
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the implementation of state and municipal policy in the field of renewable energy sources, sets a binding target for the share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption in the Republic of Slovenia and measures to achieve this goal and methods of financing, regulates energy sources. electricity from renewable sources, the use of energy from renewable sources and excess heat in the heating and cooling sector and the transport sector, and informing and training installers Energy from renewable sources means energy from renewable non-fossil sources, namely wind, solar (solar heat and solar photovoltaic sources) and geothermal energy, ambient energy, tidal energy, waves and other marine energy, hydropower and biomass, landfill gas, gas from sewage treatment plants and biogas. This Act regulates the participation of the Republic of Slovenia in the European Union mechanism for financing energy from renewable sources for the implementation of Regulation (EU) 2018/1999 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 December 2018 on energy union management and climate action. This Act also transposes certain  European Union directives into the legal order of the Republic of Slovenia (see article 2). Article 4 sets binding targets as follows: 1. The share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy in the Republic of Slovenia, which represents a contribution to the common achievement of a binding common EU target, shall be determined in the comprehensive national energy and climate plan; 2. The share of energy from renewable sources in the gross final consumption of energy in the Republic of Slovenia may not be less than the initial share of 25%; 3. The production of electricity, gas and heat from renewable energy sources and the construction and takeover of facilities and land necessary for it are in the public interest. Chapter XI sets inspection related provisions; Chapter XII provides for criminal provisions.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 299-a constituting protected area of regional significance state nature reserve “Upper river Viga.”
Policy_Content: Protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area state nature reserve “Upper river Viga” is constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of valuable natural complexes and objects, including habitats of endangered and protected wild fauna and wild flora species. Protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area state nature reserve “Upper river Viga” performs the following tasks: (a) maintaining the integrity of the ecological system of the watersheds of the Kostroma and Unzha rivers; (b) conservation of the bog complex, which plays a decisive role in maintaining hydrological regime of the Viga River; (c) preservation of valuable swamps and forests; and (d) conservation and restoration of habitats of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species. Protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area state nature reserve “Upper river Viga” is constituted for unlimited period of time and is classified as complex (landscape). The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area state nature reserve “Upper river Viga”: (a) haymaking; (b) grazing; (c) educational tourism; (d) recreational and sport hunting and fishing; (e) scientific research; (f) environmental protection; and (g) timber extraction and procurement of non-timber forest resources. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area state nature reserve “Upper river Viga”: (a) felling, except for selective felling and selective sanitary felling except for in case of the outbreak of foci of harmful pests and diseases; (b) application of toxic chemicals as forest protection means, also for scientific research purposes; (c) introduction of alien plant and tree species; (d) commercial hunting; (e) all types of land reclamation; (f) plowing land for agricultural purposes; (g) ruin of nests, clutches, burrows; (h) introduction of plants and animals for the purpose of acclimatization, with the exception of re-acclimatization and restoration of the number of native species; (i) any type construction not related to the functioning of protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area state nature reserve “Upper river Viga”; (j) allotment of land plots for individual housing construction, gardening or horticulture; (k) traffic off roads and established traffic routes, as well as parking of transport outside specially designated places; (l) pollution of territories and water areas; (m) storage and disposal of manure and industrial and consumption waste; (n) storage of fuels and lubricants, pesticides, mineral fertilizers, placement of cattle burial grounds, cemeteries, dumps of domestic and industrial waste; (o) destruction of hollow trees, large trees with broken tops; (p) tapping trees; (q) industrial harvesting of medicinal raw materials, moss, reeds, forest litter, bark, other technical raw materials; (r) organization of tourist routes without special flooring; (s) organization of tourist camps, bivouacs, making fires outside specially allotted places without agreement with the administration of the reserve “Upper river Viga”; (t) moving through the territory of the reserve “Upper river Viga” using tracked vehicles (with the exception of cases related to ensuring the regime of protection, forestry, reforestation and forest protection works); (u) geological study, exploration and extraction of minerals and groundwater; (v) destruction or damage of barriers, notice boards, stands and other information signs and telltales, as well as equipped ecological trails and recreation areas; and (w) causing harm to natural complexes and their components.
