Policy: Second Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC).
Policy_Content: The Second Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) is rooted in the Oman Vision 2040 and the National Energy Strategy to support a gradual transition to a low carbon economy and an energy matrix significantly lower in carbon emissions. This goal will be achieved by slowing GHG emission growth and reduce them by 7% in 2030 (4% based on national efforts, and the remaining 3% would necessitate grants and other forms of concessional financing and assistance). The process will also benefit from the co-benefits such as reduction of air pollutants', creation of jobs, and the transition to a climate-resilient economy and society. The Sultanate adopted a strategic alignment between their NDC adaptation goals with the National Adaptation Plan (NAP) process to foster the resilient climate development's coherence and efficiency. Furthermore, according to the 2040 Vision, the strategic economic direction is toward a diverse and sustainable economy anchored on technology, knowledge, and innovation that operates within integrated frameworks, ensures competitiveness, embraces industrial revolutions, and achieves fiscal sustainability.

Policy: Public Health Covid-19 General Regulations, Government Notice 144 of 2021
Policy_Content: These regulations are made in response to the global outbreak of the Coronavirus Disease. These apply during the specified period of 16th July 2021 to 31st July 2021. Essentially, the regulations provide penal sanctions for the contravention of the provisions a authorize officers to enforce same provisions. The regulations provide for a curfew of 21:00 to 04:00 for the duration. The regulations further mandate the wearing of masks and authorizes certain officers to enforce the compulsory wearing of masks in public places. The regulations further prohibit public gatherings, with specific exceptions including where the gathering is composed of members of the same family, people gathered in their workplace, a group of people independently or coincidentally find themselves at a specific place, etc. There are certain restrictions relating to the time of sell and purchase of alcohol, as well as restrictions on contact sports, nightclubs, casinos and other businesses. The regulations prevent the entry of non-citizens and people who do not hold a permanent residence in Namibia from entry into the country during the specified period. For persons allowed entry into the country, the regulations provide for such persons to be quarantined in accordance to the Public and Environmental Health Act, 2015. The Regulations allow for the operation of businesses relating to the transportation of goods and services and provides for such to be done in strict compliance with guidelines set out to suppress the spread of COVID-19.

Policy: Nationally Determined Contribution.
Policy_Content: This updated Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) is a nationwide sectoral document, in line with Article 4 of the Paris Agreement, representing an incremental contribution beyond the current efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions economy-wide between 30-35% relative to the Business-As-Usual (BAU) scenario by 2030. For this purpose, the country is committed to embark on a sustainable development pathway and undertake mitigation measures based on national circumstances and capabilities. Two documents, the National Climate Change Response Strategy (2021) and the Zanzibar Climate Change Strategy (2014) have been already developed to enhance adaptive capacity to climate change and promote adaptation action in order to support long-term climate resilience of social systems and ecosystems and to enhance participation in climate change mitigation activities to contribute to international efforts while ensuring sustainable development. These two strategies were instrumental in the formulation of this Tanzania NDC. Adaptation targets by 2030 are (i) increased access to clean and safe water for the total population in urban and rural areas from 86% and 67.7% respectively in 2015 to 100% by 2030; (ii) reduced impacts of sea-level rise to the island and coastal communities, infrastructure and ecosystems including mangroves; (iii) consider the impacts of climate change in development planning at all levels. As for the mitigation contributions, they are as follows (i) reduce greenhouse gas emissions economy-wide between 30-35% relative to the Business-As-Usual (BAU) scenario; (ii) reduce about 138 - 153 million tons of carbon dioxide. Priority mitigation sectors are energy, transport, forestry, and waste management.

Policy: Update of Israel's Nationally Determined Contribution under the Paris Agreement.
Policy_Content: This Nationally Determined Contribution is a nationwide sectoral document developed under paragraphs 24 and 25 of decision 1/CP.21 and aims to update the First NDC. This new NDC is in line with the Government Decision 171 of July 2021 entitled Transition to a Low Carbon Economy that provides for a GHG emissions reduction goal for 2050 of 85% relative to 2015. Furthermore, this updated NDC is an improvement (i) in the process by which the 2030 and 2050 national and sectoral goals were determined; (ii) in the more ambitious mitigation goal; and (iii) in the work carried out to increase preparedness and adaptation to Climate Change. The reduction of GHG emissions will concern the following sectors (i) Transport; (ii) Waste; (iii) 	Electricity Generation; (iv) Industry; (v) Climate Impacts of Goods and Services, establishing a voluntary mechanism for reporting and publicizing information on the GHG emissions.

Policy: Liberia’s Revised Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC).
Policy_Content: This revised Nationally Determined Contribution is a 10-year nationwide sectoral document aiming at reducing the economy-wide greenhouse gas emissions by 64% below the projected business-as-usual level by 2030, through a combination of the following (i) unconditional GHG reductions of 10% below BAU; (ii) an additional 54% reduction conditional upon international support. The commitment of Liberia is constructed from GHG mitigation targets across nine key sectors – Agriculture, Forests, Coastal zones, Fisheries, Health, Transport, Industry, Energy, and Waste – as well as cross-cutting targets for urban green corridors. The NDC also includes climate change adaptation targets for eight sectors – Agriculture, Forests, Coastal zones, Fisheries, Health, Transport, Energy, and Waste – as well as cross-cutting targets for urban green corridors.

Policy: Regional Law No. 647-Z “On state social assistance.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of assigning state social assistance at the expense of the regional budget. Recipients of state social assistance can be poor families, low-income citizens living alone and other categories of citizens. When determining the amount of the applicant's subsistence minimum for provision of state social assistance, shall be applicable minimum subsistence amount for the main socio-demographic groups of the population, established by the regional administration. State social assistance shall be assigned by the authorized state regional executive body in the field of social protection. State social assistance is assigned no more than once per year subject to the following conditions: (a) the recipient permanently or predominantly resides in the regional territory; (b) the recipient's income does not exceed the subsistence level; and (c) the recipient is unable for reasons beyond his control, using all the possibilities and means at his disposal, to increase his/her income to the amount of subsistence minimum.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 288-a constituting protected area of regional significance “Ivankovo swamp”.
Policy_Content: Protected area of regional significance “Ivankovo swamp” is constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of valuable natural complexes and objects, habitats of rare and protected species of wild fauna and wild flora. Protected area of regional significance “Ivankovo swamp” shall perform the following tasks: (a) preservation of representative landscapes of sandy hilly glacier plains with boreal spruce-pine forests and swamps; (b) maintaining the ecological framework of the northwestern part of the Kostroma region in the form of a strip of coniferous water protection and slope protection forests along the valleys of the Kostroma and Vochi rivers; (c) preservation of valuable forest-bog and inundable-meadow natural communities; and (d) conservation and restoration of habitats of rare and endangered species plants and animals. Protected area of regional significance “Ivankovo swamp” shall be classified as complex nature reserve, constituted for an unlimited (open-ended) period of time. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of protected area of regional significance “Ivankovo swamp”: (a) haymaking; (b) grazing; (c) educational tourism; (d) recreational and sport hunting and fishing; (e) scientific research; (f) environmental protection; and (g) timber extraction and procurement of non-timber forest resources. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protected area of regional significance “Ivankovo swamp”: (a) felling, except for selective felling and selective sanitary felling except for in case of the outbreak of foci of harmful pests and diseases; (b) application of toxic chemicals as forest protection means, also for scientific research purposes; (c) introduction of alien plant and tree species; (d) commercial hunting; (e) all types of land reclamation; (f) plowing land for agricultural purposes; (g) ruin of nests, clutches, burrows; (h) introduction of plants and animals for the purpose of acclimatization, with the exception of re-acclimatization and restoration of the number of native species; (i) any type construction not related to the functioning of protected area of regional significance “Ivankovo swamp”; (j) allotment of land plots for individual housing construction, gardening or horticulture; (k) traffic off roads and established traffic routes, as well as parking of transport outside specially designated places; (l) pollution of territories and water areas; (m) storage and disposal of manure and industrial and consumption waste; (n) storage of fuels and lubricants, pesticides, mineral fertilizers, placement of cattle burial grounds, cemeteries, dumps of domestic and industrial waste; (o) destruction of hollow trees, large trees with broken tops; (p) tapping trees; (q) industrial harvesting of medicinal raw materials, moss, reeds, forest litter, bark, other technical raw materials; (r) organization of tourist routes without special flooring; (s) organization of tourist camps, bivouacs, making fires outside specially allotted places without agreement with the administration of the reserve "Ivankovo swamp"; (t) moving through the territory of the reserve "Ivankovo swamp" using tracked vehicles (with the exception of cases related to ensuring the regime of protection, forestry, reforestation and forest protection works); (u) geological study, exploration and extraction of minerals and groundwater; (v) destruction or damage of barriers, notice boards, stands and other information signs and telltales, as well as equipped ecological trails and recreation areas; Policy: Regional Decree No. 290-a constituting protected area of regional significance state nature reserve “Formozovsky”.
Policy_Content: Protected area of regional significance “Formozovsky” is constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of valuable natural complexes and objects, habitats of rare and protected species of wild fauna and wild flora. Protected area of regional significance “Formozovsky” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of the integrity of the ecosystem in the form of connected stripes of light coniferous forests along the valleys of the rivers Vetluga, Nei, Big Kakshi; (b) conservation of representative landscapes of sandy aeolian-glacial plains with pine forests and swamp ecosystems; (c) conservation of the oldest biological research site that recorded the state of landscapes at the beginning of the 20th century, also as an indicator of global changes and regional trends in the development of natural complexes; (d) conservation of the water protection value of forests in the valley of the river Neya; and (e)  conservation of habitats of rare and endangered animal and plant species. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of protected area of regional significance “Formozovsky”: (a) haymaking; (b) grazing; (c) educational tourism; (d) recreational and sport hunting and fishing; (e) scientific research; (f) environmental protection; and (g) timber extraction and procurement of non-timber forest resources. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protected area of regional significance “Formozovsky”: (a) felling, except for selective felling and selective sanitary felling except for in case of the outbreak of foci of harmful pests and diseases; (b) application of toxic chemicals as forest protection means, also for scientific research purposes; (c) introduction of alien plant and tree species; (d) commercial hunting; (e) all types of land reclamation; (f) plowing land for agricultural purposes; (g) ruin of nests, clutches, burrows; (h) introduction of plants and animals for the purpose of acclimatization, with the exception of re-acclimatization and restoration of the number of native species; (i) any type construction not related to the functioning of protected area of regional significance “Formozovsky”; (j) allotment of land plots for individual housing construction, gardening or horticulture; (k) traffic off roads and established traffic routes, as well as parking of transport outside specially designated places; (l) pollution of territories and water areas; (m) storage and disposal of manure and industrial and consumption waste; (n) storage of fuels and lubricants, pesticides, mineral fertilizers, placement of cattle burial grounds, cemeteries, dumps of domestic and industrial waste; (o) destruction of hollow trees, large trees with broken tops; (p) tapping trees; (q) industrial harvesting of medicinal raw materials, moss, reeds, forest litter, bark, other technical raw materials; (r) organization of tourist routes without special flooring; (s) organization of tourist camps, bivouacs, making fires outside specially allotted places without agreement with the administration of the reserve “Formozovsky”; (t) moving through the territory of the reserve “Formozovsky” using tracked vehicles (with the exception of cases related to ensuring the regime of protection, forestry, reforestation and forest protection works); (u) geological study, exploration and extraction of minerals and groundwater; (v) destruction or damage of barriers, notice boards, stands and other information signs and telltales, as well as equipped ecological trails and recreation areas; and (w) causing harm to natural complexes and their components.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 289-a constituting protected area of regional significance “Susanin swamp”.
Policy_Content: Protected area of regional significance “Susanin swamp” is constituted with a view of conservation of a large wetland complex, including ecosystems of transitional and lowland bogs with valuable habitats of rare wild fauna and wild flora species, which has important water protection and water regulation value. Protected area of regional significance “Susanin swamp” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of a unique in size, set of tracts, degree of landscape diversity on the scale of the Upper Volga physical and geographical province and the Kostroma region wetland areas; (b) conservation of a large lowland bog complex, which acts as a link of ecosystem that supports the sustainable state of natural complexes of the basins of the Kostroma and Shacha rivers; (c) conservation of the swamp massif, which has a water-protective and runoff-forming value for river Shachi; (d) conservation of landscapes that have aesthetic, historical, educational and recreational value; and (e) conservation of habitats of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species. Protected area of regional significance “Susanin swamp” shall be classified as complex nature reserve, constituted for an unlimited (open-ended) period of time. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of protected area of regional significance “Susanin swamp”: (a) hunting management in compliance with the legislation on hunting and protection of hunting species (game); (b) reforestation; (c) scientific research; (d) educational activities; (e) procurement of non-timber forest resources and medicinal herbs by citizens for personal needs; (f) recreational fishing; (g) haymaking in specially allotted areas; and (h) fire prevention and forest protection measures carried out in accordance with forestry regulations. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protected area of regional significance “Susanin swamp”: (a) modification of the existing hydrological regime; (b) collection of plants in bouquets; (c) felling of forest plantations (except for felling, thinning, clearing and localization and elimination of foci of harmful organisms); (d) use of toxic chemicals for the protection of forests, including scientific purposes; (e) introduction of  alien species of trees, shrubs, lianas, other forest plants; (f) commercial hunting; (g) all types of land reclamation works; (h) plowing land for agricultural purposes; (i) ruin of nests, clutches, burrows; (j) introduction of plants and animals for the purpose of acclimatization, with the exception of re-acclimatization and restoration of the number of native species; (k) any type construction not related to the functioning of Protected area of regional significance “Susanin swamp”; (l) allotment of land plots for individual housing construction, gardening or horticulture; (m) traffic off roads and established traffic routes, as well as parking of transport outside specially designated places; (n) pollution of territories and water areas; (o) storage and disposal of manure and industrial and consumption waste; (p) storage of fuels and lubricants, pesticides, mineral fertilizers, placement of cattle burial grounds, cemeteries, dumps of domestic and industrial waste; (q) destruction of hollow trees, large trees with broken tops; (r) tapping trees; (s) industrial harvesting of medicinal raw materials, moss, reeds, forest litter, bark, other technical raw materials; (t) organization of tourist routes without special flooring; (u) organization of tourist camps, bivouacs, making fires outside specially allotted places without agreement with the administration of the reserve "Susanin swamp"; Policy: Federal Law No. 296-FZ “On limiting greenhouse gas emissions”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law defines the foundations of legal regulation of relations in the field of economic and other activities, which is accompanied by greenhouse gas emissions and is carried out on the territory of the Russian Federation, as well as on the continental shelf, in the Exclusive Economic Zone of the Russian Federation, in the Russian sector of the Caspian Sea. The scope of this Federal Law shall be to create conditions for sustainable and balanced development of the economy of the Russian Federation while reducing the level of greenhouse gas emissions. Principles for limiting greenhouse gas emissions shall be as follows: (a) ensuring sustainable and balanced development of the economy of the Russian Federation while reducing emissions greenhouse gases; (b) obligation of regular reporting by regulated organizations on greenhouse gas emissions; (c) obligation to meet the reduction targets of greenhouse gas emissions; (d) voluntary implementation of climate projects; and (e)  scientific substantiation, consistency and complexity of the approach to limiting greenhouse gas emissions. Measures to limit greenhouse gas emissions include: (a) state accounting of greenhouse gas emissions; (b) setting greenhouse gases emission reduction targets; and (c) support in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation of activities to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and increased absorption of greenhouse gases. Target for reducing greenhouse gas emissions for the economy of the Russian Federation is established by the Government of the Russian Federation in accordance with the decrees of the President of the Russian Federation and documents of strategic planning, developed within the framework of goal-setting at the federal level, taking into account the absorption of greenhouse gases in forests and other natural ecological systems and is based on the need to ensure sustainable and balanced development of the economy of the Russian Federation. The report on greenhouse gas emissions must contain information on the amount of greenhouse gas emissions resulting from economic and other activities of regulated organizations, for calendar year, as well as the initial information on the basis of which the amount of these emissions is determined. Liability for untimely submission of such a report, as well as for submission in the specified report of unreliable information is established by the legislation of the Russian Federation. State accounting of greenhouse gases emissions shall be performed in the form of maintaining a register of greenhouse gas emissions, which is a state information system, in accordance with this Federal Law, legislation of the Russian Federation on information, information technologies and protection of information and other regulatory legal acts. Russian Federation shall perform international cooperation in the field of limiting greenhouse gas emissions in accordance with generally recognized principles and norms of international law and international treaties of the Russian Federation.

Policy: Act (2021:787) on climate statement for buildings.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to reduce the climate impact when buildings are constructed. The building contractor shall be responsible for elaborating a climate statement when a new building is constructed. Barns and production premises for agriculture, forestry and similar industries are exempted from this Act. The information on the climate impacts of the building shall include: 1) supply of raw materials in the product phase; 2) transport in the product phase; 3) manufacturing in the product phase; 4) transport  during the construction phase; and 5) the construction and installation process in the construction phase. Statements shall be registered by the registration authority.

Policy: Law No. 12/2021 approving the Mining Code.
Policy_Content: This Law approves the Mining Code. This Code, consisting of 161 articles divided into twenty Chapters and three Annexes, establishes the legal regime applicable to Mining Activities in the Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste. The administration of Mining Activities relating to Minerals that are not classified as Strategic Minerals under article 6 of this Code in the Special Administrative Region of Oe-Cusse Ambeno, is the responsibility of the Regional bodies as defined. The Code has the following strategic objectives: a) guarantee the country's sustained socio-economic development through research activities; b) create employment and improve the living conditions of populations living in mining areas; c) protect the environment by minimizing the negative impact that geological-mining operations may cause to the environment, as well as its environmental recovery; d) ensure the development of national human capital through training programmes and human resources development; e) guarantee tax revenue for the State; f) ensure gender integration and combat discriminatory practices in this industry; g) combat illegal mining practices; h) establish an effective regime for granting mining rights, based on the generic principle of free access within the framework of the mining policy and strategy; i) encourage the use of national mineral resources; j) encourage the reinvestment in the country of income from the exploitation of mineral resources, etc.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 8/2021 establishing the Legal Regime for Soil Classification and Qualification.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 30 articles divided into three Chapters, establishes the Legal Regime for Soil Classification and Qualification. It establishes the criteria for classification and qualification of soils and the qualification categories of rural and urban soils within the national territory. These apply to the procedures for drawing up, amending and revising municipal territorial plans, in accordance the Basic Law for Land Use Planning. Administrative easements and public utility restrictions that affect the discipline of occupation, use and transformation of land from their own legal frameworks and which have territorial impact are duly integrated and represented in the territorial municipal plans. In areas covered by administrative easements and public utility restrictions, the respective regimes prevail over other provisions of the land use regimes of the categories to which they belong. Soil classification represents a planning option by which a fundamental distinction is made between the classes of rustic soil and urban soil, considering the nature, functions, potential and basic destination of the soil, which are defined in the municipal territorial.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2021/1119 for achieving climate neutrality (European Climate Law).
Policy_Content: This Regulation aims at achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions for Member States as a whole by 2050, mainly by regulating union-wide greenhouse gas emissions and removals, investing in green technologies and protecting the natural environment. To this end, this Regulation sets out a binding objective of climate neutrality in the Union by 2050 in accordance with the long-term objectives of the Paris Agreement, and establishes a framework for the irreversible and gradual reduction of anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions by sources and enhancement of removals by sinks regulated in Union law. In addition, this Regulation sets out a binding Union target of a net domestic reduction in greenhouse gas emissions for 2030 and 2040. The relevant Union institutions and the Member States shall take the necessary measures at Union and national level to enable the collective achievement of the climate-neutrality objective. A Union strategy on adaptation to climate change in line with the Paris Agreement shall be adopted by the Commission. Furthermore, national measures taken by the Member States, including legislation and adaptation strategies, will be assessed regularly by the Commission to check their consistency with the climate-neutrality objective or adequate to enhance adaptive capacity, in order to strengthen resilience and reduce vulnerability to climate change. This Regulation applies to anthropogenic emissions by sources and removals by sinks of the greenhouse gases listed in Part 2 of Annex V to Regulation (EU) 2018/1999. Public participation will be promoted to enable and empower all parts of society to take action towards a just and socially fair transition to a climate-neutral and climate-resilient society. Finally, this Regulation amends some Articles of the Regulation No. 2018/1999 on the Governance of the Energy Union and Climate Action in pursuit of the Union’s climate-neutrality objective, as well as the objectives and targets of the Energy Union and the long- term Union greenhouse gas emissions commitments consistent with the Paris Agreement.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Climate change,Air quality/air pollution,Energy conservation/energy production,Emissions,Precautionary principle,Protection of environment,Public participation,Enforcement/compliance,International agreement-implementation,Pollution control

Policy: Decree No. 405 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On the implementation of the system for assessing the seismic resistance of buildings and structures and formation of electronic technical passports.”
Policy_Content: This Decree determines the procedure for formation of electronic technical passports on assessment of seismic resistance of the buildings and constructions located in all territory of the country. Unified integrated platform of electronic technical passports includes buildings and structures located in all regions of the country, as well as electronic technical passports of residential (apartment) buildings and shall be regularly updated. Electronic technical passport - an electronic document containing the necessary information on the state of seismic stability of buildings and structures. Formation of electronic technical passports includes systematic collection, processing and analysis of information on the seismic resistance of buildings and structures, as well as apartment buildings. The generated electronic technical passports are used to study the seismic strength of buildings and structures, as well as residential multi-apartment houses in the presence of a seismic hazard forecast, to prepare for an expected earthquake and to mitigate its consequences. The tasks of formation of electronic technical passports are: (a) organization of regular visual and instrumental-technical inspections of buildings and structures located in all regions of the country, as well as in residential (apartment) buildings; (b) conducting research on the seismic strength of buildings and structures, including the construction and operation of buildings and structures in seismic areas, as well as monitoring of damage to buildings and structures after the earthquake; (c) collection of information on seismically weak buildings and structures, as well as residential multi-apartment houses, implementation of appropriate measures to ensure their seismic stability; and (d) prevention of damage to buildings and structures as a result of the earthquake, as well as residential multi-apartment houses, determination of the level of possible damage to their equipment, engineering and communication networks.
Subject: Environment gen.

Moreover, this Act repeals the Agricultural Marketing Corporation Act.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1098 “On federal state forest control (supervision).”
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes the procedure for organization and performance of federal state forest control (supervision). The subject of state control (supervision) is compliance by legal entities, individual entrepreneurs and citizens with the requirements established by the Forest Code of the Russian Federation, other federal laws and adopted in accordance with them other regulatory legal acts of the Russian Federation, laws and other regulatory legal acts of the constituent entities of the Russian Federation in the fields of application, protection, reproduction of forests and afforestation (including in the field of fire safety in forests), in the field of forest seeds production, with the exception of mandatory requirements in the field acceptance, transportation, processing and storage of timber and its traceability, accounting of timber and transactions therewith. State control (supervision) shall be carried out by executive bodies, their territorial bodies, state institutions subordinated thereto, within their competence in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation. The objects of state control (supervision) shall be as follows: (a) the activities of controlled persons in the field of forest management; (b) protection of forests; (c) afforestation and reforestation and afforestation; (d) production facilities: (e) forest plots, parts of forest plots, on which, inter alia, activities are carried out related to the use, protection, reproduction of forests and afforestation; and (f) means of preventing and extinguishing forest fires.

Policy: Regulation on Packaging Waste Management.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down provisions for the development and protection of the environment in a sustainable manner, relating to: (I) responsibilities and liabilities of businesses for the production and marketing of packages with certain standards, conditions and qualifications; (II) prevention of the formation of packaging waste, and reduction of the amount of unavoidable packaging waste to be disposed of by using reuse, recycling and recovery methods; (III) management of packaging wastes within a significant management system, including deposit management and zero-waste management systems; (IV) implementation of a deposit management system; and (V) activities to be carried out by the Turkish Environment Agency in line with its duties and authorities in the management of packaging and packaging wastes. This Regulation shall apply to all packages and their wastes released in the market. This Regulation aims to ensure the collection of packaging wastes within the scope of the zero-waste management system in line with the provisions of the Zero Waste Regulation. Furthermore, the responsibilities and liabilities of individuals and businesses are determined within the Polluter Pays Principle and Extended Producer Liability concepts. The mandatory deposit management will be implemented as of 1 January 2022 for glass, polyethylene terephthalate and aluminum packages of drinks. Moreover, this Regulation sets out specific targets for recycling and recovering in general as well as for certain types of products.

Keyword: Waste management,Waste prevention,Waste disposal,Protection of environment,Recycling/reuse,Business/industry/corporations,Polluter pays principle,Pollution control,Liability/compensation

Policy: Loi du 25 juin 2021 portant création d’un pacte climat 2.0 avec les communes et portant modification de la loi modifiée du 15 décembre 2020 relative au climat.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de continuer de promouvoir l’engagement climatique des communes dans le cadre de la réduction des émissions de gaz à effet de serre, de l’adaptation au changement climatique et de la transition vers une gestion efficace des ressources au niveau communal. À cette fin, l’État est autorisé à subventionner, pendant la période du 1er janvier 2021 au 31 décembre 2030, selon les modalités de la présente loi, les communes s’engageant par la signature d’un pacte climat 2.0 à mettre en oeuvre sur leur territoire un programme d’action climatique sanctionné par l’attribution de la certification « European Energy Award ». En plus, cette loi modifie l’article 14, paragraphe 1er, numéro 3° de la loi modifiée du 15 décembre 2020 relative au climat est modifié, pour l'adapter à ses dispositions.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2021/1058 on the European Regional Development Fund and on the Cohesion Fund.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down rules for the tasks, specific objectives, thematic concentration of and scope of support from the Cohesion Fund and the European Regional Development Fund with regard to the Investment for jobs and growth goal and the European territorial cooperation goal. The specific objectives are: (I) a more competitive and smarter Europe by promoting innovative and smart economic transformation and regional ICT connectivity, (II) a greener, low-carbon transitioning towards a net zero carbon economy and resilient Europe by promoting clean and fair energy transition, green and blue investment, the circular economy, climate change mitigation and adaptation, risk prevention and management, and sustainable urban mobility, (III) a more connected Europe by enhancing mobility, (IV) a more social and inclusive Europe implementing the European Pillar of Social Rights, and (V) a Europe closer to citizens by fostering the sustainable and integrated development of all types of territories and local initiatives.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2021/1057 establishing the European Social Fund Plus (ESF+) and repealing Regulation (EU) No 1296/2013.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the European Social Fund Plus (ESF+) for the period 2021 to 2027 to support investments in people and systems in the policy areas of employment, education and social inclusion. The ESF+ aims to support Member States to ensure equal opportunities and access to the labour market, fair and quality working conditions, social protection and inclusion, in particular focussing on quality and inclusive education and training, lifelong learning, investment in children and young people and access to basic services. The specific objectives of the ESF+ are: (I) improving access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups, (II) modernizing labour market institutions and services to assess and anticipate skills needs, (III) promoting an equal participation labour market with a gender-sensitive approach, equal working conditions, and a better work-life balance, (IV) improving the quality, inclusiveness, effectiveness and labour market relevance of education and training systems, (V) promoting equal access to and completion of quality and inclusive education and training, in particular for disadvantaged groups, (VI) promoting the socio-economic integration of marginalised communities and third-country nationals, (VII) enhancing equal and timely access to quality, sustainable and affordable services, (VIII) promoting social integration of people at risk of poverty or social exclusion, including the most deprived persons and children, (IX) providing food and/or basic material assistance to the most deprived persons, including children, and taking accompanying measures supporting their social inclusion. ESF+ contributes to the promotion of equality between women and men to foster equality of treatment and opportunities between women and men in all areas. Moreover, this Regulation will contribute to mainstream climate actions and to the achievement of an overall target of 30 % of Union budget expenditure supporting climate objectives.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Entry into force notes: This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union and shall apply from 1 January 2021 with regard to the Employment and Social Innovation strand.

Performance of measures for the maintenance and preservation of ameliorative forest plantations located on land plots non transferred to third parties, is carried out by the regional state budgetary institutions subordinated to the authorized body in accordance with the requirements established by the legislation of the Russian Federation and the regional legislation. Selective cutting and clear cutting of trees and shrubbery in ameliorative protective forest plantations shall be authorized in the following cases: (a) construction, reconstruction and operation of power lines, communication lines, roads, pipelines, other linear objects and constructions, that are an integral technological part of the above facilities, unless it is not prohibited or restricted by the legislation of the Russian Federation and the regional legislation of Stavropol Territory – in accordance with authorization; and (b) prevention and elimination of emergency situations of natural and technogenic character – no authorization required.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2629-OZ implementing some provisions of the Federal Law No. 490-FZ “On apiculture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues in the field of apiculture on the regional territory. In particular, it delimits powers of the regional bodies and establishes the forms of state support of apiculture. Regional Legislative Assembly shall have the following powers: (a) adoption of regional laws; and (b) control over implementation of regional legislation and compliance therewith. Regional Government shall have the following powers: (a) validation of regional state programs in the field of agriculture; (b) determination of the authorized regional state body in the field of apiculture; and (c) validation of the procedure for legalization and keeping veterinary and sanitary certificate of apiary. Regional state executive body authorized in the field of apiculture shall have the following powers: (a) elaboration and implementation of regional state programs in the field of apiculture; and (b) implementation of other powers in the field of apiculture, envisaged by federal and regional legislation. The forms of regional state support of apiculture shall be as follows: (a) information beekeepers; (b) assistance in the creation of marketing (trade), processing, service, consumer and other agricultural cooperatives; and (c) assistance in the development of apiculture by creating favorable organizational, legal, environmental and other conditions for apiculture production, including the provision of scientific and technical developments and technologies.

Policy: Decree (2021: 664) on support for energy efficiency in apartment buildings.
Policy_Content: The present Decree lays down rules on economic support for energy efficiency measures in apartment buildings. Support may only be given to property owners, holders of plot rights and owners of buildings that belong to someone other than the property owner. Support may only be provided for a building that: 1. predominantly contains residential flats leased with a tenancy, cooperative tenancy or tenant-ownership; and 2. has an energy performance which, expressed as a primary energy figure, exceeds 100 kWh / m2 and year. Further, support may only be given if the person implementing the measures contributes to training new professionals in the construction sector through active collaboration with relevant upper secondary schools and the Swedish Public Employment Service and by receiving apprentices in completed education. Specific rules are contained on eligible actors and eligible buildings; eligible measures; calculation of the amount of the support; filing an application for support; deciding on an application for support; etc.

Policy: Act (2021:579) on the prohibition of unfair trading practices when purchasing agricultural and food products.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to protect suppliers of agricultural and food products against certain unfair trading practices. It applies to purchase of agricultural and food products if the buyer or supplier is established in Sweden and the buyer: 1. Has an annual turnover of more than EUR 2 million; or 2. is an authority established in the European Union. The Act does not apply to consumer purchases. Section 5 contains a list of prohibited trading practices, which include the cancelling of an order with less than 30 days notice; unilaterally enforcing a change in the terms of an agreement; requiring payment from the supplier for things that are not linked to the supplier's sales; not complying with the supplier's request to receive a written confirmation of the terms of a contract; etc. Section 12 contains a list of trading practices that are prohibited unless the parts have clearly agreed otherwise. The Act contains rules on supervision, offences and penalties.

Policy: Order No. 1348 on port reception facilities for waste from ships, waste delivery and port's waste planning.
Policy_Content: This Order lays down rules on port reception facilities for the delivery of waste from ships. Por reception facilities for waste from ships and cargo residues from ships shall be established in every Danish port. This Order covers all ships calling at a Danish port regardless of their flag, and all waste on board in such ships. The Danish Environmental Protection Agency may also order companies mentioned in Section 2 to establish port reception facilities for oil mixed ballast and tank washing waste. The por operator shall be responsible for establishing port reception facilities for the delivery of waste. The shipmaster of a ship calling at a Danish port is obliged to ensure that all waste transported by the ship is delivered to the port's reception facility in accordance with the relevant discharge standards laid down in the MARPOL Convention. A notification shall be given on the quantity and type of waste the ship is expected to have on board at call. The port operator shall draw up a plan for the reception and management of waste from ships, referred to in the Order as Waste Plans. Supervision and control of compliance with the provisions of this Order shall be the responsibility of the Danish Environmental Protection Agency.

Policy: Kuwait National Implementation Plan to the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants
Policy_Content: This National Implementation Plan is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at (i) describing the actions that Kuwait has undertaken regarding the inventory, management, and reduction of the presence of POPs; (ii) proposing actions that Kuwait will undertake in order to manage and eliminate POPs, as well as for preventing these chemicals from entering the environment; (iii) informing the Conference of the Parties and Kuwait’s stakeholders about the national initiatives and projects designed to meet the requirements of the Stockholm Convention. The overall objective of the sound management of POPs and hazardous chemicals, is to strengthen the national capacity and capability to deliver a comprehensive assessment of the threats posed by chemicals, reduce and where possible, eliminate the exposure of the populations and the environment, to POPs and hazardous chemicals. Consequently, it is necessary to (i) eliminate or reduce POPs releases; (ii) carry out environmentally sound management of stockpiles of POPs containing wastes and contaminated sites that pose risks to human health and the environment; (iii) integrate environmental considerations and pollution prevention into the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) of the 2030 Sustainable Development Agenda. The current NIP has assessed the 28 POPs listed up to 2017 (COP8) and also includes dicofol (POP 29) listed in 2019 (COP9), while excludes PFOA, also listed in 2019. The document includes cross-sectoral issues, such as gender considerations, considering that efforts to ensure sound management of chemicals, including POPs have important gender dimensions, because in daily life, men, women, and children are exposed to different kinds of chemicals in varying concentrations. Time frames for its implementation are short-term (2 years and less), medium-term (3 to 5 years) and long-term (10 years).

Policy: National Five Year Development Plan 2021/22–2025/26.
Policy_Content: This Third National Five Year Development Plan (FYDP III) for the period 2021/2026 is a nationwide multisector document aiming at achieving the goals set in the National Development Vision 2025. The main areas included in the Plan are (i) increasing the country’s capacity for production; (ii) building a competitive economy that will stimulate the country’s participation in trade and investment; and (iii) stimulate human development. In achieving the priority areas of the Plan, the strategic objectives of the FYDP III are (i) improve key productive infrastructures including roads, railways, water, and air transport as well as reliable access to energy; (ii) strengthen the business and investment enabling environment through effective policies to facilitate free private-sector competition; and (iii) improve and strengthen education and training systems, including reforming the education curriculum in line with labor market demand as well as integrating research and development with productive economic activities. To achieve these objectives, main efforts will be directed to (i) identification of interventions designed to improve the competitiveness of the country (also through a transformative participation of the private sector and non-state actors in the competitive economy); (ii) interventions to further deepen industrialization; (iii) trade and investment to increase Tanzania’s participation in global and regional trade; (iv) social development, emphasizing coverage, equity and quality of services to attain inclusive economy; and (v) skills development.

Policy: This Regional Law No. 746-OZ “On powers of the regional public authorities in the field of biological security.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes powers of the regional Legislative Assembly, the Regional Government and of the region al executive bodies in the field of ensuring biological security. Regional Legislative Assembly shall adopt regional laws and shall exercise control over the implementation thereof. Regional Government shall take part in the implementation of state policy of the Russian Federation in the field of ensuring biological security, nomination of the authorized regional executive bodies in the field of ensuring biological security and coordination of the activities thereof. Regional executive bodies shall exercise the following powers: (a) planning and implementation of anti-epidemic, anti-epizootic, anti-epiphytic measures; (b) monitoring of biological risks; (c) information of local government and the population of the measures aimed at ensuring biological security; and (d) acceptance of proposals from citizens on measures to ensure biological security on the regional territory.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 379-VI “On public-private partnership.”
Policy_Content: The objectives of this Law are to regulate relations in the field of public-private partnership, as well as the creation of legal conditions for the concentration of material, financial, intellectual, scientific, technical and other resources, ensuring a balance of interests and risks, attraction of funds from extra-budgetary sources for the implementation of projects, plans and development programs related to infrastructure facilities. Public-private partnership shall be intended legally formalized for a certain period mutually beneficial cooperation between public and private partners, based on combining their resources for the preparation and implementation of a public-private partnership project. State partner shall be Turkmenistan, on behalf of which operate executive bodies, as well as other bodies (organizations) authorized by the Cabinet of Ministers of Turkmenistan. Private partner shall be intended a legal entity (except for a legal entity, in the authorized capital of which a share, exceeding 50 percent belongs to the state), foreign organization and natural persons engaged in entrepreneurial activity without forming a legal entity - an individual entrepreneur who is a party to a public-private partnership agreement. The basic principles of public-private partnership are: (a) the rule of law; (b) the social orientation of the regulation of economic activity; (c) fair competition; (d) ensuring a balance of interests and risks between public and private partners; (e) equality of rights for public and private partners; (f) environmental protection; (g) transparency of rules and procedures in the implementation of public-private partnerships; and (h) the effectiveness of public-private partnership projects. The main directions of state policy in the field of public-private partnership are: (a) stimulating economic growth and ensuring sustainable development of Turkmenistan; (b) implementation of state programs in the field of public-private partnerships; (c) assistance in the formation, restoration, operation, maintenance of socio-economic infrastructure; (d) improving the quality of operation and maintenance of socio-economic infrastructure; (e) digitalization and improvement of the quality of public services, as well as expanding access to them; (f) creating conditions for attracting private sector finance, including foreign investment; and (g) state support for scientific research, the introduction of modern methods and technologies for the development and improvement of the institutional and legal foundations of public-private partnerships. This Law consists of IX Chapters divided into 38 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II establishes state regulation of public-private partnerships. Chapter III determines the parties to public-private partnership agreements, rights and obligations thereof. Chapter IV regards initiation and preparation of the projects of public-private partnerships. Chapter V regards selection of a private partner. Chapter VI defines public-private partnership agreement. Chapter VII establishes guarantees of the rights of private partner and creditor. Chapter VIII regards monitoring and reporting of project implementation of public-private partnership. Chapter IX lays down conclusive provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., General
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Resolution of the Council of Ministers No. 68/2021 approving the National Strategy for the Sea 2021-2030.
Policy_Content: This Resolution of the Council of Ministers approves the National Strategy for the Sea 2021-2030. The sea is one of the most important identity marks of Portugal. A healthy ocean is a fundamental condition for Portuguese society to benefit from, including the sustainable, circular and inclusive blue economy. In a decade marked by the imperative of global threats, such as climate change, loss of biodiversity and ecosystem integrity, new forms of pollution and ocean acidification, Portugal is called to play an active role in the search for global solutions. Scientific research allows us to identify ways to protect vulnerable species and ecosystems, safeguard cultural heritage and optimize economic activities, working as an engine for innovation, which is fundamental for economic development and job creation. The security dimension is crucial to respond to threats, preventing and acting in situations that put the marine environment, economic activities and human life at sea at risk. Thus, the vision of this strategy is based on promoting a healthy ocean to enhance sustainable blue development, the well-being of the Portuguese. Strategic objectives for the decade: Portugal and the world are facing major global challenges today and in the next 10 years. Climate change, the over-exploitation of the planet's natural resources and the decline of its biodiversity, hunger and thirst, human and ecosystem health and the loss of goods and knowledge linked to cultural heritage are actual challenges.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2181-OZ “On some issues of the development of beekeeping.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues in the field of development of beekeeping attributed to the powers of public authorities of constituent entities of the Russian Federation. The powers of the Regional Legislative Assembly in the field of beekeeping shall be as follows: (a) adoption of regional laws in the field of beekeeping development; (b) control over implementation of regional laws in the sphere of beekeeping; 2) control over the implementation of the laws of the region in the sphere of beekeeping development; (c) other powers of the regional legislative (representative) body in the field of beekeeping, stipulated by normative legal acts of the Russian Federation and regional laws. The powers of the Regional Administration in the field of beekeeping development shall be as follows: (a) validation of regional state programs related to the development of beekeeping; (b) determination of authorized regional executive bodies in the field of beekeeping development; (c) other powers of the supreme regional executive body in the field of beekeeping development envisaged by normative legal acts of the Russian Federation and other regional normative legal acts. Policy: Loi du 31 mai 2021 modifiant la loi du 15 mai 2018 relative à l’évaluation des incidences sur l’environnement et modifiant : 1° la loi du 18 juillet 2018 concernant la protection de la nature et des ressources naturelles ; 2° la loi modifiée du 19 décembre 2008 relative à l’eau ; 3° la loi modifiée du 10 juin 1999 relative aux établissements classés.
Policy_Content: La présente loi modifie plusieurs textes contenants dispositions pour la protection de l'environnement. En particulier elle contienne des modifications de la loi du 15 mai 2018 relative à l'évaluation des incidences sur l'environnement (articles 1,3,5, 7, 8, 9, 14, 15, 17, 20, 22, 35). Aussi le titre de l'Annexe est remplacé. Quant à la loi du 18 juillet 2018 concernant la protection de la nature et des ressources naturelles, les articles 60 (concernant les autorisations de constructions) et 61 (concernant le résumé des résultats des consultations et des informations recueillies conformément à la loi du 15 mai 2018 relative à l'évaluation des incidences sur l'environnement) sont modifiés. L'article 23 de la loi modifiée du 19 décembre 2008 relative à l'eau est modifié de la même manière. Enfin, l'article 13 de la loi modifiée du 10 juin 1999 relative aux établissements classés est modifié. L'article concerne les décisions portant autorisation, actualisation ou refus d'autorisation pour les établissements soumis à évaluation des incidences sur l'environnement.

Policy: Regional Law No. 33-OZ “On state support of agricultural production.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the field of state support of agricultural production on the regional territory. Agro-industrial complex shall be intended aggregate of agricultural commodity producers, organizations and individual entrepreneurs, carrying out primary and (or) subsequent processing of agricultural commodities and trade thereof, providing services (performing work) in the field of animal husbandry, crop production, veterinary medicine, technical and other types of services, scientific organizations and educational organizations providing training of personnel in the field of agriculture, whose activities are interconnected with each other in technological, economic and organizational relationship. Recipients of state support shall be the following categories: (a) agricultural producers; (b) organizations and individual entrepreneurs performing primary and (or) subsequent processing of agricultural commodities and trade thereof; (c) organizations and individual entrepreneurs providing services to agricultural producers, which include in accordance with the All-Russian Classifier of Types of Economic activities ancillary activities in the field of crop production and post-harvest processing of agricultural commodities, including field preparation, sowing, cultivation of crops, harvesting, protection of plants from agricultural pests, preparation of crops for storage and trade on the market, and storage of agricultural commodities; (d) other organizations and individual entrepreneurs of agro-industrial complex; (e)  persons filling the positions of heads of agricultural organizations; (f) workers of the agro-industrial complex, including young specialists; and (g) citizens of the Russian Federation living and working in rural areas or who have expressed a desire to move to a permanent residence in rural areas and work there. State support shall be granted in the following forms: (a) provision of financial support; (b) provision of support in the development of human resources potential; and (c) provision of information and extension services.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 46/2021 establishing principles and rules for the activity of Energy Service Companies (ESE).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 30 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes principles and rules for the activity of Energy Service Companies (ESE). In particular it: a) Creates the conditions for the development of a highly specialized ESE market that can provide its services with quality, safety and effectiveness; b) Establishes the legal regime applicable to the ESE, regulating the access and exercise of the activity; c) Defines the general guidelines that should guide the performance of energy audits, the preparation of Energy Sustainability Plans (PSE) and Energy Performance Contracts (CDE); and d) Provides for the creation of the Energy Services Management System (SIGSE). The Statute applies to all private entities that wish to provide energy services to final consumers, in particular energy efficiency services and local energy production services, based on CDE. It also applies to the final consumer of energy and signatory of a CDE, who is an individual, collective, public, private or cooperative entity.

Policy: Regional Order No. 41-P of the Forestry and Hunting Agency validating the Regulation on the procedure of registration of conservation obligation related to nature monuments of regional significance.
Policy_Content: This Regional Order establishes the procedure of registration of conservation obligation related to nature monuments of regional significance. The Agency shall draw up conservation obligations for nature monuments on the basis of proposals received from owners and tenants of land plots on which nature monuments are located, who undertake obligations to ensure the regime of special protection of nature monuments. Draft conservation obligation is prepared by the specialists of the authorized structural subdivision of the Agency in accordance with the form contained in the Annex. Conservation obligation shall be executed in two copies (one copy for each party).  Conservation obligation is signed by the Head of the Agency or a person acting on his/her behalf and certified by a seal. Conservation obligation is sent to the conservatory person for review and signing in two copies by registered mail with notification within 5 working days or is delivered against signature directly to the conservatory person. Conservatory person shall review and sign the conservation obligation within 10 working days. After signing by the conservatory person, one copy of the signed conservation obligation shall remain with the conservatory person, while the second copy shall be sent to the Agency within 5 working days by registered mail with notification. Annex 1 contains Model form of certificate of nature monument of regional significance.

Policy: Regional Law No. 745-OZ “On regulation of some issues related to apiculture.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of apiculture. The main directions of the regional policy in the development of apiculture shall be as follows: (a) stimulating the development of beekeeping in the region, increasing the number of physical and legal persons involved in apiculture; (b) preservation and multiplication of honey yielding wild plants that are sources of apiculture; (c) education of careful attitude to bees, protection of bees; and (d) other areas in accordance with the federal legislation. Financial support of apiculture in the form subsidies shall be allocated from the regional budget. The placement of stationary apiaries by natural and legal persons involved in apiculture on land plots belonging to them by right of ownership or other rights, envisaged by the Russian Federation, as well as on land of forest fund shall be performed in accordance with the Russian forest and land legislation in conformity with veterinary regulations. In order to ensure productive keeping of bee families and effective pollination of agricultural entomophilous plants natural and legal persons involved in apiculture have the right to place non-stationary (nomadic) apiaries near honey collection sources. The placement of non-stationary apiaries shall be performed in accordance with the Russian forest and land legislation in conformity with veterinary regulations. The owner of an apiary shall be issued veterinary and sanitary certificate. The issuance of veterinary and sanitary certificate shall be performed at the location of the apiary.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 783 validating Requirements for the content of the action plan for reproduction of agricultural land fertility and the procedure for its preparation.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree sets out requirements for the content of the action plan for reproduction of agricultural land fertility and establishes the procedure for its preparation. Action plan is drafted in the form of a single document consisting of text and tabular sections. The textual part of the plan shall contain: (a) information about the owner of the land plot, land tenant, landlord and lessee of agricultural land plot, on which in the corresponding year in accordance with federal state budgetary institutions subordinate to the Ministry of Agriculture of the Russian Federation, were performed soil, geobotanical and other surveys of agricultural land related to: (1) for physical person - surname, name and patronymic (the last - if available); (2) for legal entity - full or abbreviated (if any) name, main state registration of the identification number of the legal entity, the date of its assignment and the name of the body, which made the decision to register a legal entity; and (3) for individual entrepreneur, peasant (farm) economy, created without the formation of a legal persons, - last name, first name and patronymic (the last - if any), main state registration number of the record of an individual entrepreneur, taxpayer identification number; (b) postal and e-mail addresses provided by the owner of land plot, land tenant, land owner and lessee of agricultural land plot, but in case of failure to provide information by the specified persons about address - legal address (for a legal entity) or location address/residence (for physical person); (c) list of the surveys carried out, the period of their performance, surveyed area; (d) results of the surveys (list of surveyed indicators of the state of agricultural land fertility; (e) comparative analysis of survey results (if available results of previous surveys); and (f) substantiation for the performance of arrangements. The tabular part of the plan is a schedule of implementation of activities, which shall contain: (a) serial number of the land plot destined for planned arrangements; (b) location of land plot; (c) cadastral number of land plot; (d) land area (hectares); (e) list of arrangements; (f) works performed within the framework of the performance of arrangements; and (g) the timing of the arrangements.

Policy: Resolution no. 19/2021 approving the Statute of the Public Institute of Cereals of Mozambique (ICM, IP).
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Statute of the Public Institute of Cereals of Mozambique (ICM, IP). This Statute, consisting of 35 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of ICM entitled to develop the value chain of agricultural marketing, by intervening as a buyer of last resource, management of storage, conservation and agro-processing infrastructures, as well as the promotion and coordination of the constitution of strategic reserves. In particular, ICM, IP is responsible for: a) promoting the structuring, and modernization of the value chain of agricultural commercialization of cereals, legumes and oilseeds with an impact on the development of the agro-industry and on the balancing of import and export with national production and consumption; b) management of infrastructure to support the agricultural marketing value chain; c) promotion and management of alternative financing solutions for the agricultural marketing and rural trade value chain; and d) promotion, coordination and establishment of strategic reserves of cereals, legumes and oilseeds for food security for food security.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2021/819 on the European Institute of Innovation and Technology.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the European Institute of Innovation and Technology, in order to contribute to sustainable Union economic growth and competitiveness by reinforcing the innovation capacity of the Union and Member States in order to address major challenges faced by society. Policy: Investment Law No.18 of 2021.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 51 articles divided into XII Chapters aims at (i) creating a competitive investment environment to attract capital and benefit from various expertise and specializations; (ii) expanding the production base to increase job opportunities and raising economic growth rates, which will have a positive impact on the increase in national income, leading to comprehensive and sustainable development; (iii) simplifying the procedures to obtain a license from the Syrian Investment Authority, whose main feature is tax exemptions for projects of national interest. Article 6 establishes the Supreme Investment Council, chaired by the Prime Minister, with the following main powers (i) studying and approving investment proposals; (ii) making decisions related to dealing with cases related to investors' problems; (iii) proposing the creation of special economic zones after coordination with the concerned authorities; (iv) studying and approving the procedures manuals; (v) studying and updating project licensing mechanisms in coordination with the concerned authorities; (vi) canceling exemptions, benefits or facilities granted to the project; (vii) procedural matters related to the work of the Syrian Investment Authority, a public body of an administrative nature established under article 8 that replaces the newly created in 2007 with its rights and obligations. Article 16 establishes the Investor Services Center which includes representatives of all public agencies concerned with investment, and acts as a single window for investment as well as (i) receiving and studying investor requests for an investment license; (ii) issuing all the licenses and approvals necessary to start the project; (iii) granting an investment license to start implementing the investment project; (iv) providing technical support, advice, data and information necessary to the investor throughout the life of the project; (v) registering companies and issuing records with the concerned authorities. The incentives provided by the Law regard (i) customs incentives (art.20); tax incentives (art.21); non-tax incentives (art.22). The tax and customs duty incentives in certain cases reach the level of complete tax exemption for a project. Development projects will benefit from a 75% discount on income taxes for 10 years. Some industrial projects benefit from exemptions ranging from 50% to 75% on income taxes, including those about technology, medicine, pharmaceuticals, renewable energy, waste recycling, and crafts. Imports of equipment, machinery, assembly lines, and transport systems will be processed free of duties and tariffs. Agricultural projects will not be taxed on profits.

Policy: Resolution No. 18/2021 approving the Statute of the Regional Administration of Águas do Sul, Public Institution (ARA-Sul, IP).
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Statute of the Regional Administration of Águas do Sul (ARA-Sul, IP). The ARA-Sul, IP, is a public authority aimed at the operational management of water resources and provision of category A services, endowed with legal personality. Geographical limits of ARA-Sul, IP territory extend from the Southern Border to the Save River basin (inclusive), with headquarters in Maputo Province. ARA-Sul, IP, is competent for Water Basin Management Divisions, Project Offices and other forms of representation in the area under its jurisdiction. The attributions of ARA-Sul, IP are: Management of hydrographic basins, with a focus on land occupation plans and protection zones for the water domain; Preparation of zoning maps and technical annexes in close coordination with the environmental sector, in the territorial planning component, in order to guarantee the standardization of land registration; Management and inspection of partial and total protection areas on the banks of rivers, lakes, reservoirs and lakes and authorization of projects that can be developed in these areas without prejudice to the public interest; Inventory of water resources and water needs to update the National Water Resources Register; Collection, processing, analysis and storage and systematic dissemination of hydro-climatological information; Update of the National Water Resources Information System; Issuance of Licenses and Concessions for the use and use of raw water, authorizations for effluent discharges; Implementation of measures to protect water resources; Definition and implementation of structural measures aimed at defense against floods and floods and drought mitigation; Approval and inspection of hydraulic works, etc.

Policy: Ley 11/2021, de 14 de mayo, de recuperación de la tierra agraria de Galicia.
Policy_Content: La presente ley tiene como finalidad la recuperación de las tierras agrarias de Galicia para uso agrícola, ganadero y forestal, sin limitarse a enunciar estos valores con carácter genérico, sino que forman parte fundamental de las medidas y de las propuestas contenidas en su articulado. Así, el apoyo a la actividad agrícola y a los ingresos de las explotaciones agrarias familiares, y singularmente a las mujeres agricultoras, el fomento de la aplicación de prácticas agrícolas que contribuyan al mantenimiento de los ecosistemas e incrementen la capacidad de adaptación al cambio climático, el fomento de la gestión forestal sostenible y activa y la lucha contra la degradación y el abandono de los suelos agrarios son a la vez cuestiones transversales presentes en la ley y ejes fundamentales del Pacto verde europeo, muy especialmente de la Estrategia «De la granja a la mesa» incluida en él, así como de la Acción por el clima y de la nueva Estrategia forestal de la Unión Europea.

Policy: Ley Nº 27.621 - Ley Para la Implementación de la Educación Ambiental Integral en la República Argentina.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce el derecho a la educación ambiental integral (EAI) y define el marco para su implementación. Se entiende por educación ambiental integral el proceso educativo permanente con contenidos temáticos específicos y transversales, cuyo propósito es la formación de una conciencia ambiental, en la cual distintos conocimientos, saberes, valores y prácticas confluyan y aporten a la formación ciudadana y al ejercicio del derecho a un ambiente sano, digno y diverso. Los principios rectores de la EAI incluyen el respeto y valor de la biodiversidad, la igualdad desde el enfoque de género, la participación y formación ciudadana, el cuidado del patrimonio natural y cultural. La Estrategia Nacional de Educación Ambiental Integral (ENEAI) será el principal instrumento de la política de la educación ambiental en todo el territorio nacional. El artículo 24 reconoce el derecho al libre acceso a la información ambiental.

Policy: EU Action Plan: 'Towards Zero Pollution for Air, Water and Soil'.
Policy_Content: This EU Action Plan is a policy at the EU level with a cross-sectoral approach. The timeframe of the policy is 10 years between 2021 and 2030. The objective of this policy is to reduce: (I) the negative impacts of air pollution on health; (II) noise pollution due to transport; (III) the threat of air pollution on biodiversity; (IV) nutrient losses, the use and risk of chemical pesticides and hazardous chemicals, and the sale of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture; (V) marine pollution due to plastic litter and microplastics released into the environment; and (VI) total waste generation. Moreover, this action plan also sets out key actions for other European Green Deal initiatives, including the chemicals strategy for sustainability, for the period of 2021-2024.

En application du présent arrêté, le Département de la Mobilité et des Travaux publics peut accorder une aide aux entreprises afin de leur permettre d'aller au-delà des Normes de l’Union en matière de protection de l'environnement ou, à défaut de Normes de l’Union, afin d'augmenter le niveau de protection environnementale. Policy: Decision on green public procurement in central public procurement procedures.
Policy_Content: This Decision, based on the provisions Law on the Government of the Republic of Croatia, determines that the Central State Office for Central Public Procurement is obliged to apply green public procurement criteria in central public procurement procedures as part of the technical specification and/or criteria for selection of tenders in all central public procurement procedures, where this is in line with technical suitability, the financial capacity of the central public procurement beneficiary, wider sustainability and a sufficient level of competition. The stated obligation primarily refers to the procurement categories such as office supplies, consumables, computers and computer equipment, motor vehicles and electricity supply. Green public procurement criteria are based on the common criteria of the European Commission for green public procurement. The Ministry responsible for environmental protection is instructed to publish the annual savings of carbon dioxide emissions resulting from the implementation of this Decision on the national website for green public procurement, as specified in article 2.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
