Policy: Law No. 60 “On the basics of crime prevention.”
Policy_Content: This Law defines the legal and organizational framework for the prevention of offences and regulates public relations arising in the field of crime prevention in the Kyrgyz Republic. The goals of crime prevention shall be to increase the level of protection of citizens, a decrease in the level of crime, identification, elimination of the causes and conditions that contribute to committing offences. The tasks of crime prevention shall be as follows: (a) ensuring protection of rights, freedoms and legal interests of the individual; (b) raising the level of legal consciousness and legal culture of citizens and officials' responsibility, strengthening legality, as well as the formation of an intolerant attitude towards offences and violations of the law; (c) creation of systems for the prevention of offences and reorientation of state bodies from combating the consequences of crimes to the prevention of offences; (d) study and identification of the reasons for the commission of offences and conditions conducive to the commission of offences, acceptance of measures to eliminate them; (e) social rehabilitation and social adaptation of victims of offences,  prone to committing offences, as well as persons who have committed offences; and  (f) ensuring interaction of the subjects of prevention of offences by implementation of the prevention of offences. Prevention of offences shall be based on the following principles: (a) priority of human rights and freedoms, responsibility of subjects of the prevention of offences for ensuring human rights and freedoms; (b) legality; (c) ensuring the consistency and unity of approaches in the implementation of prevention of offenses; (c) openness, continuity, sequence, timeliness, objectivity, sufficiency and scientific substantiation of the measures taken to prevent offences; (d) competence and complexity in the implementation of prevention of offences; and (e) cooperation and interaction between subjects of prevention of offences. Special prevention of offences shall be intended the activity of subjects of crime prevention for the development and implementation of measures aimed at the prevention of certain types of offences, elimination of the reasons and conditions for their commission, identification of certain categories of persons and rendering them preventive assistance shall include combating corruption and prevention of crimes committed by officials.

Policy: Décret nº 2021 - 191 du 5 mai 2021 portant création du Fonds national pour l'Environnement et le Climat et approbation de ses statuts
Policy_Content: Il est créé en République du Bénin, un Fonds national pour l’Environnement et le Climat. Sont approuvés, tels qu'ils figurent en annexe au présent décret, les statuts du Fonds national pour l'Environnement et le Climat. Le patrimoine du Fonds national pour l'Environnement et le climat et le patrimoine du Fonds national pour le Développement Forestier seront versés au patrimoine du Fonds national pour l'Environnement et le Climat. Le Ministre du cadre de vie et du Développement Durable et le Ministre de l'Économie et des Finances sont chargés, chacun en ce qui le concerne, de l'application du présent décret. Le Fonds national pour l'Environnement et le climat a pour mission de financer les programmes et projets visant la protection et la gestion rationnelle de l'environnement, des ressources naturelles et forestières, la lutte contre les effets néfastes des changements climatiques et la promotion du développement durable au Bénin.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 115/21 approving the Statute of the Geographical and Cadastral Institute of Angola (IGCA).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of the Geographical and Cadastral Institute of Angola (IGCA). The Statute, consisting of 29 articles divided into five Chapters and six Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the IGCA, entitled to ensure the regulation and execution of the Executive's policy, in the geographic and cadastral domains at the national level. The IGCA is subject to the superintendence of the head of the Ministerial Department responsible for the Territorial Planning Sector. The IGCA has the following functions: Prepare, promote and update technical standards and specifications for topo-geodesic, cartographic, photogrammetric and land registry works; Define the National Geodetic System and the National Cartographic Projection Systems; Ensure the establishment and consolidation of the National Geodetic Network; Promote the coverage and updating of cartography in the national territory; Organize the processes for granting urban and rural land concessions, which are not under the jurisdiction of Local Authorities; Assign the Building Identification Number (NIP); Issue the Land Registry Certificate; Promote the execution, conservation and renewal of the land registry; Establish technical guidelines that guarantee the quality and standards of the information contained in the land registry; Carry out inspection processes; Approve the registration work prepared by public and/or private entities; Guarantee the proper functioning, quality and permanent updating of the computerized registry; Organize and maintain the land; Organize and carry out the technical work relating to the demarcation of State land and reserves; Develop, coordinate and manage the Angolan Territorial Infrastructure Data (IDEA), etc.

Policy: Federal Law No. 112-FZ amending Forest Code (No. 200 – FZ).
Policy_Content: Forest Code (No. 200 – FZ) shall be supplemented with Article 38 (1) of the following wording: “Use of forests for fisheries. The use of forests for fisheries, except for recreational fisheries, shall be performed with or without granting of a forest plot, with or without application of servitude or a public servitude. When using forests for fisheries shall be authorized construction of non-capital structures and constructions used for fisheries on forest plots. Forest plots located in the forests owned by the state or a municipality can be allotted for the purpose of fishing in areas adjacent to the shoreline of a waterbody or its part, related to the fishing area. Rules for the use of forests for the purposes of fishing shall be established by the authorized federal executive body."

Policy: Regulation No. 2021/783 of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a Programme for the Environment and Climate Action (LIFE), and repealing Regulation (EU) No. 1293/2013.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the LIFE Programme, Programme for the Environment and Climate Action for the period of 2021-2027. The general objectives of the LIFE Programme: (a) to contribute to a just transition towards a sustainable, circular, energy- efficient, renewable energy-based, climate-neutral and -resilient economy, to the protection, restoration and improvement of the quality of the environment, including the air, water and soil, and of health, and to halting and reversing biodiversity loss, including by supporting the implementation and management of the Natura 2000 network and tackling the degradation of ecosystems; (b) to improve the development, implementation, monitoring and enforcement of EU environmental and climate change policy and legislation, and to act as a catalyst for, and promote the integration and mainstreaming of environmental and climate objectives into other European Union policies and public and private sector practices; (c) to improve governance at all levels, in particular by enhancing the capacities of public and private actors and the involvement of civil society; (d) to support the implementation of the 7th Environment Action Programme and any subsequent Union environment action programme. The progress of the LIFE Programme will be monitored and reported regularly by the Commission towards the achievement of the objectives based on the indicators set out in Annex II. The Commission shall be assisted by the Committee for the LIFE Programme.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Biodiversity,Capacity building,Climate change,Data collection/reporting,Ecosystem preservation,Energy conservation/energy production,Environmental planning,Enforcement/compliance,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Governance,Monitoring,Protection of environment,Public health,Non-governmental entity,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Pollution control

Policy: Trade Act 2021.
Policy_Content: The Act is organised in 5 Parts and 6 Schedules. Part 1 concerns international trade agreements and their implementation. It regulates implementation of the Agreement on Government Procurement, it lays down general rules on the implementation of international trade agreements, such establishing that the implementation provisions on certain areas (e.i. protection of human, animal or plant life or health; animal welfare; environmental protection, employmnet etc.) must be consistent with maintaining UK levels of statutory protection in that area. The Part also consider the situation and provides for procedures to be followed when there is a Free Trade agreement and exist credible reports of genocide in the territory of a prospective FTA counter-party.

Policy: Resolución Nº 2.602 - Fija exigencias sanitarias para la importación de platos preparados que contengan ingredientes de origen animal a Chile.
Policy_Content: Mediante la presente Resolución, del Servicio Agrícola y Ganadero (SAG), establece los requisitos y exigencias para la importación de platos preparados que contengan ingredientes de origen animal a Chile. Por plato preparado se entiende toda preparación culinaria con componentes de origen animal que se presentan listas para consumo, requiriendo únicamente cocinado o calentamiento. Toda partida de platos preparados deberá presentar la respectiva certificación sanitaria, en la que conste el cumplimiento de dichos requisitos. En general, se exige que los productos provengan de un país o zona libre de las enfermedades que se señalan, o que hayan sido sometidos a alguno de los tratamientos indicados.

Policy: National Land Use and Development Master Plan (NLUDMP).
Policy_Content: This National Land Use and Development Master Plan (NLUDMP) is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at guiding the optimal use of land with the main target of (i) finding the best balance sheet based on spatial and economic analysis; (ii) generating specific guidelines for implementation; (iii) designing a new and updated spatial structure for the nation considering that all settlements, urban, rural, big or small, are part of the national spatial puzzle, including Kigali and the secondary cities. The NLUDMP motto is “Ensuring tomorrow’s sustainability today!”, and its ideals are encapsulated in the word “COOPERATE” as follows (1) Consolidated development, (2) Orderly planning, (3) Openness for innovation, (4) Preservation of nature, (5) Economic yields, (6) Rational urbanization, (7) Ambient services, education and healthcare, (8) Transportation for all, (9) Employment all over. This new NLUDMP updates the first version adopted by the Cabinet in January of 2011.

Policy: Decreto Nº 41 - Prohíbe la fabricación, importación y la exportación de los productos con mercurio añadido clasificados en las subpartidas arancelarias que corresponde al listado establecido en el Convenio de Minamata sobre el Mercurio.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, para dar cumplimiento a los compromisos adquiridos por Colombia relacionados con el Convenio de Minamata sobre el Mercurio, prohíbe la fabricación, importación y la exportación de los productos con mercurio añadido clasificados en las subpartidas arancelarias que corresponde al listado establecido en el Anexo A, Parte 1 del Convenio. Policy: Décret n° 061-2021 du 21 Avril 2021/P.M/ portant réaménagement du cadre national de concertation sur la sécurité alimentaire et instituant un Dispositif National de Prévention et de Réponse aux Crises Alimentaires et Nutritionnelles (DCAN).
Policy_Content: L'objet de ce décret, organisé en cinq Titres, est identifié par le premier Titre: le réaménagement du cadre national de concertation sur la sécurité alimentaire et l'institution d'un Dispositif National de Prévention et de Réponse aux Crises Alimentaires et Nutritionnelles (DCAN) comprenant des instances de concertation à compétence générale, des instances de concertation spécialisées et des instances de concertation décentralisées. Le instances de concertation à compétence générale, leur composition et leur fonctionnement sont détaillés par le deuxième Titre qui, divisé en deux chapitres, s'occupe du Comité de Programmation Alimentaire (CPA) (chapitre 1) et du Comité Technique Permanent de Sécurité Alimentaire et de Nutrition (CTP)(chapitre 2). Le troisième Titre, aussi divisé en deux chapitres, est dédié aux instances de concertation spécialisées, notamment les Comités Techniques et les Groupes de Travail chargés, à titre permanent et pour le compte du CPA et du CTP, du système de veille et d'évaluation des besoins, ainsi que de la coordination et du suivi de la mise en oeuvre de la réponse. En particulier, le premier chapitre réglemente le Comité d’Analyse des Besoins (CAB) qui coordonne l'activité de quatre Groupes Techniques Spécialisés (GTS) auxquels sont dédiées les quatre sections qui suivent qui s'occupent de définir les fonctions, la composition et le fonctionnement, respectivement, du Groupe de Travail Spécialisé Chargé du Suivi de la Campagne Agro-pastorale, du Groupe de Travail Spécialisé Chargé de la Vulnérabilité, du Groupe de Travail Spécialisé Chargé du Suivi des Marchés alimentaires et des Approvisionnements et du Groupe de Travail Spécialisé Chargé de la Nutrition. Le deuxième chapitre réglemente, par contre, le Comité de Coordination de la Mise en oeuvre de la Réponse (CCMR) qui coordonne l'activité de quatre Comités Techniques Spécialisés (CTS), qui font l'objet de quatre sections dédiées: le Comité de Travail Spécialisé Chargé des Filets Sociaux, le Comité de Travail Spécialisé Chargé des Moyens d’Existence, le Comité de Travail Spécialisé Chargé de l’Assistance Alimentaire, le Comité de Travail Spécialisé Chargé de la Nutrition. Le quatrième Titre s'occupe des instance de concertation décentralisées: il est créé au niveau de chaque Wilaya un Comité Régional de Suivi de la Sécurité Alimentaire et Nutritionnelle (CRSAN) qui assure la concertation dans ce domaine. Suivent, dans le cinquième Titre, des dispositions finales.

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 20/MPO/2021 establishing the Structure of the General Directorate for Territorial Planning.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order establishes the Structure of the General Directorate for Territorial Planning (DGOT). It establishes and regulates the structure of the General Directorate for Territory Planning of the Ministry of Planning (MPO). The DGOT is a central service of the Ministry of Planning integrated in the direct administration of the State and responsible for ensuring the implementation of the national territorial planning policy, including urban planning, coastal planning, geospatial and cartographic information, promoting national cohesion, while ensuring protection and enhancement of cultural and natural heritage. In particular, the DGOT is responsible for: a) Elaborating the necessary instruments for the development of the public policy of territorial planning, in compliance with general principles and objectives enshrined in the respective Basic Law of Planning; b) Develop the technical bases for the formulation and application of the policy contained in the Basic Law of Territorial Planning, promoting its execution, monitoring and evaluation, in coordination with the related Ministries; c) Develop the necessary mechanisms for the promotion and effective consolidation of the territorial management system; d) Propose the legal and regulatory framework to support territorial planning policies; Carry out technical studies in the areas of land use planning, etc.

Policy: Regulation on incentives for programmes for improving competitiveness for investments in physical assets of agricultural holdings through support for the establishment of perennial production plantations of fruit and hops.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with the provisions of the Serbian Law on incentives in agriculture and rural development, determines the types of incentives for programmes aimed at improving competitiveness, which include investments in physical assets of agricultural holdings through incentives for raising perennial fruit and hop plantations, including conditions and procedural manner for exercising such rights to incentives for raising production. Incentives for raising production plantations include support for programmes related to: 1) support for raising new production plantations with modern technology for growing fruit and hops, without backrest and with backrest; 2) preparation of land for raising such production plantation. These incentives can be used for procurement of seedlings of fruit trees, vines and hops; purchase of necessary planting additional materials; preparation, cultivation of soil, digging and planting; chemical soil analysis with recommendation for correct fertilization procedures.

Policy: Investment Act No.11 of 2021.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 39 articles divided into IX Chapters aims at (i)  building an environment conducive to investment to attract both national and foreign investors; (ii) creating a more predictable, transparent, and fair system that supports investment. Article 6 establishes the Investment and Private Sector Development Authority and the units it supervises and it is the main authority responsible for the investments. The Law also deals with the single window, to coordinate the different concerned ministries am=nd bodies (art.9). The Ministry every 5 years shall develop an Investment National Strategy in coordination with the concerned parties (art.15). Several tax exemptions are introduced by article 20, including customs, business profits tax, and VAT, among others, until the end of the capital recovery period for projects that achieve an economic benefit. Article 25 establishes the creation of an Investment Register that will gather all investing entities’ data and store it in modern and secure systems. Article 26 provides for the issuance of an investment procedural guide which includes all the conditions, procedures, timeframes prescribed for land allocation, issuance of approvals, permits, and licenses about investment activities to clarify and facilitate procedures for all investors. This guide will be accessible online and will be updated periodically. While a specialized insurance company, envisaged by article 27, will ensure investors against different risks (e.g., risks of nationalization, risks of war, domestic conflict and civil disobedience, risks of recession, etc.) for an annual premium.
Subject: General

Policy: Resolution No. 13/2021 approving the Health Policy and the Strategy for its Implementation.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Health Policy and the Strategy for its Implementation. The Policy mission aims to improve the health conditions of all Mozambicans, through a system that recognizes, trains and brings together, in a coordinated manner, all the stakeholders, based on 6 principles: solidarity, ethics and professional deontology, respect diversity, humanization, professionalism and commitment. Its general objective aims at improving the conditions and ways of life of populations, reinforcing the implementation of measures aimed at improving individual and collective health and reducing vulnerabilities and health risks arising from social determinants of health. In particular, its specific objectives are: a) stimulate health promotion as part of comprehensive care in the National Health System; b) contribute to the adoption of social and health practices, centered on gender, equity and participation, respecting social differences; c) offer better services suited to all levels, ensuring their continuity; d) promote education and training, specific to health promotion, according with the principles expressed in this policy; e) carry out research, production and dissemination of knowledge and innovative strategies in the context of health promotion actions; f) contribute to the articulation of public policies with national and international health agendas.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 35/2021 establishing the Regime for Intensive Energy Consumers (RCIE).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law establishes the Regime for Intensive Energy Consumers (RCIE), instituted with the objective of promoting energy efficiency and local energy production in the facilities of final consumers who present significant energy consumption in the final consumption structure. It applies to all energy intensive consumers, legal persons, public and private, whose final energy consumption in the immediately preceding calendar year has been equal to or greater than equivalent tons of oil fixed by Decree of the Government member responsible for the Energy area. In the case of transport, road and maritime companies, and companies with their own energy-intensive fleets, the application of this regime must be adapted under the terms to be established in specific legislation for this purpose. The regime may be applicable to companies that have an energy consumption below specified limits. It also applies to Energy Auditors who want to act in the provision of services to Energy Intensive Consumers (CIE).

Policy: Ley Nº 31168 - Promueve el Empoderamiento de las Mujeres Rurales e Indígenas.
Policy_Content: La presente ley tiene por objeto fortalecer, a través de acciones afirmativas, el empoderamiento, la igualdad de oportunidades y el desarrollo integral de las mujeres rurales e indígenas, potenciando su autonomía económica, cultural, social, a través de la capacitación y el financiamiento productivo. Se entiende por mujeres rurales aquellas que, residiendo en zonas rurales, realizan actividades relacionadas directa o indirectamente con la productividad y sustentabilidad rural, incluso si dicha actividad no es reconocida por los sistemas de información y medición del Estado o no es remunerada. Las mujeres rurales pueden autoidentificarse como indígenas, nativas, afrodescendientes o mestizas. El Ministerio de Desarrollo Agrario y Riego, en coordinación con el Ministerio de la Producción, en el ámbito de su competencia, desarrolla programas específicos sobre planes de negocio, proyectos productivos, asistencia técnica y manejo de tecnologías agrícolas, dirigidos específicamente a las mujeres rurales e indígenas. La Superintendencia de Banca, Seguros y Administradoras Privadas de Fondos de Pensiones, en coordinación con el Ministerio de Desarrollo Agrario y Riego, el Ministerio de la Producción y el Ministerio de Desarrollo e Inclusión Social, desarrolla programas de capacitación sobre el financiamiento y el acceso a créditos dirigidos específicamente a las mujeres rurales e indígenas.

Policy: Legislative Decree 8/2021 regarding the Consumer Protection Law.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 83 articles divided into VIII Chapters aims at (i) protecting the rights of the consumer; (ii) ensuring the safety of food; (iii) preventing monopoly through setting regulations for trade practicing, pricing, imposing censorship on the quality of goods and products. It also tightens penalties and fines on monopoly, selling without an invoice, not announcing prices, and manipulating with weight, as well as selling at increasing prices. Article 3 lists the consumers' rights as follows (i) obtaining the product according to its intended purpose; (ii) health and safety when using or consuming the products provided to him; (iii) knowing the price and all correct information and data about the products; (iv) the freedom to choose the products that meet the quality in conformity with the specifications and the price specified for them; (v) obtaining an invoice proving that he acquired the product; (vi) decent treatment and respect for community customs and traditions; (vii) submit a complaint about the violations stipulated in this Legislative Decree. Article 4 specifies cases in which it is possible or not, to replace or return the products. Article 8 prohibits the supplier to possess or sell any products of unknown origin or spoiled materials. To achieve the objectives of this Legislative Decree, the Ministry of Internal Trade and Consumer Protection shall assume the following powers (i) take the measures to prevent monopoly and tampering with prices of the products; (ii) determine the price, without prejudice to the supplier's right to reduce the price in the interest of the consumer; (iii) oblige the importer to submit customs declarations and all documents required by the ministry; (iv) oblige the importer, producer, and wholesaler to submit a declaration on the basic materials and commodities that he possesses or trades, and these permits are exempt from the stamp duty; (v) monitoring compliance with the advertisement of prices on adherence to economic rules related to legitimate competition, in a manner that secures the consumer’s freedom of choice (art.11).

Policy: Law on the Registration of Commercial Companies at the Duty Free Zones, Law No. 96/2021
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to set out a legal framework for the establishment and registration of commercial companies in special economic zones in the Republic of Somaliland and is administered by the Somaliland Special Economic Zones Authority. The law provides the types of legal entities, to include; a) an establishment with limited responsibility and a single shareholder (an "SEZ Establishment"); b) a limited liability company (an "SEZ Co"); and c) a branch of an offshore or onshore company (a "Branch Office"), Together, the "SEZ Commercial Companies" and each an "SEZ Commercial Company"). Commercial Companies enjoy their legal entity status pursuant to their registration with the Authority and entry into the Register and would be accorded the capacity, rights and privileges of a person. The law provides extensively for the formation, shareholding, objects, naming, etc. of a commercial company. On the other hand,  private company, while having full legal personhood, shall not be permitted to offer any of its shares to the public by way of any subscription of shares, stock, debentures or debenture stock. Similar provisions are made with regards shareholding, objects, naming, etc of the private companies. Provisions also require companies to have meetings, keep certain mandatory registers, appoint board of directors, etc.

Policy: Danish Climate Action Plan for Agriculture.
Policy_Content: The present Climate Action Plan for Agriculture sets out the Government's intention to cut carbon dioxide emissions from agriculture by 7.1 million tons by 2030, primarily through increased spending on green farming technologies. The Government will allocate funds amounting to 700 million kroner for research and innovation for biogas fuels and other technologies. The Action Plan includes initiatives such as a partial ban on farming on peat soil through which carbon is being released; funding research and development of new technologies such as pyrolysis, which converts agricultural residues into fuel and biochar; using EU subsidy schemes for agriculture actively in the green transition within the agriculture sector; reducing nitrogen emissions by 10,400 tons by 2027; and incentivising agriculture within the younger population through economic support.

Policy: Waste Management (Landfill) (Amendment) Regulations, 2021.(L.N. 147 of 2021)
Policy_Content: These regulations amend the Waste Management (Landfill) Regulations ("the principal regulations")as follows: Sub-regulations (2) of Regulations 1 are substituted so as to better define the objective of the Regulations, which is supporting the European Union’s transition to a circular economy and meeting the requirements of Directive 2008/98/EC, particularly so as to ensure a progressive reduction of landfilling of waste and reduce negative effects on the environment. Also sub-regulations 3 is amended and sub-regulations 4, which is substituted to reflect the amendments in the European legislation as regards specific criteria for the storage of metallic mercury. Regulation 2 is amended so as to introduce some new definitions. Regulations 3 is also modified: in particular a sub-regulation 3 is added here in order to exclude the management of waste from land-based extractive industries from the scope of these regulations. Regulation 5 is also amended: a new sub-regulation 3 is added foreseeing, by 2035, the reduction of the amount of municipal waste landfilled to 10% or less of the total amount of municipal waste generated (by weight). A new sub-regulation 4 is also added to provide for the possibility to postpone the target referred to in sub-regulations  3. Rules on the calculation of the attainment of such targets are set out in a new regulation 5A. In regulation 6, among other, are revised the wastes that are not accepted in a landfill and a sub-regulations 2 is added which requires that the competent authority endeavours to ensure that, as of 2030, all waste suitable for recycling or other recovery, in particular municipal waste, shall not be accepted in a landfill (excepted the waste for which landfilling delivers the best environmental outcome). Further, regulations 10, 11, 12 and 14 are reworded and a new regulation 17A is added after regulation 17, referring to economic instruments and other measures to provide incentives for the application of the waste hierarchy under regulation 4A of the Waste Regulations. Also Schedules 1, 2 and 3 are amended.

Policy: Waste (Amendment) Regulations, 2021. (L.N. 146 of 2021).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, to be read and construed together with the Waste Regulations, 2011 (principal regulations) amend several of its provisions. Sub-regulation (2) of regulations 2, concerning the objective of the regulations is reworded stressing the accent on the importance of the transition to a circular economy and the European Union’s long-term competitiveness. Sub regulation (3)is amended to reflect the changes in European legislation. In regulation 3, among other amendments, a new paragraph (e) is added to mention substances that are destined for use as feed materials. Regulation 4 is reviewed to introduce, amend or delete some definitions: Agency, agreement, backfilling, best available techniques, bio-waste, community, construction and demolition waste, A new regulation 4A is added to introduce and apply a waste hierarchy, described thereof, to encourage the best overall environmental outcome according to the principles of self sufficiency and proximity. Regulation 5 is substituted to guarantee, upon certain conditions, that a substance resulting from a production process isconsidered not to be waste, but to be a by-product. Regulation 6 is also substituted to recognize that waste which has undergone a recycling or other recovery operation is considered to have ceased to be waste if it complies with the following conditions. Regulation 7 is substituted concerning the classification as hazardous waste to that displaying one or more of the properties listed in Schedule 3. Regulation 8 is deleted and so is Sub-regulation (2) of regulation 9. Regulation 10 on separate collection is substituted and new regulations 10A, 10B, 10C and 10D are added to, respectively, foresee the adoption of measures to prevent waste generation; ensure that waste undergoes preparing for re-use, recycling or other recovery operations; to promote preparing for re-use activities trough economic instruments, procurement criteria, quantitative objectives and targets or other measures; to calculate whether the targets laid down in regulation 10C. Regulation 12 is amended and sub-regulation (7) is reworded to reflect the Extended Producer Responsibility Framework Regulations, 2021, in accordance with the polluter pays principle. Regulation 16 is amended to provide that Where hazardous waste has been unlawfully mixed in breach of this regulation, separation is carried out where technically feasible or treated in a facility that has obtained a permit. Regulation 18 concerning waste oils is reworded and a regulation 19A concerning bio-waste is introduced. Regulations 19, 23 are reworded and also regulation 28 concerning the establishment of one or more waste management plans. Regulation 29 and (2) is amended to provide for the Minister to establish waste prevention programmes setting out the waste prevention measures laid down in regulation 10A and for the competent authority and the Agency to describe the contribution of instruments and measures listed in Annex IVa to Directive 2008/98/EC. A new regulation 33A providing for annual reporting activities by the establishments and undertakings which act as dealers and brokers of waste is introduced. Regulation 34 concerning measures to prohibit the abandonment, dumping or uncontrolled management of waste, including littering is reworded. Schedules 2,3 and 5 are amended; schedule 7 is deleted and a new schedule 10 substitutes the previous one.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Law No. LP50/2021 “On local initiative groups.”
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to create a legal basis for the establishment and functioning of local initiative groups. This Law regulates the procedure for the establishment, operation, reorganization and liquidation of local initiative groups. Local initiative groups shall be intended unprofitable, non-political association with the status of a legal entity, which is created for the purpose of developing and implementation of local development strategies based on established at the local level between public, business and civil sectors of territorial partnership, in which none of these sectors can own more than 49 percent of voting rights at the decision-making level. Local initiative groups shall be constituted on voluntary basis and have the status of legal entity. The scope of local initiative groups shall be definition of a rural area consisting of adjacent residential areas related by social, economic and natural features, characterized by local identity, common traditions, needs and prospects within which the local development strategy is being implemented, and development and approval of a local development strategy. This Law consists of VI Sections divided into 39 Articles. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II regards membership and establishment. Section III regards governing bodies. Section IV regards internal financial management. Section V regards monitoring and control. Section VI lays down conclusive and transitional provisions.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 127 validating the Regulation on ecological corridors.
Policy_Content: Regulation on ecological corridors governs creation of ecological corridors, establishing regimes for their protection and use of land included therein. Ecological corridor shall be intended part of ecological networks, represented by protected areas of land and waterbodies connecting protected natural territories among themselves for securing natural migrations (distribution) of wild fauna and wild flora species and conservation of biological diversity. Ecological barriers shall be intended natural, natural and technogenic elements/objects (high mountain systems, landscapes, canals, transport routes), representing obstacles to movement of wild fauna species and spreading of wild flora species, biogeochemical and biogeocenotic regulation. Ecological corridors can be natural or artificial (man-made). Ecological corridors are created for the purpose of ensuring spatially genetic unity and integrity of populations, conservation of natural complexes, biological and landscape diversity thereof, ensuring protection and reproduction of economically valuable, as well as rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species, natural migration routes of wild fauna species and spreading of wild flora species. Creation of an ecological corridor is aimed at performance of the following main tasks: (a) preservation of the main landscape, protective, forage and other conditions, favorable for certain species of biological diversity, including those listed in the Red Book of the Kyrgyz Republic providing their feeding, reproduction and migrations/spreading; (b) maintaining spatially genetic unity and connectedness to ecosystems, preventing their fragmentation; and (c) promoting conservation of wild fauna and wild flora species composition, maintaining and increasing number thereof, improving conditions of their habitat/growth, and migration/distribution.

Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the legal and organizational framework of the State Institution "Center for Public-Private Partnership" under the Ministry of Economy and Finance of the Kyrgyz Republic. The PPP Center is a state executive body of the Kyrgyz Republic, functioning in the status of a subordinate subdivision of the Ministry of Economy and Finance of the Kyrgyz Republic in the form of a state institution carrying out management functions to promote public-private partnership mechanisms. The PPP Center operates in cooperation with government agencies and local government, representatives of the business community, foreign investors, international organizations, as well as other legal entities and natural persons. The purpose of the PPP Center is to develop mechanisms of public-private partnership by promoting PPP projects, improving state and municipal infrastructure and services in the Kyrgyz Republic through attracting investment and management experience from the private sector with the use of PPP mechanisms. The tasks of the PPP Center shall be to coordinate projects of public-private partnerships and the dissemination of PPP mechanisms in various socially significant sectors of the Kyrgyz Republic through the formation of the necessary PPP project management systems, including assistance to government partners in the search, initiation, preparation, implementation and monitoring of the implementation of PPP projects.

Policy: Resolución N⁰ 81/2021 - Crea el Programa Gobernanza Ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea el Programa Gobernanza Ambiental que tiene por objeto acompañar a los municipios con la problemáticas y necesidades existentes en todo el territorio nacional en materia ambiental. El programa tiene como objetivo: fortalecer las capacidades estatales de los gobiernos locales con las herramientas que les permitan actualizar la normativa vigente, fortalecer las capacidades estatales municipales a través de un sistema de capacitaciones sobre distintas temáticas, y establecer indicadores de Gobernanza Ambiental Municipal en base a las normas ambientales y estado de implementación de las mismas. Policy: Real Estate Cadastre Act.
Policy_Content: This Act stipulates the establishment, management and maintenance of the real estate cadastre, the state border register, the register of spatial units and the register of addresses. The purpose of the Act is to ensure the entry of correct and complete data on real estate, which shows the actual situation in space, and the display of data on the state border, spatial units, addresses and data from other public records, if required. The Real Estate Cadastre, the state border register, the register of spatial units and the register of addresses shall be established and maintained by the Surveying and Mapping Authority of the Republic of Slovenia. Part Eight provides for supervision and penalty provisions.

Policy: Decision on declaring fossils of dinosaurs and their sites as protected parts of nature.
Policy_Content: This Decision, as in accordance with the provisions of the national Law on nature protection, established that dinosaur fossils, present on 24 (twenty-four) sites located on the territory of the Republic of Croatia, are significant due to their rarity, size, appearance, educational and scientific significance, and are declared protected parts of nature. It is forbidden to destroy protected dinosaur fossils and to carry out interventions and/or actions that may lead to damage to such protected dinosaur fossils and related sites. Protected dinosaur fossils are kept at the site of their original finding (in situ), and if it is not possible to protect them at the site, with the permission of the ministry responsible for nature protection, they are given for safekeeping to a legal or natural person who will provide their professional protection (ex situ protection or conservation). Protected dinosaur fossils and their sites are managed by locally competent public institutions for the management of protected areas and/or other protected parts of nature.

Policy: Action Plan for the development of organic production.
Policy_Content: The Action Plan for the development of organic production is a policy at the EU level addressing all Member States with a cross-sectoral approach. The overall purpose of this Action Plan is to develop a sustainable food system for the European Union by producing high quality food with low environmental impact. To this end, the targets of this policy are to use at least 25% of the EU’s agricultural land under organic farming and achieve a significant increase in organic aquaculture by 2030.

The Regulation, consisting of seven Chapters, establishes the legal regime applicable to the exercise of the above mentioned activities, under the General Electricity Law, approved by Law No. 14-A/96 of 31 May, defining the composition, actors and principles of the National Electric System (SEN), which comprises the Public Electric System (SEP) and the Unbound Electric System (SENV). Policy: Regulation on the award of grants under the Competitive Agriculture Project.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, pursuant to article III, Programme 2, Section I, Subsection B item 1 of the Loan Agreement (Competitive Agriculture Project) between the Republic of Serbia and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, provides types of eligible investments and costs, conditions and manner of exercising the right to grants, persons exercising the right to grants, as well as the minimum and maximum amount of grants per beneficiary for the implementation of the Competitive Agriculture Project. Eligible types of investments are: 1) preparatory costs; 2) capital investments; 3) investments in human resources; 4) investments for professional and technical assistance and training of users for the use of grants. These investments are meant for: 1) investments aimed at improving the competitiveness of primary agricultural production in livestock in the field of milk production; 2) investments aimed at improving the competitiveness of primary agricultural production in livestock in the field of meat production; 3) investments aimed at improving the competitiveness of primary agricultural production in animal husbandry in the field of beekeeping; 4) investments aimed at improving the competitiveness of primary agricultural production in livestock in the field of aquaculture; 5) investments aimed at improving the competitiveness of primary plant production in the field of fruit, vegetables, grapes and flowers; 6) investments aimed at improving the competitiveness of primary plant production in the field of production of other crops; 7) investments aimed at improving the income on the agricultural farm through engaging in activities in the field of old and artistic crafts, ie domestic handicrafts.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2021/522 establishing a Programme for the Union’s action in the field of health (‘EU4Health Programme’) for the period 2021-2027, and repealing Regulation (EU) No 282/2014.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the EU4Health Programme for the period from 2021 to 2027, in order to improve human health throughout the Union and to ensure a high level of protection of human health in all Union policies and activities with the One Health approach. Due to the COVID-19 outbreak, this Regulation puts an emphasis on strengthening health systems by improving their resilience and resource efficiency; strengthening the capability of the Union for prevention of, preparedness for, and rapid response to, serious cross- border threats to health in accordance with relevant Union legislation, and improving the management of health crises.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2021/523 establishing the InvestEU Programme and amending Regulation (EU) 2015/1017.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the InvestEU Fund and an advisory support mechanism to support financing and investment operations carried out by the implementing partners, provide support for the development of investable projects and access to financing and to provide related capacity building assistance. The areas eligible for financing and investment operations include the development of the energy sector in accordance with the Energy Union priorities; climate adaptation and mitigation, including natural hazard disaster risk reduction; water, including drinking water supply and sanitation; enhancement and restoration of ecosystems and their services; substantial reduction of emissions in such industries; and sustainable agriculture, forestry, fishery, aquaculture and other elements of the wider sustainable bioeconomy.

Policy: Decree on the sustainability criteria for biofuels and greenhouse gas emissions.
Policy_Content: This Decree, based on the provisions of the Slovenian Environmental protection Act, determines sustainability and greenhouse gas emission saving criteria for biofuels, bioliquids for energy purposes and biomass fuels, by providing: obligation to reduce greenhouse gas emissions over the life cycle of fuels used in transport; sustainability criteria for biofuels; verification of compliance with sustainability criteria for biofuels and issuance of accompanying certificates; use of a system of mass balance of raw materials or biofuels, and biomass fuels used in transport, with different sustainability criteria in the joint supply; methodology for calculating and saving greenhouse gas emissions over the life cycle of fuels used in transport; obligation for annual suppliers of fuels to report on the emission intensity and amount of greenhouse gas emissions from fuels and energy used in transport. This text is in accordance with several EU legislative documents as listed in article 1. The Annex (1-7) is also part of this publication (containing Rules for calculating the impact of biofuels, biofuels for energy purposes and their comparative values for fossil fuels on greenhouse gases; Rules for calculating the impact of biomass fuels and their comparative values for fossil fuels on greenhouse gases; Advanced fuels; Method for calculating the total life cycle greenhouse gas intensity of fuels and energy for fuel suppliers; Typical and default values of greenhouse gas savings over the life cycle of biofuels; Energy values of biofuels and fuels; Greenhouse gas emissions due to indirect land use change).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy

Policy: Ley Nº 1068 - Crea la Autoridad Nacional de Regulación Sanitaria (ANRS).
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea la Autoridad Nacional de Regulación Sanitaria (ANRS), adscrita al Ministerio de Salud y que será sucesor legal sin solución de continuidad de la Dirección General de Regulación para la Salud, establecida en el Decreto Nº 25-2006. La ANRS tendrá por objeto facilitar, regular, implementar, desarrollar y coordinar las políticas, leyes, reglamentos y normas relacionadas con las autorizaciones sanitarias, vigilancia, promoción, publicidad, control y fiscalización de: medicamentos (leche maternizada y sucedáneos de la leche materna), vacunas, biológicos, biotecnológicos; productos naturales medicinales y homeopáticos; alimentos y bebidas; suplementos nutricionales; dispositivos médicos y otras tecnologías vinculadas a la salud; todo lo relacionado con radiaciones ionizantes; sustancias químicas precursoras; productos cosméticos e higiénicos; tabaco y sus derivados. Así mismo, la regulación y control de donaciones, brigadas médicas extranjeras, insumos médicos y no médicos; regulación del ejercicio profesional en salud, auditorías sobre la calidad de atención del servicio en salud, establecimientos proveedores de servicios de salud, establecimientos farmacéuticos y no farmacéuticos, establecimientos alimentarios; establecimientos que presten servicios de desinfección, saneamiento estructural o habitacional con plaguicidas, sustancias tóxicas, peligrosas y otras similares; y otros que puedan tener impacto en la salud.

Policy: Decision on adoption of the Programme for spending funds with criteria for distribution of funds "Subsidies to private companies and entrepreneurs - Incentive for agriculture" determined by the Budget of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina for 2021 to the Federal Ministry of Agriculture, Water Management and Forestry.
Policy_Content: This Decision adopts the Programme for spending funds with criteria for distribution of funds "Subsidies to private companies and entrepreneurs - Incentive for agriculture" determined by the Budget of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina for 2021, and aimed for the Federal Ministry of Agriculture, Water Management and Forestry. The purpose of this Support Programme is to continue to support priority measures within the available budget, to ensure continuous payment of production incentives and payments within structural policy measure for 2021. Direct support, as well as structural measures, both have the aim to ensure a long-term sustainability of agricultural holdings that perform agricultural activity in plant and animal production. The Programme will implement priority measures of financial support according to the model of production incentives and part of measures and structural policies that should contribute to achieve the following goals: a) improvement of agricultural production and increase the extent of agricultural land use with the aim strengthening competitiveness at home and abroad market; b) increasing the supply of domestic agricultural products while improving the quality of health and hygiene correctness of the product in accordance with consumer requirements; c) ensuring a stable agricultural income and improving the living standards of farmers manufacturers; d) gradual harmonization and integration of the agricultural sector into the European Union and global market.

This Regulation, consisting of 10 articles divided into three Chapters and 2 Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Directorate, as a direct executive service of the Ministry, entitled to promote and ensure the implementation of national and sectorial policy on industrial safety, emergency management, prevention and control, quality and environmental protection in mining, oil, gas and biofuels activities, etc. In addition, the Directorate is entitled to: implement strategies and guidelines on industrial safety, management and control of emergencies and environmental protection; promote research to improve practices related to risks, technological incidents, pollution prevention and control, environmental management, and available technologies; cooperate with other Ministry services and other entities in the elaboration of standards, regulations, manuals and technical specifications related to mining, oil and gas activities and biofuels; give technical opinions on control plans for emergencies, quality and environmental protection, licensing on safety and environmental protection, etc.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the Directive Council of the Ministry of the Mineral Resources and Petroleum. This Regulation establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Council, which is the periodic consultation body of the related Ministerial Department. Policy: Governmental Resolution No. 268 validating the Regulation on the Ministry of Energy.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Resolution establishes that the Ministry of Energy is a specialized body of the central public administration, which implements the strategy and the program of governance in the field of energy and energy resources, energy generation, transportation, distribution and supply of electric and thermal energy, including energy from renewable/green, hydrogen or other sources of alternative/unconventional energy, in the field of operation, processing, transportation, distribution and capitalization of energy resources obtained from minerals/hydrocarbons, on-shore or off-shore, coal, uranium, oil and natural gas and their derivatives, in the field of civil nuclear radioactive waste management and heavy water management, in the field of maintenance and periodic inspections of technology and equipment in the field of energy efficiency and the Green Deal environmental pact, in compliance with the requirements of the market economy and acting legislation. The Ministry shall perform the following functions: (a) initiates, elaborates and promotes draft acts of regulations, coordinates and controls their application in coordinated fields; (b) substantiates the proposals for allocation of budgetary finances and investments in the field of energy; (c) manages state property in the field of responsibility; (d) implementation of state policy in the field of responsibility; (e) international cooperation; and (f) ensures the fulfillment, in the field of competence, of the obligations deriving from the status of Romania as a member state of European Union, including transposition and/or creating the legal framework for the direct application of legal acts related to mandatory implementation of the European Union, implementation and monitoring of their application.

Policy: Law of Georgia on State Support for Children and Youth Unions (No. 2139-IIs of 1999)
Policy_Content: This Law determines the notion, forms, and general principles of the state support for children and youth unions. It consists of five chapters: General provisions (I); Main forms of the state support to children and youth unions (II); Organizational bases for the state support to children and youth unions (III); and Transitional provisions (IV); and Final provision (V). Supporting children and youth unions includes a system of measures undertaken according to the law within the framework of the state youth policy towards self-realization and protection of the rights in civil life of children and youth, supporting the economic and organizational conditions of these unions, and to provide legal safeguards for the stability of their work. The children unions are established as non-commercial legal entities with their founding bylaws aiming to protect the freedoms and rights of children and youth, and to develop their talent and skills and support their self-realization in the society.

Policy: Agricultural Workers Regulation No.19 of 2021.
Policy_Content: This Regulation consisting of 17 articles aims to regulate the operations of the workforce sector, preserve workers' rights without discrimination, and ensure their coverage under the social insurance per the Social Security Law in place. Article 3 establishes that (i) the agricultural work contract is considered for a fixed term if it is agreed between the worker and the agricultural employer to work for a specific period or season. Otherwise, the agricultural work contract is considered to be of unlimited duration; (ii) the agricultural worker may prove his rights by all legal methods of proof if the contract is not drawn up in writing. Article 4 establishes working hours, rest hours, extra hours in case of emergency. The agricultural worker is entitled to a weekly day off according to the nature of agricultural work (art.5). Agricultural work is prohibited under 16 years of age, while the age of 18 must be completed for agricultural work that is dangerous, exhausting, or harmful to health, and these jobs are determined by a decision issued by the Minister (art.6). Article 7 deals with annual leave. Article 8 provides for (i) the wage of an agricultural worker, that may not be less than the minimum wage specified in accordance with the law; (ii) payment of the wage and prohibition of deductions except in cases permitted by law; and (iii) duty of equal wages for agricultural workers for every work of equal value without any discrimination based on sex. As for article 9 the agricultural business owner is obligated and at his expense to provide suitable housing for agricultural workers and appropriate facilities in the event that the nature of the agricultural work requires that or the agricultural work contract includes this condition. An agricultural business owner who employs at least twenty agricultural workers is obligated to establish an internal system that indicates working hours, daily rest periods, holidays, vacations, work violations, penalties (including dismissal from work and its implementation). The internal system is subject to the approval of the Minister (art.10).

La presente Resolución incluye los requisitos, las instrucciones y los formularios necesarios para los titulares de emprendimientos que desean acceder a los beneficios previstos por la Ley N⁰ 25.080. También se explique las funciones que realizaran las autoridades de aplicaciones provinciales en las que la Autoridad de Aplicación haya delegado o delegue funciones atreves de convenios celebrados a tal efecto. La presente Resolución explique: las características y presentaciones de los emprendimientos, como acceder los beneficios fiscales, las responsabilidades de los profesionales, las responsabilidades de los titulares, y las responsabilidades de la autoridad de aplicación provincial.

Policy: Governmental Decision HG27/2021 validating the Regulation on the establishment of a diesel fuel quantum from external humanitarian aid provided by Romania, intended to support agricultural producers affected by the 2020 drought.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes a diesel fuel quantum from external humanitarian aid provided by Romania, intended to support agricultural producers affected by the 2020 drought as a form of partial compensation of damages of agricultural producers due to losses of crops. Assistance shall be provided in case that, according to the acts of ascertaining, 60% or more of crop yields from the 2020 crop were lost due to drought. To receive assistance, the applicant must meet the following conditions: (a) to prove the fact of ownership or cultivation of land plots sown by crops for the harvest of 2020; and (b) the submitted acts of ascertaining must contain reliable data and must be drawn up within the time period established by this Regulation. Governmental Decision contains calculation formula for the establishment of a diesel fuel quantum.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Outline of the People’s Republic of China 14th Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and Long-Range Objectives for 2035.
Policy_Content: This 14th five-year plan (FYP) is a cross-sectoral policy document at the national level. It outlines the policy framework, priorities and economic and social goals for 2021-2025. The Plan is divided into 19 Sections and 65 Chapters. The Plan is divided into 19 sections and 65 chapters, covering on all aspects of development over the next five years, as well as presenting China’s 2035 vision. The 14th FYP is the first Plan that builds on the first centenary goal (achieving a Xiaokang society in all respects) and on the eradication of absolute rural poverty. It sets the basis for the second centenary goal – “build a modern socialist country that is prosperous, strong, democratic, culturally advanced and harmonious” by 2049  through “basically realizing socialist modernization” by 2035.

Policy: Decision on financial compensation for loss of income to apple growers due to the COVID-19 epidemic.
Policy_Content: This Decision, based on the provisions of the COVID-19 Second Wave Mitigation Measures Act, specifies the measure, beneficiaries, conditions, method of calculation and procedure for granting financial compensation for loss of income to apple growers due to the COVID-19 epidemic. The financial compensation shall be granted in the form of a flat-rate financial compensation per hectare of intensive apple orchard. The beneficiary of the financial compensation is the holder of the agricultural holding in accordance with the Agriculture Act. This financial compensation shall be granted in accordance with the Communication from the Commission Temporary Framework for State aid measures in support of the economy in the event of an outbreak of COVID-19.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 88 validating the Regulation on the Ministry of Public Health and Social Development.
Policy_Content: Ministry of Health and Social Development of the Kyrgyz Republic is a state executive body responsible for the development and implementation of state policy in the field of: (a) protection and strengthening of the health of citizens in the Kyrgyz Republic; (b)  social development and gender equality; (c) social protection of the population, including support for socially unprotected categories of citizens, children in difficult life situations, persons with disabilities (PWDs) and the elderly citizens; (d) protection from domestic violence; (e) labor, including issues of promoting employment of the population and labor protection; (f) protection of ethnic Kyrgyz, Kairylmans, refugees, as well as victims of human trafficking within the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic in the field of prevention and combating human trafficking; (g) state social insurance and pension provision; and (h) basic state and compulsory health insurance of citizens.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 87 “On issues of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic.”
Policy_Content: Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic is an authorized state executive body of the Kyrgyz Republic implementing a unified state policy in the field of civil protection, fire safety, radiation safety, safety of people on waterbodies, hydrometeorology, ecology and environmental protection, ensuring environmental safety, management of protected natural areas (excluding state natural parks), management of the system of state material reserve, state supervision and control on environmental, fire and radiation security. The scope of the Ministry is to develop and implement unified state environmental policy ensuring the preservation of the ecological system of the Kyrgyz Republic and environmental protection, implementation of state supervision and control over ensuring compliance with the norms and requirements of environmental security and stable functioning of the systems of state material reserve. The Ministry shall perform the following tasks: (a) monitoring and forecasting hazardous natural, technogenic processes and phenomena, planning of activities in the field of civil protection, fire safety, radiation safety, safety of people on waterbodies and hydrometeorology, training of governing bodies, forces of civil protection and the population to act in emergency situations; (b) prevention, implementation of preventive protective measures against emergency situations; (c) organization and holding search and rescue, emergency recovery, other urgent work, elimination of consequences of emergency situations, assessment of their scale; (d) implementation of state policy and regulation in the field of ecology, environmental protection, as well as accounting, assessment of the state of natural components; (e) preventing the impact of possible negative consequences from the implementation, planned management, economic and other activities on the environment; (f) establishment and development of international cooperation of the Kyrgyz Republic in the field of environmental protection, ecological security; (g) state supervision and control over compliance with regulatory requirements of legal acts, technical regulations for fire, environmental, biological, chemical, radiation and nuclear safety in relation to products (objects) and/or related processes of manufacturing, construction, installation, adjustment, operation, storage, transportation, use, trade, burial, placement and disposal; (h) management of material assets of state material reserve; (i) ensuring the fulfillment of tasks established by mobilization plans approved by the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic, as well as mobilization tasks in cases of emergencies, the introduction of a regime of state of emergency and martial law, or wartime mobilization; and (j) organization of dispatch for storage, accumulation, storage, refreshment and release of material assets of the state material reserve.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 044-2021-PCM — Procedimientos administrativos estandarizados en materia forestal y de fauna silvestre cuya tramitación es de competencia de los Gobiernos Regionales.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Procedimientos administrativos estandarizados en materia forestal y de fauna silvestre cuya tramitación es de competencia de los Gobiernos Regionales. Los gobiernos regionales se encuentran facultados a establecer condiciones más favorables en la tramitación de los procedimientos administrativos estandarizados, que se expresa en la exigencia de menores actividades y plazos de atención a los establecidos en la normativa vigente respectiva. Se considera comprendido en este supuesto la tramitación de los procedimientos administrativos por canales no presenciales. Los gobiernos regionales deben tramitar los procedimientos administrativos estandarizados, en concordancia con la normativa ambiental vigente, incluyendo la obligación de solicitar la Opinión Técnica de la entidad competente, de forma previa a la emisión de su pronunciamiento, en los casos que corresponda.

Policy: Décret nº 2021 - 090 du 10 mars 2021 portant création d'un Fonds de développement pétrolier
Policy_Content: Il est créé en République du Bénin, un compte spécial du Trésor dénommé « Fonds de développement pétrolier ». Le Fonds de développement pétrolier est destiné au financement : des activités d’investissement de l'opérateur national sous forme de prêts ; des études de toutes natures en relation avec les activités relevant du secteur pétrolier amont, y compris et sans que cette liste ne soit limitative, celles relatives à la définition des politiques publiques dans le secteur pétrolier amont, à l'amélioration du cadre légal, institutionnel et règlementaire de ce secteur, à la revue et à l'évaluation des études de faisabilité et documents connexes soumis au ministère en charge des Hydrocarbures par les titulaires ou demandeurs d'Autorisations prévues par le Code pétrolier aux fins d'exercice des opérations pétrolières et des opérations de transport et de stockage telles que définies dans ce code ; de toutes dépenses nécessaires au renforcement des capacités des agents des administrations compétentes dans le secteur pétrolier amont, y compris les dépenses de formation des agents du ministère en charge des Hydrocarbures ; des opérations de prospection entreprises en vertu des dispositions de l'article I du Code pétrolier et de toutes activités ou opérations tendant à la promotion du secteur pétrolier amont ; des opérations de surveillance administrative et de contrôle technique des opérations pétrolières et des opérations de transport et de stockage, réalisées conformément aux dispositions du Code pétrolier et des textes pris pour son application ; des actions sociales et communautaires au titre des opérations pétrolières ; de toutes activités connexes aux opérations pétrolières et aux opérations de transport et de stockage, entreprises par l’Etat.

Policy_Content: The Ministry of Agriculture, Water Resources and Regional Development of the Kyrgyz Republic is the authorized state  executive body carrying out state policy in the field of agro-industrial complex, including animal husbandry, veterinary medicine, fishfarming (aquaculture), plant growing, plant quarantine, land reclamation, water resources, irrigation and reclamation infrastructure, food and processing industry, development of regions and local government, land legal relations, state registration of rights to real estate, geodesy and cartography, including ensuring uniformity in the application and observance of land legislation, forestry and hunting management, management of state natural parks of the Kyrgyz Republic, as well as state supervision and control in the field of veterinary, phytosanitary safety and compliance with land and water legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic. Policy: Decreto Nº 1264 - Reglamento General a la Ley Orgánica para la Planificación Integral de la Circunscripción Territorial Especial Amazónica.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento General a la Ley Orgánica para la Planificación Integral de la Circunscripción Territorial Especial Amazónica, que tiene por objeto regular las acciones. procedimientos generales, instrumentos y mecanismos que permitan la aplicabilidad de lo dispuesto en la Ley Orgánica para la Planificación Integral de la Circunscripción Territorial Especial Amazónica. Las disposiciones del presente Reglamento son de aplicación obligatoria para todos los actores de la Circunscripción Territorial Especial Amazónica inmersos en la Ley Orgánica para la Planificación Integral de la Circunscripción Territorial Especial Amazónica, todas las instituciones públicas comprendidas en la Ley Orgánica del Servicio Público, las personas naturales, personas jurídicas, consorcios, empresas privadas, empresas mixtas, empresas comunitarias con capital nacional o extranjero, organizaciones pueblos y nacionalidades y quienes desarrollan actividades en la Circunscripción Territorial Especial Amazónica.

Policy: Resolución N⁰ 59/2021 – Exportación de productos de especies forestales incluidas en la convención sobre el Comercio Internacional de Especies Amenazadas de Fauna y Flora Silvestres (CITES).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene como objeto establecer un nuevo marco técnico común y mejorador que se complemente con las normativas provinciales vigentes con el fin de amenizar los procesos a nivel regional, modernizar los mecanismos de presentación y brindar mayor claridad al proceso de aprovechamiento de los productos forestales madereros de las especies forestales que se encuentran o se encontrasen alcanzadas por el Apéndice II de CITES. Se establece especificaciones técnicas para el aprovechamiento forestal de productos con destino a la exportación de especies forestales. Se establece criterios de adjudicación de cupos, procedimientos de control y seguimiento de las intervenciones que originen productos para exportación de especies forestales contenidas en el Apéndice II de CITES.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 005-2021-EM ─ Modifica el Decreto Supremo Nº 039-2014-EM, Reglamento para la protección ambiental en las actividades de hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo modifica el Reglamento que tiene por objeto normar la protección y gestión ambiental de las actividades de hidrocarburos, en aspectos relacionados con el marco legal aplicable a las actividades de hidrocarburos, que debe ser predecible y claro en materia ambiental, con la finalidad de permitir: 1) Reducir incertidumbre en las inversiones garantizando la seguridad jurídica; 2) Reducir costos innecesarios y promover las inversiones privadas en el subsector; 3) Facilitar el cumplimiento de la normativa ambiental y la tramitación de los procedimientos de evaluación de impacto ambiental, mediante una comunicación fluida y eficiente entre la Autoridad Ambiental Competente y el Titular de las Actividades de Hidrocarburos.

Policy: Resolución N⁰ 2/2021 – Promoción de propuestas de legislación provincial de desarrollo territorial. Aspectos mínimos.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece, en el marco del componente “Promoción de propuestas de Legislación Provincial de Desarrollo Territorial” del Programa de Planificación y Desarrollo Territorial, los aspectos mínimos que deberán contemplar los proyectos de normas provinciales que en el marco del programa se dicten. Se establece que los principios rectores de la política territorial deben ser promover la justicia social, el reparto equitativo de cargas y beneficios de los procesos territoriales, el ejercicio socialmente responsable del derecho de propiedad y garantizar de esa manera la gestión democrática del territorio y la progresividad en el cumplimiento de las metas establecidas. Se establece los componentes del Programa de Capacitación y Asistencia Técnica en Planificación y Ordenamiento Territorial. Se invita a los gobiernos provinciales, municipales y a la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires a participar del concurso “Experiencias Innovadoras de Planificación, Desarrollo Territorial y Políticas de Suelo para la Reconstrucción Argentina” y establece que tiene que establecer el reglamento del concurso.

Policy: Resolución Nº 028-2021-MINAM ─ Crea la Unidad Funcional de Delitos  Ambientales (UNIDA) del Ministerio del  Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea la Unidad Funcional de Delitos Ambientales (UNIDA) del Ministerio del Ambiente, dependiente del  Viceministerio de Gestión Ambiental, que tendrá las siguientes funciones: 1) Contribuir a la generación e intercambio de  información técnica relevante para la prevención,  reducción y seguimiento de los delitos e infracciones  ambientales con énfasis en la Tala Ilegal, Tráfico Ilícito de  Fauna Silvestre y Minería Ilegal; 2) Proporcionar análisis estratégicos relacionados con  la comisión de delitos e infracciones ambientales; 3) Diseñar y proponer mejoras normativas e  institucionales para prevenir y reducir la comisión de los  delitos e infracciones ambientales; 4) Coordinar con las entidades que conforman el  Sistema Nacional de Gestión Ambiental y el Sistema de Justicia para fortalecer la articulación en la prevención,  reducción y seguimiento de los delitos e infracciones  ambientales; 4) Elaborar y proponer los lineamientos y criterios  para la formulación, implementación y evaluación de las  políticas públicas sobre delitos e infracciones ambientales,  que permitan un adecuado y oportuno acceso a la  justicia ambiental, así como en la toma de decisiones  institucionales; 5) Coadyuvar en la implementación de las medidas  de reconocimiento y protección de los defensores  ambientales; 6) Proponer la invitación a otras instituciones  públicas, privadas o de la sociedad civil, la cooperación  internacional, entidades de fiscalización, así como a  profesionales especializados, para que contribuyan en la  formulación de recomendaciones específicas orientadas  a la prevención de los delitos ambientales e infracciones  ambientales.

Policy: Regulation on the collection of market data.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, which is composed of 17 articles and one Annex, lays down: (1) detailed scope of the collection of data on agricultural market; (2) the way of indicating entrepreneurs obliged to provide this information; (3) the form and deadlines for submitting market data. The scope of data collection includes: (1) prices of purchase, sale, marketing, marketplace, wholesale, producers and importers; (2) trading volume; (3) particulars used to identify the exact agri-food commodity. The scope of the information to be provided and collected depends on the products concerned: beef, veal, pork, cereals, poultry, milk, dairy products, eggs, sugar, mutton, flax and hemp fiber, high-protein plants, milk-like preparations, fruits and vegetables, oil plants, hop and tobacco, fodder and flowers. The Annex specifies agricultural foodstuffs included in individual markets and detailed scope of market data collected for these foodstuffs.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 22 April 2021.

L'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 24 janvier 2019 relatif à l'octroi des aides aux zones soumises à des contraintes naturelles ou à des contraintes spécifiques est modifié pour en étendre la durée jusqu'au 2022. Policy: Decree on determining the Medium-term programme for the development of advisory activities in agriculture for the period from 2021 to 2025.
