Policy: Loi n°2021‐23 du 02 mars 2021 relative aux contrats de Partenariat Public‐Privé.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de régir les contrats de partenariat public‐privé. Les dispositions de la présente loi s’appliquent aux contrats de partenariat public‐privé  conclus dans tous les secteurs de la vie économique et sociale à l’exception des contrats  suivants: a) les contrats de partenariat public‐privé, tels que définis à l’article 3 de la présente  loi, régis par des dispositions législatives et réglementaires spécifiques aux secteurs  suivants :  -  les énergies ;  -  les mines ;  -  les télécommunications, au sens des activités régulées et soumises au régime de la  licence et de l’autorisation par le Code des communications électroniques; b) les contrats passés entre autorités contractantes, à l’exception des contrats de  partenariat public‐privé passés entre une société anonyme à participation publique  majoritaire dont le capital social n’est pas exclusivement détenu par des autorités  contractantes et une autre autorité contractante qui restent régis par la présente loi; c) les contrats ayant pour objet des besoins de défense et de sécurité nationale  exigeant le secret ou pour lesquels la protection des intérêts essentiels de l’État est  incompatible avec des mesures de publicité; d) les contrats attribués aux opérateurs économiques en vertu de droits exclusifs  octroyés par des dispositions législatives ou réglementaires nationales ; e)  les  contrats  conclus  avec  un  opérateur  économique  avec  lequel  l’autorité  contractante entretient une relation de quasi‐régie lorsque les conditions suivantes  sont réunies :  -  l’autorité contractante exerce sur l’opérateur économique un contrôle analogue à  celui qu’elle exerce sur ses propres services ;  -  l’opérateur économique contrôlé réalise au moins 80 % de son activité dans le  cadre des tâches qui lui sont confiées par l’autorité contractante qui le contrôle ou  par d’autres personnes morales que cette autorité contractante contrôle ;  -  l’opérateur économique contrôlé ne comporte pas de participation directe de  capitaux privés, à l’exception des formes de participation de capitaux privés sans  capacité de contrôle ou de blocage ; et f) les contrats portant sur la privatisation ou la cession des entreprises, biens et  équipements en infrastructure des autorités contractantes.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Resolución  N⁰ 45/2021 – Crea la Red de Adecuación Ambiental de la Cuenca (RAAC).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea la “Red de Adecuación Ambiental de la Cuenca – RAAC”, como red institucional de apoyo a las políticas que la Autoridad de Cuenca Matanza Riachuelo (ACUMAR) implemente para fomentar lo mejor en el desempeño ambiental de aquellos establecimientos del sector productivo y de servicios radicados en el ámbito de la Cuenca Matanza Riachuelo. Policy: Joint Ministerial Order No. 8/2021 regulating the Price of Rice for Resale.
Policy_Content: This Joint Ministerial Order No. 8/2021 regulates the Price of Rice for Resale. Considering that the situation reported derives from several factors, which include the consequences of the Covid-19 pandemic, as well as the fact that the National Logistic Center (CLN) has food security stocks of rice, it establishes that the CLN must immediately proceed with the sale of the rice it has stored to face the current shortage of this essential food item, prioritizing population areas under sanitary fence under the terms of Government Resolutions No. 4/2021 and No. 5/2021 of 15 February.

Policy: Décret modifiant le décret du 5 avril 1995 contenant des dispositions générales concernant la politique de l’environnement et le décret du 23 décembre 2011 relatif à la gestion durable de cycles de matériaux et de déchets
Policy_Content: Ce décret, composé par 4 chapitres, modifie le décret du 5 avril 1995 contenant des dispositions générales concernant la politique de l'environnement et le décret du 23 décembre 2011 relatif à la gestion durable de cycles de matériaux et de déchets. Quant au premier, l'article 10.3.3, § 2 est complété par des points 20°, 21° et 22°. Quant au deuxième, l'article 2 est modifié pour l'adapter à la transposition de la normative européenne en vigueur. Dans l'article trois sont insérées ou modifiées les définitions de biodéchets, déchets alimentaires, déchet non dangereux, régime de responsabilité élargie des producteurs et déchets municipaux ainsi que les définitions de unité de bâtiment et de logement. L'article 4 est révisé dans sa phrase introductive qui définit l'objectif du décret comme celui d'arrêté des mesures pour promouvoir une économie circulaire et pour réaliser des cycles de matériaux par lesquels, entre autre, au point 1 est prévu que la santé de l’homme et de l’environnement soient protégées en prévenant ou en réduisant la production de déchets et les incidences négatives de la production et de la gestion des déchets. L'article 9 est conséquentement complété par un paragraphe 3 prévoyant que le collecteur de déchets propose au producteur de déchets une formule de collecte qui incite le producteur de déchets à offrir les déchets de manière à ce que les objectifs visés à l’article 4 puissent être maximisés lors du traitement des déchets. L'article 10 est révisé pour régler le coûts de la gestion des déchets, y compris ceux relatifs aux infrastructures nécessaires et à leur exploitation en conformité au principe du pollueur-payeur. Aussi l'article 17 est révisé relativement aux programmes de prévention et aux mesures minimales qu'il comportent en termes de modèles de production et de produits satisfaisant certaines conditions. L'article 18 est modifié dans son paragraphe 6 relativement aux éléments que les plans d'exécution doivent comporter au moins en mentionnant les grandes installations d'élimination ainsi que une évaluation de la nécessité de fermeture d’installations de déchets existantes, de la nécessité de mettre en place des infrastructures supplémentaires d'installation de gestion des déchets (points 2 et 3 par.6) L'article 21, concernant l'attribution de responsabilité financière pour la gestion des déchets est aussi revu ainsi que les pratiques que cette attribution mire à obtenir quant au développement, à la fabrication et à la commercialisation de produits avec certaines caractéristiques.Dans l'article 21 est aussi inséré un article 21/1 qui prévoit que, face au régime de responsabilité qu'il établit, le Gouvernement flamand fixe une série de paramètre auxquels se conformer. L'article 33 relatif au protocole d'inspection de l'inventaire d'amiante est aussi révisé quant à la détermination déterminer des constructions d'années à risque qui doivent faire partie de l'inventaire d'amiante. Les articles 36, 39 et 40 relatifs à ce que peut être considéré comme déchet (déchets qui ont subi un traitement en vue de leur recyclage, matériaux pour lesquels n'ait été établi aucun critère européen etc.) sont aussi modifiés.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 5-p of the Forest Service validating the Regulation for carrying out control (patrolling) measures in forests on the land of the forest fund located in the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree is designed to detect and suppress violations by legal entities, individual entrepreneurs and citizens of the mandatory requirements of forestry legislation, as well as in in order to participate in ensuring measures to eliminate the consequences of the identified violations in the implementation of the federal state forestry supervision (forest protection measures) and federal state fire supervision in forests. Organization and control over the implementation of control measures (patrolling) in the forests is carried out by the head of the department of the federal state forestry and fire supervision in the forests of the Main Directorate, heads of forestry departments of the Main Directorate. Control (patrolling) activities in forests can carried out constantly and at any one time. Forest patrol routes are being developed by forestry departments of the Main Directorate within the boundaries of the territory of forestry, taking into account the places of the supposed, systematic or actual violations of the requirements of forest legislation: forest areas, which are places of mass recreation of citizens; forest areas that are the most fire hazardous (young conifers, forest areas where previously there were forest fires); forest plots available for entry of vehicles for hunting purposes; forest areas where young conifers grow in order to protect them during the harvesting of spruce trees and (or) trees of other conifers for the New Year holidays; forest sites on which the development of minerals is carried out, linear objects are located; forest areas adjacent to land of agricultural purposes, peatlands, borders of populated points, horticultural, vegetable gardening and suburban farming associations of citizens; forest plots provided to citizens and legal entities in use, including for the purpose of checking existing cutting areas, located on the forest patrol route, for compliance with requirements of forest legislation by forest users.

Policy_Content: The provisions of this Instruction shall be applicable to: (a) the procedure for registering, issuing and recording forms on the applicable legislation; (b) the procedure for confirming pension insurance record realized in the territory of the Republic of Moldova or the receipt/non-receipt of social rights in the state system of social insurance for presentation to a competent authority on the territory of another contracting state, with which was concluded international agreement in the field of social protection; (c) the procedure for the appointment, renewal, revision of pension rights, payment and accounting for the following types of social rights: (1) old age pension; (2) pension for disability; (3) pension in case of loss of breadwinner; (4) pension and disability allowance in case of employment injury or occupational diseases; (5) burial allowance; (6) unemployment benefits; (7) maternity benefits; (8) monthly childcare allowance until the age of 3 years; and (9) benefit for temporary disability. Applications for the issuance of a form on applicable law shall be submitted personally by an employer, self-employed worker or through a legal representative on the basis of a notarized power of attorney, with the provision of the necessary documents to the responsible specialist of the management of the applicable legislation and cooperation. Submittal of applications for the assignment/renewal/revision of social rights for pension insurance record realized on the territory of the Republic of Moldova is carried out according to provisions of international agreements in accordance with national legislation in the field of state social insurance.

Policy_Content: La présente loi détermine le régime applicable à la pollution, par les navires, du milieu marin ou de l’atmosphère. Policy: Regional Law No. 10-oz “On regulation of some issues in the field of management of domestic and non-domestic waste.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law, with a view of preventing negative impact of domestic and non-domestic waste on environment and human health, saving natural resources, regulates some issues of domestic and non-domestic waste management on the regional territory. Transportation of waste shall be performed with the consideration of the requirements set forth by the federal legislation and in accordance with the regional waste management scheme. Authorization for transportation of waste shall be issued to legal or natural persons performing transportation (movement) of waste, including construction and solid waste. Waste accumulation on the regional territory, including through separate storage by type of waste, groups of wastes, groups of homogeneous wastes (separate accumulation) with due consideration of the requirements established by the federal and regional legislation. Organization of unauthorized waste disposal sites, as well as accumulation, storage, dumping of waste outside the places (sites) of waste accumulation sites that meet the requirements of the sanitary, epidemiological and hygienic well-being of the population and other legislation of the Russian Federation, including forest fund land, agricultural land, lands of protected areas shall be prohibited.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 78-p “On the regional early warning system of the population.”
Policy_Content: The scope this Regional Decree shall be to coordinate activities related to setting up and maintenance of early warning system in a state of constant readiness. The Regulation defines the purpose and tasks of the regional public early warning systems, the procedure for their activation and maintenance in alert. Notification of the population in emergency situations is early warning of the population - delivery of notification signals and urgent information to the population about dangers arising in the case of natural and manmade emergencies, military activities or as a consequence of the aforesaid actions and the necessity to perform protective arrangements. A warning signal is a command to carry out activities for civil protection and protection of population from emergencies, natural and man-made disasters by management bodies and forces of civil protection and unified state system of emergency prevention and mitigation of the consequences thereof, as well as for the use by the population of means and methods of protection. Emergency information about actual and forecasted hazardous natural and anthropogenic phenomena, environmental pollution, diseases that may put at risk life or health of citizens, as well as rules of conduct and methods of protection shall be immediately transmitted via the public notification system.

Policy: Law on environmental protection.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates: a) the principles of environmental protection; b) protection of environmental components; c) competence in the field of environmental protection; d) information and education on the environment; e) access to environmental information and public participation in the field of environmental protection; f) environmental planning; g) strategic environmental impact assessment; h) establishment of environmental quality standards; i) environmental impact assessment; j) environmental permit; k) prevention of large-scale accidents; l) financing of environmental protection; m) civil liability for environmental damage; n) eco-labelling and environmental management system; o) inter-entity cooperation in the field of environmental protection; p) administrative and inspection supervision and r) misdemeanor provisions. General objectives of this Law are: a) reduced use, prevention of pollution and environmental pollution, prevention of disturbances, as well as improvement and restoration of the damaged environment; b) improvement of environmental conditions, protection of human health, including the right to a healthy life; c) conservation and protection of natural resources, rational use of resources and such a way of doing business which ensures the renewal of resources; d) harmonization of social, economic and other interests of the Federation of BiH with the requirements for environmental protection; e) realization and improvement of international cooperation in environmental protection; f) public animation and public participation in activities aimed at environmental protection; g) coordination of the economy and integration of social and economic development in accordance with the requirements of environmental protection; h) establishment and development of institutions for protection and preservation of the environment. The provisions of this Law apply to: a) all components of the environment (air, water, soil, world of plants, animals and fungi, landscape, built environment); b) all types of activities whose purpose is the use and burdening of natural resources, i.e. the impact on the environment that means the risk of pollution during the activity, or have a negative impact on the environment (such as noise, vibration, radiation, excluding nuclear radiation, waste, light pollution , etc.); c) rights and responsibilities of legal and natural persons performing activities determined by law; d) tasks in the field of environment arising from international conventions. Everyone has the right to a healthy and environmentally sound environment as a fundamental human right and it is a general duty to protect and improve the environment for the benefit of present and future generations. Entities that ensure environmental protection are the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, cantons and local self-government units in accordance with this Law and other regulations.

Policy: Ley Nº 2082 - Ley que crea la categoría de municipios "ciudades capitales" y adopta mecanismos tendientes a fortalecer la descentralización administrativa .
Policy_Content: La presente Ley  tiene por objeto crear la categoría de municipios "ciudades capitales" y adoptar mecanismos tendientes a fortalecer la descentralización administrativa, de conformidad con lo estipulado en el Artículo 320 de la Constitución Política. El Distrito Capital de Bogotá y los demás distritos y municipios que tienen la condición de capitales departamentales pertenecerán a la categoría de "ciudades capitales" y tendrán un régimen especial para su organización, gobierno y administración y un tratamiento diferenciado por parte de las autoridades administrativas, con el fin de promover su desarrollo integral y regional, a partir de su población e importancia económica. Las ciudades capitales estarán sometidas a la Constitución, a las leyes especiales que se dictan para definir su organización, funcionamiento, recursos y competencias, y, en ausencia de disposiciones especiales constitucionales o legales, a las normas vigentes que rigen para los demás municipios.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 54-pP validating the Regulation on the procedure for the allocation of subsidies to organizations and individual entrepreneurs engaged in the primary and (or) subsequent (industrial) processing of agricultural products.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the procedure to organizations and individual entrepreneurs engaged in the primary and (or) subsequent (industrial) processing of agricultural products. It shall be applicable to allocation of subsidies for reimbursement of part of the costs for the purchase of food wheat on condition of co-financing at the expense of the federal budget and reimbursement of part of the costs of selling produced and sold bread and bakery products. The distributor of subsidies shall be Regional Ministry of Agriculture withing finances envisaged for the current fiscal year. Subsidies shall be granted to selected recipients, complying with the following requirements at the date of application for subsidies: (a) the participant of the selection must not have overdue indebtedness on return to the regional budget, budget investments granted in accordance with other legal acts, and (unsettled) indebtedness to the regional authorities; (b) during the subsidized period the recipients - legal entities must not be in the process of reorganization, liquidation or bankruptcy proceedings, the activities of the recipient have not been suspended in accordance with the procedure stipulated by the legislation of the Russian Federation, and the recipients who are individual entrepreneurs have not ceased their activities as an individual entrepreneur; (c) the recipient is not a foreign legal entity, as well as a Russian legal entity, in the authorized (share) capital of which the share of participation of foreign legal entities, the place of registration of which is a state or territory included in the list of states or territories approved by the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation, providing preferential tax treatment and (or) which do not stipulate the disclosure or presentation of information related to financial transactions (offshore zones) with regard to such legal entities exceeds 50 percent in the aggregate; (d) participants of the selection should not receive funds from the regional budget within the program of agricultural development and regulation of agricultural markets, raw materials and food; and (e) applicants - legal entities must not be included in the register of legal entities brought to administrative responsibility for refusal or evasion to conclude a contract, for which the conclusion of such a contract is mandatory.

Policy: Ley 6/2021, de 17 de febrero, de residuos y suelos contaminados de Galicia.
Policy_Content: Constituye el objeto de esta ley la regulación de la producción y gestión sostenible de los residuos, potenciando medidas que prevengan su producción y disminuyan los impactos adversos sobre la salud humana y el medio ambiente, vinculados a su generación y gestión, al tiempo que se fomenta el uso sostenible de los recursos y la transición hacia una economía circular y baja en carbono en el territorio de la Comunidad Autónoma de Galicia. Además, es objeto de esta ley regular el régimen jurídico de los suelos contaminados aplicable en la Comunidad Autónoma de Galicia. La ley se compone de 8 títulos, a saber: instrumentos de la política de residuos (I); de la producción, posesión y gestión de residuos (II); gestión de residuos domésticos, comerciales e industriales (III); responsabilidad ampliada del sujeto productor del producto (IV); expropiación (V); de los suelos contaminados (VI); fomento, producción y difusión (VII); y vigilancia, inspección, control y potestad sancionadora (VIII).

Policy: Regulation on the boundaries of sub-basin areas and small basin areas.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with the Montenegrin Law on plant health protection, determines the boundaries of areas of sub-basins and small river basins present on the territory of Montenegro. The areas of sub-basins in the water area of the Danube basin are: 1) Drina sub-basin area; 2) Ibar sub-basin area. The areas of sub-basins in the water area of the Adriatic basin are: 1) the area of the Bojana sub-basin; 2) the area of sub-basins of watercourses, which flow into the Adriatic Sea, except Bojana. Areas of small basins in the water area of Montenegro are: 1) the area of the small Piva basin; 2) the area of the small Tara basin; 3) the area of the small Lima basin; 4) the area of the small Ibar basin; 5) the area of the small Ćehotina basin; 6) the area of the small Zeta basin; 7) the area of the small Morača basin; 8) the area of the small basin of Skadar Lake with its tributaries, except Morača; 9) the area of the small Bojana basin; 10) the area of a small basin of watercourses flowing into the Adriatic Sea, except Bojana.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 43/21 approving the Regulation for the Independent Electric Energy Production.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Regulation for the Independent Electric Energy Production. This Regulation, consisting of 34 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes the Legal Regime applicable to Independent Electricity Production and the rules on the acquisition of its surplus for public supply. This Regulation applies to all natural and legal persons who carry out the activity of independent production of electricity, aimed at satisfying their own needs and who are authorized to inject surplus energy into the Public Electricity System (SEP). Self-production is excluded from the scope of this Regulation. Independent electricity production assumes the following classification: a) Independent generation under general regime; b) Independent production under special regime. Independent production under a special regime, whose remuneration regime is defined in these Regulations, includes the following special regimes: a) Independent renewable production; b) Independent emergency production.

Policy: Ley Nº 1359 – Ley de emergencia sanitaria.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco legal básico para el manejo de emergencias sanitarias. Sus objetivos son: a) Proteger la salud pública y prevenir su pérdida o deterioro; y b) autorizar a la Ministra o Ministro de Salud y Deportes para adoptar las medidas previstas en la presente Ley cuando así lo exijan razones sanitarias. Policy: Governmental Decree No. 46 validating the Regulation on the procedure for organizing the activities of pre-school farms.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes the procedure for organizing the activities of pre-school farms, created as non-profit entities and aimed at improving quality and variety of the diet of students in general education organizations, as well as to ensure the sustainable development of their activities. The principal of an educational organization has the right to create a pre-school farm if there is a plot of land on the territory of the general education. In case of a decision to create a pre-school farm, the principal of an educational organization a decree on the creation of a pre-school farm, and not later than 10 working days (in written form) informs the executive body of local government and the territorial body of the authorized state educational administration. In case of unavailability of a land plot the principal of a general education organization for creation of a pre-school farm applies to the executive body of the local government for allotment of a land plot. After the allotment of the land plot by the executive body of the local government and the issuance of entitling document, the principal of the general education organization takes measures to create a pre-school farm on the allotted land plot. To manage the activities of the pre-school farm by order of the principal of the general education organization establishes a steering committee for a period of 4 years. The steering committee is headed by the director of the educational organization. Economic activities of the school farm shall be subject to mandatory documentation in the forms established by the authorized state body in the field of education.

Policy: Order No. 16/2021 establishing Technical Norms for the Characterization of Urban Waste.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes Technical Norms for the Characterization of Urban Waste. The aim of this Order is to regulate and classify all kind of Waste, according to its source, into: a) Urban waste, RU or MSW: waste from households, namely: «Green waste»: waste from cleaning and maintaining gardens, public green spaces, etc.; «Waste from commercial activity»: waste produced by one or more commercial establishments which, by their nature or composition, are similar to waste from households; «Wastes from industrial activity»; «Waste from service activities»: waste similar to waste from households; «Waste from hospital activity»; «Waste from agricultural activity»: waste from agricultural or livestock farming. Waste is classified, according to its hazard, into: «Hazardous waste»: «Non-hazardous waste»: waste that does not have the characteristics of hazardous waste due to its safety for human health or the environment; and «Inert waste»: waste that does not undergo physical changes.

Policy: Ley 1/2021, de 12 de febrero, de Simplificación Urbanística y Medidas Administrativas.
Policy_Content: Resaltando el contexto derivado de la pandemia provocada por la COVID19, el documento fija como objetivo la articulación de respuestas efectivas en todos los ámbitos, también en el normativo, que fomenten la minoración de los perniciosos efectos de la pandemia, así como la procura de las mejores condiciones para el establecimiento y desarrollo de actividades económicas en todo el territorio castellano-manchego, y muy particularmente, en sus ámbitos rurales. Una primera línea de acción en la presente ley es la implantación en la normativa de ordenación territorial y urbanísticos una serie de principios de desarrollo sostenible que recogen postulados de textos tan fundamentales como, entre otros, los objetivos de desarrollo sostenible de la Agenda 2030 y las Agendas urbanas europea y española, cuyos objetivos son seguidos como referencia por la presente ley: se trata de ordenar el territorio, haciendo un uso racional del suelo en pos de su conservación y protección; evitar la dispersión urbana y revitalizar la ciudad existente; prevenir y reducir los efectos del cambio climático y mejorar la resiliencia; hacer una gestión sostenible de los recursos y favorecer la economía circular;  favorecer  la  proximidad  y  la  movilidad  sostenible;  fomentar  la  cohesión  social  y  la  equidad,  garantizando  el acceso a una vivienda digna y adecuada; liderar y fomentar la innovación digital y el tránsito a un consumo energético derivado de fuentes renovables; y mejorar los instrumentos de intervención y la gobernanza.

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2021/241 establishing the Recovery and Resilience Facility.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the Recovery and Resilience Facility and lays down the objectives of the Facility, its financing, and the forms of Union funding and its provision. In the context of the COVID-19 crisis, the Facility shall promote the Union’s economic, social and territorial cohesion by improving the resilience, crisis preparedness, adjustment capacity and growth potential of the Member States, by mitigating the social and economic impact of that crisis, in particular on women. The Facility shall be implemented by the Commission referring to EU policies in the fields of: (I) green transition; (II) digital transformation; (III) smart, sustainable and inclusive growth, including economic cohesion, jobs, productivity, competitiveness, research, development and innovation, and a well-functioning internal market with strong small- and medium-scale enterprises; (IV) social and territorial cohesion; (V) health, and economic, social and institutional resilience, with the aim of increasing crisis preparedness and crisis response capacity; and (VI) policies for the next generation, children and the youth, such as education and skills. Member States shall prepare national recovery and resilience plans in this scope and necessary financial support shall be provided by the Facility from the Union funds. Support under the Facility shall be additional to the support provided under other Union programmes and instruments. The Commission shall monitor the implementation of the Facility and the monitoring of implementation shall be targeted and proportionate to the activities carried out under the Facility.

Policy: Parliament Resolution No. HP15/2021 validating the Declaration of the Parliament of the Republic of Moldova on the current and future impact of hydropower facilities on the Dniester River, as well as on the prevention of an imminent environmental catastrophe.
Policy_Content: In 2011, the Government, by Resolution No. 205 of March 31, initiated the procedure ratification, and Parliament, by Law No. 171 of July 28, ratified the Moldovan-Ukrainian protocol, on the basis of which to Ukraine was transferred full ownership of Novodnistrovskaya pump-storage hydroelectric power station. Scientists and environmentalists note deteriorating hydrological, hydrochemical and hydrobiological regime of the Dniester River, 80-percentage decrease over the past 7-8 years in the potential for self-cleaning (the river is no longer capable of self-cleaning), the disappearance of valuable fish species, intensive siltation of the river, a sharp drop in volume, debit and level of water, replacement of plants characteristic of rivers with plants, characteristic of marshes and wetlands, and many other problems indicating the risk that our citizens will soon be left without a source of drinking water, while catastrophic environmental consequences can become irreversible not only for Republic of Moldova, but also for Ukraine. Parliament expresses deep concern about Kiev's intention to establish and put in operation of new turbines and expansion of the Novodnistrovsk pump-storage hydroelectric power plant, as well as the planned construction on the Dniester of a cascade of six hydroelectric power plants, which we consider disastrous for the Republic of Moldova. We believe that proposals for new environmental impact assessments due to the expansion of the Dniester hydropower complex are relevant and will allow solving serious problems of the lower reaches of the Dniester River. In this regard, we call on international and European organizations in the field of environmental protection, development partners and diplomatic missions, accredited in the Republic of Moldova, representatives of civil society and mass media in the country and abroad to be more actively involved in solving the problem of Dniester River.

Policy_Content: These Updated First Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC) is a nationwide multi-sectoral document aiming at reflecting the Kingdom’s efforts to comply with the provisions of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and Paris Agreement by engaging in actions and plans to pursuit the economic diversification with the following co-benefits (i) greenhouse gas emission avoidance, reduction and removal; (ii) climate adaptation; and (iii) managing the impacts of response measures, maximizing long-term benefits and minimizing potential negative side effects. The aim is reducing and avoiding GHG emissions by 278 million tons of CO2eq annually by 2030, with the year 2019 designated as the base year for this NDC. The document presents two possible scenarios different in the allocation of hydrocarbons produced for either domestic consumption or export. While exported hydrocarbons will not contribute to the GHG emissions of Saudi Arabia, the domestic consumption will increase its GHG emissions.

Policy: Clusters Development Plan - Agricultural Cluster - Jenin 2021-2023
Policy_Content: This Agricultural Cluster Plan for the province of Jenin comes within the framework of the Government's approach to adopting a comprehensive economic development methodology according to the Clusters system, intending to (i) contribute to achieving sustainable competitive advantages for the Palestinian economy in all geographical areas and (ii) develop and encourage investment in all sectors. This is to realize what is stated by the Vision for the region of achieving excellence and quality in the agricultural sector to provide job opportunities, income, and food security for the citizen in a sustainable manner, and contributing to advancing economic growth in the governorate through the investment of natural resources, available market opportunities, and knowledge. The Plan is based on the following pillars (i) promote access to agricultural lands, water and natural resources, and markets; (ii) increase investment in the agricultural sector and strengthening the partnership between the public and private sectors; (iii) find alternatives and solutions to adapt to the phenomenon of climate change; (iv) activate the role of agricultural institutions, especially those concerned with small farmers, and improving the role of women and youth in agriculture and rural development; (v) give high priority to the restoration of the agricultural sector and the provision of budgets and appropriate support, whether from the general budget or donor countries and institutions.

Policy: Energy and Natural Resources Sector Strategy 2021-2023.
Policy_Content: This Energy and Natural Resources Sector Strategy is a nationwide sectoral document that falls within the broader National Development Plan 2021 - 2023 endorsed by Prime Minister's Office. The energy sector in Palestine aims to advance in all its branches: generation, transmission, and distribution to achieve the Energy Authority’s mission of (i) preparing and developing appropriate policies and legislation to achieve sustainable energy security under international best practices; (ii) building an energy system capable of meeting the needs of the Palestinian citizen; (iii) achieve a comprehensive and sustainable development at reasonable prices that reflect the true cost of production, transportation, distribution, and consumption; (iv) utilizing all locally available energy sources, especially renewable and environmentally friendly energy sources, with high efficiency, quality, and reliability that meet internationally approved specifications and comply with internationally approved environmental standards. Among the most important goals to be achieved through this Strategy (i) increasing the amount of locally produced capacity, exploiting local resources and reducing dependence on imports as much as possible; (ii) increasing the share of energy produced from new and renewable energy sources in the energy balance to mitigate negative environmental impacts; (iii) efficient production, transmission, distribution and consumption of energy, and adopting a policy of rationalizing consumption and reducing waste; (iv) diversifying energy sources to ensure energy security by increasing the proportion of energy produced locally and from all sources, and increasing the proportion of imported energy through regional connectivity and energy exchange with neighboring countries; and (v) building specialized and effective institutions in the energy sector capable of implementing development programs and developing the energy sector, and separating the sector’s activities from the policymaker, executor of these policies, and the supervisory body to implement these policies. Achieving these goals helps to secure energy at competitive prices which in turn contributes to lowering the cost to the consumer. The aforementioned goals can be achieved through the following (i) provision of strategic energy reserves; (ii) energy exchange with neighboring countries; (iii) developed transmission and distribution system; (iv) applying modern technologies and automating the monitoring and control of the energy transmission and distribution system; (v) energy efficiency and rationalization of consumption; (vi) intervening on the institutions operating in the energy sector; (vii) integrated and comprehensive planning for the energy sector within a single policy framework; (viii) efficiency of the cadres working in the energy sector; (ix) increasing the economic efficiency of the sector; (x) supplying natural gas to the Gaza power station and providing natural gas resources to build power stations in the West Bank; (xi) exploitation of natural gas discovered in the Gaza Sea and potential oil resources in the West Bank; (xii) the completion of the drafting of the commercial agreement with the Israel Electricity Company regarding the import of electricity.

Policy: Land Sector Strategy 2021 - 2023.
Policy_Content: This Land Sector Strategy is a nationwide sectoral document that falls within the broader National Development Plan 2021 - 2023 endorsed by Prime Minister's Office. The Strategy has been developed by the Land Authority (established according to Law No.6 of 2010) to achieve the sector's Vision of reaching a "real estate sector that stimulates investment and ensures efficient management as well as the optimal use of land and real estate". Other goals set up for the sector are (i) fixing and protecting immovable property rights through electronic archiving and the inclusion of owners' card numbers on immovable property records; (ii) raising the efficiency and production capacity of land transactions through the creation of offices to distribute work pressure in the sites, as well as providing some electronic services, improve information systems so that they all operate centrally, increase the number of transactions that end in one working day, and enter some legislative reforms represented in the long run by unifying the legal framework governing the land sector; (iii) conducting a comprehensive real estate assessment of the registered immovable property; (iv) standardization of the geodetic reference by developing a survey work through the establishment of a new national coordinate system to eliminate differences in survey work resulting from the use of multiple coordinate references and in this way reduce conflicts and preserve property and rights; and (v) preserving State property through a strategic development plan prepared by the Land Authority to exploit and invest in state property and its optimal administration in cooperation with the central government, the main and relevant government institutions, including local government bodies, and all partner parties, with a focus on youth, projects for graduates, and sustainable investment business.

Policy: National Development Plan for Palestine - Resilience, resistance, disassociation and development by clusters towards independence.
Policy_Content: This National Development Plan for Palestine is a nationwide multi-sectoral document consisting of two main parts: one is purely political, the other economic. This latter focuses on the new development paradigm of the development by clusters, a concept of development that allows taking advantage of the competitive advantage of each of the country's governorates, and maximizing these advantages in economic terms. In other words, clustered development means packing the Palestinian geography and its economic, institutional, educational and other activities into interconnected clusters, in order to reach the general national goal and contribute to achieving it with the participation of all development partners, namely the government, local bodies, the private sector, community, universities and donors. It is necessary a shift in the outputs of the educational system, and the nature of jobs and job opportunities. The Plan aims to (i) encourage industrial, agricultural and tourism production; (ii) reduce unemployment and fight poverty; (iii) enhance the role of women and youth; (iv) pay attention to education and vocational training; (v) preserve public freedoms and enhance transparency; (vi) strengthen and establish industrial cities, in addition to creating development pioneering projects, business and technology incubators; (vii) enhance investment in clean energy and pay attention to water resources; and (viii) enhance the resilience of citizens by improving health, educational and economic services, social protection and other basic services.

Policy: Nationally Determined Contribution of Kingdom of Bahrain under UNFCCC 2021.
Policy_Content: This Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) is a nationwide sectoral document, developed under Article 3 of UNFCCC and Article 4.7 of the Paris Agreement, aiming at increasing the strives of Bahrain to (i) promote mitigation co-benefits resulting from both adaptation actions and economic diversification plans; (ii) reduce emissions in its economic development; (iii) improve national energy efficiency leading to a reduction of energy consumption. The document envisages an adaptation Strategy to enhance the adaptive capacity to cope with climate change risks to be built on a National Adaptation Investment Plan (NAIP) that is the guiding document to identify interventions. The NAIP set out the following 5 objectives (1) systematically describe what adaptation to the adverse impacts of climate change means in Bahrain and identify objectives for adaptation (situational analysis); (2) identify interventions to increase resilience to climate change and achieve the objectives for adaptation (project pipeline); (3) identify relevant options of how to finance these interventions (finance strategy); (4) identify the stakeholders in the different areas affected by the adverse impacts of climate change on which successful adaptation will depend (stakeholder analysis); and (5) prescribe institutional arrangements across different departments and agencies to implement the identified interventions.

Policy: Food Vision 2030.
Policy_Content: This Food Vision 2030 is a nationwide strategic document aiming, as a primary purpose, at providing a vision and policies for the Irish agri-food sector over the coming decade following the path of transition experienced by the sector over the past years. As for the aforementioned Vision, Ireland aims to become a world leader in Sustainable Food Systems (SFS) over the next decade, meeting the highest standards of sustainability – economic, environmental, and social - and producing safe, nutritious, and high-value food, while protecting and enhancing the natural and cultural resources and contributing to vibrant rural and coastal communities and the national economy. The Strategy is based on the concept of 4 high-level Missions underpinned by a series of 22 key goals and actions. The 4 Missions are as follows (i) a climate-smart, environmentally sustainable agri-food sector; (ii) viable and resilient primary producers with enhanced well-being; (iii) food that is safe, nutritious and appealing, trusted, and valued at home and abroad; and (iv) an innovative, competitive and resilient agri-food sector, driven by technology and talent.

Policy: Better Health, Better Lives: Combating Non-Communicable Diseases in the Context of Norwegian Development Policy (2020-2024).
Policy_Content: The present Strategy seeks to position Norway in a leading role to expand the work on noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) in international health and development policy as well as to ensure practical action in low-income countries. The Strategy's overarching goal is to help reduce the number of premature deaths from NCDs in low-income countries by one-third by 2030 and promote mental health and wellbeing (SDG Target 3.4), and to generally improve people’s health throughout the life-course. It seeks to reach the poorest and most vulnerable groups in order to help achieving the main objective of the 2030 Agenda – that no one is left behind. The Strategy focuses on three main areas: i) Preventing and reducing risk through concrete measures across sectors to prevent disease and premature death, where regulation, taxation and multi-sectoral measures will be important; ii) Strengthening primary health care by improving prevention, diagnosis and treatment of non-communicable diseases, and ensuring everyone has access to health care subsidized by the public authorities; and iii)  Strengthening global public goods, including normative work, access to health data and health information, digitalization and research.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 36 validating the Regulation on the procedure for determining the norms of livestock pressure on grazing land of the Kyrgyz Republic.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for determining the norms of livestock pressure on grazing land of the Kyrgyz Republic with a view of preventing degradation and desertification of agricultural land. It shall be applicable to grazing grounds, including forest pastures. The scope of determining the norms of livestock pressure on grazing land shall be to maintain ecological balance, natural grass stand, implementation of calculations according to the norm of pressure on rangelands for the rational use of rangelands. Rates of livestock pressure on grazing land shall be calculated per hectare expressed in the number of conventional head of livestock that can provide forage for a unit of pasture area. The pressure is determined depending on the typological composition of vegetation, the utilization rate of rangelands (herbage by seasons) and yield. The rate of load on pastures of the Kyrgyz Republic for the territory of the corresponding rural district is established by local authorities of self-government, taking into account natural and climatic conditions, productivity, daily feed rates that cannot be lower than baseline indicators.

Policy: Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2021/652 amending Delegated Regulation (EU) 2017/891 as regards the activities and operational programmes of producer organisations in the fruit and vegetables sector.
Policy_Content: This Regulation makes several amendments to the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2017/891 regarding the activities and operational programmes of producer organizations in the fruit and vegetables sector. Therefore, Annexes II, III and VI are amended in accordance with the Annex to this Regulation. Member States should be allowed to extend their national strategy until 31 December 2025. A maximum Union financial assistance for withdrawals will be set for free distribution of processed fruit and vegetables with the view to avoiding any possible effect of overcompensation. Moreover, the Member States are obliged to notify the Commission of the weighted average recorded producer prices of fruit and vegetables corresponding to the types and varieties of products, sizes and presentations as specified in Annex VI to that Regulation.

Policy: Presidential Decree UP No. 25 “On measures for the development of agro-industrial complex.”
Policy_Content: The President recommends to the Government to adopt the following measures: (a) to increase the efficiency of use and market turnover of agricultural land; (b) to consider the possibility of transferring to the management of the authorized body for agriculture part of land of the State Fund of Agricultural Land for the development of cooperatives, seed and breeding farms; (c) to introduce cluster farming methods in the agro-industrial complex at the national and regional levels, including organizing agroclusters for the processing of milk, meat, walnuts, medicinal herbs, fish products, textile crops, wool and leather; (d) to create conditions for: large land users (100 hectares and more) with the provision of opportunities for them on their land plots for the construction of farms necessary for the functioning and development of farming, including fiscal measures and incentives; (e) to introduce agricultural insurance system in areas of risky farming and distant cattle breeding; (f) to develop halal agricultural products; (g) to create conditions and mechanisms to stimulate industrial enterprises, including residents of free economic zones, as well as enterprises of textile and clothing industry for the use of agricultural raw materials and materials (spinning crops, leather, wool, etc.) in the manufacturing of finished products; (h) to create mechanisms of cooperation with industrial science and cluster alliances to improve farmers' access to innovation and ensure introduction of modern technologies, including resource-saving technologies in agriculture; (i) to determine the list of public services and functions in the field of agro-industrial complex and agriculture on the basis of mechanisms of Public Private Partnership; (j) to abolish the licensing of artesian wells used for needs of agriculture; (k) to take measures for the effective use of undeveloped and unproductive agricultural land and pastures, consider the possibility of development on these land plots for agroforestry, horticulture and viticulture; (l) to create an information and reference system for peasants and farmers; (m) to ensure traceability of agricultural commodities; (n) to ensure agribusiness access to land, water and pasture resources for the transformation of agricultural land into production goals; (o) to create conditions for organizing and expanding fish production in water reservoirs, including infrastructure for production and processing of fish products; (p) to take measures to overcome small-scale production by developing cooperation in agriculture; (q) to improve the access of agricultural cooperatives to local and national agricultural markets and trade networks of the country; and (r) to introduce technologies aimed at improving water accounting in irrigation networks.

Los presentes Lineamientos tienen la finalidad de orientar y facilitar los procesos de valoración económica de la diversidad forestal y fauna silvestre, y son de aplicación para las autoridades competentes y personas naturales o jurídicas, públicas y privadas, que participan en el aprovechamiento y gestión de la diversidad forestal y fauna silvestre.

Policy: Ley Nº 196 - Crea el Régimen Especial para el establecimiento de Empresas Operadoras y Desarrolladoras de Agroparques.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Régimen Especial para el establecimiento de Empresas Operadoras y Desarrolladoras de Agroparques, con el propósito de desarrollar un marco regulatorio para cumplir los siguientes objetivos: 1) Incentivar la inversión y el establecimiento de agroparques que contribuyan a la creación de polos de desarrollo que, al tiempo que fomenten la generación de agronegocios, promuevan el establecimiento de cadenas de valor a partir de bienes nacionales, en un entorno geográfico y bajo condiciones idóneas; 2) Promover la producción agroalimentaria, agroindustrial y de servicios afines, así como también industrias relacionadas con el sector forestal, productos del mar y materias primas para la industria farmacéutica en un entorno eficiente que promueve la innovación; 3) Desarrollar cadenas productivas de valor con la adopción de altas tecnologías sostenibles con el ambiente, agregando valor a través de la transformación y/o procesamiento de la materia prima y sus subproductos; 4)  Identificar promotores con capacidad de creación de mercado, para fomentar el desarrollo de una oferta exportable apegada a las necesidades globales; 5) Incentivar la participación de empresas desarrolladoras nacionales e internacionales, con experiencia probada en modelos similares, quienes asesoraran a los agroempresarios y agroindustriales poniendo a su disposición tecnología de punta, experiencias de producción, transformación, procesamiento y reciclaje; 6) Cumplir con los estándares nacionales e internacionales y observar las normas sanitarias y ambientales que garanticen la inocuidad, seguridad y trazabilidad de la producción; 7) Implementar el uso de la agrotecnología de forma eficiente y sostenible con el ambiente, adoptando conceptos de producción más limpia y sostenible, buenas prácticas de estándares globales de producción, manejo postcosecha y asegurar una gestión integrada de residuos generados del proceso productivo agropecuario, de conformidad con la legislación vigente; 8) Establecer mecanismos de asociatividad entre los agroempresarios, empresarios de servicios y agroindustriales que faciliten relaciones de negocios entre ellos y el acceso a beneficios redistributivos a la mayor cantidad de personas y sujetos del sector agropecuario y de exportación; 9) Garantizar la modernización de los procesos, trámites y permisos que faciliten la investigación, financiamiento y promoción de la agroindustria nacional; 10) Promover las inversiones en agua, energía y comunicaciones que tiendan a impactar en el desarrollo de las cadenas de valor; 11) Apoyar con servicios agrosanitarios y de inocuidad, y el desarrollo de productos de valor a partir de la agroindustria nacional; 12)  Optimizar el recurso hídrico de forma sostenible, promoviendo el aumento de la resiliencia del sector agropecuario frente al cambio climático.

Policy: Ley Nº 21.305 - Sobre eficiencia energética.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece la obligación del Ministerio de Energía de elaborar, cada cinco años, un Plan Nacional de Eficiencia Energética, el que deberá comprender, al menos, las siguientes materias: eficiencia energética residencial; estándares mínimos y etiquetado de artefactos; eficiencia energética en la edificación y el transporte; eficiencia energética y ciudades inteligentes; eficiencia energética en los sectores productivos y educación y capacitación en eficiencia energética. Este Plan deberá establecer una meta de reducción de la intensidad energética para el país de, al menos, 10% al año 2030, respecto del año 2019. El Ministerio de Energía deberá someter al Consejo de Ministros para la Sustentabilidad el primer Plan Nacional de Eficiencia Energética, en un plazo no superior a dieciocho meses contado desde la publicación de esta ley (13 de febrero de 2021). La Ley establece los lineamientos para la elaboración del Plan, incluyendo mecanismos que aseguren la participación ciudadana. Asimismo, se establecen normas sobre la calificación energética para obtener permisos de edificación, se crea el Registro Nacional de Evaluadores Energéticos, se establecen las obligaciones y responsabilidades de los evaluados energéticos, se establece la obligación de los gobiernos locales de velar por el buen uso por el buen uso de la energía en los inmuebles que ocupen y/o administren, entre otras materias relacionadas con la eficiencia energética.  La presente Ley modifica el Decreto Ley N° 2.224, de 1978, del Ministerio de Energía, con tal de incluir al hidrógeno y combustibles a partir de hidrógeno dentro de las competencias en el sector energía de este Ministerio; y se agregan nuevos párrafos referidos a los nuevos estándares de eficiencia energética.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 37/21 approving the National Policy on Social Action.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the National Policy on Social Action (PNAS). The PNAS, consisting of 16 Chapters, three Tables and one Annex, aims to establish the theoretical and methodological bases for a National Social Action System, and is based on the action of the different actors and promoters of Social Action. It also deals with the principles of the right of access to the programmes and projects of Social Action and Solidarity. In addition, it establishes the State's responsibility for the guidance, management, financing and control of the Social Action, being also responsible for the integration and application of the Prevention, Protection and Promotion axes (the "3 P"), in order to protect people, families and communities who are in a situation of poverty and severe vulnerability or need by giving them a decent standard of living, such as: access to basic services, to their social and economic rights, thereby improving the National Human Development Indexes.

Policy: Somaliland Special Economic Zones Law, No: 93/2021
Policy_Content: This law is made for the following purposes; 1) To regulate the establishment, development, operation and maintenance of Special Economic Zones in the Republic of Somaliland. 2) To establish the legal framework and mechanisms for the regulation and administration of activities within the special economic zones with due regard to the principles of openness, competitiveness and transparency, and 3) To enable environment for the development of all aspects of special economic zones including; development of integrated infrastructure facilities, creation of incentives for economic and business activities and to remove of impediments to economic or business activities that generate profit for enterprises in areas designated as special economic zones. Furthermore, the specific purpose for designating special economic zones include; a) to promote and facilitate local and foreign investment in the Republic of Somaliland; b) to create and expand employment opportunities; c) to stimulate economic growth in existing and new business sectors through the sustainable development of new Special Economic Zones; d) to develop new infrastructure and rehabilitate existing infrastructure; e) to encourage the private sector to participate in the development, operation and maintenance of Special Economic Zones including the development of Infrastructure; to promote an investment and trade environment in-line with international best practices; f) to create an attractive regulatory framework and conducive business environment for local and foreign investors, including through the creation of a one stop shop and entitlement to a package of fiscal and non-fiscal incentives; g) to promote financial and industrial cooperation between the Republic of Somaliland and foreign countries through technology-intensive industries that will modernize the country’s industrial sector and improve productivity levels by utilizing new technological and managerial know-how; and h) To enable the Special Economic Zones to operate outside the Customs Territory, within the framework of the Constitution and the national sovereignty and territorial integrity of the Republic of Somaliland. The law provides that, among others, all Special Economic Zones (SEZ) in the Republic of Somaliland shall be operated on a common user basis without any unfair or discriminatory practice against any actual or prospective SEZ User or SEZ Resident. The law establishes the  Somaliland Special Economic Zones Authority, which shall have exclusive regulatory jurisdiction over all Special Economic Zones. The commercial activities which may be carried out within a Special Economic Zone include industrial, logistics, retail, residential, commercial, and any other activities permitted under the applicable License.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 117 “On rates of export customs duties on grain crops exported from the Russian Federation outside the states - parties to the agreements on the Customs Union.”
Policy_Content: Starting from April 1, 2021, the Ministry of Agriculture of the Russian Federation will monitor grain prices by observing price indicators: daily exchange quotations for wheat and meslin, barley and corn, or, if they are absent, indices calculated on the basis of over-the-counter contracts. So, with regard to wheat at a world price of up to 200 US dollars per ton, the duty will not be levied. At a price exceeding 200 US dollars per ton, the duty will be 70% of the difference between the world and this base price of 200 US dollars. For barley and corn, the indicator is set at 185 US dollars per ton. The monitoring period is 7 calendar days preceding the date of calculation of the rates of export customs duties for the specified grain crops. On the last working day of the week, the Ministry of Agriculture of the Russian Federation calculates the rates of export customs duties on grain crops and posts information about the calculated rates on its official website on the Internet.

Policy: Law No. 04/2021 establishing the Great Options of the Plan for the Economic Year 2021.
Policy_Content: This Law approves the Great Options of the Plan for the Economic Year 2021. These Great Options are part of the ongoing economic recovery process, structured in measures and actions oriented towards the implementation and the achievement of the strategic objectives defined for the period 2018-2022. The Great Options of the Plan for the year 2021 are those assumed by the Government, as fundamental pillars of the governmental action, namely: a) Deepening the democratic rule of law; b) Robust economic growth and accelerated job creation; c) Improving the quality of health and social protection; d) Foreign policy at the service of development. The priority areas for intervention are mainly based on activities related to post-Covid 19 recovery, with highlights for transport infrastructures; capturing and distributing water to populations; improving the production, transport and distribution of electricity to the population; improving the quality of the education system at all levels; reform in the justice sector and the improvement of health care.

Policy: Loi du 5 février 2021 modifiant la loi modifiée du 27 juin 2016 concernant le soutien au développement durable des zones rurales.
Policy_Content: La présente loi modifie certains articles de la loi modifiée du 27 juin 2016 concernant le soutien au développement durable des zones rurales. En particulier les articles 3, 5, 7, 9 et 10 sont modifiés. A la suite de l'article 14, un nouveau chapitre 14bis est inséré prévoyant la création d'un régime d'aides en faveur des microentreprises dans les secteurs agricole et forestier et dans les zones rurales. L'aide couvre le recours à un service de conseil pour l'élaboration d'un plan d'entreprise et une aide en capital. L'article 25 de la même loi est aussi modifié ainsi que les articles 31 et 32. L'article 35 concernant l'éligibilité de ponts et ponceaux traversant les cours d’eau qui peuvent faire l'objet d'aménagement et d'amélioration est remplacé. À la suite de l'article 35 de la même loi, il est inséré un article 35bis pour lequel sont éligibles l'aménagement et l'amélioration de points d’abreuvement du bétail par utilisation de l'eau des cours d'eau et de gués, réalisés par le propriétaire ou le preneur de la parcelle. Enfin, l'article 36 est remplacé, concernant les investissements visés à l'article 31 bénéficiant d'une aide fixée.

Policy: Loi nº 2020 - 37 du 03 février 2021 portant protection de la santé des personnes en République du Bénin
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet : l'organisation de la protection de la santé des personnes ; la définition des sujétions imposées aux citoyens en leur personne en cos de maladies transmissibles, non transmissibles, contagieuses ou d'épidémies. Elle s'applique à toute personne vivant en République du Bénin ou entrant sur le territoire béninois. L'organisation de la protection de la santé des personnes vise à garantir la réalisation du droit à la santé pour tous et à contribuer à la promotion du renforcement du capital humain dans une approche multisectorielle. Elle garantit notamment à cet effet les principes de bonne moralité, de probité, d'éthique, d'équité, de dévouement et de responsabilité indispensables à l’exercice des professions de la santé en vue d'assurer le bien-être des populations. Elle vise précisément la protection de la personne humaine et le renforcement du capital humain par : la promotion des conditions optimales pour une bonne qualité des soins ; la promotion des bonnes pratiques dons le système de santé ; la modernisation du poteau technique des formations sanitaires ; l'augmentation des infrastructures sanitaires ; le renforcement des capacités des acteurs du système à tous les niveaux ; la protection de l'environnement et la promotion de l’hygiène et de l'assainissement de base ; la formation et le recrutement du personnel de santé qualifié ; l'amélioration du dispositif d'approvisionnement et de distribution des médicaments ; la répartition équilibrée et cohérente du personnel de santé sur tout le territoire ; l'amélioration du cadre et des conditions de travail du personnel de santé ; la responsabilité du service médical et paramédical ; la prévention des maladies émergentes el réémergentes, transmissibles et non transmissibles. L'organisation de la protection de la santé des personnes intègre les accords et conventions internationaux afin de déterminer les moyens à mettre en œuvre pour réaliser les objectifs visés au présent chapitre.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Human rights,International agreement-implementation,Public health
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Loi nº 2020 - 37 du 03 février 2021 sur la biosécurité en République du Bénin
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe les règles de protection en matière de transfert, de manipulation et d'utilisation des organismes vivants modifiés et produits dérivés résultant de la biotechnologie moderne. La présente loi s'applique à la mise au point, à l'expérimentation, à la production, à la dissémination, au stockage à la destruction ou à l'élimination, à l'importation, à l'exportation, au transport, ou mouvement transfrontière, au transit de tous organismes vivants modifiés et produits dérivés. Elle ne s'applique pas aux produits pharmaceutiques issus d'organismes vivants modifiés. La présente prévoit également classification des niveaux de risques ; notification et autorisation d'utilisation d'organismes vivants modifiés et de produits dérives ; utilisation des organismes vivants modifiés en milieu confine ; utilisation des organismes vivants modifiés en milieu ouvert ; et responsabilité et réparation.

Policy: Regulation on the implementation of the Programme of support to primary agricultural producers due to difficult business conditions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with the Croatian Law on agriculture, prescribes the implementation of the Support Programme for primary agricultural producers due to difficult business conditions caused by the COVID-19 disease pandemic. Support under this particular Programme is granted on the basis of the Communication from the European Commission - Temporary Framework for State aid measures to support the economy in the current COVID-10 pandemic, adopted on 19 March 2020 (see additional reference details in article 2). Aid under this Program is compatible with the internal market within the meaning of Article 107 (3) (b) of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union ("TFEU") and has been notified to the European Commission for evaluation in accordance with Article 108 of the same Treaty. The Programme will be implemented from the date of receipt of the decision of the European Commission on the approval of state aid; and this kind of support may be granted until 30 June 2021 at the latest. Among agricultural enterprises, a family agricultural holding, a self-sufficient agricultural holding and a trade registered for the performance of agricultural activity as natural persons within the meaning of this Regulation shall be considered as micro and small enterprises. All these entities are here declared as eligible for support object of this text. Measures in the implementation of this Programme are listed as follows: Measure 1. Support to cattle breeders in the cow-calf system; Measure 2. Support to fattening cattle breeders; Measure 3. Support for sow breeders; Measure 4. Support for apple producers; Measure 5. Support to mandarin producers; Measure 6. Support to potato producers.

Policy: Decree No. 43 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on the procedure for withdrawal (withdrawal) from circulation, return, export, disposal of dangerous products.”
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the procedure for withdrawal (withdrawal) from circulation, return, export, disposal of dangerous products by the manufacturer (supplier, seller, importer) in order to prevent circulation of such products on the territory of the Republic of Belarus. It shall not apply to dangerous products, withdrawn, seized or converted to the benefit of the state in accordance with the procedure established by legislative acts. Competent bodies shall classify products as hazardous based on the results of laboratory research (tests) conducted by in accredited testing centers (laboratories); and on the basis of documents issued by the results of external inspection. Termination of import and/or circulation of hazardous products in the territory of the Republic of Belarus, their withdrawal (recall) from circulation shall be carried out by a business entity on the basis of the prescription issued by the competent authority. A business entity upon receipt of an order within a period of not more than 10 working days from the date of its receipt determines the possibility of bringing hazardous products into compliance with the requirements of technical regulations and informs the competent authority about the decision in written (electronic) form. The period of adjustment of hazardous products in accordance with the requirements of technical regulations must not exceed two months. A business entity is obliged to confirm the result of compliance of hazardous products with the requirements of technical regulations through implementation of the procedure of conformity assessment in accredited bodies and testing centers. In the event that hazardous products cannot be brought into compliance with the requirements of technical regulations within the specifies period, it shall be subject to disposal or return.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Executive Order on Tackling the Climate Crisis at Home and Abroad (2021)
Policy_Content: This executive order declares that the United States and the world face a profound climate crisis. We have a narrow moment to pursue action at home and abroad in order to avoid the most catastrophic impacts of that crisis and to seize the opportunity that tackling climate change presents. Policy: Decree-Law No. 4/2021 creating the Institution for Children's Rights Protection.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 28 articles divided into five Chapters, creates and approves the statute of the Institution for Children's Rights Protection IP (INDDICA), as a public board integrated in the indirect administration of the State. INDDICA is headquartered in Dili and can create and establish decentralized services within the municipal administrative districts and in the Special Administrative Region of Oe-Cusse Ambeno. INDDICA's mission is to contribute to the promotion, protection, safeguard and monitoring of children's rights. In particular, the Institution carry out the following functions: a) Monitor situations of threat, violation of the rights, freedoms and security of the child and report to the competent authorities, in order to take action; b) Encourage the articulation of efforts by public and private entities for the children's rights protection; c) Contribute to the strengthening of public policies and government actions in favor of children's rights; d) Promote the preparation of a General State Budget sensitive to the promotion of the rights of the child; e) Promote a culture of full respect for the rights of the child, etc.

Policy: Water Resources (Control of Agricultural Pollution) (Wales) Regulations 2021 No. 77 (W. 20).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are organised in 8 Parts. Part 1 contains introductory provisions including transitional provision for all holdings not previously within a Nitrate Vulnerable Zone. Part 2 imposes annual limits on the amount of nitrogen from organic manure that may be applied or spread. Part 3 sets requirements and limits relating to the amount of nitrogen to be spread on a crop; it also establishes that an occupier must plan in advance the spreading of nitrogen fertiliser, record additional information during the year. Part 4 regulates the spreading of nitrogen fertilizer, where and when to spread it, conditions when the spreading happens near surface water, control system among others. Part 5 establishes closed periods during which it is prohibited to spread nitrogen fertilizer. Part 6 makes provision for the storage of organic manure and prescribes the capacity and construction requirements for such storage systems. Part 7 specifies what records must be kept. Part 9 contains criminal offences and enforcement provisions.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. DP24/2021 validating the Regulation on advisory councils under the President of the Republic of Moldova.
Policy_Content: In order to ensure constructive dialogue and effective cooperation between the President of the Republic of Moldova and representatives of non-profit organizations, business environment and civil society, public institutions, central and local public authorities on the most important problems faced by the Republic of Moldova, and on the basis of part (1) of Article 94 of the Constitution of the Republic of Moldova, the President of the Republic of Moldova decides to validate the Regulation on the activities of the advisory councils under the President of the Republic of Moldova. The advisory councils are involved in the implementation process by the President of the Republic of Moldova of his constitutional powers by: (a) active participation of representatives of non-profit organizations, business environment and civil society in the decision-making process; (b) drawing the attention of the President to the decision on the most important state problems; (c) submitting proposals on issues aimed at protecting rights, freedoms and legitimate interests of citizens; (d) participation in the decision-making process and making recommendations regarding implementation by the President of the Republic of Moldova of his powers in accordance with the Constitution; (e) participation in the endorsement of legislative initiatives of the President in various fields and in promoting reform initiatives and developing proposals for these initiatives; (f) development of studies, analyzes and reports on the activities of central public authorities and other public authorities and institutions and the establishment of cooperation of the President of the Republic of Moldova with them; (g) active cooperation with representatives of local public administration and holding joint meetings to identify problems in their activities and finding ways to solve them; (h) providing informational, methodological and other assistance to strengthen relations between the President of the Republic of Moldova and representatives of non-profit organizations, business environment and civil society, as well as public institutions and bodies of central and local public administration; (i) submitting proposals to the President of the Republic of Moldova on legislative initiatives related to various fields of activity; (j) studying the requests of the head of state by presenting decisions and recommendations on problems of society; (k) organizing public discussions on draft laws and other normative acts in compliance with the law; (l) analyzing proposals from experts in the relevant field and representatives of civil society on the adoption of measures necessary for the implementation of state policies; (m) involving experts and specialists in various fields in its activities; and (n) setting up working groups composed of experts, well-known personalities and representatives of public authorities to discuss problems in various fields.

Policy: Decree No. 02/2021 creating the National Committee for Trade Facilitation.
Policy_Content: This Decree creates the National Committee for Trade Facilitation (CNFC), a body aimed at coordinating and monitoring trade facilitation policies. The CNFC is a multi-institutional public-private partnership of an advisory nature, with the authority to formulate recommendations in the context of the development of international trade/exchanges and all of its logistics. The CNFC has the necessary duration for the implementation and monitoring of the trade facilitation measures required in several trade agreements in which the country is engaged, for monitoring the reform and implementation of commercial policies scheduled by the Government. The CNFC aims to: a) Facilitate national coordination for the implementation of trade facilitation reforms and measures; b) Function as a platform for coordination, simplification and harmonization of procedures related to international trade; c) Create a space for exchange and dialogue between all public and private institutions involved in international trade.
