Policy: Resolution No. 7/2021 approving the tourist and environmental enhancement programme for rural villages.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the tourist and environmental enhancement programme for rural villages. This Programme, consisting of nine Sections and one Table, aims to diversify the tourist offer, to improve basic sanitation and to increase the income and the quality of life of the population in rural areas. The Programme applies on national level and focuses on rural villages on the islands of Santo Antão, São Nicolau, Maio, Santiago, Fogo and Brava. Interventions include the improvement of: rural areas, back roads, corrals, viewpoints, housing rehabilitation and its framing in the landscape, facades, promotion of tourist activity, pedestrian circuits, signals, translation centres, awareness and environmental education, among others.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 24 validating the Regulation on nature monument of regional significance "Two Giant Oaks".
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes legal status of nature monument of regional significance "Two Giant Oaks", defines its boundaries and particular protection regime. The objectives of the nature monument are: (a) preservation of wild plant communities; (b) monitoring the state of natural complexes; (c) scientific research; and (d) environmental education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of nature monument of regional significance "Two Giant Oaks": (a) geological study of the subsoil and development of mineral deposits; (b) creation of timber processing infrastructure; (c) clear-cutting of forest stands; (d) cutting of healthy specimens of old-growth trees; (e) activities involving disturbance of soil cover, alteration of the hydrologic regime (excluding activities aimed at conservation, protection and regeneration of forests); (f) construction of infrastructure facilities; (g) construction of trunk roads, pipelines, and other communications, economic and residential objects, not connected with construction of trunk roads, pipelines, other communication lines, economic and residential facilities not associated with the functioning of the nature monument; (h) allotment of land plots for individual housing construction, construction of garden homes, gardening and horticulture facilities; (i) use of natural resources for industrial purposes, including procurement of soft resin, industrial procurement and collection of berries, fruits, seeds, medicinal and technical raw materials; (j) collection of biological collections, except for those carried out within the frameworks of scientific and research activities; (k) collection of fruits, berries, seeds, medicinal and technical raw materials for research activities; (l) activities resulting in disturbance of the growing and living conditions in habitats of flora and fauna species; (m) use and storage of pesticides, oil products, mineral fertilizers, plant protection chemicals, growth stimulators and other harmful substances; (n) passage and parking of motor vehicles outside of existing roads (excluding cases related to compliance with the parking of motor vehicles outside existing roads (excluding cases, connected with fulfillment of forest management arrangements (reforestation, fire prevention, forest protection) and biotechnical measures); (o) arrangement of resting places, bivouacs, tourist parking lots and campfires; (p) disposal of industrial and domestic waste; (q) destruction and damage of flagpoles, barriers, posts, boundary poles and other informational signs, equipped ecological trails and recreation areas; and (r) other activities that result in disturbance of the integrity of nature monument.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 20/21 approving the National Road Plan of Angola (PRA).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, consisting of 17 articles, divided into four Chapters and one Annex, approves the National Road Plan of Angola (PRA). The National Road Plan, is a sectorial territorial planning instrument that regulates the National Road Network, its administrative classification and the management and planning of roadways and develops throughout the entire territorial extension of the country. It specifies the linking provincial capitals with each other, as well as municipal and communal areas, and other locations, such as: agricultural and industrial centers, airports, ports and border posts regulating tolls.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand modifiant l’arrêté du Gouvernement flamand du 19 décembre 2014 concernant les aides aux investissements et à la reprise dans l’agriculture.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté modifie  l'arrêté du Gouvernement flamand du 19 décembre 2014 concernant les aides aux investissements et à la reprise dans l'agriculture. Dans les articles 1er e 3, des modifications formelles sont apporté, notamment pour réfléchir la différente dénomination du Code des Société en Code des sociétés et des associations. L'article 4 est modifié pour introduire la possibilité d'augmenter l'intensité de l'aide en présence d'au moins un des chefs d'entreprise âgé de moins de 41 ans. L'article 6 est modifié pour étendre la période de référence jusqu'au 2022 et pour introduire une prime à l'investissement en fonction de l'intensité des aides pour l'investissement subventionnable concerné et l'âge du directeur d'entreprise le plus jeune. Dans l’article 7, l'obtention d’une subvention d'intérêt est éliminée des objets pour lesquelles un investissement financé par un crédit  d’investissement peut être demandés seulement par intervention d’une institution de crédit. Les articles 8.1 et 8.2 sont insérés pour réfléchir, respectivement, le cas dans lequel un investissement n’est admissible au bénéfice de l'aide et les temps et les modalités, aussi substantielles, selon lesquelles l’agriculteur doit introduire une demande de paiement via le guichet électronique. L' articles 10 apporte des modifications formelles et l'article 14 est modifié par l'abrogation des points 1° et 2°.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decree No. 10.606 creating the Integrated Information System for the Sectoral Plan for Consolidation of a Low-Carbon Economy in Agriculture and the Technical Committee for Monitoring the Sectoral Plan for Consolidation of a Low-Carbon Economy in Agriculture.
Policy_Content: This Decree creates the Integrated Information System for the Sectoral Plan for Consolidation of a Low-Carbon Economy in Agriculture and the Technical Committee for Monitoring the Sectoral Plan for Consolidation of a Low-Carbon Economy in Agriculture. The Integrated Information System (SIN-ABC) is under the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply, with the purpose of: provide technical and scientific support to the Technical Committee for Monitoring the Sector Plan for Consolidation of a Low Carbon Economy in Agriculture (CTABC), in the monitoring and evaluation actions of the Sector Plan for Consolidation of a Low Carbon Economy in Agriculture Agriculture (ABC Plan); consolidate the results of the execution of the ABC Plan, especially those arising from: a) Governance System of the ABC Plan - SIGABC; b) Rural Credit Operations System and Proagro - Sicor; and c) Multi-institutional Platform for Monitoring Reductions of Greenhouse Gas Emissions in Agriculture (ABC Platform). The SIN-ABC is composed of the following bodies: General Coordination of Climate Change of the Department of Innovation, Rural Development and Irrigation of the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply (SIGABC); Brazilian Agricultural Research Corporation - Embrapa: ABC Platform; and Central Bank of Brazil: Sicor.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 3-p validating the Instruction on regulation of emissions of pollutants to the atmospheric air under unfavorable meteorological conditions.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the procedure for regulation of emissions of pollutants to the atmospheric air under unfavorable meteorological conditions with a view of reduction of negative environmental thereof and prevention of health risks for human beings. In the absence of observational data on atmospheric pollution risk degree of unfavorable meteorological conditions is determined on the basis of the analysis of the complex of unfavorable synoptic situations, meteorological conditions and characteristics of specific emission sources. It establishes reduction of emission levels in different risk periods. The period of validity of the list of measures to reduce emissions during unfavorable meteorological conditions shall not exceed 5 years if in the aforesaid period are not commissioned or reconstructed the existing sources of emissions of the pollutants. In the case of changes of emissions sources, it is necessary to submit for approval changes in the list of measures to reduce emissions during unfavorable meteorological conditions within two months from the date of putting in operation of the sources.

Policy: Executive Order on Protecting Public Health and the Environment and Restoring Science to Tackle the Climate Crisis (2021)
Policy_Content: This Executive Order provides that our Nation has an abiding commitment to empower our workers and communities; promote and protect our public health and the environment; and conserve our national treasures and monuments, places that secure our national memory. Where the Federal Government has failed to meet that commitment in the past, it must advance environmental justice. In carrying out this charge, the Federal Government must be guided by the best science and be protected by processes that ensure the integrity of Federal decision-making. It is, therefore, the policy of my Administration to listen to the science; to improve public health and protect our environment; to ensure access to clean air and water; to limit exposure to dangerous chemicals and pesticides; to hold polluters accountable, including those who disproportionately harm communities of color and low-income communities; to reduce greenhouse gas emissions; to bolster resilience to the impacts of climate change; to restore and expand our national treasures and monuments; and to prioritize both environmental justice and the creation of the well-paying union jobs necessary to deliver on these goals. To that end, this order directs all executive departments and agencies (agencies) to immediately review and, as appropriate and consistent with applicable law, take action to address the promulgation of Federal regulations and other actions during the last 4 years that conflict with these important national objectives, and to immediately commence work to confront the climate crisis.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 6 validating the Regulation on the procedure for establishing and changing the boundaries of forest green belts on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the procedure for establishing and changing the boundaries of forest green belts on the regional territory. Regional Government shall be authorized regional state executive body entitled to establish boundaries of forest green belts on the regional territory. Regional Government non less than one in six months shall display on the official web-site information of the state of forest green belt and change of the boundaries thereof.

Policy: Disposal Plastic Prohibition Ordinance.
Policy_Content: This Ordinance applies to products that are entirely or partially made of plastic and are placed in the market regardless if they are used only for packaging. The Ordinance is drafted in light of EU Regulations on impact reduction of certain plastic products on the environment. The Ordinance provides for the prohibition on placing certain plastic products in the market such as cutlery, plates, drinking straws, food container. The Ordinance further provides for administrative offences. The Ordinance consists of 5 Articles as follow: Scope of application (1); Definitions (2); Restrictions of placing on the market (3); Administrative offences (4); Entry into force (5).
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decreto Nº 107 - Prohíbe la exportación de madera proveniente del bosque natural o extraída de embalses de agua, en troza.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto prohíbe la exportación de madera proveniente del bosque natural o extraída de embalses de agua, en troza. Entiéndase por troza a cada una de las porciones en que se divide un tronco, mediante cortes transversales, para su salida del bosque. La madera proveniente del bosque natural o extraído de embalses de agua, solo podrá exportarse siempre y cuando cumpla con los siguientes requisitos: 1) Deberán de tener transformación y tratamiento primario, entiéndase por: i) Transformación primaria es el inicio del procesamiento al que se somete a las trozas de madera para su transformación óptima, mediante máquinas y técnicas que tienden a obtener el mayor volumen de madera aserrada con la más alta calidad posible (tablones, tablas, vigas, listones y además chapas y astillas, entre otros; ii) Tratamiento primario es el tratamiento preventivo contra agentes biológicos (insectos, hongos) que debe someterse a la madera, creando alrededor de la misma una barrera protectora con una cantidad mínima de producto de conservación a cierta profundidad según la intensidad de los riesgos biológicos. 2) Las especies de maderas para ser exportables deberán provenir de planes de manejo forestal sostenibles avalados por el Ministerio de Ambiente.

Policy: Resolución Nº 013-2021-MIDIS — Crea la Intervención Temporal “Hambre Cero”.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, — considerando que el Acuerdo Nacional - Compromiso Solidario con la Protección de la Vida “PERÚ HAMBRE 0”, asume la tarea de dar viabilidad al esfuerzo por derrotar el hambre en el contexto de la crisis por COVID-19 para implementar intervenciones de fortificación de alimentos y suplementación nutricional en las poblaciones más vulnerables, establecer cadenas de distribución que permitan llegar a todos los que lo necesiten, promover la priorización de la compra de la producción agrícola y pecuaria nacional, especialmente la de agricultores familiares e impulsar la producción nacional de los bienes requeridos; —, crea la Intervención Temporal “Hambre Cero”, con la finalidad de contribuir en la reducción de brechas de inseguridad alimentaria de manera focalizada, diferenciada y gradual, en beneficio de la población del ámbito urbano y rural en situación de vulnerabilidad como resultado de la propagación del COVID-19. Dicha intervención temporal es liderada por el Ministerio de Desarrollo e Inclusión Social (MIDIS) en estrecha coordinación y articulación con los diferentes sectores competentes y niveles de gobierno durante el año 2021, en el marco de sus competencias.

Policy: Environmental Investment Programme for 2021.
Policy_Content: This Programme, based on the provisions Macedonian Law on environment, determines the purpose and allocates funds for financing, co-financing and implementation of plans, projects and other activities in the field of environment for 2021. The Ministry of Environment and Physical Planning will take care of the manner and dynamics of the realization of this Programme. The funds from this programme can be used to finance all types of costs for the implementation of plans, projects and other activities in the field of environment, except for: 1) lease of land; 2) lease of existing buildings; 3) expenses incurred before 1 January 2021; 4) expenses incurred to cover the salaries of the employees working with the beneficiary; 5) costs for preparation of the application form for obtaining funds from the Programme; 6) general and administrative costs of the applicant; 7) interest on debts, fees for financial operations, and other purely financial expenses; 8) legal obligations and penalties; 9) Costs for the functioning of the project after its execution, which are not related to the training of staff or trial testing.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This text enters into force on the day after its publication in the Official Gazette (published on 20 January 2010).

Policy: Regulation on detailed conditions of access to the carbon dioxide transport network, procedure and criteria for acceptance of carbon dioxide flows.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with provisions of the Montenegrin Law on the protection from negative impacts of climate change, determines the necessary conditions for access to the carbon dioxide transport network, and further sets the procedure and criteria for acceptance of related carbon dioxide flows. Carbon dioxide flow is a flow of substances that occur during carbon dioxide capture processes; transport network is a network of pipelines, as well as associated pumping stations, for transport of carbon dioxide in storage space. The carbon dioxide stream may contain substances added to it in the process of finding, carbon capture and injection as well as traces of substances added for easier monitoring and verification of carbon dioxide flow through the transport network. Article 4 lists the requirements for access to the transport network for the cross-border transport of carbon dioxide streams.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette (published on 5 February 2021).

Policy: Regional Decree No. 9 validating the Regulation on creation of state nature reserve of regional significance “Derezovsky”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance "Derezovsky" is a protected natural area of regional significance, which includes natural complexes and objects of particular ecological and aesthetic value, and intended for use for nature protection, educational, scientific and cultural purposes. State nature reserve has a complex profile and is intended for: (a) preservation and restoration of natural complexes; (b) reduction of the level of anthropogenic impact on unique landscape complexes; and (c) maintaining the ecological balance in the region on the basis of rational use of natural resources.  State nature reserve of regional significance “Derezovsky” is stablished without limitation of its duration and without expropriation of land plots from owners, land tenants and landlords. The reserve was established to perform the following tasks: (a) preservation of natural complexes and objects in their natural state, restoration and reproduction of natural resources; (b) implementation of rational nature management; (c) scientific research; (d) environmental monitoring; and (e) environmental education, dissemination of environmental knowledge, ecological tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve of regional significance "Derezovsky": (a) destroying anthills, clutches, holes, nests, other habitats of animals, collecting eggs of wild birds; (b) harvesting of edible forest resources and collection of medicinal plants, except for collection and harvesting thereof by citizens for their own needs; (c) collection and harvesting of non-timber forest resources; (d) creation of forest plantations and their exploitation; (e) geological exploration, prospecting and extraction of minerals, except for land plots containing groundwater used for potable and domestic water supply; (f) construction and reconstruction of objects of capital construction; (g) application of toxic chemicals, plant protection means and plant growth stimulants; (h) littering of the territory and waste disposal; (i) placement of cemeteries and burial grounds; (j) creation of facilities for disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive, chemical, explosive, toxic and poisonous substances; (k) allotment of land plots for individual housing construction, gardening and horticulture; (l) recreational activities; (m) passage and parking of motor vehicles outside of existing roads; (n) destruction and damage of flagpoles, barriers, posts, boundary poles and other informational signs, equipped ecological trails and recreation areas; (o) ploughing up; (p) explosive works; (q) burning of vegetation; (r) organization of summer camps for farm animals; (s) discharge of sewage, including drainage water, on the relief; (t) clear-cutting, except for sanitary felling; and (u) other types of activities resulting in the reduction of ecological value of a particular area or that cause damage to natural complexes.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Resolution No. 3/2021 approving the Statute of the National Institution for Disaster Risk Management and Reduction (INGD).
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Statute of the National Institution for Disaster Risk Management and Reduction (INGD), created by Law No. 10/2020. The Statute, consisting of 40 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes INDG as the Coordinating Entity for the Management and Reduction of Disaster Risk in Mozambique, ensuring, in the exercise of its functions, the articulation and multi-sectorial coordination aimed at the management and reduction of the risk of disasters. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of INDG entitled to coordinate the following actions: prevention, mitigation, early warning and disaster response, emergency management and response, development of arid and semi-arid areas, post-disaster reconstruction, process of prevention, mitigation, preparedness and response to risk threats and strengthen resilience and disaster risk management programmes. In addition, it establishes the National Civil Protection Unit, the Organic Units, the local representation of INGD, the budget and the regime of staff and remuneration.

Policy: Programme of activities in the implementation of special fire protection measures of interest to the Republic of Croatia in 2021.
Policy_Content: This Programme, based on the provisions of the Croatian Law on firefighting, provides for programmed action scheme for the implementation of special fire protection measures of interest to the Republic of Croatia for the year 2021, which is represented by a set of activities with the aim of effective preventive and operative (curative) action for the reduction of the number of open fires, reduction of damage and of the number of human victims, burned areas, protection of critical infrastructure. The goal will be achieved by appropriate undertaking of a wide range of preventive measures (forestry, agronomic, organizational, promotional, inspection) to prevent fires (and thus reduce the number of fires) and development of appropriate elements (in manpower, equipment) of firefighting operational forces. Joint action and the implementation of preventive and operational measures will ultimately reduce the number of fires and prevent and reduce disturbance of biological and landscape diversity and shall support the sustainable development of ecosystems.

Policy: Law No. 14.119 creating the National Payment Policy for Environmental Services.
Policy_Content: This Law creates the National Payment Policy for Environmental Services. This Law defines concepts, objectives, guidelines, actions and criteria for the implementation of the National Policy on Payment for Environmental Services (PNPSA), crates the National Register of Payment for Environmental Services (CNPSA) and the Federal Payment Programme for Environmental Services (PFPSA) and provides for contract fees for environmental services. The National Policy on Payment for Environmental Services (PNPSA) has the following objectives: guide the actions of public authorities, civil society organizations and private agents in relation to payment for environmental services; encourage the conservation of ecosystems, water resources, soil, biodiversity, genetic heritage and traditional knowledge; economic, social and cultural value of ecosystem services; avoid the loss of native vegetation, habitat fragmentation, desertification and other processes of degradation of native ecosystems, promoting systemic conservation of the landscape; encourage measures to ensure water security for human consumption and desertification processes; contribute to climate regulation and the reduction of emissions from deforestation and forest degradation; favor the maintenance, recovery or improvement of ecosystem services; to stimulate the elaboration and execution of voluntary private projects of provision and payment for environmental services; stimulate scientific research related to the valuation of ecosystem services; ensure the transparency of information relating to the provision of environmental services; establish data and information management mechanisms for the full execution of environmental services; encourage the private sector; encourage the creation of a market for environmental services; foster sustainable development.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 1 validating the Regulation on nature monument of regional significance "Enchanted Forest”.
Policy_Content: Nature monument of regional significance "Enchanted Forest” is constituted without expropriation of land (forest) plots from owners, tenants and lessees of land (forest) plots. The natural monument is formed without a time limit. The purpose of creating natural monument shall be preservation of the unique, irreplaceable, ecologically, scientifically, culturally, and aesthetically valuable natural complex, conservation of the habitats of rare species of wild fauna and wild flora species and other organisms, which are necessary for the preservation of the natural habitats thereof and natural environment. The objectives of the nature monument are: (a) conservation of natural complexes (landscapes) and forests; (b) conservation of endangered bird species (c) maintenance of hydrological regime; (d) monitoring the state of natural complex; (e) scientific research; (e) environmental education; and (f) ecological tourism and recreation. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of nature monument of regional significance "Enchanted Forest": (a) clear cutting and timber extraction, except for sanitary felling and forest fire prevention arrangements; (b) burning of vegetation except for sanitary felling and forest fire prevention arrangements; (c) ploughing up, except for sanitary felling and forest fire prevention arrangements; (d) grazing; (e) any type of land reclamation work entailing change of hydrological regime of the territory; (f) construction; (g) passage and parking of motor vehicles outside of existing roads (excluding cases related to compliance with the parking of motor vehicles outside existing roads (excluding cases, connected with fulfillment of forest management arrangements (reforestation, fire prevention, forest protection) and biotechnical measures); (h) organization of provisional lodges for hunting and fishing; (i) destruction and damage of flagpoles, barriers, posts, boundary poles and other informational signs, equipped ecological trails and recreation areas; (j) littering and waste disposal; (k) holding cultural and mass events, sports competitions, sports festivals and training camps; (l) procurement of soft resin; and (m) exploration of mineral deposits and extraction of minerals.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 3-pp validating the Regulation on organization and conduct of open tenders for conclusion of contracts of lease of public forest plots for timber extraction.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the procedure for organization and conduct of open tenders for conclusion of contracts of lease of public forest plots for timber extraction. Public forest land plots shall be allotted on lease by the results of tenders. Regional Forestry Department accepts applications for participation in tender according to the form, in accordance with the procedure, at the address of the place of reception of applications and within the time limits established by the tender documentation. A legal entity or an individual entrepreneur in possession of timber processing infrastructure have the right to apply for participation in the tender. The decision on the winner of the tender shall be made on the day of the meeting of the Tender Committee and shall be documented in the protocol on the results of the tender, which is signed by the members of the Tender Commission and approved by the Chairman of the Tender Commission. The protocol on the results of the tender is the basis for concluding with the winner of the tender a forestry plot lease agreement.

Technical specific emission standards - values of emissions into the environment of emissions per unit of product output determined on the basis of the capability of specific technical means at costs acceptable to the economy of an enterprise. Policy: Ley Nº 31112 - Ley que establece el control previo de operaciones de concentración empresarial.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer un régimen de control previo de operaciones de concentración empresarial con la finalidad de promover la competencia efectiva y la eficiencia económica en los mercados para el bienestar de los consumidores. Se encuentran comprendidos dentro de su ámbito de aplicación: 1) Los actos de concentración empresarial, conforme a los umbrales previstos en la presente Ley, que produzcan efectos en todo o en parte del territorio nacional, incluyendo actos de concentración que se realicen en el extranjero y vinculen directa o indirectamente a agentes económicos que desarrollan actividades económicas en el país; 2) Los agentes económicos que oferten o demanden bienes o servicios en el mercado y realicen actos de concentración que produzcan o puedan producir efectos anticompetitivos en todo o en parte del territorio nacional. Una operación de concentración empresarial es todo acto u operación que implique una transferencia o cambio en el control de una empresa o parte de ella. En el procedimiento de control previo, el órgano competente evalúa los efectos de la operación de concentración, a fin de identificar si produce una restricción significativa de la competencia en los mercados involucrados.

Policy: Ecological Code (Law No. 400-VI ZRK).
Policy_Content: This Code regulates public relations in the sphere of interaction between man and nature (environmental relations), arising in connection with the implementation of activities by natural and legal entities that have or can have impact on the environment. The relations regulated by this Code also include social relations in the field of environmental monitoring, meteorological and hydrological monitoring, which are aimed at provision of natural and legal persons with ecological and hydrometeorological information. This Ecological Code shall be valid throughout the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan, including continental shelf and exclusive economic zone of the Republic of Kazakhstan in accordance with the norms of international law. The scope of the environmental legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan is determination of legal grounds, tasks and principles, as well as mechanisms for implementation of the unified state environmental policy in the Republic of Kazakhstan. Objectives of the environmental legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan shall be as follows: (a) ensuring a high level of environmental protection through the implementation of state regulation aimed at preventing environmental pollution, environmental damage, ensuring elimination of consequences of environmental damage, as well as gradual reduction of negative anthropogenic impact on the environment; (b) provision of environment favorable for human life and health; (c) ensuring sustainable development; (d) provision of contribution of the Republic of Kazakhstan to strengthening of global reaction to the risks of climate change in the context of sustainable development, as well as implementation of international, regional and transboundary programs on environmental protection and transition to "green" economy; (e) protection, preservation and rehabilitation of environment, including areas and objects of special ecological, scientific, historical, cultural, recreational, economic and social significance, including the rights of local communities to associate with nature; (f) creation of an effective public management system in the field of environmental protection which provides for cooperation and coordination among all government agencies; (g) encouraging and stimulating the government to "green" investments and wide use the best available resource-saving practices, reduction of waste volumes and waste hazardousness indicators, use of renewable energy, water conservation, and measures to improve energy efficiency, sustainable use and restoration of natural resources; (h) ensuring continuous and systematic collection, accumulation, storage, analysis and dissemination of environmental information to the public; (i) ensuring transparency and full public participation in addressing environmental protection and sustainable development issues in the Republic of Kazakhstan; (j) ensuring effective environmental monitoring and environmental; (k) creating conditions to attract investments into environmental protection measures, modernizing the existing and constructing new infrastructure to provide a high level of environmental protection; (l)  compliance with international treaties and other obligations in the field of environmental protection; (m) forming environmental culture in the society, promoting environmental knowledge at all educational levels, development of environmental education; and (n)  strengthening of law and order in the field of environmental protection and environmental security. This Ecological Code contains 24 Sections divided into 418 Articles. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 regards state management in the field of environmental protection. Section 3 regards state regulation of environmental relations. Section 4 regards economic regulation of environmental protection. Section 5 regards environmental damages. Section 6 regards sites of historic pollution. Section 7 regards elimination of the consequences of activities at facilities that have a negative impact on environment. Section 8 regards state monitoring of environment and natural resources. Section 9 regards activities in the field of meteorological monitoring, hydrological monitoring and monitoring of the state of environment. Section 10 regards state register of natural resources. Section 11 regards environmental supervision. Section 12 regards ecological culture and education. Section 13 regards ecological research. Section 14 regards atmospheric air protection. Section 15 regards waterbodies protection. Section 16 regards land protection. Section 17 regards nature protection. Section 18 regards climate and ozone layer. Section 19 regards waste management. Section 20 establishes ecological requirements for some types of activities. Section 21 regards areas of ecological emergencies and ecological disasters. Section 22 regards international cooperation in the field of environmental protection. Section 23 establishes liability for ecological offences and the procedure for dispute settlement. Section 24 lays down final provisions.

Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the 2021 State Program for Social Rehabilitation and Care of the Child. It consists of seven articles: Purpose of the program (1); Subprograms (components) of the program (2); Source and mechanism of the program financing (3); Beneficiaries of the program (4); Program supervision (5); Penalties (6); and Program implementation timeline (7). Subprograms (components) of the program include: Providing services in day centers (Annex 1.1); Subprogram for supplying support items, including supplying wheelchairs for the persons disabilities and promoting their employment (Annex 1.2); Subprogram for supporting the communication of deaf people (Annex 1.3); Community organizations’ subprogram (Annex 1.4); Subprogram for rehabilitation of veterans (Annex 1.5); Required criteria (medical diagnosis) for receiving wheelchairs under the subprogram for supplying support items (Annex 1.6); Required criteria (medical diagnosis) for receiving medium or highly fit pediatric wheelchairs under the subprogram for supplying support items (Annex 1.7); and Required criteria (medical diagnosis) for receiving electric wheelchairs under the subprogram for supplying support items (Annex 1.8). The additional subprograms (components) of the program include: Assistance sub-program aimed for families with child(ren) in crisis (Annex 2.1); Early childhood development subprogram (Annex 2.2); Child rehabilitation/habilitation subprogram (Annex 2.3); Day center subprogram (Annex 2.4); Subprogram for providing shelter for mothers and children (Annex 2.5); Subprogram for child foster care (Annex 2.6); Subprogram for small-sized family-type houses (Annex 2.7); Subprogram for providing shelter to homeless children (Annex 2.8); Home-based care of children with severe and deep mental developmental retardation (Annex 2.9); Specialized family-style services subprogram for children with severe and deep disabilities and health problems (Annex 2.10); Reintegration program for children without care (Annex 2.11); Subprogram to support youth aged 18-21 who have left the state care system (Annex 2.12); Subprogram to provide food to youth aged 18-21 who have left the state care system (Annex 2.13); Required criteria to determine the target group of the early childhood development subprogram (Annex 2.14); Required criteria to determine the target group of the child habilitation/rehabilitation subprogram (Annex 2.15).

Policy: State Environmental Policy of the Czech Republic 2030 with a view to 2050.
Policy_Content: The State Environmental Policy formulates goals in the field of environmental protection in the Czech Republic, covers environmental issues and sets a strategic direction until 2030 with a view to 2050. The Policy takes into account other strategic documents at the national, European and international level, legislative documents, principles sustainable development and the results of the evaluation of the State Environmental Policy 2012-2020, as well as the annual evaluation of the environmental reports of the Czech Republic. Predictions of external influences, such as socio-demographic developments, economic developments, global pressures, as well as the impacts of the current COVID-19 viral pandemic, were also taken into account.

Policy: Law No. 75-C/2020 approving the Great Options Plan for 2021-2023.
Policy_Content: This Law approves the Great Options Plan for 2021-2023 (GO 2021-2023). GO 2021-2023 present an economic policy that seeks essentially, in a context of strong disruption caused by the world health crisis, mitigate the negative impacts on economic and social level in the short term and relaunch economic growth in the medium-term, not forgetting the political priorities defined for the horizon of the legislature, which, for the most part, and not only remain current, as they are reinforced in the context of the current crisis. Thus, the GO 2021-2023 are based on the Great Options of the 2020-2023 Plan and give it the current status and the necessary adjustments to respond to the challenges that remain, reinforce or emerge from the pandemic crisis that affected all countries on a global scale. The Law integrates the identification and planning of economic policy options and multiannual budgetary programming, for the sub-sectors of central administration and social security.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 2398 validating the Criteria for attributing objects having a negative impact on the environment to objects of categories I, II, III and IV.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree validates the Criteria for attributing objects having a negative impact on the environment to objects of categories I, II, III and IV classified as follows: (a) objects of I category include economic activities related to manufacturing of coke, crude oil, natural gas, petroleum products, mining and (or) enrichment of iron ores, mining and (or) preparation of ores of non-ferrous metals, metallurgical production, non-metallic mineral production, manufacturing of pesticides and mineral fertilizers, management, disposal and treatment of waste of I-III hazard classes, and wastes of hazard classes IV and V (with a design capacity of 3 tons per hour and more); (b) objects of II category include electric energy, gas and steam supply using equipment with installed generating capacity of less than 250 MW and more than 3.5 MW, extraction of ores and sands of precious metals, tin ores, titanium ores, Chromium ores at alluvial deposits and (or) their preparation, metallurgic production of cast iron and steel, production of magnesium oxide, collection and treatment of wastewater as it relates to the treatment of wastewater treatment in centralized sewage systems (sewerage) with a volume of less than 20 thousand cubic meters of wastewater per day, paper production, leather production, food production (except for packaging); (c) objects of III category include operation of nuclear power plants; and (d) objects of IV category include presence of the following criteria at the same time: (1) absence of emissions of pollutants into the atmospheric air or the presence at the facility of stationary sources of pollution environment, the mass of pollutants in emissions into the atmospheric air does not exceed 10 tons a year and also absence in the composition of emissions of substances of hazard classes I and II, radioactive substances; and (2) absence of discharges of polluting substances in the composition of wastewater into centralized sewerage systems, other facilities and systems for sewage disposal and treatment, except for discharges of pollutants resulting from use of water for domestic needs and also absence of discharge of pollutants into environment.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 2399 validating the List of prohibited activities in the central ecological zone of Baikal natural territory.
Policy_Content: List of prohibited activities in the central ecological zone of Baikal natural territory includes, inter alia, the following activities: (a) forest management with the application of plant protection means, containing hazardous substances; (b) timber extraction, except for timber procurement by citizens for individual needs and timber extraction resulting from sanitary felling; (c) collection of soft resin; (d) exploration and mining; (e) dredging of Baikal lake in its water protection zone, in the beds of spawning rivers and their water protection zones; (f) tanning and dressing of leather, dressing and dyeing of fur, manufacturing of nuclear fuel and nuclear fuel-based products, manufacturing of chemicals and chemical products, manufacturing of rubber and plastics; (g) energy generation; (h) construction and reconstruction of hazardous and technically complex facilities and infrastructure; (i) capital construction of facilities not related to protected areas, recreation and tourism; (j) wholesale of solid, liquid and gaseous fuel; (k) inland waterway transport navigation related to small-size vessels not equipped with facilities for the collection and disposal of oils, bilge and domestic wastewater and production wastes, transportation of petroleum products, fertilizers, pesticides, hazardous and toxic substances without packaging in hermetically sealed containers; (l) use of vessels and other floating facilities within 3 kilometers zone from the rookeries of the Baikal seal and spawning grounds of valuable fish species of valuable fish species during the spawning period; (m) logging; (n) GMO-related research; (o) acclimatization of alien species; (p) military activities; (r) waste disposal; and (s) effluent waste water discharge.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 2422 validating the Regulation on the procedure for keeping record of the federal register of viticultural land.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes the procedure for keeping record of the federal register of viticultural land by the Ministry of Agriculture in electronic form for the purpose of registration of land fit for viticulture. The registry is a unified state information system for recording grapevine land, including information on land plots, which have been used for the purposes of cultivation of vine plantations for at least 5 years during the last 50 years. The register contains the following information on land plots: (a) individual number of the land plot and the date of its allotment; (b) the name of the viticulture and wine-making zone within which boundaries the land plot is located; (c) name of viticulture and wine-making area, within which boundaries the land plot is located; (d) name of viticulture and wine terroir within which boundaries the land plot is located (if available); (e) decision of the authorized body on acknowledgement of the land plot as viticultural land; (f) cadastral number of the land plot and its area; and (g) information on the right holder of the land plot.

Policy: Cabinet Resolution No.262 of 2020 issuing the Electricity Law.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 42 articles divided in 9 Chapters aims at (i) upgrading the electricity service provided to the consumer and protecting his rights, including his right to obtain electrical service with high reliability and efficiency, and choose among licensed competitors, with reasonable competitive prices; (ii) creating an appropriate environment to encourage legitimate competition in electrical activities; (iii) ensuring that the electricity sector adheres to state policies and directives; (iv) facilitating consumers' access to electrical supplies, and working to deliver services to areas not provided by the electric service; (v) providing safe, reliable, high-efficiency, and at the lowest cost possible; (vi) protecting the rights and interests of licensees, and providing a regulatory framework for electrical activities for both public and private sector; (vii) encouraging the private sector to contribute and participate in the systematic expansion of electrical activities; (viii) restructuring the electricity sector by following an effective and fair process; (ix) encouraging research and development work; and (x) ensuring that the electricity sector adheres to the approved environmental and safety regulations and standards.

Policy: Ley Nº 2071 - Ley por medio de la cual se adoptan medidas en materia de financiamiento para la reactivación del sector agropecuario, pesquero, acuícola, forestal y agroindustriales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto adoptar medidas para aliviar las obligaciones financieras y no financieras de aquellos pequeños y medianos productores agropecuarios, pesqueros, acuícolas, forestales y agroindustriales afectados por fenómenos fitosanitarios, zoosanitarios (generadas por plagas y enfermedades en cultivos y animales), biológicos, caída severa y sostenida de ingresos de conformidad con el artículo 12 de la Ley 1731 de 2014, afectaciones fitosanitarias y zoosanitarias, climáticas y en general por cualquier otro fenómeno no controlable por el productor que haya afectado su actividad productiva y comercialización impidiéndoles dar cumplimiento a las mismas. Se entenderá por deudas no financieras aquellas acreencias adquiridas por los pequeños y medianos agricultores con asociaciones, cooperativas, agremiaciones u otras entidades no financieras que estén legalmente reconocidas y tributariamente reportadas.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1824 - Modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo Agropecuario, Pesquero y de Desarrollo Rural, en lo relacionado con la clarificación de la vigencia legal de los títulos de origen colonial o republicano de los resguardos indígenas.
Policy_Content: La presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo, Agropecuario, Pesquero y de Desarrollo Rural, en lo relacionado con la clarificación de la vigencia legal de los títulos de origen colonial o republicano de los resguardos indígenas. El nuevo Capítulo 6 tiene por objeto reglamentar el procedimiento de clarificación de la vigencia legal de los títulos de origen colonial o republicano de los resguardos indígenas, de conformidad con lo establecido en el artículo 85 de la Ley Nº 160 de 1994. La solicitud de clarificación sobre la vigencia legal de los títulos de origen colonial o republicano de los resguardos indígenas, para su reestructuración o ampliación, podrá ser realizada por las autoridades indígenas tradicionales del resguardo objeto de la solicitud, sus cabildos u organizaciones indígenas que actúen con su previo consentimiento colectivo, el cual deberá constar en acta ante la Agencia Nacional de Tierras.

Policy: Ley Nº 2069 - Ley que impulsa el emprendimiento en Colombia.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer un marco regulatorio que propicie el emprendimiento y el crecimiento, consolidación y sostenibilidad de las empresas, con el fin de aumentar el bienestar social y generar equidad. Dicho marco delineará un enfoque regionalizado de acuerdo a las realidades socioeconómicas de cada región. El Departamento Administrativo Nacional de Estadística (DANE) diseñará, implementará y administrará el Sistema de Información de Actividades Económicas Informales (SIECI), como instrumento estadístico para identificar y caracterizar unidades económicas para el diseño e implementación de políticas públicas orientadas a la formalización empresarial. Este sistema tendrá como insumo principal los registros administrativos, las operaciones estadísticas económicas y sociales que realiza el DANE y el Censo   Económico que empezará su realización en el año 2021.

Policy: Programa Nacional Forestal 2020-2024.
Policy_Content: El Programa Nacional Forestal 2020-2024 es un Programa Especial derivado del Plan Nacional de Desarrollo 2019-2024. Los Objetivos prioritarios del Programa, son: 1) Promover el manejo forestal comunitario para el uso sostenible y diversificado de los recursos forestales, así como la integración y desarrollo de redes locales de valor competitivas que detonen economías locales para mejorar la calidad de vida de la población que habita en zonas forestales; 2) Proteger los ecosistemas forestales de factores que deterioran la cobertura vegetal para mantener el patrimonio natural y contribuir a la mitigación al cambio climático, para el bienestar de la población que habita en las zonas forestales y de la sociedad en general, a través de una gestión territorial; 3) Conservar y restaurar la capacidad de provisión de servicios ecosistémicos de áreas forestales estratégicas, mediante un enfoque incluyente y participativo que contribuya a garantizar un medio ambiente sano para el desarrollo y bienestar de la población; 4) Impulsar un nuevo modelo de gobernanza, pluralidad y participación social y ciudadana efectiva e incluyente, en el sector forestal; 5) Promover una articulación institucional efectiva y mejorar el desarrollo de capacidades institucionales para la atención del sector forestal.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 036-2020-EM ─ Modifica disposiciones de seguridad relacionadas al estudio de riesgos y planes de contingencia y establecen medidas complementarias para la seguridad en las actividades de hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo modifica disposiciones de seguridad relacionadas al estudio de riesgos y planes de contingencia y establecen medidas complementarias para la seguridad en las actividades de hidrocarburos. En lo específico, se modifica el Estudio de Riesgos de Seguridad que cubre aspectos de seguridad en las instalaciones y en las actividades de hidrocarburos y en su área de influencia, con el propósito de determinar y/o verificar las condiciones e instalaciones existentes en el medio, así como prever los efectos y las consecuencias de la instalación y su operación, indicando los procedimientos, medidas y controles que deberán aplicarse con el objeto de eliminar condiciones que podrían suscitarse en la operación. Además, dicho estudio debe considerar de manera integral los efectos y consecuencias de la operación de otros productos y/o sustancias que no se encuentren bajo el ámbito de competencia del subsector Hidrocarburos.

Policy_Content: Regulation on organization of prevention and elimination of oil and petroleum product spills on the continental shelf of the Russian Federation, in internal sea waters, in the territorial sea and the contiguous zone of the Russian Federation establishes: (a) requirements for the content of the plan for preventing and responding to oil and petroleum product spills on the continental shelf of the Russian Federation, in the territorial sea and the contiguous zone of the Russian Federation; (b) the procedure for conducting comprehensive exercises to confirm  the readiness of the organization operating artificial pipelines, islands, installations, performing drilling operation, use of structures, underwater works in the regional geological studies, geological surveys, exploration and production of hydrocarbon raw materials, as well as during transportation and storage of oil and petroleum products on the continental shelf of the Russian Federation, in internal sea, the territorial sea and the contiguous zone of the Russian Federation, to actions for localization and liquidation of oil and petroleum product spills; (c)  the procedure for issuing an opinion on the operator's readiness for localization and elimination of oil spills; (d) the procedure for notification of the approval of the plan for the prevention and elimination of oil and petroleum product spills; (e) procedure for notification of the competent authorities of oil and petroleum products spills; and (f) the procedure for attracting additional forces and means of the Unified State System of Emergency Prevention and Response for implementation of measures for oil and oil products spill response.

Policy: Order No. KR DCM-336/2020 of the Minister of Public Health “On some issues of rendering state services in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population.”
Policy_Content: This Order validates: (a) Rules for the provision of public services for the issuance of sanitary-epidemiological conclusions (Annex 1); (b) Rules for Assignment of Record Numbers to Food Processing Facilities subject to state control and supervision in the field of sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population (Annex 2); (c) Rules for state registration of produce determined by normative legal acts of the Eurasian Economic Union (Annex 3); and (d) Rules for the provision of the state service "Issuance of permits for work with microorganisms of I-IV pathogenicity groups and helminths" (Annex  4). Rules for the provision of public services for the issuance of sanitary-epidemiological conclusions determine the procedure for issuing sanitary and epidemiological conclusion on compliance of the object of high epidemic significance with normative legal acts in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population and drafts of regulatory normative documents on maximum permissible emissions and maximum permissible discharges of hazardous substances and physical factors in the environment, sanitary  protection zones and hygienic protection zones, for new types of raw materials and products complying with normative legal acts in the field of sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population. Rules for Assignment of Record Numbers to Food Processing Facilities subject to state control and supervision in the field of sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population determine the procedure for assigning registration numbers of food production facilities subject to state control and supervision in the field of sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population, and maintenance of register thereof. Rules for state registration of produce determined by normative legal acts of the Eurasian Economic Union determine the procedure of state registration of products determined by the normative legal acts of the Eurasian Economic Union by the agency of the state body in the field of sanitary-epidemiological welfare of the population. Rules for the provision of the state service "Issuance of permits for work with microorganisms of I-IV pathogenicity groups and helminths" establish the procedure for issuance of permits for operation with the aforesaid microorganisms.

Policy: Ley Nº 31110 - Ley del Régimen laboral agrario y de incentivos para el sector agrario y riego, agroexportador y agroindustrial.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley del Régimen laboral agrario y de incentivos para el sector agrario y riego, agroexportador y agroindustrial, tiene por objeto promover	y fortalecer el desarrollo del sector agrario y riego, agroexportador y agroindustrial,	así como garantizar los	derechos	laborales de las trabajadoras y los trabajadores reconocidos por	 la Constitución Política del Perú y los tratados internacionales laborales	y de protección	de los derechos	 humanos,	y contribuir a	la competitividad y	desarrollo de las actividades de estos sectores. Están incluidas en los alcances de esta Ley: 1) Las personas naturales o jurídicas que desarrollen cultivos y/o crianzas; 2) Las personas naturales o jurídicas que realicen actividad agroindustrial, siempre que utilicen principalmente productos agropecuarios, fuera de la provincia de Lima y la Provincia Constitucional del Callao. No incluidas en la presente ley las actividades agroindustriales relacionadas con trigo, tabaco, semillas oleaginosas, aceites y cerveza; 3) Los productores agrarios excluyendo aquellos organizados en asociaciones de productores, siempre y cuando cada asociado de manera individual no supere 5 hectáreas de producción. Policy: Federal Law No. 490-FZ “On apiculture”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law establishes the legal framework for development of beekeeping as an agricultural activity, as well as activities aimed at the preservation of bees. The objectives of this Federal Law shall be to ensure the production of bee products and the preservation of bees. Apiculture shall be intended a set of economic activities defined on the basis of the All-Russian Classifier of Economic Activities as a totality of economic activities related to breeding, keeping, and use of bees, including for the pollination of agricultural crops, production and processing of bee products, including provision of services in the aforesaid sphere. Bee products shall be intended honey, wax and other products, defined in accordance with the All-Russian Classifier of products. This Federal Law regulates relations, arising in connection with the implementation of activities in the field of beekeeping, as well as the preservation of bees. Agricultural land and other land categories shall be authorized for use for apiculture, if the implementation of apiculture, if their regime of land tenure allows it, as well as the use of land plots provided or acquired for apiculture is also allowed to use land plots provided or acquired for the purpose of smallholding. The requirements for the location of apiaries are established by the federal body of executive power responsible for developing state policy and normative legal regulation in the sphere of agriculture. It is prohibited to locate apiary infrastructure on land plots that have been used for the placement of cemeteries, burial grounds, disposal facilities for industrial and consumption waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, and poisonous substances, radioactive waste disposal sites. Agricultural producers engaged in apiculture are the owners of beekeeping products, obtained as a result of their activities. It is prohibited to use for the treatment of bees the drugs that have not passed state registration in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation. This Law consists of VI Chapters divided into 18 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II establishes economic grounds for apiculture. Chapter III regards apiculture management. Chapter IV establishes the procedure for apiculture management. Chapter V regards conservation of bees. Chapter VI lays down final provisions.

Article 20 (1) establishes that import to the territory of the Russian Federation of grain without accompanying document for a batch of grain shall be prohibited.

Policy: Federal Law No. 505-FZ amending Federal Law No. 33-FZ on protected areas.
Policy_Content: Federal Law No. 33-FZ on protected areas shall be supplemented with Article 3 (1) of the Federal Law No. 33-FZ on protected areas of the following wording: “Settlements may be included in the composition of protected areas without expropriation of land plots and other immovable property located on their territories from rights holders (except for state nature reserves), if this does not contradict the regime of special protection the relevant category of protected areas. In case of zoning of the protected areas settlements are included into the composition of functional zones, the regime of which permits performance of economic activities. Turnover of land plots on the territory of the populated area, included into the protected area of federal or regional significance, is not restricted. Such land plots may be, on the grounds envisaged by law, owned by the Russian Federation and constituent entities of the Russian Federation, municipal units, by citizens or legal entities, or classified as land plots the ownership of which is not delimited. Allotment of land plots pertaining to state or municipally ownership shall be performed in accordance with land legislation. The use of land plots on the territory of settlement included into a protected area must be carried out with due consideration of the regime of protected area. Urban planning regulations in relation to the territory of such a settlement shall be established in accordance with the legislation on urban planning and this Federal Law. The regulation on protected area may establish requirements with respect to urban planning regulations. The provisions of this Article do not apply to protected areas, fully located on the territory of a settlement, and if protected area is partially located on the territory of a settlement, with respect to that part of it, which is located within the borders of the settlement." Article 95 of Land Code (No. 136-FZ of 2001) shall be amended to add the following wording: “Land and land plots within the boundaries of populated areas included in the composition of protected areas shall belong to the category of urban land. The use of land and land plots within the boundaries of settlements included in protected areas shall be restricted with the consideration of the need to protect natural complexes of protected areas from adverse anthropogenic impacts.”

Article 15 (1) establishes that officials of the federal executive bodies performing control (supervision) in the field of safe handling of pesticides and agrochemicals must control state registration status of pesticides and agrochemicals and assess compliance of imported pesticides with the requirements of registration certificate. Policy: Law No. 492-FZ “On biological safety”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law establishes the grounds for state regulation in the field of ensuring biological safety in the Russian Federation and defines a complex of measures aimed at the protection of the population and the environment from the effects of hazardous biological factors, prevention of biological threats (hazards) and the creation and development of a system of monitoring of biological risks. Biological safety shall be intended the state of protection of the population and the environment from the effects of biological hazards, which provides an acceptable level of biological risk. Biological security shall be intended a set of measures to ensure biological safety implemented in order to prevent or mitigate adverse effects of biological hazards on humans, animals and plants. Biosafety is based on the following principles: (a) protection of the health of citizens and the environment from the impact of hazardous biological factors; (b) combination of the interests and responsibilities of the individual, society and the state in the field of ensuring biological safety; (c) correspondence of measures of state regulation in the field of ensuring biological safety to the existing biological threats (risks), as well as systematic approach in implementation of measures aimed at ensuring of biological safety; (d) increase of public awareness related to the issues of biological safety; (e) protection, reproduction and rational use of natural resources as a prerequisite to ensure biological safety; (f) presumption of biological hazard of planned economic and other activities at potentially hazardous biological sites; (g) timely response to emerging biological threats (risks), including creation of production facilities and reserves, including state material reserve of products (commodities) necessary for ensuring the safety of the population. Activities for ensuring biological safety shall be as follows: (a) determination of the main directions of state policy and strategic planning in the field of biological safety; (b) forecasting, identifying, analyzing, assessing biological risks; (c) development and application of measures to identify, prevent and eliminate biological threats (risks), including those identified as a result of monitoring of biological risks, localization and neutralization of consequences of their occurrence; (d) application of special economic measures in order to ensure biological safety; (e) ensuring security of potentially hazardous biological sites; (f) development, production and implementation of new technologies and methods for activities using pathogens, as well as standardization of methods of their research; (g) organization of scientific research activities in the field of ensuring biological safety; (h) collection activities related to the use of pathogenic microorganisms and viruses; (i) coordination of activities of federal public authorities, public authorities of constituent entities of the Russian Federation (regions) and local government in ensuring biological safety; (j) information, analytical and expert support for the activities of federal executive agencies in ensuring biological safety; and (k) international cooperation for ensuring biological safety.

Policy: Law No. 396-VI “On technical regulation”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the fundamental principles of technical regulation arising in the process of establishment, execution of requirements related to processing, rendering services, and also defines legal bases of the functioning of the state system of technical regulation. Safety of produce and process shall be intended absence of unacceptable risks causing damage to human life, health, environment, including damage including to wild flora and wild fauna. Objects of technical regulation shall be products, except for veterinary drugs, and voluntary certification, except for veterinary, plant protection and plant quarantine. The main objectives of technical regulation are: (a) ensuring safety of products, processes and services for human life, health; (b) ensuring the safety of products, processes and services for human life, health and environment, including flora and fauna; and (b) prevention of actions misleading purchasers (consumers) regarding safety and quality of products and services, also by ensuring reliability of their conformity assessment, traceability of products and related processes. Manufacturer, importer and seller of products must declare safety of their products. This Law establishes responsibility of manufacturer, importer and (or) seller for release of products into circulation that do not comply with technical regulations and (or) standards. The use of conformity certificates in the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan, when releasing in circulation products that are subject to mandatory confirmation of conformity, the information of which is absent in the register of technical regulation or unified registers of issued or accepted documents on conformity assessment of the Eurasian Economic Union, shall be prohibited. Technical regulations must contain: (a) an exhaustive list of products, processes, which are covered by requirements; (b) requirements applicable to the characteristics of products, processes, ensuring compliance with the establishes technical requirements. Technical regulation may contain the rules of sampling and testing of products, forms and schemes of conformity assessment and (or) requirements related to terminology, packaging, marking or labelling and rules of their application. The conformity mark is intended for marking products that have passed conformity assessment procedures. Voluntary confirmation of conformity is carried out in the form of voluntary certification.

Policy: Regulation of the Water and Electricity Regulatory Authority issued by Cabinet Resolution No.263 of 2020.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 20 articles aims at organizing the activities of the Water and Electricity Regulatory Authority which is the authority in charge of (i) regulating and supervising services within the scope of its competence; (ii) monitoring; and (iii) coordinating between the relevant institutions and agencies, and between authorized persons, to set the necessary regulatory and procedural framework to ensure that service activities are carried out at levels of high quality and reliability, to provide them to the consumer at appropriate prices and tariffs, and support sustainable development. In particular, the Authority shall undertake the following (i) improve the services that concern the consumer, and protect his rights, including his right to obtain services with high reliability and efficiency, and to choose between competitors licensed, at reasonable competitive prices; (ii) encourage the local and international private sector to contribute, participate and invest in the systematic expansion and development of services; (iii) prepare the electrical activity in the Kingdom for a gradual transition to the electricity market; (iv) prepare the water activity for the gradual transition to privatization; (v) ensure that service providers adhere to the national policies, directives, and requirements for the security of supplies, sustainable economic growth, and the good of society; (vi) increase consumers' access to the necessary supplies of services, and work to verify their delivery to the areas they have not reached; (vii) ensure the provision of safe, reliable, and highly efficient supplies; (viii) provide an organizational framework for services that is clear, stable, and free from discrimination; (ix) protect the public interest and protect the rights and interests of consumers, authorized persons, and investors in developing services; (x) coordinate with the relevant authorities and institutions to encourage and support legitimate competition and reduce monopoly in services, and work to complete the development of the infrastructure for services; (xi) ensure that services are of a high standard in terms of working methods and technologies used; (xii) work to achieve the environmental standards and standards adopted in the services; (xiii) conduct periodic reviews and prepare periodic reports on the status of services; and (xiv) provide assistance and advice to State institutions with regard to developing the capabilities of services and making the supporting equipment and supplies. The authority, in order to achieve its tasks, shall, among others, do the following (i) issue regulations regarding its duties, including procedural environmental and technical rules related to services, classifying the types of service activities and updating them, rules for licenses and permits, take the necessary measures to ensure the provision of additional sources of services in the event that a clear shortage of those supplies is expected; (ii) take the necessary measures to implement the provisions of the laws and regulations thereof; (iii) monitoring the implementation of the regulations, rules and procedures related to management; (iv) raise the efficiency of water and electricity production plants.

Policy: Regional Law No. 172-OZ “On ecological education and formation of ecological culture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal, organizational and economic bases for organization and development of ecological education and formation. It shall be applicable also to ecotourism. Ecological education is a purposeful, continuous process of environmental education, upbringing and education at all levels of general and professional education, and vocational training in the frameworks of additional education, a set of acquired knowledge related to environmental protection, efficient use of natural resources and environmental security, as well as dissemination of environmental knowledge and information, aimed at the development of environmental culture and professional training of specialists in the field of environmental protection. Ecotourism is one of the directions of tourism activities in the region, aimed at organizing recreation and (or) environmental education, with a view of organizing recreation and/or environmental education, environmental upbringing, taking into account the adoption of the necessary measures to prevent and eliminate the negative impact on the environment. The system of ecological education includes: (a) educational programs aimed at the development of environmental educational programs and forming environmental culture; (b) federal and regional normative legal acts, including, including strategic planning documents containing provisions aimed at developing environmental education and forming environmental culture; (c) subjects of the system of environmental education and environmental culture development; (d) regional information resources established for the purpose of disseminating environmental knowledge and public environmental education.

Policy: Eighth Five Year Plan (July 2020 - June 2025).
Policy_Content: This Eighth Five Year Plan is a nationwide multi-sectoral document aiming at completing the agenda of achieving the social and economic transformation. It centers around 6 core themes, which are (1) rapid recovery from COVID-19 at both health and economic level; (2) GDP growth acceleration, employment generation, and rapid poverty reduction; (3) a broad-based strategy of inclusiveness; (4) a sustainable development pathway that is resilient to disaster and climate change; (5) improvement of critical institutions necessary to lead the economy to Upper Middle Income Country status by 2031; and (6) attaining SDGs targets and mitigating the impact of LDC graduation. As for the poverty reduction, the Plan envisages to have a much stronger focus on job creation, infrastructure supply, credit, and social protection income transfers, a much stronger social protection system nationwide, make the digital/mobile financial services system more effective in achieving financial inclusion of the poor and marginalized groups. As for the social inclusion strategy, the Plan focuses on the gender issue, providing support to organizations that promote women entrepreneurs in informal and formal economy, giving access to finance schemes such as micro-credit, receiving better education, improving child care availability, improving the safety of women’s movements and in the workplace, and getting more support from men and other family members. The Plan aims also to include the ethnic minorities by eliminating all legal and regulatory restrictions to inclusion and building affirmative actions in its social development policies to protect social inclusion. The entire document is heavily focused on the strategy for recovery from COVID-19, at- economic, social, and health levels.

Policy: Regional Law No. 156-oz “On apiculture.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the legal framework of activities on breeding, keeping bees, their use for pollination of agricultural entomophilous plants, manufacturing of beekeeping products, protection of bees from diseases and poisoning by agrochemicals, as well as protection of the rights and interests of citizens, individual entrepreneurs and legal entities involved in beekeeping in the region. Policy: Governmental Decree No. 2314 validating the Regulation on handling production and consumption waste in terms of lighting devices, electric lamps, improper collection, accumulation, use, neutralization, transportation and disposal of which may cause harm to life, health of citizens, harm to animals, plants and the environment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for handling production and consumption waste in terms of lighting devices, electric lamps, improper collection, accumulation, use, neutralization, transportation and disposal of which may cause harm to life, health of citizens, harm to animals, plants and the environment. Consumers of mercury-containing lamps, except for natural persons, who accumulate waste mercury-containing lamps, designate persons responsible for the safe accumulation of mercury-containing lamps and transfer them to the operator. Local government shall organize the creation of accumulation sites for used mercury-containing lamps, as well as informing consumers about the location of such places. The damaged mercury-containing lamps must be stored in sealed transport packaging that prevents environmental pollution and harm to human life and health. Accumulation of spent mercury-containing lamps shall be made separately from other types of waste. Damaged and undamaged mercury lamps shall not be accumulated together.  and undamaged mercury-containing lamps must not be accumulated together. Burial of spent mercury-containing lamps is prohibited.
