Policy: Order No. KR DCM-331/2020 of the acting Minister of Public Health validating "Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for the collection, use, application, treatment, transportation, storage and disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste.”
Policy_Content: This Order establishes "Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for the collection, use, application, treatment, transportation, storage and disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste”. It includes recycling and reprocessing of liquid and solid waste. Domestic (consumption) waste shall be classified as solid domestic (municipal) waste and medical waste. Collection and temporary storage of industrial waste shall be carried out by natural persons and legal entities in the process of operation of facilities, buildings, structures, constructions and other facilities, which generate industrial waste as a result of their activities, and the aforesaid operations shall be regulated by contracts with specialized business entities for further treatment, disposal (burial) or recycling of waste. At production facilities, collection and temporary storage of non-domestic (industrial) waste shall be performed at special sites (locations) that correspond to the hazard class of waste. Waste, as it is accumulated, shall be collected separately for each group of waste in accordance with the hazard class. According to the degree of impact on human health and the environment, waste shall be classified into the following five hazard classes: (a) 1st class - extremely hazardous; (b) 2nd class - highly hazardous; (c) 3rd class - moderately hazardous; (d) 4th class - slightly hazardous; and (e) 5th class - non-hazardous. On the territory of settlements collection, use, application, neutralization, transportation, storage and burial of domestic (consumption) waste shall be performed by specialized organizations. In small settlements, in case of specialized organizations for collection, removal and maintenance waste disposal sites for solid domestic waste, shall be organized landfills with autonomous transportation of domestic waste under supervision and servicing by local government. Food waste from catering and trade facilities, general education institutions, sanatoria and resort organizations, except for infectious disease hospitals, including tuberculosis hospitals, dermatological and venereal diseases shall be collected in containers with covers and kept in a refrigerated room or in refrigerated chambers.

Policy: Regional Law No. 10-4614 “On the acknowledgement of citizens in need for the purpose of provision thereto certain measures of social protection.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the criteria of citizens in need and the procedure for considering citizens in need in order to provide certain measures of social support. The neediness criteria applied in assessing the neediness of citizen to determine the right to receive social support measures, include: (a) the average per capita income of a citizen; and (b) the level of property in possession of citizen. To make a decision on the recognition of a citizen as being in need for the purpose of providing certain social support measures, an assessment of neediness through the application in the aggregate of the criteria of neediness shall be required. Assessment of the neediness of a citizen as a family member, shall be performed with the consideration of aggregate household property and income. In order to declare a citizen in need, the assessment of his/her average per capita income is calculated on the basis of the sum of incomes of family members or a single person for the last three calendar months preceding the month of submission of the application. A citizen is deemed to be in need if his monthly average per capita income for the calculation period does not exceed twice the subsistence minimum of a low-income family or a low-income single person.

Policy: Order No. KR DCM-328/2020 of the acting Minister of Public Health validating the Regulation on establishment and operation of biobanks.”
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for the establishment and operation of biobanks. Biobank shall be intended a specialized storage of biological materials for scientific and biomedical purposes (including samples of cells, tissues, deoxyribonucleic acid, ribonucleic acid genetic material of human and/or animal and/or plant genetic material, and other biological and genetically modified substances and organisms). Biological materials of preclinical (non-clinical) clinical tests stored in biobanks, collected in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan, norms of bioethics, in compliance with all requirements for sample preparation, transportation, laboratory processing and storage. A biobank shall be established on the basis of a healthcare organization, an organization of higher and (or) postgraduate education and scientific organization on the basis of: (a) a positive opinion of the Central Bioethics Commission issued in accordance with the Standards of Activities of Bioethics Commissions approved by the Central Commission; and (b) a positive opinion of the Biosafety Commission of a research center (if any) or an expert on biosafety from a third-party organization in case of the absence of Biosafety Commission under research center. Biobank activities include: (a) collection, incoming visual quality control, storage of samples of biological materials, including samples of cells, tissues, deoxyribonucleic acid, ribonucleic acid genetic material of human and/or animal and/or plant, and other biological and genetically modified substances and organisms; (b) issuance of biological materials to researchers according to their developed inclusion criteria; (c) accounting of stored samples of biological materials and associated medical, demographic and laboratory information, maintenance of an electronic database; (d) storage of collected samples of biological materials, observance of temperature regimes, and availability of reserve sources of power supply, which guarantees full safety of accumulated biomaterial; (e) provision of services of collection, processing, storage and analysis of biological materials for researchers and research teams at the research center; (f) interaction with other Kazakhstan and foreign biobanks; and (g) exchange of samples of biological materials between biobanks and medical organizations.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2020/2221 amending Regulation (EU) No 1303/2013 as regards additional resources and implementing arrangements to provide assistance for fostering crisis repair in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic and its social consequences and for preparing a green, digital and resilient recovery of the economy (REACT-EU).
Policy_Content: This Regulation makes several amendments by laying down rules and implementing arrangements regarding the additional resources provided as Recovery Assistance for Cohesion and the Territories of Europe (‘REACT-EU’) to provide assistance for fostering crisis repair in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic and its social consequences and for preparing a green, digital and resilient recovery of the economy. Under REACT-EU, an additional financial support will be made available to support those Member States and regions that are most affected by crisis repair in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic and its social consequences and Member States should use the REACT-EU resources primarily to support access to the labour market and social systems, through job creation and quality employment, in particular for people in vulnerable situations, and for social inclusion and poverty eradication measures.

Policy: Ley para el desarrollo agrícola sustentable del Estado de Tlaxcala.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto: 1) Enaltecer la actividad de los agricultores del Estado reconociendo su noble labor en la producción tanto de los  alimentos que como sociedad consumimos, como de aquellas fibras e insumos necesarios para la industria; 2) Establecer las bases para alcanzar un desarrollo sustentable de las actividades agrícolas y su promoción buscando  su armonización con los procesos de urbanización, desarrollo industrial y territorial, así como con los programas  integrales de desarrollo rural, con el propósito de abatir la contaminación de suelos, agua y atmosfera, reducir la  erosión e incrementar la eficiencia, productividad y competitividad del campo Tlaxcalteca mediante el uso óptimo  y racional de los recursos naturales, la adopción de la tecnología adecuada en las unidades de producción, la  consideración de las condiciones socioeconómicas de los productores y su participación permanente en el  proceso; 3) Definir un programa agrícola estatal que, a partir de un proceso de planificación en todos los niveles, asegure  la práctica sustentable de la actividad mediante análisis de costos y rentabilidad de las acciones, así como del  seguimiento y la evaluación sistemática por parte de los actores insertos en el proceso, permitiendo alcanzar  los objetivos planteados; 4) Establecer políticas y estrategias pertinentes para el seguimiento y evaluación de los programas y actividades  públicas dirigidas y/o relacionadas con la agricultura, con el fin de asegurar que la actividad se realice de  acuerdo con aquellos parámetros que aseguren la sustentabilidad de los recursos naturales; 5) Impulsar las buenas prácticas en el manejo de los recursos naturales mediante procesos de capacitación y  asesoría a todas aquellas personas que intervienen en el sector agrícola acerca de los procesos de reconversión  de cultivos y la diversificación productiva que aseguren un manejo sustentable; 6) Promover y financiar la investigación agrícola, manejo postcosecha y agregación de valor, estableciendo  mecanismos eficaces de difusión y transferencia de la tecnología generada, creando los espacios de  concertación y consulta necesarios entre las instancias académicas, científicas y los productores, que impacte  en un incremento en la producción y la rentabilidad de la actividad, para mejorar la calidad de vida de los  habitantes de las áreas rurales del Estado; 7) Establecer mecanismos de mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de los habitantes de las zonas rurales del  Estado; 8) Desarrollar e implementar sistemas de comercialización y mercadeo de todos los productos y subproductos  agrícolas, así como la promoción para el consumo de los mismos a escala estatal, nacional e internacional; 9) Implementar un sistema eficiente y oportuno de gestión de los recursos que demandan para su correcta  operación los programas y acciones de desarrollo agrícola sustentable que formule la Secretaría dirigidas a  apoyar las labores de preparación del terreno, siembra, fertilización, combate de malezas, plagas y  enfermedades, así como de cosecha, manejo postcosecha, comercialización o industrialización, asegurando la  productividad de los predios, la conservación de los recursos y la inocuidad de los productos; 10) Promover las acciones fitosanitarias requeridas, tanto para el control y vigilancia de la producción, como para  el traslado, transformación y comercialización de la producción agrícola, en y desde las áreas de producción  a los mercados locales, regionales, nacionales e internacionales, de tal manera que mediante un manejo  integrado, evitar, contener o reducir aquellos productos afectados por contaminación física, química,  microbiológica y plagas que pudieran afectar los productos agrícolas y la salud humana a través  de su ingesta; 11) Propiciar las condiciones para la libre asociación y organización de productores y asegurar su inclusión al  proceso productivo estatal; 12) Establecer mecanismos y estrategias de capitalización que permitan a las organizaciones de productores el  acceso a aquellos recursos económicos necesarios para su correcto funcionamiento y apoyo al sector agrícola  del Estado.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants, Water

Policy: National Environment (Standards for Discharge of Effluent Into Water or Land) Regulations, 2020.
Policy_Content: These regulations, organized in six Parts and five Schedules, prescribe the environmental standards and measures for the treatment of effluent before discharge from various sources into water or land. A general obligation is set up, to prevent and mitigate pollution according to the legislation in force and a standard for effluent before discharge into water or land is prescribed in these Regulations (standards for general chemicals and micro-biological discharge set out in Schedule 2, standards for inorganic substances effluent discharge set out in Schedule 3 and standards for organic substances effluent discharge set out in Schedule 4). The discharge of effluent into public sewers is also regulated, by article 7. Part three is dedicated to the issuance, by the National Environment Management Authority, of licences to operate an effluent treatment plant and to obtain an effluent discharge permit, which can be issued under the imposition of conditions and requirements, as specified by article 14 and can, upon the circumstances described by article 16, be suspended or revoked. Part four is dedicated to the monitoring, records and reports: a record of volumes and quality of effluent discharged into the environment shall be maintained by the holder of a licence or permit and the authority shall conduct regular inspections and monitoring of the facility generating and discharging effluent into water or land. Events of acute pollution caused by the effluent discharge shall be immediately notified the police by a holder of a licence or permit. Part five is dedicated to offences, penalties and administrative measures. The last Part is a general one, covering revocations and containing the Schedules.

Policy: Law on the establishment of guarantee scheme as a measure of support to the economy for mitigating the consequences of the SARS-CoV-2 caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Policy_Content: This Serbian Law on the establishment of guarantee scheme as a measure of support to the economy for mitigating the consequences of the SARS-CoV-2 COVID-19 pandemic, here regulates the conditions, procedure, amount and manner of providing funds for issuing (state) guarantees of the Republic of Serbia in connection with offered guarantee scheme, including the criteria, conditions and manner of approving of related loans by banks, reporting, and other issues relevant to the above mentioned guarantee scheme. This scheme is created as a measure of support to the economy, in order to mitigate the economic consequences caused by the pandemic of the disease COVID-19 caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, with the aim of increasing the liquidity of economic entities on the territory of the Republic of Serbia. Issues of persons who cannot be beneficiaries of a loan secured by a guarantee from the guarantee scheme are laid down in article 5. Persons who are authorized/designated as beneficiaries of a loan secured by a guarantee from the guarantee scheme are defined in article 6 of this text (this list includes agricultural holdings, registered with the Business Registers Agency and classified as an entrepreneur, or a micro, small and medium-sized company). The national Ministry of Finance shall supervise the application and enforcement of these provisions. Conditions for securing a loan in accordance with the guarantee scheme are listed in article 8.

Policy: Resolution No. 172/2020 approving the Policy Charter for the Blue Economy in Cape Verde.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Policy Charter for the Blue Economy in Cape Verde. This Charter has the following strategic objectives: a) Sustainable and inclusive economic growth; b) Reduction of regional asymmetries; c) Combating unemployment, especially for youth generation; d) Use of demographic parameters; e) Research and technology; f) Investment in education of excellence; g) Strengthening security. Cape Verde defined, in the various strategic instruments and in the governance programmes, its vision of development. The strategy is based on key economic sectors for the Blue Economy, such as: Fisheries and aquaculture; Trade, and food security; Marine and coastal environment; Oceans, climate change and pollution, fight against plastics in the seas; Tourism and aquatic ecotourism; Maritime transport and port development; Maritime Spatial Planning and Enhancement of Coastal Areas and Bays; Services and scientific research; Maritime Security; Renewable energy.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto declara el estado de excepción por calamidad pública en todo el territorio nacional, por el grave incremento en el contagio de la COVID-19 por causa de las aglomeraciones así como la exposición a una mutación con mayor virulencia importada desde el Reino Unido, a fin de contener la expansión del coronavirus y sus consecuencias negativas en la salud pública. Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo emite las Reglas de Operación del Programa Sembrando Vida, para el ejercicio fiscal 2021, que está diseñado para atender a la población rural que se encuentra en las regiones de más alta biodiversidad del país, que vive en localidades marginadas y cuyos municipios se encuentran con niveles de medio a muy alto grado de Rezago Social fijados por el Consejo Nacional de Evaluación de la Política de Desarrollo Social (CONEVAL), o con ingresos inferiores a la línea de pobreza por ingresos, establecida también por el CONEVAL. El Programa incentivará a los sujetos agrarios a establecer sistemas productivos agroforestales, el cual combina la producción de los cultivos tradicionales en conjunto con árboles frutícolas y maderables, y el sistema de Milpa Intercalada entre Árboles Frutales (MIAF), con lo que se contribuirá a generar empleos, se incentivará la autosuficiencia alimentaria, se mejorarán los ingresos de las y los pobladores y se recuperará la cobertura forestal en el país.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 033-2020-SA — Regula la Autorización Sanitaria del sistema de tratamiento y disposición final de aguas residuales domésticas con infiltración en el terreno.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo tiene como objeto regular la Autorización Sanitaria del sistema de tratamiento y disposición final de aguas residuales domésticas con infi ltración en el terreno, que es el procedimiento administrativo por el cual la Dirección General de Salud Ambiental e Inocuidad Alimentaria (DIGESA) autoriza el uso de un sistema de tratamiento y disposición final de aguas residuales domésticas con infiltración en el terreno, con el objetivo de evitar la propagación de enfermedades y deslindar todo impacto que se genere en las rutas de exposición: agua, aire y suelo a causa de la presencia de vectores a fin de salvaguardar la salud de la población. Forma parte del presente procedimiento la realización de una inspección técnica previa solo en caso se solicite la autorización para un Sistema existente.

Policy_Content: L'arrêté ministériel du 27 novembre 2017, relatif à l'aide complémentaire à l'investissement dans la transformation et la commercialisation des produits agricoles ou le développement de produits agricoles, ainsi qu'à l'investissement pour les entreprises du secteur de la première transformation du bois, est modifié comme il suit: dans l'article 1 la nomenclature NACE-BEL est insérée. L'annexe 2, relatif aux points attribués aux critères de sélection dans le cadre de l'aide complémentaire à l'investissement pour les entreprises du secteur de la première transformation du bois, est remplacé. Policy: Decree No. 109/2020 redefining functions and competences of the National Institute of Meteorology.
Policy_Content: This Decree redefines functions and competences of the National Institute of Meteorology (INAM, IP). The INAM, IP is the entity responsible for the exercise of meteorological activity at national level. INAM, IP, has its headquarters in Maputo and cooperates with two regional weather forecasting centers in Sofala and Nampula. INAM, IP, is represented at the local level by provincial delegations and meteorological stations. In particular, INAM, IP is entitled to: a) exercise its authority over meteorological activity at national level; b) carry out scientific research in the field of climate change, astronomy, natural disasters and meteorological applications; c) elaborate weather and climate forecasts for the public, aviation, marine and other interested parties; d) meteorological, climatic and technical information necessary for the definition of national policies related to the risks of natural disasters of meteorological origin; e) provide for meteorological and climatic information necessary to guarantee the sustainable development of the national economy; f) coordinate matters relating to the execution of international treaties, conventions and agreements relating to meteorology.

Policy_Content: El objetivo general del Programa es incrementar el ingreso de los pequeños y medianos productores agropecuarios de granos básicos (arroz, frijol, maíz y trigo) y leche, a través de la implementación de Precios de Garantía. Los objetivos específicos del Programa son: 1)        Establecer precios de garantía para el maíz de pequeños productores, frijol y leche; 2) Apoyar la comercialización del maíz de medianos productores, trigo y arroz.  El alcance del Programa Precios de Garantía a Productos Alimentarios Básicos es nacional y focalizado de manera precisa hacia los productores elegibles. El pago de los Precios de Garantía estará en función de la disponibilidad presupuestal y se hará de manera estrictamente individualizada a cada uno de los productores beneficiarios. SEGALMEX (Seguridad Alimentaria Mexicana), Organismo Público Descentralizado sectorizado en la  Secretaría de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural (SADER), es la instancia responsable de la operación del Programa de Precios de Garantía.

Policy: Ley 9/2020, de 16 de diciembre, por la que se modifica la Ley 1/2005, de 9 de marzo, por la que se regula el régimen del comercio de derechos de emisión de gases de efecto invernadero, para intensificar las reducciones de emisiones de forma eficaz en relación con los costes.
Policy_Content: La presente ley incorpora parcialmente al ordenamiento jurídico español la Directiva (UE) 2018/410 del Parlamento Europeo y del Consejo, de 14 de marzo de 2018, por la que se modifica la Directiva 2003/87/CE para intensificar las reducciones de emisiones de forma eficaz en relación con los costes y facilitar las inversiones en tecnologías hipocarbónicas, así como la Decisión (UE) 2015/1814. Las modificaciones introducidas en el capítulo I de la Ley 1/2005, de 9 de marzo, incluyen la actualización del objeto de la norma conforme a lo establecido en la Directiva 2018/410, y la inclusión de nuevas definiciones. El capítulo II regula el régimen de las autorizaciones de emisión de gases de efecto invernadero con las que deben contar las instalaciones sometidas al ámbito de aplicación de la ley y cuyo otorgamiento corresponde al órgano competente que designe la comunidad autónoma en la que se ubique la instalación. Destaca la eliminación de la obligación por parte  del  órgano  autonómico  de  revisar  cada  cinco  años  la  autorización  de  emisión  de  gases de efecto invernadero. El  capítulo  IV,  regula  la  asignación  de  derechos  de  emisión. Destaca como principal novedad respecto del procedimiento para solicitar asignación gratuita de derechos de emisión que determinados aspectos, como son la determinación del plazo para la presentación de las solicitudes, su contenido, formato y la documentación a aportar, serán desarrollados reglamentariamente. Por último, se dedica un nuevo capítulo V a la regulación de los ajustes y de la devolución de la asignación gratuita de derechos de emisión.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG914/2020 validating the Regulation on the limitation of emissions of volatile organic compounds resulting from the use of organic solvents in certain paints, varnishes and products used for car finishing.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the limitation of emissions of volatile organic compounds arising from the use of organic solvents in some paints, varnishes and products used for finishing cars is aimed at limiting the total content of volatile organic compounds in some paints, varnishes and car finishing products to prevent and reduce air pollution caused by the contribution of volatile organic compounds to the formation tropospheric ozone. This Regulation sets maximum limits for the content of volatile organic compounds in some paints, varnishes and finishing products cars, to achieve the aforesaid goal. The requirements of this Regulation apply to the products specified in Appendix No. 1, intended for placement on the market in a finished form. It shall be authorized to place on the market varnishes, paints and products used for finishing of cars specified in Appendix No. 1, only if they match the maximum limit values for the VOC content set out in Appendix No. 2.

Policy: Phytopharmacy Law.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the rules for registration and authorization of phytopharmaceutical products (medicines with pure active substances that come from plants or parts of plants) in commercial form and sets all necessary provisions regarding their placement on the market, production, use and control on the territory of the Northern Republic Macedonia, including rules for approval of active substances, antidotes and synergists of which phytopharmaceuticals are composed or contained, the rules for additives and conformulants, as well as issues related to residues deriving from such phytopharmaceuticals products. This Law establishes a framework for achieving sustainable use of hytopharmaceutical products by reducing their risks and impacts of use on human, animal and environmental health and monitoring principles of integrated plant protection. This Law is further harmonized with the provisions of the Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the placing of plant protection products on the market and repealing Council Directives 79/117/EEC and 91/414/EEC.

Policy: Regional Law No. 422-ZO “On protection of the population and regional territory against emergency situations of natural and technogenic character.”

It defines plenary powers of the regional authorities in the field of protection of the population against natural and technogenic emergencies. Territorial subsystem for the prevention and liquidation of emergencies is integral part of the unified state system for the prevention and liquidation of emergencies and local government, municipal entities and organizations, whose competence includes solving the issues of protection of the population and territories against emergency situations, including safety of people on waterbodies.

Policy: Regulation on the control of SARS-CoV-2 infection in mink.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, which is composed of ten paragraphs and one Annex, lays down the detailed method and mode of controlling and preventing the occurrence of SARS-CoV-2 infection in mink. In particular the present Regulation establishes: (1) the manner and procedure when suspecting a disease; (2) measures used to control the disease; (3) cleaning and decontamination procedures; (4) conditions and manner of placing mink on farms again.
Subject: Wild species & ecosystems, General

Policy: Regulation on periodic tests of electromagnetic field levels in the environment.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation of the Minister of Climate and Environment is to assure as good as possible the state of environment by keeping the level of electromagnetic fields below acceptable or at least on this level. The present Regulation, which is composed of eight paragraphs and three Annexes, lays down the scope and method of conducting periodic tests of electromagnetic field levels in the environment, including: (1) method of selecting measurement points; (2) required frequency of measurements; (3) methods of presentation of measurement results.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Arrêté Conjoint nº162/MINFOF/MINTP/MINMAP du 15 Decembre 2020 Fixant les modalités d'utilisation du bois d'origine légale dans la commande publique.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les modalités de l'utilisation du bois d'origine légale  dans la commande publique. Il s'applique aux commandes publiques  passées par l'Etat et les autres personnes morales de droit public. L'utilisation du bols d'origine légale consiste en la mise en place de mécanismes d'utilisation du bois d'origine légale et d'un environnement propice à l'accessibilité dudit bois, ainsi qu'en l'établissement d'un fichier sur la consommation des bois d'origine légale par les acteurs publics. L'utilisation du bois d'origine légale est obligatoire dans la réalisation de tous les ouvrages et fournitures faisant l'objet d'une commande publique.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Order No. KR DSM-275/2020 of the Minister of Public Health validating the Regulation on Sanitary Rules "Sanitary and Epidemiological Requirements for Radiation Safety".
Policy_Content: These Sanitary Rules "Sanitary and Epidemiological Requirements for Radiation Safety" establish sanitary and epidemiological requirements for ensuring radiation safety when selecting a land plot, when designing, construction, reconstruction, overhaul, commissioning, operation and decommissioning of radiation facilities, handling sources of ionizing radiation (sealed and unsealed radionuclide sources, radioactive substances, radioisotope devices and equipment generating ionizing radiation), management of radioactive waste, use of materials and products contaminated with or containing radionuclides, radiation monitoring, the use of personal protective equipment and personal hygiene, medical exposures, exposure to natural sources of ionizing radiation and radiation accidents. Sanitary rules shall apply to all natural and legal persons, carrying out: (a) design, construction, reconstruction, overhaul, commissioning and decommissioning of radiation facilities, extraction, production, storage, use, transportation of radioactive of radioactive substances and other sources of ionizing radiation; (b) collection, storage, processing, transportation and disposal of radioactive waste; (c) assembly, repair and adjustment of devices, facilities and apparatuses, the operation of which is based on ionizing radiation sources and devices generating ionizing radiation; and (d) radiation control of man-made sources of ionizing radiation. Sanitary Rules also apply to natural persons and legal entities, whose activities affect the level of human exposure to natural sources of ionizing radiation, and organizations carrying out work in the territory contaminated by radioactive substances.

Policy: Order No. KR DSM-267/2020 of the Minister of Public Health validating the Regulation on keeping register of potentially hazardous chemical and biological substances prohibited for use in the Republic of Kazakhstan.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for keeping register of potentially hazardous chemical and biological substances prohibited for use in the Republic of Kazakhstan. Keeping register shall be intended: (a) entry of information submitted by subordinate organizations of state body in the sphere of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of population, subjects of scientific and (or) scientific-technical activity to the state body in the sphere of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population; (b)  consideration of materials, decision making by state body in the sphere of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population on inclusion or refusal to include hazardous substances in the register; (c) updating the register in the event of changes in information about potentially hazardous substances; and (d) posting of the register on the Internet site of the state authority in the sphere of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population. Annex 1 contains the form of report on scientific expertise. Annex 2 contains the form of register of potentially hazardous chemical and biological substances prohibited for use in the Republic of Kazakhstan.

Policy: Décret n° 2020/749 DU 14/12/2020 Portant Création de la Société Nationale des Mines
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte création de la Société Nationale des Mines en abrégé "SONAMINES" et ci-après désignée "la SONAMINES". La SONAMINES a pour mission de développer et de promouvoir le secteur minier au Cameroun, à l'exception des hydrocarbures et des substances des carrières, et de gérer les intérêts de l'Etat dans ce domaine. A ce titre, elle est chargée notamment: de réaliser l'inventaire des indices miniers en liaison avec les autres administration et organismes compétents; de conduire les études relatives à l'exploration et à l'exploitation des substances minérales; de mener les opérations d'achat et de commercialisation des substances minérales pour le compte de l'Etat; de mener les activités d'exploration et d'exploitation des substances minérales; d'assurer la mise en oeuvre des mesures relatives à la restauration, à la réhabilitation et à la fermeture des sites d'exploitation miniers; de participer aux négociations et au suivi de l'exécution des contrats passés entre l'Etat et les sociétés minières; de collecter et conserver la documentation sur les substances minérales et les activités minières; de contribuer à la promotion de la transparence dans le secteur minier; et de réaliser toutes les opérations commerciales, industrielles, mobilières, immobilières  et financières qui se rattachent à son objet social ou de nature à favoriser son développement.

Policy: RESOLUTION NO XIV-72 ON THE PROGRAM OF THE EIGHTEENTH GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF LITHUANIA.
Policy_Content: The Program of the eighteenth Government is a nationwide multi-sectoral policy document. Government activities and goals can be implemented in a variety of ways. The Government pledges to follow these principles: (a) making the Government accountability clearer and more accessible to the public, and the involvement of society and its groups in decision-making, open communication and cooperation will add to greater public accountability of the Government; (b) gradual building a continuous and ongoing legislative and deliberative process  providing an opportunity for stakeholders to engage constructively in discussions; (c) wide-ranging and inter-sectoral cooperation between institutions and governmental bodies; (d) commitment to launch long-term policies to strengthen and enhance the country’s reputation; (e) Government priorities take the form of missions, which often span across the competence of several ministries; (f) innovation; (g) focus on cultural heritage and effective cultural heritage management; (h) empowerment of the most vulnerable groups of the population, including risk assessment and protection of jobs and income;  (i) reduction of risk-of-poverty rate to 17% (currently 20.6%) and increase of employment rate to 72.5% (currently 70.7%); (j) equal opportunities for all, adoption of  measures aimed at ensuring gender equality between women and men; and (k) the short-term priority of the Government will undoubtedly be effective management of the COVID-19-induced situation until vaccination in the country reaches the recommended level.

Policy: UAE National Implementation Plan under the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs).
Policy_Content: This National Implementation Plan is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at reducing the risks of persistent organic pollutants to protect the environment and public health from the danger of these pollutants at all stages, from production to transportation, and handling, and then safe disposal in addition to the use of safer alternatives and access to environmentally clean technology. This requires the country to take more measures to implement regulatory obligations and phase out persistent organic pollutants, including (i) development, validation, and study of the use of POPs and verification of legal compliance; (ii) plan and conduct surveys to control the presence or absence of existing POPs bans and restrictions; (iii) conduct control over the prohibited uses of POPs, and practices necessary for their safe disposal by users; (iv) coordination with various research projects related to primary and new persistent organic pollutant issues. The NIP includes measures to reduce the risks from exposure to hazardous chemicals, as well as the need for cooperation with other government agencies, in addition to the industrial sector, the scientific and environmental communities. The identified priorities are (i) developing legislation related to the management of persistent organic pollutants, banned and restricted pesticides, economic and service activities that may release dioxins and furans; (ii) developing the infrastructure to manage persistent organic pollutants; (iii) coordinating with universities and research sectors to carry out scientific studies related to the alternatives to POPs, rehabilitation of contaminated areas, and inventory of dioxin and furan releases; (iv) management of POPs based on the application of best environmental practices and best technologies available in facilities; and (v) conducting training programs on illegal trade, in addition to courses on best environmental practices and best available technologies.

Policy: Regulation on evaluation of levels of substances in ambient air.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation of the Minister of Environment is unifying the rules for assessing air quality. The present Regulation, which is composed of 16 articles and nine Annexes, implements art. 90 point 3 of the Environment Protection Act and establishes: (1) methods and scope of the evaluation of levels of substances in ambient air; (2) requirements for the quality of measurements and other methods of air quality assessment, including mathematical modeling of transport and transformation of substances in the air; (3) upper and lower threshold values for certain substances in ambient air and the permissible frequency for exceeding threshold values; (4) required measurements, divided into continuous and periodic measurements; (5) criteria for the location of the sampling points; (6) minimum number of fixed sampling points; (7) cases when air quality assessment shall be made with individual measuring methods; (8) reference methodology; (9) requirements for documentation regarding justification of the location of measuring points; (10) criteria for the validation of data on substances in ambient air; (11) scope of measurements supporting the assessment of air quality, in particular the scope of the analysis of the chemical composition of dust.

Policy: Guidelines for the management of landfills in Uganda
Policy_Content: These Guidelines are designed to provide a basis for protecting human health and the environment from the adverse effects of landfilling of waste. Policy: Estatutos Sociales de LICONSA S.A.
Policy_Content: Los Estatutos Sociales de LICONSA S.A. regirá sus actividades y también lo hará por lo establecido en las Reglas de Operación del Programa de Abasto Social de Leche, a cargo de la propia empresa. También se regirá por las demás disposiciones legales aplicables. La sociedad LICONSA S.A. tiene por objeto: 1) Coadyuvar, en los términos del artículo anterior, al desarrollo de la autosuficiencia y seguridad alimentaria de la población más necesitada del país, realizando las siguientes actividades: i) La adquisición y enajenación, por cualquier título legal, de leche fresca o en polvo y de otros productos necesarios para su industrialización y la de sus derivados, en plantas propias o de terceros contratadas con los sectores público y privado, así como de complementos alimenticios; ii) El procesamiento, distribución y venta de leche fluida pasteurizada o en polvo y de otros productos lácteos y sus derivados, complementos alimenticios, y otros productos derivados del aprovechamiento de sus procesos industriales, a los sectores urbanos y rurales en pobreza, en establecimientos propios o de terceros, a través de cualquier canal de distribución que se precise en las Reglas de Operación del Programa de Abasto Social de Leche a cargo de la sociedad o en otros programas autorizados; iii) La distribución y venta a precio preferencial de leche líquida, pasteurizada, rehidratada, ultra pasteurizada o en polvo y fortificada, así como de complementos alimenticios, derivados lácteos, u otros productos a través de cualquier canal de distribución y comercialización, a fin de obtener recursos adicionales. 2) La adquisición, renta, obtención de comodato o por cualquier título legal de bienes inmuebles y de bienes muebles, en especial equipo, materiales y materias primas como leche líquida o en polvo, de origen nacional o internacional, que se utilicen para desarrollar las actividades necesarias a fin de lograr el objeto social. 3) La celebración de toda clase de actos, contratos, pedidos y convenios, de cualquier naturaleza, necesarios o convenientes para el cumplimiento del objeto social. 4) Proveer de leche fresca o en polvo a las instituciones gubernamentales con que se convenga.

Policy: Estatutos Sociales de DICONSA S.A.
Policy_Content: El presente Estatuto Social de DICONSA S.A. de C.V. regirá sus actividades y también lo hará por lo establecido en las Reglas de Operación del Programa de Abasto Rural a cargo de la propia empresa; también se regirá por las demás disposiciones legales aplicables. La sociedad DICONSA S.A. tiene por objeto: 1) Coadyuvar, al desarrollo de la autosuficiencia y seguridad alimentaria de la población más necesitada del país; 2) Coadyuvar al fomento del desarrollo económico y social del país, garantizando el abasto de productos básicos y complementarios perecederos y no perecederos a precios competitivos, a fin de que se satisfaga la demanda de la población que se encuentra en situación de pobreza y pobreza extrema, y mediante su participación organizada; 3) Instrumentar la participación antes mencionada, a través de la organización, administración y operación de sucursales y/o unidades operativas, así como de almacenes y puntos de venta destinados a la comercialización de los bienes de consumo necesario para la alimentación de los sectores de la población objetivo; 4) Promover y organizar la participación de la comunidad para propiciar la corresponsabilidad en los Programas a cargo de la empresa; 5) Impulsar la modernización del mercado de los bienes de consumo necesario para la alimentación de los sectores de la población objetivo; 6) Ampliar la cobertura de puntos de venta y almacenes, en la medida en que persistan problemas de competencia en los mercados y particularmente en aquellos lugares en donde exista un punto de venta de LICONSA, en donde no exista presencia alguna de oferta de productos para la atención de la demanda de la población que se encuentra en situación de pobreza y pobreza extrema; 7) Participar con las distintas instituciones de gobierno en programas sociales y políticas públicas de abasto y distribución de productos básicos y complementarios, perecederos y no perecederos y otros bienes de consumo en favor de los beneficiarios, de la población en condición de pobreza, así como para la atención de los grupos más vulnerables, de adultos mayores, de rezago y de marginación y cuando se presenten situaciones de emergencia o desastre; 8) Emitir, suscribir, aceptar, endosar y avalar cualesquiera títulos o valores mobiliarios permitidos por la Ley; 9) Contratar y convenir, activa o pasivamente, toda clase de prestaciones de servicios; adquirir y explotar, por cualquier título, patentes, marcas industriales, nombres comerciales, opciones, preferencias, así como derechos de propiedad literaria, industrial, artística o concesiones de alguna autoridad; 10) Obtener y otorgar, por cualquier título permitido por la Ley, el uso y goce de bienes muebles e inmuebles; 11) Contratar servicios técnicos, consultivos y de asesoría; 12) Adquirir, o por cualquier título poseer y explotar, toda clase de bienes muebles, derechos reales y personales, así como los bienes inmuebles que sean necesarios para su objeto social; 13) Contratar al personal necesario para el cumplimiento de los fines sociales; 14) Llevar a cabo, por cuenta propia o de terceros, servicios de transporte que sean necesarios para el cumplimiento de su objeto, previo el cumplimiento de los requisitos legales correspondientes; 15) Proveer artículos de la Canasta Básica o aquellos que se convengan con instituciones gubernamentales; 16) Recibir donaciones y darles el destino que corresponda, conforme a sus finalidades y objetivos sociales.

Policy_Content: This Revised National Development Plan (PDN) 2018-2022 is adapted to the current context, aiming to prioritize Action Programmes, Public Investment Projects and Development Support Activities that can be carried out until the year 2022, updating the PDN 2018-2022, given the internal and external context, characterized by the reduced availability of financial resources, as well as the risks of Pandemic Covid-19 and the volatility of the price and decrease in oil production, and as a corollary of the mid-term review, maintaining the sense of compliance with the essential goals of the Governance Programme, with the objective of ensuring that the evolution of the real growth rate of non-oil GDP, improving from year to year the indicators of the Human Capital Index (ICH) until 2022 and achieving an improvement in the Gini coefficient, by reducing regional asymmetries.

Policy: Estatuto Orgánico del organismo público descentralizado Seguridad Alimentaria Mexicana (SEGALMEX).
Policy_Content: El presente Estatuto Orgánico del organismo público descentralizado Seguridad Alimentaria Mexicana (SEGALMEX), establece los procedimientos para su funcionamiento y la realización de su objetivo, que es: 1) Favorecer la productividad agroalimentaria y su distribución en beneficio de la población más rezagada del país, a través de acciones tales como: 1. Coordinar la adquisición de productos agroalimentarios a precios de garantía, en favor de los productores y regiones nacionales que tengan mayores carencias económicas o, también, para estimular la reducción de importaciones de productos básicos; 2) Promover la autosuficiencia alimentaria del país; 3) Autorizar la transferencia de recursos para garantizar los precios de garantía a la leche; 4) Adquirir el maíz de pequeños productores y frijol a precios de garantía para atender las necesidades de provisión de la red de abasto; 5)  En los casos de sequía o emergencia que lo ameriten prestar a los campesinos grano apto para la siembra. El pago en especie, por parte de los agricultores, será del mismo monto y calidad a lo recibido y se hará cuando cosechen, al terminar el ciclo agrícola.

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 69/2020 delegating the management and planning of the coastal zone and beaches to the Municipal Council of Maputo City, the matters to be exercised in the territorial area of ​​the Municipality, administration and planning of the coastal zone and beaches, installation of mandatory information systems, authorization of sporting activities , religious, cultural and recreational, policing of the coastal zone and beaches, and protection and safety of bathers.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order delegates the management and planning of the coastal zone and beaches to the Municipal Council of Maputo City, the matters to be exercised in the territorial area of ​​the Municipality, administration and planning of the coastal zone and beaches, installation of mandatory information systems, authorization of sporting activities, religious, cultural and recreational, policing of the coastal zone and beaches, and protection and safety of bathers. The Minister of the Sea, Inland Waters and Fisheries, using the powers defined in Decree No. 97/2020 of 4 November, approving the Regulation for the Management and Planning of the Coastal Zone and Beaches, in conjunction with article 42 of Law No. 14/2011 of 10 August, regulating the Public Administration and establishes the rules for the defense of the rights and interests of individuals, decides to delegate, within the scope of the management and planning of the coastal zone and beaches, to the Municipal Council of Maputo City, the following matters to be exercised in the territorial area of ​​the Municipality: a) Administration and planning of the coastal zone and beaches; b) Installation of mandatory information systems; c) authorization of sporting, cultural and recreational activities; d) Policing the coastal zone and beaches; and e) Protection and safety of bathers. The purpose of this Ministerial Order is to ensure that the Municipal Council of Maputo City ensures that coastal areas and beaches, common use goods of citizens, fulfill their socio-environmental function, complying with the principles of integrated and shared territorial management, of respect diversity and decentralization, as well as rationalization and efficiency of use, promoting the correct use and occupation of the coastal zone and beaches.

Policy: Resolution No. 43/2020 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Labour and Social Security.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Statute of the Ministry of Labour and Social Security. The Statute, consisting of 22 articles divided into four Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Ministry, entitled to perform the following activities: direction, planning, studies, monitoring and control of government action in the field of labour administration and social security. In addition, the Ministry is responsible for ensuring the execution of policies, strategies and economic and social programmes adopted by the Government. In particular, the Ministry has the following duties: a) implementation of labour laws and regulations consistent with the country's socio-economic development process; b) social consultation with a view to better performance and relationship between the social partners and the promotion of legitimate duties, rights and interests of employers and workers; c) prevention and promotion of the extrajudicial resolution of labour conflicts; d) development of work studies programmes; e) management of the labour market information and observation system; f) development and administration of mandatory social security systems; g) participation in regional and international events related to labour and social security.

Policy: Resolución Nº 31 - Crea la Fiscalía Superior Especializada en Asuntos Civiles, Agrarios y de Familia.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea y establece la estructura y funciones de la la Fiscalía Superior Especializada en Asuntos Civiles, Agrarios y de Familia, adscrita a la Procuraduría General de la Nación, con atribuciones en toda la República de Panamá, que ejercerá las siguientes funciones: 1) Defender los intereses del Estado o del Municipio en los procesos civiles y arbitrales, según los casos y representar al Estado en los procesos que se instauren en contra de éste, en la jurisdicción civil o arbitral, privativamente, en el Primer Distrito Judicial; 2) Promover y sostener los procesos civiles o arbitrales necesarios para la defensa de los bienes e intereses del Estado, observando las instrucciones que sobre el particular reciba del Ejecutivo, y representar activamente al Estado en las demandas civiles y arbitrales que contra éste se sigan ante la Corte Suprema de Justicia o tribunales arbitrales, respectivamente; 3) Ejercer las acciones civiles que por delegación o comisión le asigne la Procuraduría General de la Nación destinadas a la defensa de los intereses del Estado; 4) Llevar a cabo todas las acciones tendientes a la consecución de las pruebas pertinentes para una mejor defensa de los intereses de la Nación o del Municipio; 5) Emitir concepto de segunda instancia en representación y defensa de los intereses del Estado en los procesos civiles que conoce el Primer Tribunal Superior del Primer Distrito Judicial; 6) Emitir concepto de segunda instancia, en los procesos que conocen el Tribunal Superior de Familia, y Tribunal Superior de Niñez y Adolescencia; 7) Emitir concepto, previa delegación del Procurador General de la Nación sobre las denuncias de bienes ocultos, según lo dispuesto en el Código Fiscal; 8) Emitir concepto favorable, previa delegación del Procurador General de la Nación, para transigir o someter a arbitraje los asuntos litigiosos en que el Estado sea parte; 9) Coordinar con las distintas Secciones Especializadas en Asuntos Civiles , Agrarios y de Familia a nivel nacional, las acciones a seguir en los procesos civiles en los que el Estado panameño sea el demandante; 10) Compilar toda la información estadística relativa a los procesos que sea de conocimiento de su especialidad a nivel nacional; 11) Proporcionar a requerimiento del Despacho Superior de la Procuraduría General de la Nación, la información estadística centralizada obtenida; 12) Orientar y servir de consejero jurídico a los distintos Despachos de Asuntos Civiles, Agrarios y de Familia que intervengan en procesos civiles en los que tenga interés el Estado; 13) Denunciar la existencia de algún hecho delictivo, cuando así lo advierta, dentro de los procesos en los cuales intervenga.

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment (Amendment No. 2) Regulations, 2020.
Policy_Content: These amending regulations  must be read and construed as one with the Environmental Impact Assessment Regulations (which provide for a high level of protection of the environment and of human health, to contribute to the effective integration of environmental considerations into the permitting procedure for public and private projects, and to ensure that public and private projects which are likely to have significant impact on the environment are adequately assessed before any development consent is granted).   The following regulations of the Environmental Impact Assessment Regulations are amended: sub-regulation (2) of regulation 6 of the principal regulations is amended by changing the possibility to integrate the environmental impact assessment into the development consent procedure (or into any other relevant procedures or binding decisions that may be required to comply with these regulations) into an obligation.  Sub-regulation (6) of regulation 12 of the principal regulations is amended by clarifying the information that the project description statement, made by the Environment and Resources Authority, must indicate. Sub-regulation (5) of regulation 16 is also amended as well as sub-regulation (6), which is modified so as to add a time line for the updating of the information provided to the public in line with sub-regulation (5).  Sub-regulation (2) of regulation 19 of the principal regulations shall be amended in order to add the authorities and entities likely to be concerned by the project by reason of their specific environmental responsibilities among the recipients of the EIA report.  Sub-regulation (3) of regulation 22 is reworded to add a deadline within which the EIA report shall be made available on the Authority’s website. Regulation 23 of the principal regulations shall be amended, in its point 1 as to include the possibility to the applicant and the public to make comments and representations on the Authority assessment on EIA report, and to the include a 15 days deadline for the Authority to make its assessment available on its website. Point 2 will reflect the introduction of the comments received from the public concerned at any stage of the process pursuant to these regulations, and any other environmental considerations that may be relevant, which shall be given due regard by the Authority in preparing and arriving at its final assessment.  Regulation 30 is also slightly reworded as well as regulation 32.  Immediately after regulation 32 a new regulation, 32A, adds that, when providing recommendations following the completion of an environmental impact assessment, the Authority shall duly take into account the comments received from the public.  Also schedule I is reworded.

Policy: Resolution No. 42/2020 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Public Works, Housing and Water Resources.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 26 articles divided into four Chapters, approves the Statute of the Ministry of Public Works, Housing and Water Resources. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Ministry, as a central organ of the State that ensures the realization of the tasks of the Government in the areas of public works, housing, water resources, water supply and sanitation. This Ministry in particular is responsible for: Planning the construction of public works; Monitoring the quality of public and private works, ensure safety, durability and functionality; Inspection of public works; Construction and maintenance of mentioned public infrastructure, namely: water supply, sanitation, retention, protection and water storage systems; Design, execution and supervision of public works; Regulation of the use and quality control of construction material; Promotion of the Construction Industry; Technical assistance in the design, construction and maintenance of public buildings; Implementation of policies and strategies for the rational and sustainable use of water resources, determining needs at the level of the river basin; Management of water resources, ensuring their best rational and sustainable use, as well as for the prevention and mitigation of the impacts of floods and droughts; Management and operation of water infrastructure; Implementation of policies and strategies for the improvement of water supply and sanitation services; Guarantee of universal and equitable access to water supply and sanitation; Ensuring supervision of public water supply and sanitation services.

Policy: Regulation on international projects under contracts/agreements with international partners.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Statute of the environmental protection fund of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, sets the criteria, procedures and manner regarding international projects under contracts and agreements (financial and co-financing, partnership) with international partners, all in relation with strategic European Union goals (article 3). An international project or programme is a set of coordinated activities aimed at achieving designated goals in the field of environmental protection, as well as other areas of the Fund's activities. The implementation is financed/co-financed by European Union and by other international sources and support through other selected forms of cooperation. International partners are entities with which the Fund realizes direct or indirect cooperation on international projects (listed in article 2, point b).

Policy: Ley Nº 21.288 - Crea el fondo de emergencia transitorio Covid-19.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea y regula el fondo de emergencia transitorio Covid-19, el que estará vigente hasta el 30 de junio de 2022. El Fondo estará destinado a financiar, de acuerdo a las disposiciones de esta ley, un programa fiscal por un máximo de $9,72 billones de pesos, equivalentes a $12.000 millones de dólares, con el objeto de solventar todo tipo de gastos para enfrentar los efectos y atender las necesidades derivadas de la crisis sanitaria causada por la enfermedad Covid-19. Los recursos del Fondo se destinarán única y exclusivamente a financiar los objetivos explícitos sintetizados en el documento "Marco de Entendimiento para un Plan de Emergencia por la Protección de los Ingresos de las Familias y la Reactivación Económica y del Empleo" de 14 de Junio de 2020. Se establece además que en la ejecución de los recursos del Fondo se tenderán a priorizar las inversiones o proyectos que consideren tecnologías innovadoras, energías renovables no convencionales, protección del medio ambiente, desarrollo inclusivo, impulso a las empresas de menor tamaño, desarrollo local, o personas en situación de discapacidad o vulnerabilidad social.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1250-VI amending Regional Law No. 1993-IV “On protection of the atmospheric air”.
Policy_Content: Article 3 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Regional Assembly shall have the authority to apply restrictions on the use of petroleum products and other fuel, the combustion of which leads to atmospheric air pollution in the respective territory, as well as encouraging the production of ecologically safe fuels and other energy carriers.” Article 6 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Legal entities and individual entrepreneurs that are owners or in possession on other legal grounds, of facilities used for entrepreneurial activity heated by autonomous heat supply sources, in the presence of technological connection to the heat supply system of a settlement or urban district shall be prohibited to use solid fuels (coal, lignite, firewood) in autonomous heat supply sources during the period from September 15 till May 15 of the calendar year.”

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 012-2020-MINAGRI ─ Formaliza la creación del Programa de Desarrollo Productivo Agrario Rural - AGRO RURAL.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo formaliza la creación del Programa de Desarrollo Productivo Agrario Rural - AGRO RURAL, que tiene como ámbito de intervención a las zonas rurales en el ámbito agrario en territorios de menor grado de desarrollo económico. Las funciones del Programa son: 1) Proponer y ejecutar líneas de intervención orientados al desarrollo agrario rural; 2) Promover el mejoramiento de capacidades productivas e institucionales de los productores agrarios y las productoras agrarias y el acceso de éstos al mercado local, regional y nacional; 3) Formular y ejecutar intervenciones para el aprovechamiento sostenible del recurso hídrico a fin de contribuir con el manejo eficiente con fines agrarios; 4) Contribuir con el aprovechamiento sostenible de los recursos naturales bajo el enfoque territorial, en el marco de las competencias del Ministerio de Desarrollo Agrario y Riego; 5) Contribuir con la competitividad de la producción agraria de los pequeños, las pequeñas, los medianos y medianas productores, a través del fomento de la asociatividad, la adopción de tecnología agraria, entre otros; 6) Articular con los tres niveles de gobierno, acciones alineadas a las políticas y planes sectoriales, con los planes de desarrollo regional y local concertados, según corresponda.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 67/2020 approving the Regulation of the Kimberley Process Management Unit, Precious Metals and Gemstones.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order approves the Regulation of the Kimberley Process Management Unit, Precious Metals and Gemstones (UGKP). The Regulation, consisting of 41 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of this public institution endowed with technical and administrative autonomy, subordinated to the Minister who oversees the area of Mineral Resources, whose object is to define its organic system, functions and operations. This Regulation applies to all Employees and State Agents and Technical Brigades in service at the UGPK and to experts from different sectors that make up the Technical Brigade, pursuant to article 15 of Resolution No. 22/2017 of 24 November. The UGPK's aims at the implementation of the Kimberley Process, namely, the management of technical and administrative procedures for screening, security and control of rough diamonds, within the scope of the Kimberley Process and the commercialization of precious metals and gemstones.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Decree No. 103/2020 revising Decree No. 62/2016 of 26 December, which redefines the attributions and competences of the Mozambican Cereals Institute (ICM).
Policy_Content: This Decree aims at replacing Decree No. 62/2016 of 26 December, which redefines the attributions and competences of the Mozambican Cereals Institute (ICM). ICM is a Category A public legal person, whose object is to develop the value chain of agricultural marketing. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of ICM. In particular, the duties of the ICM, IP are: a) to promote structuring and modernization of the value chain of the agricultural marketing of cereals, legumes and oilseeds with an impact on the development of the agro-industry and on the balance of import/export with production and national consumption; b) the management of infrastructure to support the agricultural marketing value chain; c) the promotion and management of alternative financing solutions for the agricultural marketing and rural trade value chain; d) the promotion, coordination and establishment of strategic reserves of cereals, legumes and oilseeds for food security.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Law No. 148 – ZSO “On ensuring peace and quiet of citizens.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations for ensuring peace and quiet of citizens. Peace and quiet shall be applicable to the following facilities: (a) residential premises, non-residential premises, common premises in apartment buildings, as well as land plots on which these apartment buildings are located; (b) residential buildings and the land plots on which they are located; (c) horticulture and gardening land plots with residential buildings located thereon; and (d) hostels, hotels, hospitals, dispensaries, sanatoria, rest homes, boarding houses, kindergartens, boarding houses for children, the elderly, the disabled and the land plots on which they are located. This Regional Law regulates relations concerning peace and quiet of citizens in night hours (intended from 21 p.m. to 08.00 a.m. local time on workdays from Monday to Thursday inclusive, from 23 p.m. to 10.00 a.m. on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and non-working public holidays established by the federal legislation. The aforesaid offences shall entail administrative proceedings.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Ley Nº 186 - Ley que regula las sociedades de emprendimiento en la República de Panamá.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto crear un nuevo tipo de persona jurídica, denominada sociedad de emprendimiento, a fin de que sea utilizada como el vehículo jurídico que facilite la formalización de empresas en la República de Panamá, mediante un sistema simplificado de registro y otorgando incentivos fiscales a los emprendedores que las crean. La presente Ley será aplicable a todos los emprendimientos que sin ser necesariamente innovadores, representan creaciones de valor o beneficio social y económico a nivel nacional, cuya renta gravable sea producida dentro del territorio de la República de Panamá.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible, en lo relacionado con el Diagnóstico Ambiental de Alternativas y el trámite de licenciamiento ambiental, disponiendo que si el interesado presenta una solicitud de Licencia Ambiental con una alternativa distinta a la elegida en el acto administrativo del Diagnóstico Ambiental de Alternativas, la Autoridad Ambiental no dará trámite a la solicitud de Licencia Ambiental, debiendo el interesado solicitar el inicio de un nuevo trámite de Diagnóstico Ambiental de Alternativas. Policy: Regulation on scopes and content of the report on the assessment of suitability for placing on the market of genetically modified organisms and products consisting of or containing a genetically modified organism or a combination of genetically modified organisms.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as for the purposes of the Croatian Law on genetically modified organisms, prescribes the scope and content of the report on the assessment of suitability for placing on the market of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) and products consisting of or containing GMOs or a combination of GMOs. The report on the assessment of suitability for placing on the market of GMOs and products consisting of or containing GMOs or a combination of GMOs shall state: a) that a specific GMO is suitable for placing on the market; b) that this GMO is suitable for placing on the market and under what conditions; c) of that a specific GMO is not suitable for placing on the market.

Policy: Ley de Modernización a la Ley de Compañías.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de modernización a la Ley de Compañías, considerando que resulta indispensable    viabilizar   el   derecho   de   asociación    con   fines económicos de acuerdo a las tendencias corporativas contemporáneas. A tal fin, también se reconoce a , que podrán constituirse mediante contrato o acto unilateral. Se dispone que las personas jurídicas, con excepción de los bancos, compañías de seguro, capitalización y ahorros, pueden ser socias de las compañías de responsabilidad limitada, en cuyo caso se hará constar, en la nómina de los socios, la denominación o razón social de la persona jurídica asociada. Podrán ser socias de una compañía de responsabilidad limitada las sociedades extranjeras cuyos capitales estuvieren representados únicamente por participaciones, acciones, o partes sociales nominativas, es decir, expedidas o emitidas a favor o a nombre de sus socios, accionistas o miembros, y de ninguna manera al portador.

Policy: Executive Decree No. 297/20 approving the Regulation of the National Directorate for Prevention and Assessment of Environmental Impacts within the Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Environment.
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the National Directorate for Prevention and Assessment of Environmental Impacts within the Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Environment. The Directorate has the following attributions: a) Promote the identification and prevention of the impacts of human activity on the environment; b) Participate in the assessment and management of natural and industrial risks; e) Carry out the assessment of environmental impacts in projects and undertakings of public and private entities; d) Guide and monitor environmental audits and carry out the assessment of environmental impacts in projects and undertakings of public and private entities; e) Proceed with the environmental licensing of projects whose activity significantly interferes with the environment, in accordance with the legislation in force; j) Guide the application of preventive measures aimed at mitigating the risks diagnosed in the assessment of environmental impacts and ensuring the application of technological alternatives; g) Analyze and issue technical opinions on the studies of environmental impacts that are submitted; h) Carry out environmental impact studies and actions to analyze and prevent environmental risks; j) Encourage public consultation on studies of environmental impacts through the participation of civil society and the scientific community; k) Participate in environmental judicial expertise whenever requested, etc.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG853/2020 validating the Regulation on certification of registrars in the field of cadastral activities.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the certification of registrars in the field of cadastral activities establishes the purpose of certification, conditions, terms and procedure for organizing and conducting the certification procedure for registrars in the field of cadastral activities. The purpose of certification of registrars is to determine the level of their professional training, suitability for the position held, verification of risk factors, stimulation of professional development, increasing responsibility in the performance of official duties, ensuring objective promotion. The registrar is subject to attestation once every three years. To receive category of qualification the registrar, upon application, can be certified ahead of schedule. The specified period includes a period of time during which the attested person actually held his position. Certification consists of an assessment of professional skills, results of the activity of the registrar, the level of development and manifestation of professional qualities in accordance with the requirements of the position held. When assessing the professional achievements of the registrar in the process of certification shall be taken into account his/her theoretical knowledge and performance. Work experience is taken into account when assigning a qualification category.

Policy: Oil and Hazardous and Noxious Substances Pollution Preparedness, Response and Co-operation Regulations, 2020
Policy_Content: In its first of thirteen articles, the Regulation sets its purpose as being the establishment of a regulatory framework for the applicability of the OPRC Convention and the OPRC-HNS Protocol, the provision for the applicability of the National Contingency Plan and the provision for the requirement to have in place marine pollution response emergency plans for marine terminals, marine facilities and ports. The Regulation follows with the definitions (article 2) and sets the National Contingency Plan among the Laws of Malta, establishes its field of application (art.3) as well as the National Competent Authority responsible to implement, maintain, update and enforce it ( the Authority for Transport in Malta) (art.4). The Regulation follows detailing the powers (art.5) of the National Competent authority (art.5) as well as its responsibilities for preparing pollution emergency plans for the ports under its jurisdiction, administration, management and control (art.6). Article 7 specifies that, although there may be joint plans between the Authority and operators of marine terminals and operators of marine facilities located within the same port area, each marine terminal and each marine facility shall have their respective separate pollution emergency plan. Article 8 sets the duty to report polluting incidents to the National Competent Authority, laying on every marine terminal operator and marine facility operator and on every ship master. Th Regulation follows with the provision of administrative fees payable with reference to a pollution emergency plan (art.9), offences against the provisions of these regulations and relevant penalties. The Regulation ends clarifying the non exhaustive character of the offences and punishments provided thereof in favour of other laws and regulations concerning pollution and emergencies, which remain applicable.

Policy: Ley  Nº 27.592 – Ley Yolanda.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como objeto garantizar la formación integral en ambiente, con perspectiva de desarrollo sostenible y con especial énfasis en cambio climático para las personas que se desempeñen en la función pública. A tal efecto establece la capacitación obligatoria en la temática ambiental, de conformidad con los lineamientos generales que fijará la autoridad de aplicación. El objetivo principal de la “Ley Yolanda” es que las y los funcionarios y empleados públicos comprendan la transversalidad de los temas ambientales en el diseño, la planificación y la implementación de las políticas públicas para contribuir, desde la gestión estatal, a la construcción de una Argentina ambientalmente sostenible.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 60/2020 approving the Statute of the National Development Agency.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law creates and approves the Statute of the National Development Agency (ADN), as a service that integrates the direct administration of the State. The Statute, consisting of 36 articles divided into seven Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of ADN, aimed at designing, coordinating, executing and evaluating the policy on evaluation, management, monitoring and inspection of development projects.
