Policy: National Development Strategy 1, 2021 to 2025
Policy_Content: Up to this point, the country has implemented several economic blueprints aimed at promoting sustainable economic growth, employment and new wealth creation, national development and poverty alleviation, albeit achieving subpar results. The National Development Strategy 1 (NDS1) is aimed at realising the country's Vision 2030. The objectives of the Strategy include; i. Strengthen macroeconomic stability, characterised by low and stable inflation, as well as exchange rate stability; ii. Achieve and sustain inclusive and equitable Real GDP growth; iii. Promoting new enterprise development, employment and job creation; iv. Strengthen Social Infrastructure and Social Safety nets; v. Ensure sustainable environmental protection and resilience; vi. Promote Good Governance and Corporate Social investment; and vii. To modernise the economy through use of ICT and digital technology. The Strategy identifies its priorities as; Economic Growth and Stability; Food Security and Nutrition; Governance; Moving the Economy up the Value Chain & Structural Transformation; Human Capital Development; Environmental Protection; Climate Resilience and Natural Resource Management; Housing Delivery; ICT and Digital Economy; Health and Well-being; Transport, Infrastructure & Utilities; Image building and International Engagement and Re-engagement; Social Protection; Youth, Sport and Culture and Devolution. The successful implementation of the Strategy is pegged on the the success of other factors, including the global recovery from the  COVID-19 pandemic, local economic recovery on the back of firming international mineral prices and agriculture recovery. The Strategy provides for the mainstreaming of cross cutting issues such as gender, youth, people living with disabilities, arts and creative industry, environment and information communication technology in all thematic working programmes during its implementation. The Strategy involves a Macroeconomic Framework, premised on the e adoption and swift implementation of bold policies and programmes aimed at achieving economic transformation through the creation of a thriving private-sector led, open and competitive economy, with sound macroeconomic policies anchored on fiscal discipline, monetary and financial sector stability, a business friendly environment which promotes both foreign and domestic investment. The macroeconomic objectives for the five year period of the Strategy include; Achieve an average annual real GDP growth rate of above 5%; Maintain fiscal deficits averaging not more than 3% of GDP in line with SADC targets; Achieve and maintain single digit inflation; Increase international reserves to at least 6 months import cover by 2025; Establish a market determined and competitive foreign exchange rate regime; Maintain public and publicly guaranteed external and domestic debt to GDP at below 70% of GDP; Maintain a current account balance of not more than -3% of GDP; Create at least 760,000 formal jobs over the five-year NDS1 period; Improve infrastructure development and investment in energy, water, sanitation, roads, health, education, housing and social amenities; and Accelerate value addition and beneficiation of agriculture and mining production. The macroeconomic policies also targets an increase in agriculture production and productivity by smallholder farmers, in order to ensure food and nutrition security, enhanced income, increased opportunities for value addition and the development of agro-business value chains, among others.

Policy: Order No. KR DSM-193/2020 of the Minister of Public Health validating the Regulation on the procedure for the performance of sanitary and epidemiological monitoring.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for the performance of sanitary and epidemiological monitoring by state organizations of state body in the field of sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population. Sanitary and epidemiological monitoring is a state system of observation of the state of public health and the environment, through the collection, processing, systematization, analysis, evaluation of information and data, and prediction, as well as determining causal relationships between the state of public health and the state of human environment. The purpose of sanitary and epidemiological monitoring shall be to obtain reliable information about influence of environmental factors (chemical, physical, biological, social) on human health, estimate of effectiveness of measures to prevent outbreaks of infectious diseases, professional diseases and other socially significant diseases, and the possibility of forecasting their occurrence. Management and coordination of organizational and methodological, normative and legal, program-technical support of sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population shall be performed by state body in the field of sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population. Data of sanitary and epidemiological monitoring shall be legalized in the form of reports.
Subject: Environment gen., General
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 1046 - Reforma sustancial de la Ley Nº 620, Ley General de Aguas Nacionales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley General de Aguas Nacionales tiene por objeto establecer el marco jurídico institucional para la administración, conservación, desarrollo, uso, aprovechamiento sostenible, equitativo y de preservación en cantidad y calidad de todos los recursos hídricos existentes en el país, sean estos superficiales, subterráneos, residuales y de cualquier otra naturaleza, garantizando a su vez la protección de los demás recursos naturales, los ecosistemas y el ambiente, así como, la regulación, fiscalización y normación del sector de agua potable y saneamiento del país. La presente Ley reconoce el derecho de los Pueblos Originarios y Afrodescendientes de todo el territorio nacional, para el uso y disfrute racional de las aguas que se encuentran dentro de sus tierras comunales.

Policy: Law No. 38/20 approving the Penal Code of Angola.
Policy_Content: This Law approves the Angolan Penal Code. Policy: Executive Order No. 681 on Covid-19 in fur animals.
Policy_Content: This Order, from the Danish Veterinary and Food Administration, lays down provisions for the handling of Covid-19 in fur animals, establishing obligations for owners of fur animals, owners or users of fur animal farms, and veterinarians. It also specifies the powers of the Authority in relation to Covid-19 in fur animals. The Order contains rules on the obligation to report a suspicion of infection; obligations regarding screening; obligations on surveillance; the obligation to adopt Covid-19 infection control plans; powers of supervision in case of suspicion of infection, in case of detection of infection, or based on the geographical proximity to an infected herd; payment of expenses; and penalties. Annex 1 regulates the content of Covid-19 infection control plans. Annex 2 specificies the areas where the insertion or re-insertion of fur animals is not permitted according to article 16.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG815/2020 validating Requirements for quality of apiculture products, including beeswax, propolis, royal jelly and pollen, intended for consumption by the population.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes requirements for the quality of apiculture products, including beeswax, propolis, royal jelly and pollen intended for human consumption, establishes requirements for quality, safety of food, presentation and labeling that must be complied with in the process of production, collection, processing, packaging, storage, transportation and distribution of apiculture products, both domestically produced and imported. This Governmental Decree shall be applicable to apiculture products contained in the Annex and shall not be applicable to apiculture products manufactured in households for home consumption. Quality and safety of apiculture products must ensure compliance with established requirements, food hygiene in the process production, from raw materials to the consumer, also through application of HACCP. Manufacturers of apiculture products provide registration in the certificate of apiaries records of all preventive and curative measures to combat bee diseases. Apiculture products shall be transported by vehicles ensuring proper hygiene and temperature conditions, envisaged by these Requirements. Apiculture products (beeswax, propolis, royal jelly and pollen) intended for consumption by the population, including imported products, may only be placed on the market if they comply with these Requirements.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG817/2020 validating the Regulation on certification of specialists in the field of geodesy, cartography, topographic surveys, geoinformatics, real estate evaluation and cadastre.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for certification of specialists in the field of geodesy, cartography, topographic surveys, geoinformatics, real estate evaluation and cadastre, as well as organization and implementation of activities of certification commissions in the relevant areas. The purpose of certification of specialists in these areas is to determine the level of knowledge of the regulatory and technical base required to perform relevant jobs, their professional skills, stimulation of professional development, as well as increased responsibility in practical activities and identification of risk factors. The certification procedure is organized quarterly. The certification procedure is based on the following principles: (a) objectivity - creating equal conditions for certification for all applicants; (b) impartiality - providing impartial certification based on clearly defined criteria and a unified methodology for assessing the level of competence and assessment of the professional activity of the applicant; (c) transparency - providing all applicants with information about the topic written test and interview, on the procedure for conducting and organizing the procedure of certification, criteria for assessing the professional activity of the applicant; and (d) social justice - an objective assessment of practical knowledge and skills of applicants and their professional training, provision, suspension/revocation of certificates, regardless of nationality, gender, workplaces and their political affiliation or belonging to a particular social group. Information on certification of specialists in this field is published on the official web page of the Agency for Land Relations and Cadastre.

Policy: Regulation on conditions of use and manner of collection of other forest products.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Forest Law (Republika Srpska), determines the conditions of use of other forest products and sets the method of collecting compensation for their use in forests and on forest lands owned by the Republika Srpska. Other forest products (non-wood forest products) are considered to be all biotic products, except forest wood assortments, which can be collected for food or trade, and relate to: wild forest plants, products of animal origin and inanimate products found in forest and on forest land. Other forest products of plant origin include: wild medicinal, edible and aromatic plants, mushrooms, forest fruits, fruits, cones, seeds and leaves of forest trees and shrubs, ornamental shrubs, reeds, juices from forest trees, various plant organs (root, bark, leaves, resin, fruits, pathological growths on trees, fruits and leaves), moss, lichens, grass (hay) from meadows within forests and above forest vegetation. Products of animal origin include: bees and their products in forest trees, snails, leeches, earthworms, snakes (venom, skin, meat). Products of inanimate nature include: blackness, humus and bushes.

Policy: Resolución Nº 399/2020 – Créase el Plan Integral “Casa Común”.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución contiene el nuevo Plan Integral “Casa Común”, que se inserta dentro del Objetivo 11 “Lograr que las ciudades y los asentamientos humanos sean inclusivos, seguros, resilientes y sostenibles” de la Agenda 2030 de Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo Sostenible. El nuevo Plan Integral “Casa Común” obedece a una política de Estado orientada a promover el desarrollo humano integral mediante iniciativas innovadoras de producción y consumo sostenible, concientización, formación y capacitación. Su objetivo general es, en consonancia con la normativa general vigente, promover un desarrollo humano integral que atienda las necesidades de los sectores sociales postergados y vulnerables a partir de iniciativas socio ambientales, a nivel nacional y local, y promoviendo la formación y capacitación en objetivos de sostenibilidad y resiliencia urbana. También se busca alentar nuevas formas de producción y consumo basadas en prácticas solidarias y sostenibles así como aportar a la creación y sostenimiento de empleo orientado a prácticas de sostenibilidad ambiental. Los objetivos que se persiguen de manera específica son: 1) Promover la escala local de producción agroecológica de alimentos mediante la creación de centros de producción y reconversión de cinturones verdes en las Provincias, Municipios y la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires; 2) Impulsar y fortalecer la gestión de residuos sólidos urbanos desde la perspectiva de la Economía Circular; 3) Fortalecer la eficiencia energética a nivel local, mediante provisión de equipo y fortalecimiento de capacidades; 4) Promover el cuidado y la preservación de la biodiversidad a través de la creación, fortalecimiento y recuperación de reservas naturales urbanas y viveros en Municipios, Provincias y Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires; 5) Impulsar la creación de espacios públicos sostenibles, plazas y parques como dispositivo de divulgación y concientización de pautas de economía circular, eficiencia energética, producción comunitaria agroecológica de alimentos y/o preservación de la biodiversidad; 6) Contribuir al fortalecimiento de las capacidades institucionales de gobiernos provinciales y locales en temáticas ambientales mediante la implementación de acciones de sensibilización, educación y capacitación; 7) Contribuir al fortalecimiento de las capacidades institucionales de las Organizaciones de la Sociedad Civil en temáticas ambientales; 8) Generar espacios de participación ciudadana, especialmente orientados a la población joven; 9) Promover y acompañar el desarrollo de proyectos socioambientales por parte de organizaciones de la sociedad civil en diferentes localidades del territorio argentino; 10) Impulsar acciones que apunten a cumplimentar los Objetivos del Desarrollo Sostenible de Naciones Unidas y la normativa ambiental vigente.

Policy: Décret n° 2020-140 du 03 novembre 2020 portant création de l’Observatoire National des Droits de la Femme et de la Fille.
Policy_Content: Ce décret, qui se compose de 43 articles organisés en 5 chapitres, dispose la création d'une institution dénommée Observatoire National des Droits de la Femme et de la Fille (ONDFF), chargée de la défense et de la protection des droits de la femme et de la fille (chapitre I).  Le deuxième chapitre du décret définit le mandat et la mission de l'Observatoire.  Le troisième chapitre, composé par 6 sections, s'occupe de décrire l'organisation et le fonctionnement de l'ONDFF. En particulier, les premier quatre sections sont dédiées à la prévision de la composition, aux fontions et aux fonctionnement des quatre organes dont l'Observatoire est composé: le Conseil National d’Orientation (1ère section); le Bureau de l’Observatoire (2ème section); les commissions spécialisées (3ème section); le Secrétariat Général (4ème section. Les dernières deux sections s'occupent des ressources financières et humaines.  Le quatrième chapitre décrit les dispositions communes aux membres du conseil National d'Orientation et au personnel, qui sont celles concernant le respect du secret professionnel pour les informations, faits, actes et renseignements dont ils ont connaissance dans l'exercice de leurs fonctions.  Le dernier chapitre est dédié aux dispositions finales.

Policy: Decreto Nº 175 - Ley General de Cultura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley General de Cultura, tiene por objeto establecer principios, regulaciones, atribuciones y compromisos del Estado, dirigidos a diseñar y ejecutar una política pública inclusiva y participativa que estimule y salvaguarde las expresiones culturales y los procesos creativos en el país, el patrimonio cultural panameño, el diálogo entre culturas y la cooperación cultural internacional, como medios necesarios para promover el ejercicio de los derechos culturales y el desarrollo sostenible. La presente Ley se estructura en base a un enfoque de derechos humanos, y dispone que el Ministerio de Cultura desarrollará una política cultural que tendrá como objetivo la promoción, protección, garantía y concreción de los derechos culturales de la población. Asimismo,  asume una dimensión cultural del desarrollo sostenible, por lo cual el Estado reconoce a la cultura como un factor fundamental para la consecución de los planes orientados hacia el desarrollo sostenible, y en consecuencia, la incluirá como eje transversal en el diseño y ejecución de las políticas públicas.

Policy: Ministerial Resolution No.228 of 2020 regarding the adoption of the Handbook for Dealing with Biological Waste (Infectious Carriers) - Version 3.
Policy_Content: These updated Guidelines divided into 5 Sections aim at (i) treating and disposing of waste generated during epidemics and pandemics, including adding all new developments of the Covid-19 (therefore, a Section has been added explaining the mechanism for safely handling, treating, and disposing of waste resulting from the treatment of Covid-19, due to its special nature, to ensure the protection and sustainability of the environment); (ii) adding information that serves to enhance the capabilities of dealing with infectious waste to ensure proper and safe management in order to protect human, animal and environmental health (the mechanism for dealing in detail with the contagious waste); and (iii) adding many relevant definitions and information that are compatible with the objectives of the country's strategies for biosecurity and quality of life. Policy: Regulation amending the Regulation determining the compensation fees for forest and forest land.
Policy_Content: This Regulation amends certain provisions part of the Regulation determining the compensation fees for forest and forest land (originally published in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Croatia 12/2020). Changes are regarding several amended and added contents to the article 13 (which provides for the formula for calculation of fees for forest use and forest land for the purpose of establishing of easements). Also a new article (13a) is here added (setting rules on exception to article 13 of this text as follows: the fee for forest land for the purpose of establishing easements for the construction and maintenance of infrastructure, which is established for as long as there is a reasonable purpose for which the easement is established, shall be calculated by a different formula which is provided in new article 13a). Article 3 states that all incomplete procedures for calculating the fee for forest land for the purpose of establishing easements for exploration for the purpose of exploitation of mineral resources and for construction and maintenance of infrastructure, which is established at a time when there is a reasonable purpose for which the easement was established, adopted by the date of entry into force of this text, shall be completed in accordance with the provisions of the same.

Policy: Program to create favorable conditions for the introduction of good agricultural practices in agricultural production of the (International Standard Global G.A.P.).
Policy_Content: Program to create favorable conditions for the introduction of good agricultural practices in agricultural production of the (International Standard Global G.A.P.) is a multi-sectoral nationwide policy document establishing the necessity of adoption of international standards of food security under condition of globalization of economic relations. The basis for the promotion of the International Standard Global G.A.P., considering growth of agricultural exports from Tajikistan, is the possibility of access to alternative markets with high purchasing power. Most shopping centers (supermarkets) of the United States, Europe and Asia are tightening quality and safety requirements for agricultural products and require traceability of their production technology. The Government of the Republic of Tajikistan creates favorable conditions for increasing the competitiveness of domestic products on the internal and external markets, increase the volume of exports and reduce the share of imported products for the development of the agricultural sector.  However, taking into account existing opportunities related to consumers of international markets, to strengthen the development of exports requires adoption of additional measures. One of the unresolved issues of export growth is ensuring the traceability and compliance of agricultural commodities produced in the country with food safety standards. In the highly competitive international markets availability of a certificate of the International Standard Global G.A.P. will allow to confirm the compliance of Tajikistan's products with all food safety requirements, which will contribute to the growth of consumer demand. Resolution of the following task shall be required for the introduction of the International Standard Global G.A.P.: (a) increasing the level of knowledge of producers and involved government agencies related to the requirements of the International Standard Global G.A.P.; (b) assessment and analysis of legislation for compliance with the requirements of International Standard Global G.A.P., taking into account the analysis of existing practices of implementation of the terms and conditions, and requirements (sanitary and hygienic standards, health and safety, protection of the environment, water and soil, industrial waste management and others); (c) development of the national guidelines for interpreting requirements of the International Standard Global G.A.P.; (d) development of incentives for manufacturers planning to introduce the Global G.A.P. standard and producers holding Global G.A.P. certificates, and also producers who are certified to the International Standard Global G.A.P., (as well as HACCP and ISO) or have contracts for certification work; (e) assessment and development of measures to improve the capacity of the national quality infrastructure (development of procedures for Global G.A.P. certification, accreditation of local body and/or accreditation of local laboratories, training of consultants and auditors); and (f) coordination with the Secretariat of the International Standard Global G.A.P. Secretariat to implement the "National G.A.P." program. (Local g.a.p.), including a list of commitments to improve Tajikistan legislation.

Policy: Concept of creation and development of agro-industrial clusters in the Republic of Tajikistan for the period up to 2040.
Policy_Content: Concept of creation and development of agro-industrial clusters in the Republic of Tajikistan for the period up to 2040 is a sectoral policy document, which defines the purpose of creating agro-industrial clusters, institutional, organizational, methodological, administrative basis for their creation and development. The Concept is the basis for the development and implementation of projects for the creation and development of agro-industrial clusters, which are considered as measures to diversify production and manufacturing of competitive agro-industrial products. The scope of this Concept is to form a common understanding of methodology of creation and development of agro-industrial clusters and creation of favorable conditions for the constitution and further development of agro-industrial clusters. The Concept sets forth the following objectives: (a) formation of methodological and legislative grounds for the creation and development of agro-industrial clusters; (b) definition of the priority directions of agro-industrial clusters; (c) creation of conditions for the development and implementation of cluster projects, organizational and methodological assistance in their development and implementation; (d) assistance to organizational and practical work on the creation and development of agro-industrial clusters; (e) promotion of cooperative ties between farms, processing enterprises, research institutions and other organizations in various fields within the unified production programs, characterized by a complete form of the production of agricultural commodities (production of raw materials, processing and production of finished products, storage and trade), innovation processes, quality control programs and other; (f) increasing the innovation activity of entrepreneurs to update production and processing of agrarian products; (g) promoting better interaction between science, education and production, the formation of a system of vocational training, meeting the requirements of agricultural producers; (h) organization and maintenance of the state support system for creation and development of agro-industrial organization and functioning of the state support system for the creation and development of agro-industrial clusters; (i) establishment of coordination between the central bodies and city and district executive bodies and city and local governments; and (j) establishment of coordination between central bodies and executive bodies of the state power of cities and districts and the private sector (producers and suppliers of agricultural commodities and processed goods).

Policy: Décret nº100/091 du 28 octobre 2020 portant révision du Décret n°100/087 du 26 juillet 2018 portant organisation du ministère de l’environnement, de l’agriculture et de l’élevage.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet reviser le Décret n°100/087 du 26 juillet 2018 portant organisation du ministère de l’environnement, de l’agriculture et de l’élevage. Il fixe aussi l'organisation et attributions du Ministère. Conformément au présent document, le Ministère de l'environnement, l'agriculture et l'élevage a pour mission, notamment: planifier, coordonner et exécuter la politique nationale en matière d'environnement, d'agriculture, d' élevage, de l'eau et des terres; - mettre en place la politique d'augmenter la production agricole servant de matière premiere pour alimenter les industries agroalimentaires existantes et inciter la création de nouvelles industries; mener les réformes nécessaires au sein des institutions de recherche pour qu'elles soient des outils de prise de décisions et de planification des campagnes agricoles; élaborer les stratégies appropriées a même de conduire le secteur de l'eau vers les Objectifs du Développement Durable; réguler et suivre le fonctionnement des filières agroalimentaires ;  veiller a la sécurité alimentaire de la population par la promotion des cultures vivrières et des productions animales; élaborer et mettre en oeuvre la politique nationale en matière d'aménagement des marais, de protection et de fertilisation des sols; promouvoir la conservation, le stockage et la transformation des produits agricoles et d'élevage; concevoir et exécuter la politique nationale en matière de l 'environnement, en veillant a la protection et a la conservation des ressources naturelles; élaborer et mettre en oeuvre, en collaboration avec les ministères concernés, la politique nationale de lutte antiérosive ; concevoir et exécuter la politique nationale en matière d'assainissement et de lutte contre la pollution industrielle en collaboration avec les autres services concernés; élaborer et vulgariser un programme national en matière d'éducation environnementale; mettre en place des politiques d'adaptation aux changements climatiques en collaboration avec les autres services techniques concernés; gérer et aménager les forets naturelles et domaniales; créer et aménager les aires protégées, y compris les parcs nationaux et les réserves naturelles; décider de la vocation des terres domaniales urbaines et semi urbaines et de leur affection en suivant les orientations des schémas directeurs d'aménagement du territoire; concevoir la politique du Ministère en matière de la bonne gouvernance; et élaborer et assurer le suivi des projets d'investissement du Ministère.

Policy: Décret n°2020‐2061 du 27 octobre 2020 fixant les modalités d’application de la loi n°2019‐03 du 1er février 2019 portant Code pétrolier.
Policy_Content: Le	 présent	 décret	 fixe	 les	 modalités	 d’application	 de	 la	 loi	 n°2019‐03	 du	 1er février	2019	portant	Code	pétrolier. Notamment, il fixe l'octroi d'autorisations de prospection d’hydrocarbures; l'octroi d'autorisation d’exploration d’hydrocarbures; et la demande d'autorisations d'exploitation d'hydrocarbures. La	 demande	 d’autorisation	 ainsi	 que	 les	 dossiers	 y	 relatifs,	 constitués	 en	 cinq	exemplaires	originaux,	sont	déposés	auprès	du	Ministre	chargé	des	Hydrocarbures.	 Le	 titulaire	 d’une	 autorisation	 d’exploration	 d’hydrocarbures	 peut	 demander	 l’autorisation	d’exploiter	à	titre	provisoire	pour	une	période	maximale	de	six	mois,	une découverte	 d’hydrocarbures	 pour	 laquelle	 des	 essais	 de	 production	 ont	 déjà	 été	 effectués. De même, le document règle la cession, transfert, transmission, suspension, renonciation et retrait des titres miniers d’hydrocarbures et des contrats pétroliers dans le titre 8; et l'autorisation de transport, de liquéfaction du gaz naturel et de stockage des hydrocarbures dans le chapitre 9.  Enfin, il établit un système de surveillance administrative et technique et contrôle de la sécurité des opérations pétrolières.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 282/20 approving the Hydrocarbon Exploration Strategy from 2020 to 2025.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Hydrocarbon Exploration Strategy in Angola from 2020 to 2025. This Strategy is in line with one of the objectives of the National Development Plan 2018-2022 and which envisages boosting and intensifying the replacement of reserves, aiming to mitigate the decline in hydrocarbon production, and ensuring the development of an intense exploration activity. In addition, it aims at ensuring the allocation of oil concessions, materializing in the availability and accessibility to the areas that constitute the sedimentary basins of Angola for research and evaluation activities, in the expansion of geological knowledge and in the access to oil and natural gas resources. It also aims at ensuring the successful execution of the general strategy of attribution of oil concessions in Angola, in the intensification of research and evaluation in concessions and free areas in all the sedimentary basins of Angola, all with the purpose of expanding the geological knowledge of the country and its oil potential, including unconventional reservoirs, to foster competition in the Oil Industry and Risk Investment, from promote direct investment in the National Petroleum Industry by disseminating knowledge, technological innovation and universally accepted governance practices, and the National Concessionaire must create mechanisms aimed at the acquisition of seismic data that will allow the realization of joint studies with oil companies and universities.

Policy: Patents and Companies Registration Agency Act, No. 4 of 2020
Policy_Content: The Act repeals the Patents and Companies Registration Act, 2010. It continues with the already established Patents and Companies Registration Agency established under the repealed act. The Agency is established as a body corporate with legal personality. The functions of the Agency are to; (a) administer the Trade Marks Act, the Copyright and Performance Rights Act, the Companies (Certificates Validation)Act, the Registration of Business Names Act, the Moveable Property (Security Interests) Act, the Layout-designs of Integrated Circuits Act, the Protection of Traditional Knowledge, Genetic Resources and Expressions of Folklore Act, the Industrial Designs Act, 2016, the Patents Act, the Corporate Insolvency Act, and the Companies Act; (b) receive and investigate any complaint of alleged or suspected breach of this Act or the Acts referred to in paragraph (a) and, subject to the directives of the Director of Public Prosecutions, prosecute offences under those Acts; (c) collect, collate and disseminate information on the law relating to the Acts referred to in paragraph (a), among others. The Agency is empowered to determine and levy fees with respect to the Act. The Act provides for Board which shall perform the following functions, among other things; (a) promote good governance of the Agency; (b) formulate the policies, programmes and strategies of the Agency; (c) approve the annual work plan and activity reports of the Agency;(d) approve the annual budget estimates and financial statements of the Agency; and (e) monitor and evaluate the performance of the Agency against budgets and plans.

Policy: Arrêté interministériel du 9 Rabie El Aouel 1442 correspondant au 26 octobre 2020 fixant les modalités de suivi et d’évaluation du compte d'affectation spécial n° 302-065 intitulé « Fonds national de l'environnement et du littoral ».
Policy_Content: En application des dispositions de l'article 4 du décret exécutif n° 20- 157 du 16 Chaoual 1441 correspondant au 8 juin 2020 susvisé, le présent arrêté a pour objet de fixer les modalités de suivi et d'évaluation du compte d'affectation spéciale n° 302-065 intitulé « Fonds national de l'environnement et du littoral ».  Il est institué auprès du ministre chargé de l'environnement, dans la limite de ses attributions, un comité de suivi et d'évaluation chargé : d'examiner le programme d'action ; d'arrêter la liste des projets à financer ;  de se prononcer sur la priorité des actions à financer ; d'établir un bilan annuel. Le comité de suivi et d'évaluation est composé de membres représentants les différentes directions de l'administration centrale. Le comité est assisté, dans ses missions, par un secrétariat chargé de dresser les procès-verbaux des réunions tenues de ce comité. Les modalités de fonctionnement du comité ainsi que la nomination de ses membres sont fixées par décision du ministre chargé de l’environnement.

Policy: Ley Nº 9907 - Modifica la Ley Nº 8488, Ley nacional de emergencias y prevención del riesgo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la Ley nacional de emergencias y prevención del riesgo, respecto a a la destinación exclusiva del tres por ciento (3%) del superávit presupuestario libre, al fortalecimiento de la capacidad técnica y los procesos municipales en gestión del riesgo, a la prevención y la atención de emergencias, incluidas aquellas no amparadas a un decreto de emergencia. Las municipalidades crearán un fondo propio para estos mismos efectos y los recursos de este fondo se regirán por los principios de presupuestación plurianual y por tanto lo que no ejecuten al final de cada ejercicio económico no se constituirá en superávit.

Policy: Arrêté interministériel du 8 Rabie El Aouel 1442 correspondant au 25 octobre 2020 fixant la nomenclature des recettes et des dépenses du compte d'affectation spéciale n° 302-065 intitulé « Fonds national de l'environnement et du littoral ».
Policy_Content: En application des dispositions de l'article 3 du décret exécutif n° 20-157 du 16 Chaoual 1441 correspondant au 8 juin 2020 susvisé, le présent arrêté a pour objet de fixer la nomenclature des recettes et des dépenses du compte d'affectation spéciale n° 302-065 intitulé « Fonds national de l'environnement et du littoral ». Conformément aux dispositions de l'article 3 du décret exécutif n° 20-157 du 16 Chaoual 1440 correspondant au 8 juin 2020 susvisé, le Fonds national de l'environnement et du littoral a pour recettes, pour l'environnement et littoral: la taxe sur les activités polluantes ou dangereuses pour l'environnement; les taxes spécifiques fixées par les lois de finances; le produit des amendes perçues au titre des infractions à la législation relative à la protection de l’environnement; les dons et legs nationaux et internationaux; les indemnisations au titre des dépenses pour la lutte contre les pollutions accidentelles occasionnées par des déversements de substances chimiques dangereuses dans la mer, dans le domaine hydraulique et des nappes souterraines, dans le sol et dans l’atmosphère; les dotations éventuelles du budget de l'Etat; et toute autres contributions ou ressources.

Policy: Environmental Management and Climate Change Act No. 34 of 2020.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules for environmental management and protection and climate change, with a focus on sustainable use and development of natural resources, sustainable use and management of land and water, environmental impact assessment, pollution control, management of hazardous and ozone depleting substances, waste management, access and benefit-sharing, food security, coastal zone management, biodiversity management and conservation, conservation of endangered species, resilience to the impacts of climate change, disaster risk management, and public participation in the decision-making processes in the fields of environmental management and protection. The Secretary shall be responsible for the implementation of this Act and submit an annual report to the Minister. The Environmental Conventions and Protocols which Nauru is a party to are listed under Schedule 1 and this Act sets forth provisions in accordance with these conventions and protocols. An Environmental Impact Assessment Committee shall be established for monitoring the development projects. The application for permit for biodiversity prospecting and access shall be evaluated by the Committee. This Act sets forth measures for pollution control and waste management related to water pollution, emission, and discharge of hazardous wastes, chemicals, and oil into the environment. Climate change strategies shall be implemented to protect water resources, coastal areas, land, biodiversity, fisheries and public infrastructure. A Climate Change and Environment Protection Fund shall be established for the conservation of the reef and foreshore, protection of flora and fauna, prevention of coastal erosion, food security, health, soil conservation, ecosystem preservation and pollution control. Furthermore, this Act sets out offences including non-compliance with conditions of permit, offences against authorised officers, and related penalties. To this end, an authorised officer may issue an environmental offence fixed penalty notice on a person who contravenes this Act. The Minister may make an emergency order where a situation poses a serious threat or risk to the environment, in consistency with the National Disaster Risk Management Act 2016.

Policy: Food Reserve Act, No 6 of 2020
Policy_Content: This repeals the Food Reserve Act of 1995 and essentially continues the already established Food Reserve Agency as a legal entity. The Agency functions to market and trade a designated agricultural commodity. Other functions of the agency include; to purchase, import, sell, trade or export a designated agricultural commodity; to establish, manage, lease, and maintain a storage facility and equipment to be used in relation to a designated agricultural commodity; to collect information related to the marketing of a designated agricultural commodity; and to advise the Minister on matters relating to the National Strategic Food Reserve. The Act provides for the constitution of the board of the agency, its administration and constitution. The board is to have representation for among others, small scale farmers, large scale farmers, millers, grain traders, and ministerial representatives for agriculture, fisheries and livestock, finance, commerce, trade and industry. The Act continues the already established National Strategic Food Reserve  and states its purpose as including to; maintain the type and quantity of a designated agricultural commodity as determined by the Agency; ensure a reliable supply of a designated agricultural commodity for the country; meet local shortfalls in the supply of a designated agricultural commodity; meet a food emergency caused by drought, flood or by other natural disaster, for the purposes of this Act, that may be declared by the President; and correct problems relating to the supply of a designated agricultural commodity arising from the manipulation of prices ormonopolistic trading practices. The Act also creates certain roles for the Minister with regards to the National Strategic Food Reserve, including, to approve the quantity of a designated agricultural commodity to be maintained in, sold, traded or issued from the Food Reserve, to cause the collection of data for the purposes of national food security, to cause the preparation of the National Food Balance Sheet, to cause the inspection and verification of stock levels of designated agricultural commodities, among other roles. The standard expected of the Agency in handling a designated agricultural commodity is that of quality, condition, quantity and grade, in accordance with the Zambia Bureau of Standards.

Policy: Government Resolution No. 42/2020 on the National Water Resources Management Policy.
Policy_Content: This Government Resolution approves the National Water Resources Management Policy. This Policy defines the Government's responsibilities, intentions, objectives and strategies for the management of National water resources. It provides a general framework and an action guideline for National water resources management policy until 2030. It is a guidance and information policy for public authorities, water resources managers and all stakeholders involved in drafting and implementing legislation, regulations, policies, strategies, plans and actions for the management of water resources in the Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste. Procedures for issuing water-use certificates should ensure equitable access for women and vulnerable households to water, without prejudice to the constraints on the amount of water available, with the main objective of supporting and strengthening their involvement in agriculture, fisheries, industry, commerce or other economic activities related to water.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 701 validating the Regulation on the Ministry on Emergencies.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the Ministry on Emergencies is the central executive body of the Republic of Kazakhstan in charge of emergency prevention and response in the spheres of natural and manmade emergencies, civil defense, fire and industrial safety, formation and development of the state material reserve, ensuring the functioning and further development of the state system of civil protection, organization of prevention and extinguishing fires. The Ministry has departments: (a) Committee for Civil Defense and Military Units; (b) Committee of Firefighting Service; (c) Committee on State Material Reserves; and (d) Committee of Industrial Safety. The Ministry shall perform the following functions: (a) elaborates and implements state policy in the field of civil defense; (b) elaborates action plans for liquidation of emergencies o global and regional scale; (c) performs early warning system of the population in the area of outbreak of emergencies; (d) develops standards of minimum life support of the population in the area of emergency situations; (e) organizes monitoring of mudflow and avalanche situation; (f) validates safety regulations for waterbodies; (g) validates the rules for the investigation of accidents, disasters, catastrophes leading to emergencies; and (h) validates rules of fire extinguishment.

Policy: Regional Law No. 96-oz “On regulation of some issues in the field of forest relations.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits the powers of the regional state bodies in the field of forestry relations and determines the sources of financial support for the exercise of powers in the field of forestry. Regional Government shall have the following powers in the field of forest relations: (a) adoption, within the limits of its competence, of normative legal acts in the field of forestry relations; (b) formation of the regional executive bodies in the field of forest relations, assignment of powers and functions thereto; (c) possession, use, disposal of forest plots pertaining to the regional ownership; (d) decision-making on classification of forests as forest parks and green areas; (e) determination of functional zones in forest parks, in which forests are located, the establishment and change of the area and boundaries of land under forest parks and green areas; (f) price setting for timber extraction in public forests and registration of extracted timber; (g) organization and performance of forest fires prevention arrangements; (h) allotment of forest plots located within the boundaries of land of forest fund, for permanent (unlimited) use, rent, free use; (i) conclusion of purchase and sale contracts applicable to forest species located on the land of forest fund; and (j) establishment of servitude, public servitude in relation to forest plots located within the boundaries of forest land.

Policy: Decree No. 10.527 creating the Social Biofuel Seal and providing for the reduction coefficients for the Contribution to the Social Integration Programme and to the Civil Servant Heritage Formation Programme and the Social Contribution for Social Security Financing, incident on production and in the sale of biodiesel, and on the terms and conditions for the use of differentiated rates.
Policy_Content: This Decree creates the Social Biofuel Seal and provides for the reduction of the Contribution to the Social Integration Programme and to the Civil Servant Heritage Formation Programme - PIS/Pasep and the Social Contribution for Social Security Financing - Cofins. The Social Biofuel Seal will be awarded to the biodiesel producer that: I - promote the productive inclusion of family farmers who are included in the National Programme for Strengthening Family Agriculture - Pronaf and who supply them with raw materials; and II - prove fiscal regularity with the Unified Registration System for Suppliers - Sicaf. The biodiesel producer must: I - purchase the raw material for the national production of biodiesel from family farming, in a portion equal to or greater than the percentage to be established by the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply; II - sign, in advance, contracts for the acquisition of raw material from family farming, specifying the commercial conditions that guarantee family farmers, at least, the minimum prices established in the Price Guarantee Programme for Family Farming, referred to in the Decree No. 5.996 of 20 December 2006, in accordance with the requirements to be established by the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply; and III - ensure technical assistance and training to family farmers.

Policy_Content: National Program for the Development of Apiculture in the Republic of Moldova for 2021-2025 is a nationwide policy document aimed at the development of apiculture and, in particular, obtaining not only the basic product, honey, also a number of byproducts with added value: pollen granules, propolis, royal jelly, bee venom, and increasing export of the aforesaid products. As a result of the measures taken, beekeepers recognized changes in development of the apiculture sector and realized some of the opportunities for performing apiculture activities. As a result, over the past 10 years, the official number of bee colonies in the Republic of Moldova slowly but steadily increases. Policy: Energy Efficiency Act.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down measures for the promotion of energy efficiency, measures for increasing the efficient use of energy and measures for improving the energy efficiency of buildings or facilities. This Act also determines the competencies of the bodies performing tasks under this Act and the implementation of the state policy in the field of energy efficiency. This Act transposes several related directives of the European Union into the legal order of the Republic of Slovenia (article 2). The objectives in the field of energy efficiency and energy efficiency are in particular: reduction of energy use; efficient use of energy; increasing energy efficiency; security of energy supply; efficient energy conversion; transition to a climate-neutral society using low-carbon energy technologies; provision of energy services; ensuring the quality of the internal environment in buildings; raising the awareness of end customers about the benefits of greater energy efficiency, energy consumption and the energy efficiency of their facilities; increasing the energy efficiency of all stakeholders, especially the public sector; ensuring social cohesion; protection of consumers as final consumers of energy. When adopting policies, strategies, programs, plans and legal acts, the state and the local community shall also take into account energy efficiency objectives and, in accordance with their competencies, promote activities to increase energy efficiency. The Eco Fund, the Slovenian Environmental Public Fund established by the legislation governing environmental protection, shall prepare and implement a programme for the improvement of energy efficiency at the state level. The Eco Fund grants financial incentives under this Act on the basis of an approved programme for the improvement of energy efficiency and in accordance with the procedure laid down by the above mentioned Act governing environmental protection. The promotion of energy efficiency measures shall be carried out with the aim of reducing energy consumption, indirectly increasing the quantity and share of renewable energy sources, increasing security of energy supply, reducing import dependence on energy supply and for other energy reasons specified in strategic documents and deriving action plans. Chapter VIII provides for inspection rules and provisions. Chapter IX sets out related criminal provisions.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Resolution No. HCC02/2020 of the Council for Competition validating the Regulation on the assessment of state aid for regional development.
Policy_Content: This Resolution is applied by the Competition Council when assessing state aid for regional development in relation to investments provided to large, small and medium enterprises, state aid for urban development and, in some exceptional cases, state aid for regional development for operating activities. State aid for regional development is provided in order to support economic development and creating new jobs in some regions. The purpose of this Resolution is to provide the necessary regulatory framework for effective assessment of state aid measures for regional development.  Provision of state aid for regional development for investment is justified by the need to support regional development by supporting investment and job creation by expanding and diversifying economic activities. This Regulation does not apply to the provision of state aid in shipbuilding, coal mining, synthetic fibers, transport and related infrastructure, production and distribution of energy and infrastructure therefor, as well as to agriculture (which is regulated by separate legal instruments). State aid for regional development cannot be provided to enterprises that find themselves in a difficult situation. The enterprise is considered to be in difficult situation when it cannot, at the expense of its own financial resources, nor from the resources that it can obtain from the owners/shareholders or creditors to cover losses.

Policy: Decision on the development of strategic environmental assessment of the Spatial Plan of Montenegro.
Policy_Content: This Decisions sets the terms for the preparation of the Strategic Environmental Assessment of the Spatial Plan of Montenegro. The plan determines the need and obligation for harmonization of current and development plans with strategy at the state level (National Strategy for Sustainable Development until 2030, Energy Development Strategy, Transport Development Strategy, Undersea Oil and Gas Exploration, Water Management Basis of Montenegro, Tourism Development Strategy until 2020), with plans and international development documents related to the Mediterranean region and Southeast Europe, as well as the obligation to harmonize and connect national technical systems with such systems in neighboring countries as well as the wider international environment. The plan is made for the entire territory of Montenegro and represents a general basis for spatial organization and arrangement of Montenegro. The plan must provide a strategic framework for the general spatial development of Montenegro until the year 2040, and it has to create clearly defined corridors along which sectoral planning must move. A report on the strategic impact assessment will be prepared on the performed environmental strategic assessment, as in accordance with the provisions of article 15 of the Montenegrin Law on strategic environmental impact assessment (Official Gazette of Montenegro 80/2005, and 59/2011). The report should give special attention to the identification of negative impacts, prescribing protection measures and recommendations for consideration and selection of the best variant solution, and in particular it should prescribe guidelines that will relate to the conservation of biodiversity, water, sea, air, land, space, as well as preserving the value of other natural resources.

Policy_Content: The Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability Towards a Toxic-Free Environment is a regional policy concerning the Member States of European Union. Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1657 validating the Unified requirements for processing, recycling, treatment and disposal of solid municipal waste.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes the Unified requirements for processing, recycling, treatment and disposal of solid municipal waste, including selection of location of waste disposal sites, use of materials and technological solutions. The Unified requirements are set with the consideration of chemical, physical and biochemical factors of environmental impact. When choosing technological solutions for processing and recycling facilities, treatment, disposal of solid municipal waste and combinations of these technological solutions should be ensured their priority in the following sequence: (a) treatment of municipal solid waste in order to separate from the composition of solid municipal wastes types of waste suitable for further disposal; (b) utilization of types of waste separated from municipal solid waste during processing of solid municipal waste, using its material resource potential; (c) utilization of types of waste separated from municipal solid waste during processing of solid municipal waste, using its energy resource potential; (d) treatment of municipal solid waste; and (e) disposal of municipal solid waste.

Policy: Zanzibar Development Vision 2050.
Policy_Content: This Zanzibar Development Vision 2050 (ZDV50) is a long-term national development plan formulated to guide Zanzibar’s overall development agenda from the year 2020 to 2050. It serves as a successor plan to Vision 2020 and has the overall aspiration of lifting Zanzibar economically and socially to attain Upper-Middle Income Status by 2050 by prioritizing inclusive and pro-poor policies that target wide-reaching strategic considerations of the economic, social, political and environmental dimensions. The Vision is shaped by the following four pillars (1) economic transformation of Zanzibar’s productive capabilities through economic modernization and diversification; (2) human capital and social services that it is healthy, competitive, innovative and productive; (3) infrastructural linkages and provision of modern, high quality, accessible and reliable infrastructure within and across homes and settlements; and (4) governance and resilience. Each pillar is subdivided into different priority areas, reflecting the layers of Zanzibar’s economy and society. Every priority area in turn consists of aspirations for the next 30 years and targeted performance indicators.

Policy: National Action Plan for Combating Antibiotic-Resistant Bacteria 2020-2025
Policy_Content: The National Action Plan for Combating Antibiotic-Resistant Bacteria 2020-2025 is a national cross-sectoral action plan of the United States of America. This Plan continues to prioritize infection prevention and control to slow the spread of resistant infections and reduce the need for antibiotic use. To ensure that patients receive the right antibiotic care, the Plan supports innovative approaches to developing and deploying diagnostic tests and treatment strategies. A One Health approach, which recognizes the relationships between the health of humans, animals, plants, and the environment, is integrated throughout the Plan, with an expanded effort to understand antibiotic resistance in the environment. The Plan also focuses on collecting and using data to better understand where resistance is occurring, support the development of new diagnostics and treatment options, and advance international coordination.

También comprende las responsabilidades e intervenciones de las fuentes y los proveedores de datos requeridos en la producción de las estadísticas agrarias, y de los usuarios de la información estadística para la planificación de la producción agraria. La implementación de las disposiciones previstas en el presente Reglamento recaen en las entidades involucradas que cumplen los roles siguientes: 1) Fuentes y proveedoras de datos: Ministerio de Agricultura y Riego (MINAGRI) y sus Órganos Públicos Adscritos, Agrobanco, Junta de usuarios, productores agropecuarios, Registro Nacional de Identificación y Estado Civil, (RENIEC), Comisión Nacional de Investigación y Desarrollo Aeroespacial (CONIDA); 2) Productores y difusores de información estadística agraria: MINAGRI, Servicio Nacional Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre (SERFOR), Oficinas de estadística agraria de los gobiernos regionales y gobiernos locales y Presidencia del Consejo de Ministros, a través de la Secretaría de Gobierno Digital. La finalidad del Reglamento es fortalecer la transferencia de la información estadística agraria, asegurando la calidad, accesibilidad y disponibilidad de las estadísticas agrarias actualizada para los diferentes actores del Sector Agrario.

The status of international company may be granted in any of the following cases to a Georgian enterprise: (a) which has at least two years experience in carrying out the permitted activities referred to in Annex 2 of this Ordinance, on the basis of which it applies to obtain the status; (b) which is a representative of a non-resident enterprise in Georgia, if the non-resident enterprise has at least two years experience in the permitted activities provided for by Annex 2 to this Ordinance, which are carried out by a Georgian enterprise and on the basis of which it applies to obtain the status; and (c) of which more than 50% of shares are owned by partner enterprises independently (each partner separately), and which has at least two years of experience in the permitted activities provided for by Annex 2 to this Resolution, which are carried out by a Georgian enterprise and on the basis of which it applies to obtain the status.

Policy: GGovernmental Decree No. 1614 validating Forest fire safety regulation.
Policy_Content: Forest fire safety regulation establishes uniform requirements for forest fire safety measures depending on the purpose of land and forests and ensuring fire safety in forests in the process of management, guardianship, protection, reforestation and other activities in forests, and during stay of citizens in forests, and are also mandatory for state executive bodies, local government, legal persons and natural persons. Fire safety rules in forests for each forest district are established by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment of the Russian Federation. Fire safety measures in the forests include: (a) prevention of forest fires (firefighting arrangement in forests and providing means of forest fire prevention and extinguishing); (b) monitoring of fire danger in forests and forest fires; (c) development and approval of forest fire extinguishing plans; and (d) other measures of fire safety in forests. From the day of snow melting until stable rainy autumn weather or the formation of snow cover in forests is prohibited: (a) to use open fire (bonfires, soldering lamps, primroses, braziers, fryers); (b) to throw burning matches, cigarette butts and hot ashes from smoking tubes, glass (glass bottles, cans, etc.); (c) to use for hunting wads made of combustible (capable of self-ignition, and also ignite when exposed to an ignition source and autonomously burn after removing them) or smoldering materials; (d) leave oiled or soaked in gasoline, kerosene or other combustible materials (paper, fabric, bag, cotton, etc.) and combustible substances in places not specifically designated for this purpose; (e) to fill the fuel tanks of internal combustion engines with combustible fuel when motor is in operation, use machines with a faulty system powering engine, as well as smoke or use open fire near the cars, fueled with combustibles; and (f) to work with open fire on peatlands. It is prohibited to litter the forest with industrial and domestic waste.

Policy: Ley Nº 31051 - Ley que amplía las medidas de protección laboral para mujeres gestantes y madres lactantes en casos de emergencia nacional sanitaria.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley que amplía las medidas de protección laboral para mujeres gestantes y madres lactantes en casos de emergencia nacional sanitaria, modificando el objeto de la Ley de protección a favor de la mujer gestante que realiza labores que pongan en riesgo su salud y/o el desarrollo normal del embrión y el feto, en los siguientes términos: “En los centros de trabajo las mujeres gestantes solicitarán al empleador no realizar labores que pongan en peligro su salud y/o la del desarrollo normal del embrión y el feto durante el período de gestación, el cual debe estar certificado por el médico tratante. El empleador después de tomar conocimiento de lo solicitado asignará a la mujer gestante labores que no pongan en riesgo la salud y/o desarrollo normal del embrión y el feto durante el período de gestación, sin afectar sus derechos laborales. Durante la vigencia del estado de emergencia nacional de carácter sanitario declarada por el Estado, el empleador identifica a las trabajadoras mujeres gestantes y madres lactantes cuya integridad o la de su menor hijo/a son puestas en riesgo por las circunstancias que propiciaron el estado de excepción decretado, a efectos de aplicar de forma obligatoria el trabajo remoto para el cumplimiento de sus actividades laborales. Cuando la naturaleza de las labores no sea compatible con el trabajo remoto y mientras dure la emergencia sanitaria, el empleador asigna a las mujeres gestantes y madres lactantes labores compatibles con las funciones que originalmente realizaban, o en su defecto otorga preferentemente licencia con goce de haber sujeta a compensación posterior”.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1330 - Modifica el Decreto Nº 1071, Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo Agropecuario, Pesquero y de Desarrollo Rural, en lo relacionado con el Subsidio Integral de Acceso a Tierras (SIAT).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo Agropecuario, Pesquero y de Desarrollo Rural, en lo relacionado con el Subsidio Integral de Acceso a Tierras, con el objeto reglamentar la operación del Subsidio Integral de Acceso a Tierras, previsto Decreto Ley Nº 902 de 2017. El Subsidio Integral de Acceso a Tierras (SIAT), se compone de cuatro asignaciones referidas a: 1) El valor del predio por adquirir; 2) El monto de los gastos notariales y de registro; 3) Los gastos de subdivisión del bien, en los casos que proceda; 4) El proyecto productivo. Policy: Order No. 2-dp of the Ministry of Agriculture, Food Industry and Amelioration validating some regulatory legal acts in the field of agricultural organic production.
Policy_Content: Rules for the transition from traditional agricultural production to organic farming determine the procedure for the transition from traditional agricultural production to organic farming. Organic crop production shall be intended production of agricultural crops, using soil cultivation methods aimed at preserving its natural fertility, using special crop rotations with cultivation of legumes and other green manure crops, using organic fertilizers that have passed the stage of composting or anaerobic fermentation, and also without the use of synthetic fertilizers, pesticides and plant growth regulators. Organic animal husbandry shall be intended raising breeds or livestock species obtained from parents bred in organic production or past the transition period during which the rules were applied to organic production capable of adapting to local conditions, resistant to disease. Transition period (conversion) shall be intended the period of time required for transition to an organic way of farming, during which shall be applicable requirements set for organic production. Traditional agricultural production shall be intended activities for production of agricultural commodities, without differentiation into organic and non-organic agricultural commodities. The transition period can only begin after the premises of the production units are put into the control system and after it has started to execute these Rules and requirements for organic agricultural production in accordance with the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic in the field of organic agricultural production, Standards, by the conclusion of agreement with the certification body. The period of transition from traditional to organic agricultural production shall start: (a) two years before sowing or planting (for annual plants); (b) two years before grazing or harvesting on pastures or meadows for use as organic feed; and (c) three years before the harvest of organic products, (for perennial plants, except for fodder plants). Rules for maintaining the Register of Producers of organic agricultural commodities shall be intended an information system containing data on manufacturers (operators) of production and types of organic commodities produced, processed, or traded thereby. The register must be publicly available and published annually at the website of the authorized body in the field of agriculture.

Policy: Plan Nacional de Reducción de la Pobreza.
Policy_Content: El Plan Nacional de Reducción de la Pobreza o Plan Jajapo Paraguay es una política de carácter nacional que busca, como objetivo general, mejorar la calidad de vida de las familias en situación de pobreza, la situación económica de personas en edad productiva, así como la cohesión social en territorios y en comunidades rezagadas. El objetivo superior del Plan es reducir la pobreza en Paraguay en todas sus formas, con énfasis en la población más afectada, según zonas geográficas. En ese sentido, se plantean una serie de intervenciones prioritarias durante el periodo 2020-2023 en 7 areas geográficas prioritarias que se irán ampliando hasta cubrir a todo el territorio nacional al año 2030. Atendiendo el objetivo superior planteado, la concepción multidimensional de la pobreza y la necesidad de posibilitar el ejercicio pleno de derechos de las personas con diferentes carencias y vulnerabilidades, la política plantea desarrollar paralelamente intervenciones a nivel comunitario, para disminuir las desigualdades territoriales; a nivel familiar, para disminuir las desigualdades sociales y; a nivel de las personas, para disminuir las desigualdades económicas. A partir de esto se plantean tres (3) objetivos específicos: mejorar la calidad de vida de los hogares en situación de pobreza; mejorar la situación económica de las personas en situación de pobreza; y mejorar la cohesión social en las comunidades en situación de pobreza.

Policy: Guruve Rural District Council (Environmental) By-laws, 2020
Policy_Content: The By-laws provide that the council shall prepare an environmental action plan for the area under its jurisdiction and shall consult the inhabitants of the area, relevant government departments, the Ward Assembly in the area, and other interested stakeholders, in the development of the action plan. Where the plan sets aside an area of the council for grazing, the plan shall specify the number of livestock which may be grazed in that area, persons who may graze livestock, apropriate measures for the conversion and proper use of any animals in the grazing area, etc. Similarly, where an area is set aside for cultivation, the plan should specify which persons may cultivate the area, the type of crops to be grown, area to be set aside as wood lots, the means which may be used to cultivate in any cultivation area, among others. For plans which set aside areas for environmental and natural resources conservation, the plan shall specify areas to be set aside as wood lots, areas for growing renewable energy lots, the measures that may be taken to protect and conserve the environment and natural resources, among others. The By-laws provide that environmental impact assessment reports and certificates in respect of areas mapped out for projects must be registered to the council. There are provisions which grant powers to the council to create measures with respect to burning of vegetation, preventive invasive species, protect wetlands, reduce the cutting of trees, among others. The By-laws give a duty to individuals within an area to protect and conserve water resources and sources within the particular area by preventing water pollution and encouraging sustainable use. The By-laws also provide extensively on air pollution, waste and waste management.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Agricultural land,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Inspection,Forest fires,Waste management,Water conservation zone,Certification,Grazing,Wetlands

Policy: Warehouse Receipt (General) Regulations, 2020
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made in accordance with the provisions of the Warehouse Receipt Act. They provide for the procedure for the registration for warehouse operators, the registration of warehouses, the licensing of warehousepersons, etc. It gives details for the application, issuance, renewal, surrender and duration of certificates and licenses. The Regulations require that applicants for warehouse operator’s registration certificate must insure the warehouse against fire, explosion, employee misconduct, burglary and theft. Essentially, the Regulations provide for the warehouse receipts system which means part or the whole of the process of depositing commodities in a registered warehouse, the issuance of a warehouse receipt reflecting the quantity and quality of the deposited commodity, the regulation of warehouses and actors associated in the process, among others. The Warehouse Receipt contains certain information and terms including the name and address of the warehouse where the goods are stored, the warehouse registration number, the date of issue of the receipt, among others. There are some other security requirements for warehouse receipts which are extensively provided for, for instance, every warehouse operator shall file with the Registrar the name and specimen of signature of each person authorized to sign warehouse receipts and any changes or additions to such authorization shall be communicated to the Registrar by the warehouse operator. Furthermore, the Regulations designate warehouse receipts as negotiable instruments. The Regulations provide for the appointment of inspectors to ensure the effective enforcement of the Regulations.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Ley Nº 6598 que declara área silvestre protegida bajo dominio público municipal y con la categoría de manejo de paisajes protegidos a las nacientes aguas denominadas Ykua Itá, Ykua Chorrito Y Ykua Santa, de la ciudad de Itacurubí de la Cordillera.
Policy_Content: La presente ley declara como Área Silvestre Protegida, las nacientes denominadas Ykua Itá y Ykua Chorrito, así como el Ykua Santa, incluido el ecosistema protector que les circunda, localizadas en los barrios San José y Santa Lucia respectivamente, del municipio de la ciudad de Itacurubí de la Cordillera, Departamento de Cordillera, con una superficie total de 13,17 hectáreas aproximadamente, bajo la categoría de manejo Paisajes Protegidos, conforme lo establecido en los Artículos 4° y 6° de la Ley N° 352/1994 “DE ÁREAS SILVESTRES PROTEGIDAS”, especificando las dimensiones de las áreas en cuestión. La presente declaración se hace a perpetuidad y será ejercido con sujeción a las restricciones de uso y desarrollo correspondientes a la Categoría de Paisajes Protegidos. La administración de las áreas será ejercida por la Municipalidad de Itacurubí de la Cordillera, o a través de terceros, bajo fiscalización del Ministerio del Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible (MADES), como autoridad de aplicación. El área afectada por la presente declaratoria, se definirá como Categoría V, bajo el nombre genérico de Paisajes Protegidos, por ser un área natural destinada a la protección del paisaje terrestre, las nacientes y el chorro de agua y para la recreación, que posee elementos naturales de importante belleza escénica para la realización de actividades tendientes a la conservación y turismo, así como otros valores creados por las interacciones con los seres humanos mediante prácticas de manejo tradicionales y culturales. La ley prohibe en su artículo 10 la realización de cualquier obra pública o privada que pueda destruir, modificar o afectar al Paisaje Protegido Ykua Itá, Ykua Chorrito, Ykua Santa, debiendo la Municipalidad de Itacurubí de la Cordillera ser custodio de su protección.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 37/2020 regulating Sale, Import and Production of Bags, Packaging and other Plastic Objects.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 45 articles divided into eight Chapters and one Annex, regulates Sale, Import and Production of Bags, Packaging and other Plastic Objects. It establishes the requirements for the sale, import and production of bags, packaging and other plastic objects and applies to the following single-use plastic materials and objects: a) Materials and objects made exclusively of plastic materials; b) Materials and objects with several layers of plastic joined by adhesive or other means; c) Materials and objects printed or covered by a coating; d) Layers or plastic coating that constitute a set of two or more layers of different types of materials; e) Plastic layers in multilayer materials and multimaterial objects. This Decree-Law also covers printing inks, adhesives and coatings found in single-use plastic materials and objects intended to come into contact with food and applies to all sectors of economic activity and at all stages of the manufacture, processing and distribution, with the exception of health and cosmetics. The Annex specifies the List of Authorized Substances.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 38/2020 creating the National Authority for Water and Sanitation and approving the related Statute.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 29 articles divided into five Chapters, creates the National Authority for Water and Sanitation and approves the related Statute (ANAS, I.P.). It establishew composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned ANAS, I.P. aimed at proposing, monitoring and ensuring the implementation of national policy in the field of water resources, in order to guarantee its sustainable and integrated management, as well as the supervision and inspection of the sectors of public water supply, sanitation of urban waste water and urban solid waste. In particular, ANAS, I.P., is entitled to carry out the following duties: a) support the Government in the definition of the water resources management, water supply and sanitation policy; b) prepare proposals for water resources management plans to be submitted to the tutelage; c) support the work of the Coordination Council for Integrated Water Resources Management; d) promote the rational use of water through Water Resources Management Planning; e) propose the creation of areas in the public water domain; f) coordinate, at the national level, the adoption of exceptional measures in extreme drought or flood situations; g) ensure the monitoring, inspection and licensing of the use of water resources in accordance with the law and water resource management plans; h) propose to the Government the approval of regulatory norms related to the water resources sector, water supply and sanitation; i) regulate water supply and urban wastewater sanitation services and the quality of the service provided to users by management entities; j) ensure the monitoring, inspection and licensing of the activity of entities managing water supply and sanitation systems, in accordance with the law; k) control the correct use of water supply and sanitation systems by consumers, etc.

Policy: Décret n° 2020-1784 portant Charte de la déconcentration.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet d'instituer la Charte de la déconcentration. La déconcentration s'opère, soit par habilitation générale et permanente, soit par délégation de pouvoir. Elle assure l'unité et la cohérence de l'action de l'Etat, notamment dans les différents services centraux et les circonscriptions administratives et leur confère une pleine capacité d'initiative, de décision et d'action. La déconcentration fait de la compétence territoriale le principe de l'action de l'Etat. Elle vise a recentrer l'Administration centrale dans ses missions essentielles et a territorialiser l'action publique ainsi que les responsabilités, dans un souci de rendre la décision plus efficace et mieux adaptée aux besoins des usagers du service public. Un décret determine les matières a déléguer du niveau central a l'échelon déconcentré.
