Policy: Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Deepening the Reform of Rural Highway Management and Maintenance System.
Policy_Content: These Opinions are formulated to accelerate the establishment of a long-term mechanism for the management and maintenance of rural roads.  Rural roads are public infrastructure serving agriculture, rural areas and farmers, and an important starting point to win the battle of poverty alleviation and implement the strategy of Rural Revitalization.  Main tasks are proposed in the Document, which include: improve the rural road management and maintenance system; strengthen the rural road management and maintenance fund guarantee; and establish a long-term mechanism of rural road management and maintenance. Provincial and municipal people’s governments shall strengthen overall planning, guidance and supervision on rural road management and maintenance, and promote the road chief system at county, township and village levels. Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG695/2020 validating the Regulation on the procedure for the acknowledgement of groups of agricultural producers.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes: (a) the procedure for the creation and functioning of the Сomission for the acknowledgement of groups of agricultural producers; and (b) the procedure for the acknowledgement of groups of agricultural producers constituted in compliance with the acting legislation. The status of a group of agricultural producers shall be attributed by issuance by the Ministry of Agriculture, Regional Development and Environment of conclusions on acknowledgement. Сomission for the acknowledgement of groups of agricultural producers performs the following tasks: (a) examines applications for recognition of groups of agricultural producers; (b) checks the correctness of the information provided in the package of documents in compliance with the acknowledgement requirements; (c) considers the decision of the Agency on interventions and payments in agriculture on the plan for the acknowledgement of a group of agricultural producers; (d) ascertains the violations found in the package of documents and requires their elimination; (d) invites the competent authority to issue a confirmation of the acknowledgement of a group of agricultural producers or rejects an application for acknowledgement; (e) considers requests from groups of agricultural producers to make changes to the acknowledgement plan; (f) considers the Agency on interventions and payments in agriculture annual report on the implementation of the plans for acknowledgement of groups of agricultural producers; (g) considers the Agency on interventions and payments in agriculture proposals to withdraw the notification of acknowledgement with the issuance of an appropriate decision; and (h) recommends to include in the List of Prohibited Beneficiaries of Subsidies, kept by the Agency on interventions and payments in agriculture, of acknowledged groups of agricultural producers whose acknowledgement has been cancelled. Administrator or representative of a group of agricultural producers, acting under a power of attorney issued by the administrator submits to the competent authority application for acknowledgement of a group of agricultural producers and accompanying documents. The decision to approve or reject the acknowledgement shall be made by the Agency on interventions and payments in agriculture within 20 days from the date it was receipt.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 4348 - Identifica las áreas que constituyen centros de diversidad del maíz y zonas de cultivo de maíz amarillo, en el marco del inciso a) del numeral 4 del Artículo 13 de la Ley Nº 144, de 26 de junio de 2011, de la Revolución Productiva Comunitaria Agropecuaria.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo tiene por objeto identificar las áreas que constituyen centros de diversidad del maíz y zonas de cultivo de maíz amarillo en el marco del inciso a) del numeral 4 del Artículo 13 de la Ley Nº 144 sobre la Revolución Productiva Comunitaria Agropecuaria. Dicha áreas se identifican conforme al Estudio de zonificación para el uso de maíz en Bolivia, realizado por el Instituto Nacional de Innovación Agropecuaria y Forestal – INIAF. Con el fin de evitar la generación de semilla como resultado de la polinización cruzada entre cultivos de maíz convencional o generados por cualquier tecnología, se deberán contemplar fechas diferenciadas de siembra y distancias entre campos de uno y otro cultivo, conforme a las normas técnicas y agronómicas aprobadas por el INIAF.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Cereals/grains/rice,Zoning,Agricultural commodities,Genetic resources,Agricultural development,Food security,Planting material/seeds,Plant production

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 20-265 du 4 Safar 1442 correspondant au 22 septembre 2020 portant création de l'office de développement de l’agriculture industrielle en terres sahariennes.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte sur création et définissant les missions de l’Office de développement de l’agriculture industrielle en terres sahariennes (ODAS). Cet établissement public à caractère industriel et commercial, est doté de la personnalité morale et de l’autonomie financière. Cette agence œuvre pour la promotion et le développement de l’agriculture industrielle stratégique en terres sahariennes, en vue de renforcer les capacités nationales agricoles et agro-industrielles. L’ODAS est administré par un conseil  d’administration, dirigé par un directeur général, assisté par un comité d’expertise et d’évaluation technique et doté d’un guichet unique.  Ce décret introduit aussi deux Annexes (annexe 1 un Cahier des charges fixant les droits et obligations des investisseurs dans le cadre de la promotion de l’investissement agricole et agro-industriel en terres sahariennes et annexe 2: Cahier des charges de sujétions de service public de l'office de développement de l’agriculture industrielle en terres sahariennes).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Law No. 8/2020 approving Measures to Reduce the Use of Plastic Bags in São Tomé and Príncipe.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 28 articles divided into four Chapters and one Annex, approves Measures to Reduce the Use of Plastic Bags in São Tomé and Príncipe with the object of prohibiting the production, import, commercialization and distribution of non-biodegradable plastic bags in the territory of São Tomé and Príncipe. These measures are applicable to all natural or legal, public and private persons, involved in the production, import, commercialization and free distribution of conventional plastic bags for packaging, namely bags with or without sleeves and garbage bags, covering disposable packaging provided free or not by economic agents with the aim of containing or allowing the transport of the goods purchased there, the bags of high density (HDPE) and low density (LDPE) chemical formula (-CH2-CH2-) polyethylene intended for packaging products purchased from commercial operators and plastic bags produced from hydrocarbons of origin fossil or whose material is not able to degrade naturally and without polluting impact namely through composting processes, defining market measures and raising awareness aimed at reducing the use of conventional plastic bags and establishing inspection and sanctioning regimes.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Norma Técnica Nº 002-2020 - Que contiene las disposiciones administrativas para la gestión de registros sanitarios de referencia de productos alimenticios importados y permisos de importación otorgados por el departamento de regulación y control de alimentos, durante el estado de calamidad pública por Covid-19.
Policy_Content: La presente Norma Técnica de la Dirección General de Regulación, Vigilancia y Control de la Salud, dependiente del Ministerio de Salud, tiene por objeto establecer las medidas de carácter administrativo que permitan la emisión de autorizaciones sanitarias de productos alimenticios importados, durante el estado de calamidad pública decretado por el Organismo Ejecutivo, derivado de la pandemia del Coronavirus (COVID-19). Sus disposiciones se aplican a las solicitudes nuevas para la obtención de registros sanitarios de referencia de productos alimenticios importados; permisos de importación de materia prima y aditivos alimentarios; actualizaciones y renovaciones de dichos registros.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1508 “On reorganization of the Council for the Development of the Forest Complex under the Government of the Russian Federation and formation of the Government Commission for the Development of the Forest Complex.”
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes that the Government of the Russian Federation and formation of the Government Commission for the Development of the Forest Complex is the coordinating body constituted for ensuring coordinated actions and interaction of federal bodies of the executive power, executive authorities of subjects of the Russian Federation, scientific organizations and business communities for the development and implementation of key areas of state policy in the sphere of forestry and forest development industry. Government Commission shall perform the following tasks: (a) examination and development of decisions on strategic directions for implementation of the state policy in the field of forest complex development, including the improvement of normative legal regulation; (b) coordination of actions of the executive authorities and organizations for the purpose of sustainable forest management, introduction of innovative methods of forest management, use, guardianship, protection, regeneration of forests and afforestation, ensuring the advance growth of the forest sector of the economy, social and environmental security of the country, unconditional implementation of the international obligations of the Russian Federation regarding forests, as well as improving the long-term competitiveness of the forest sector and increasing its contribution to the socio-economic development of the Russian Federation; (c) consideration and elaboration of proposals on the issues of realization of the objectives and tasks within the framework of national and federal projects affecting the development of the forest complex and related industries; and (d) coordination of activity of executive authorities and organizations for the purposes of implementation of state programs of the Russian Federation and other strategic planning documents in the field of development of forest complex and related industries.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1509 validating the Regulation on particulars of management, protection, reproduction of forests located on agricultural land.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes particulars of management, protection, reproduction of forests located on agricultural land. It shall not be applicable to land reclamation protection forest belts. Forests located on agricultural land shall be subject to development in compliance with specific purposeful use of such land. Management, guardianship, protection and care of forest located on agricultural land shall be performed by land proprietors in accordance with the provisions of forest legislation and this Governmental Decree. In forests located in water protection zones, as well as in protected spawning strips of forests located on agricultural land clear cutting is prohibited. Forest managers of forests located on agricultural land, and land proprietors are required to observe rules of fire safety in the forests, rules of sanitary safety in forests, rules of forest care.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry
Keyword: Agricultural land,Agro-forestry,Forest management/forest conservation,Afforestation/reforestation,Forestry protection measures,Forest fires,Timber,Timber extraction/logging

Policy: Act on organic farming.
Policy_Content: This Act, which is composed of 23 articles and one Annex, establishes: (a) rules of organic farming; (b) competence of state organs in the area of organic farming; (c) rights and obligations of persons carrying out organic farming; (d) performance of the initial verification of the preconditions for organic farming; (e) keeping a register of organic farming operators and a register of inspection organizations; (f) details on the performance of organic farming control; (g) the duties and obligations of inspection organizations; (h) labeling of products of organic farming; (i) infringements and other administrative offenses in the area of organic farming. The state administration bodies in the area of organic farming are: Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development and  The Central Control and Testing Institute in Agriculture. Products of organic farming are marked with graphical sign of organic farming specified in the Annex.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1482 “On signs of non-use of agricultural land plots for their intended purpose or use in violation of the legislation of the Russian Federation.”
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes that signs of non-use of agricultural land plots for their intended purpose shall be as follows: (a) the presence of overgrowth on 50 and more percent of the land area of weeds according to the list according contained in the Annex and (or) woody shrub vegetation (with the exception of field and forest protection plantations, fruit and berry plantations), and (or) the presence of turf, characterized by the interlacing of roots, shoots, rhizomes of perennial weeds, the depth of which reaches 15 or more centimeters (except for the presence of turf on land plots intended and used for grazing farm animals), and (or) spread of land degradation; and (b) the presence of the signs specified in the second paragraph of this clause by 20 and more percent of the area of the land plot assigned in the established order to particularly valuable productive agricultural land. Signs of the use of agricultural land plots in violation of the legislation of the Russian Federation shall be as follows: (a) presence of unauthorized construction on agricultural land plot; (b) soil pollution by hazardous and radioactive substances; (c) littering of 20 and more percent of land by substances and items not related to agricultural production; and (d) massive presence of weeds, in particular, weeds subject to quarantine, on agricultural land plot.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1488 validating the Regulation on the procedure for compensation for losses caused to the indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation, associations of indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation and persons belonging to the indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation, as a result of damage to the original habitat of indigenous small-numbered peoples of the Russian Federation by the economic activities of organizations of all forms of ownership, as well as by natural persons.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes the procedure for compensation for losses caused to the indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation, associations of indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation and persons belonging to the indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation, as a result of damage to the original habitat of indigenous small-numbered peoples of the Russian Federation by the economic activities of organizations of all forms of ownership, as well as by natural persons. Compensation for losses is carried out on the basis of agreements on compensation for losses concluded by economic entities and councils of representatives of small peoples, created on public principles under the executive authorities of the constituent entities (regions) of the Russian Federation for the protection of the rights and legal interests of indigenous peoples. It is allowed to conclude one agreement with several business entities carrying out economic activities within one territory in which small-numbered indigenous peoples live. The agreement is concluded at the initiative of one of the parties.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Decree No. 84/2020 approving the Regulation for Infrastructure and Petroleum Operations Licensing.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation for Infrastructure and Petroleum Operations Licensing. The Regulation, consisting of 49 articles divided into nine Chapters and two Annexes, establishes the rules and procedures for the licensing of the construction, installation, operation and demobilizing of petroleum infrastructures, including storage transport, and authorization upon registration. This Regulation applies to infrastructures to be installed by the Concessionaires, Operators, their contractors and other legal persons, involved in Petroleum Operations in National Territory. The licensing and supervision of activities and facilities related to the reception and transportation of crude oil or other raw materials for the production of petroleum products are excluded from the scope of this regulation. Licences under the scope of this regulation are granted to legal persons involved in Petroleum Operations that guarantee the necessary precautions for environmental protection, with a view to their preservation. The Regulation is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Installation licensing (Chap. II); Operating licensing (Chap. III); Demobilizing licensing (Chap. IV); Specific petroleum operations (Chap. V); Registration (Chap. VI); Offences (Chap. VII); Taxes and fines (Chap. VIII); and Inspection (Chap. IX).
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Décret n° 165-2020 du 17 septembre 2020 fixant les attributions du Ministre de l’Environnement et du Développement Durable et l’organisation de l’administration centrale de son Département.
Policy_Content: Ce décret définit les attributions du Ministre de l’Environnement et du Développement Durable et l'organisation de l’Administration centrale de son département. Le décret décrit en détail les taches dont le Ministre est Chargé et s'assure qu'il puisse avoir recours à toutes les plateformes de concertation interinstitutionnelles aux fins de promouvoir les orientations stratégiques et opérationnelles en matière de politique environnementale. Le Ministre s'assure que les entreprises du secteur privé et public intègrent les préoccupations environnementales et les principes de développement durable dans leurs activités ; encourage l'insertion des femmes et des jeunes dans toutes les actions de protection et de restauration environnementales ; exerce son autorité sur les parcs nationaux et autres aires protégées. Policy: Single-use and Other Plastic Products (Waste Avoidance) Act 2020
Policy_Content: The objects of this Act include to— (a) provide for the restriction or prohibition of certain single-use and other plastic products; and (b) promote and support better waste management practices including the reduction of marine litter; and (c) promote and support the principles of the waste management hierarchy; and (d) promote and support the principles of the circular economy. Policy: Notification on National Estate.
Policy_Content: This Notification sets forth procedures and principles for the leasing of treasury lands for agricultural production for 10-years period. To this end, treasury lands can be leased in parcels up to 60 decare to farmers who have limited or without land. Larger land parcels can be divided into pieces not exceeding 60 decare for rent. Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 4339 – Crea la Ventanilla Única de Comercio Exterior de Bolivia – VUCEB y establece lineamientos para su implementación.
Policy_Content: En cumplimiento del Numeral 4.1 del Artículo 10 del Acuerdo Sobre Facilitación del Comercio, ratificado por la Ley Nº 998 de 27 de noviembre de 2017, el presente Decreto Supremo tiene por objeto crear la Ventanilla Única de Comercio Exterior de Bolivia (VUCEB) y establecer lineamientos para su implementación. La VUCEB consiste en un sistema que permite a los operadores que participan en el comercio exterior y el transporte contar con un punto único de entrada de información, para presentar a las autoridades u organismos participantes la documentación y/o información exigida para los tramites de operaciones de importación, exportación y tránsito aduanero internacional de mercancías, a través del uso de medios electrónicos y digitales. La implementación de la VUCEB se llevará a cabo de manera gradual y será coordinada por el Consejo Técnico de la VUCEB, creado por el presente Decreto Supremo. Dicho Consejo deberá aprobar su Reglamento Interno de funcionamiento en el plazo establecido por el presente Decreto Supremo.

Policy: Ley Nº 6616 – Que modifica y amplía el artículo 1º de la Ley Nº 515/1994, que prohíbe la exportación y tráfico de rollos, trozas y vigas de madera.

Policy: Conservation and Enforcement Measures (version of 2021).
Policy_Content: The Conservation and Enforcement Measures (CEM) of the  Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization (NAFO) shall apply to all fishing vessels used or intended for use for the purposes of commercial fishing activities conducted on fisheries resources in the (NAFO) Regulatory Area. The CEM is divided into 8 Chapters: Conservation and Management Measures (I); Protection of Vulnerable Marine Ecosystems (VMEs) in the Regulatory Area From Bottom Fishing Activities (II);  Vessel Requirements and Chartering (III); Monitoring of Fisheries (IV); Observer Scheme (V); Joint Inspection and Surveillance Scheme (VI); Port State Control (VII); Non-Contracting Party Scheme (VIII). Policy: Notice No. 4 of 2020 of the General Office of the State Council on Resolutely Stopping the De-agriculturalization of Cultivated Land.
Policy_Content: Cultivated land is an important foundation for food production. In recent years, a series of strict cultivated land protection policies and measures have been introduced in China. However, illegal occupation of cultivated land for non-agricultural construction still exists in some places. To ensure food security, the Notice puts forward six prohibited practices of non-agriculturalization of cultivated land: 1. Illegal occupation of cultivated land for greening and afforestation is strictly prohibited. 2. It is strictly forbidden to build green belts beyond the standards. It is necessary to strictly control the examination and approval of land use for green belts outside the range of land used on both sides of railways and highways. If the land along the road is cultivated, the width of green belts outside the range of land used on both sides shall not exceed 5 meters. 3. It is strictly forbidden to occupy cultivated land in violation of regulations for digging lakes and landscaping.  It is prohibited to occupy cultivated land and permanent basic farmland without authorization to make lakes and landscaping. 4. It is strictly forbidden to occupy permanent basic farmland to expand the nature reserves. 5. It is strictly prohibited to occupy cultivated land in violation of regulations for non-agricultural construction. 6. It is strictly forbidden to grant land in violation of laws and regulations. The approved land must conform to the national land and space plan. Any construction project that does not conform to the national land and space plan, as well as the land management laws and regulations and national sectoral policies, shall not be approved.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 91-Z “On allotment to certain categories of citizens in ownership free of charge land plots in their actual use on the regional territory.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates legal relations for allotment to certain categories of citizens in ownership free of charge land plots in their actual use on the regional territory pertaining to the regional public property, or owned by municipalities, or state ownership of which is not delimited, which are in their actual use, if on such land plots are located individual residential buildings, constructed before September 1 2006, the ownership of which is not formalized. Land plots shall be allotted if the owner of residential building complies with the following conditions: (a) citizen permanently resided in a residential building for at least 15 years; (b) residential building located on the land plot is suitable for permanent residence and does not pose a threat to the life and health of citizens; (c) citizen does not own or otherwise is in possession of land plots for individual housing construction, personal subsidiary farm (with the right to build a residential building); and (d) the citizen and his family members did not alienate a residential facility located on the regional territory.

Policy: Stratégie nationale pour le développement de l’hydrogène décarboné en France
Policy_Content: La présente Stratégie nationale pour le développement de l’hydrogène décarboné en France est un document sectoriel à portée nationale. La stratégie nationale bénéficiera aux offres industrielles de solutions hydrogène produites sur le territoire français. Le soutien de l’État porte à la fois sur l’offre et la demande, et accompagne de manière séquentielle et progressive toutes les étapes clés de l’émergence de l’offre : le soutien à la R&D permettant de développer des technologies plus performantes pour l’ensemble des usages de l’hydrogène ; le soutien aux premières commerciales et à l’industrialisation qui combine une approche européenne (partenariats avec des pays partenaires pour développer des projets d’envergure) et nationale ; le soutien au déploiement à travers la mise en place de mécanismes de soutien. Synchroniser le soutien à l’offre et à la demande permettra d’assurer notre souveraineté sur les principales technologies. Le Gouvernement a retenu 3 priorités d’intervention, qui correspondent aux principaux marchés de l’hydrogène et qui permettent d’ancrer leur développement sur notre territoire dans une dynamique durable et pérenne, afin que cette stratégie française contribue pleinement à l’objectif de neutralité carbone en 2050 : décarboner l’industrie en faisant émerger une filière française de l’électrolyse ; développer une mobilité lourde à l’hydrogène décarboné ; et soutenir la recherche, l’innovation et le développement de compétences afin de favoriser les usages de demain.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la que tiene por objeto promover el desarrollo de nuevos proyectos de generación eléctrica con fuentes renovables, en aspectos relacionados con la venta de energía, disponiendo que la energía producida por empresas que se acogen a los incentivos otorgados y que no tengan contratos con el distribuidor u otros agentes, deberán vender esta energía en el mercado de ocasión interno de acuerdo a sus precios promedios diarios, manteniéndose dentro de una banda de precios no mayor de 6.5 centavos de dólar por kWh. Además, el Ministerio de Energía y Minas establecerá los procedimientos para otorgar los permisos de exportación de energía cuando esté satisfecha la demanda interna. El Instituto Nicaragüense de Energía establecerá el procedimiento para actualizar esta banda de precios debidamente justificada por los índices económicos nacionales e internacionales, considerando las políticas dictadas en este campo por el Ministerio de Energía y Minas.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 227/20 approving the Integrated Plan for the Improvement of Family Farming and Fisheries 2020/2022 (PIAAPF-2020/2022).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Integrated Plan for the Improvement of Family Farming and Fisheries 2020/2022 (PIAAPF-2020/2022). This Plan aims to mitigate the socioeconomic impacts of COVID-19 and the dependence on oil. It promotes inclusive and sustainable economic growth, ensuring food and nutrition security and increasing food national production, as well as investments in value chains. In addition, it regulates institutional task force, strategic guidelines, methodology, goals to be observed by the production area, critical success factors, framework of the action plan, technical assistance for the promotion of agricultural production, livestock, fisheries, exploitation of forest resources, logistical support and financing. Its general objective is to increase productivity and agro-livestock production of forestry family products, fishing and aquaculture at the artisanal level oriented to the market; Increase rural employment, higher household income and consequent economic growth; Improvement of food and nutrition security, allowing export diversification and import substitution and economic growth. Its specific objectives are: Assist the evolution and acceleration of family farming and fishing, with a focus on meeting the needs of family producers; Promote the strengthening of relations between actors in the agricultural and fishing production chains; Provide technical and financial training to family producers; Improve infrastructures to support family farming and fishing.

Policy: Règlement C/REG. 04/09/2020 relatif à la prévention des risques biotechnologiques dans l’espace CEDEAO
Policy_Content: Le présent Règlement établit un cadre juridique et institutionnel pour prévenir, réduire ou éliminer les risques potentiels ou avères lies à l'utilisation de la biotechnologie moderne et de tout autre technologie en rapport avec la biotechnologie et des produits dérivés. A cet égard, il vise notamment à : préciser les principes directeurs qui fondent la mise en œuvre du présent Règlement ; instituer les organes et mécanismes pour une approche concertée de la prévention et de la gestion des risques biotechnologiques ; définir les mesures de prévention et les procédures d'évaluation et de gestion des risques lies a l'utilisation des biotechnologies modernes et des produits qui en sont issus ; et établir les principes et règles de responsabilité et de réparation des dommages résultant de l'utilisation des OVM et produits dérivés. Le présent Règlement s'applique à toute utilisation y compris les mouvements transfrontières, le transit, la manipulation d'organismes vivants modifies et/ou produits dérivés susceptibles d'avoir des effets défavorables sur l'environnement, et en particulier sur la conservation et l'utilisation durable de la diversité biologique, sur la santé humaine et animale. Le présent Règlement ne s'applique pas aux mouvements transfrontières d'organismes vivants modifies qui sont des produits pharmaceutiques destines à l'homme et relevant d'autres accords ou organismes internationaux pertinents.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decreto Nº 21 - Reglamento del Decreto Ley de la mecanización, el riego, el drenaje agrícola y el abasto de agua a los animales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto establecer las normas y los procedimientos para la aplicación de lo dispuesto en el Decreto Ley de la mecanización, el riego, el drenaje agrícola y el abasto de agua a los animales, y en tal sentido regula lo siguiente: 1) La certificación de las tareas técnicas y los dictámenes de las ofertas de los proveedores de los equipos agropecuarios a introducir en el país; 2) Las pruebas estatales y la validación del equipamiento antes de introducir las nuevas tecnologías; 3) La concentración de tractores, cosechadoras autopropulsadas y otras máquinas agrícolas de alto rendimiento en unidades prestadoras de servicios a la base productiva; 4) La organización de la explotación de la maquinaria agrícola en pelotones; 5) La formación de agregados tractor/máquina-implementos agrícolas eficientes energéticamente; 6) La utilización de tractores de potencia baja, fundamentalmente en unidades productoras del sector estatal y cooperativo; 7) La autorización de la venta de tractores a agricultores pequeños de alto rendimiento; 8) La rehabilitación y reposición de tractores, máquinas e implementos agrícolas, cosechadoras y equipamiento de riego, drenaje agrícola y abasto de agua a los animales; 9) La introducción y empleo de medios de mecanización agrícola y equipamiento de riego y drenaje agrícola que favorezcan el cuidado y conservación del suelo, del medio ambiente, el uso racional del agua y el empleo de las fuentes renovables de energía; 10) La mecanización agrícola y el equipamiento de riego y drenaje agrícola en los cultivos de mayor demanda de labores; 11) La elaboración del balance de maquinaria en las unidades productoras, empresas, municipios y provincias; 12) La consolidación del sistema de asistencia técnica en plantas nacionales, talleres de empresas provinciales, unidades empresariales de base prestadoras de servicios de las empresas agropecuarias, forestales y azucareras, talleres de unidades productoras y atención técnica en el campo; 13) La utilización del parque de tractores, máquinas e implementos agrícolas, fundamentalmente en actividades agropecuarias; 14) La planificación en la industria nacional de la fabricación de implementos y máquinas agrícolas, equipamiento de riego, drenaje agrícola y abasto de agua a los animales, así como partes, piezas y accesorios para su sostenibilidad; 15) La organización de la venta de recursos a los productores a través de los mercados mayorista y minorista; 16) La explotación de la infraestructura hidráulica, utilizando técnicas de riego eficientes; y 17) La sustitución progresiva del bombeo con combustible diésel por otras fuentes renovables de energía, tanto para el abasto a los animales como para el riego donde sea posible.

Policy: Urban and Regional Planning Act, No. 5 of 2018
Policy_Content: The Act provides the conditions for the declaration of authorised planning authorities, including that the local authority must have staff member(s) who are town and region with experience in matters relating to spatial planning or the authority have contracted a town and regional planner with the same qualifications. The Act also provides the procedure for an authority to apply to be declared as an authorised planning authority. The Act provides for the preparation of the national spatial development framework, regional structure plan and urban structure plan. The plan is to contain background information including national setting and geography, major planning subjects and  planning implications and conclusions. The plan is to also contain planning policies and proposals including the purpose and overall strategy, development proposals and implementation of the framework or plan. The Act encourages public participation for purposes of national spatial development framework, regional structure plan and urban structure plan through consultations with government offices, ministries and agencies as well as affected or interested stakeholders. The Act also encourages public participation through keeping records of the persons and institutions consulted and the inputs received in respect of the national development framework, regional structure plan or urban structure plan. The Act provides for zoning schemes to contain information regarding the set of clauses containing provisions prohibiting and regulating the development of land under a preliminary draft zoning scheme in the area, a scheme map showing the details of the draft zoning scheme, comments and objections received in the preparation of the scheme, a report motivating the proposals in the zoning scheme, among others. The Act provides for the procedure for lodging of deeds, plans, diagrams and other documents with the Surveyor General and Registrar of Deeds.

Policy: France Relance
Policy_Content: Le présent document « France Relance » est un document multisectoriel de la France à portée nationale. Il énonce que France entre aujourd’hui dans une nouvelle phase : celle de la relance et de la reconstruction. Pour surmonter la crise la plus importante de notre Histoire moderne, pour éviter que ne s’installe le cancer du chômage de masse dont hélas, notre pays a trop longtemps souffert, nous décidons aujourd’hui d’investir massivement. 100 milliards, dont 40 milliards sont issus de financements obtenus de haute lutte auprès de l’Union européenne, seront ainsi injectés dans l’économie dans les mois qui viennent. C’est un montant inédit qui, rapporté à notre richesse nationale, fait du plan français l’un des plus ambitieux.

Policy: Loi nº 2020 - 20 du 02 septembre 2020 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement des entreprises publiques en République du Bénin
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de déterminer les règles relatives à la création, à l'organisation et ou fonctionnement des entreprises publiques. Ces règles incluent notamment les mécanismes et procédures relatifs à la surveillance économique et financière, ainsi qu'aux transferts de participations, à la dénationalisation et à la dissolution desdites entreprises. L'État ou les collectivités territoriales créent les entreprises publiques ou prennent dons toutes outres entreprises qui existent, les participations qu'ils jugent appropriées, en vue d'assurer leurs missions de développement économique et social de la notion. L'initiative de la création ou de la prise de participation de l'État apportaient ou ministre sectoriel compétent à raison du domaine d'activité de l'entreprise. Elle est soumise à l’avis préalable du ministre chargé de l'économie et des finances. En outre, la loi prévoit les modalités de création et de prise de participation ; conseil d'administration ; directeur général ; régime juridique, social, comptable, et financier ; conventions réglementées ou interdites ; contrôle des entreprises publiques ; et modifications, transformations, dissolutions et dénationalisation.

Policy: Decree No. 76/2020 approving the Regulation of the Disaster Risk Management Act.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 41 articles divided into four Chapters, establishes the rules and procedures for implementing Law No. 10/2020 of 24 August, aimed to regulate the Disaster Risk Management System. These regulations apply to public administration bodies and institutions, to citizens and other groups, public or private individuals, who, in carrying out their functions, contribute to the management and reduction of disaster risk and the building of resilience to extreme events. It also applies to public and private organizations, national or foreign, technical and scientific research institutions whose object contributes to the management and reduction of disaster risk and have a special duty to collaborate to programmes, plans and instructions of the coordinating entity for disaster risk reduction and management, including participation in sessions of Technical Councils for Management and Risk Reduction. The Decree is divided in the following Chapters: General provisions (Chap. I); Disaster Risk Management System (Chap. II); Public Disaster (Chap. Policy: Ley Nº 21.259 - Modifica la legislación pesquera a fin de enfrentar los efectos de la enfermedad covid-19 en chile.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece normas en el ámbito pesquero para enfrentar los efectos de la enfermedad del covid-19. La Ley suspende la declaración de caducidad de las inscripciones en el Registro Pesquero Artesanal conforme a la Ley General de Pesca y Acuicultura hasta el 31 de diciembre de 2022. Además, permite el funcionamiento por medios telemáticos de diversos organismos en el área pesquera. Por último, se concede un plazo extraordinario, hasta el 31 de diciembre de 2021, para que los titulares de áreas de manejo que se encuentren afectados por las causales de caducidad de los literales b) y c) del artículo 144 de la Ley General de Pesca y Acuicultura, actualicen sus estudios o efectúen actividades de conformidad con sus planes de manejo.

El Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural, a través de la Oficina Asesora de Planeación y Prospectiva, reportará los avances de la implementación del Plan para Apoyar y Consolidar la Generación de Ingresos de la Economía Campesina Familiar y Comunitaria, a través del Sistema Integrado de Información para el Posconflicto (SIIPO).

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 223/20 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Energy and Water (MINEA).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of the Ministry of Energy and Water (MINEA). The Statute, consisting of 22 articles divided into four Chapters and two Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the MINEA, as an auxiliary Ministerial Department of the President of the Republic. Its main purpose is to propose the formulation, conduct, execution and control of the Executive's policy in the fields of energy and water. In addition, the Ministry shall: propose and promote the execution of the policy to be pursued by the Energy and Water sectors; establish strategies, promote and coordinate the rational use of energy and water resources, ensuring their sustainable development; draw up, within the framework of the general planning of the country's economic and social development, sectoral plans relating to the areas of action; propose and promote the national policy on electrification, the general use of water resources, their protection and conservation, as well as the water supply and wastewater sanitation policy; promote research activities with repercussions in the respective areas of activity; elaborate legislation on the legal framework for the energy, water and wastewater sanitation sectors; propose the institutional model for carrying out the activities of production, transport, distribution and sale of electricity and promote its implementation, etc.

Policy: Ley Nº 31040 - Ley que modifica el Código Penal y el Código de Protección y Defensa del Consumidor, respecto del acaparamiento, especulación y adulteración.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica el Código Penal y el Código de Protección y Defensa del Consumidor, respecto del acaparamiento, especulación y adulteración. Se incorporan los artículos 232 y 233 al Código Penal, aprobado por Decreto Legislativo Nº 635, en los siguientes términos: “Artículo 232.- Abuso del poder económico - El que abusa de su posición dominante en el mercado, o el que participa en prácticas y acuerdos restrictivos en la actividad productiva, mercantil o de servicios con el objeto de impedir, restringir o distorsionar la libre competencia, será reprimido con una pena privativa de libertad no menor de dos ni mayor de seis años, con ciento ochenta a trescientos sesenta y cinco días multa e inhabilitación”. “Artículo 233.- Acaparamiento - El que provoca escasez o desabastecimiento de bienes y servicios esenciales para la vida y la salud de las personas, mediante la sustracción o acaparamiento, con la finalidad de alterar los precios habituales en su beneficio, y con perjuicio de los consumidores, será reprimido con pena privativa de libertad no menor de cuatro ni mayor de seis años y con ciento ochenta a trescientos sesenta y cinco días multa”. También se modifica los artículos 234 y 235 del Código Penal, relativos a la  Especulación y alteración de pesos y medidas, y a la Adulteración, respectivamente.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 4314 - Establece la transición de la cuarentena a la fase de post confinamiento, estableciendo las medidas con vigilancia comunitaria activa de casos de Coronavirus (COVID-19).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo tiene por objeto establecer la transición de la cuarentena a la fase de post confinamiento, estableciendo las medidas con vigilancia comunitaria activa de casos de Coronavirus (COVID-19). A partir del 1 de septiembre de 2020, se inicia la fase de post confinamiento, la que tendrá vigencia hasta el 30 de septiembre de 2020. Durante este período, el nivel central del Estado y las Entidades Territoriales Autónomas, deberán implementar medidas de vigilancia epidemiológica, prevención, contención, diagnóstico, atención, tratamiento y búsqueda activa de casos de Coronavirus (COVID-19), a través de rastrillajes u otros medios. Independientemente de las medidas de post confinamiento, se permite ejercer actividades económicas relacionadas con el sector industrial, manufactura, sector agropecuario, maderero y forestal (Artículo 9). Además, las personas naturales o jurídicas, empresas privadas y públicas, dedicadas a la producción de alimentos, artículos de consumo masivo, comercialización de artículos de primera necesidad y la provisión de insumos para éstas, etc, continuarán desarrollando sus actividades ininterrumpidamente o de acuerdo a la modalidad aplicable a su actividad, a fin de garantizar la cadena productiva y de abastecimiento (Artículo 10).

Policy: Law No. 7/2020 approving Measures to Prevent and Combat Corruption.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 117 articles divided into four Titles, establishes the Prevention and Anti-Corruption Measures. It provides for general preventive measures, the regime for declaring income and assets, defines crimes of corruption, related offences and penalties, etc. In addition, it makes the sixth amendment to the Penal Code, approved by Decree-Law No. 19/2009 of 8 April, and amends the Law on the Anti-Corruption Commission, approved by Law No. 8/2009 of 15 July. The Government approves the national strategy for preventing and combating corruption and related action plans, which promote the widest public participation, through civil society organizations and the private sector aiming at integrity, transparency and accountability. The national strategy is based on rigorous collection, compilation and analysis of information on the causes and consequences of corruption. The national strategy aims to provide a general orientation that leads to the development and implementation of specific action plans by sector/institution, to ensure the implementation of the strategy. The Anti-Corruption Commission is responsible for the supervision and coordination of the implementation of the national strategy and action plan, the periodic evaluation of its application. Legal instruments and administrative measures are regularly assessed to see if they are suitable for preventing and combating corruption.

Policy: Consumer Protection Act, 2020 (No. 7 of 2020).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the National Consumer Protection Commission and defines its functions and powers. The Act also defines rights of consumers and provides mechanisms for the protection and enforcement of such rights and rules regarding fair market practices. The Commission shall be responsible for the administration of this Act and carry out the functions as set out by this Act. The Commission shall, among other things, monitor the operation of consumer markets in Sierra Leone and consider how they may be improved for the long-term interests of consumers and make recommendations to the Minister as appropriate and investigate allegations of non-compliance with this Act and take action to ensure that appropriate remedies are imposed. A consumer or consumer representative on behalf of a consumer may submit a complaint- (a) regarding goods or services; or (b) alleged unfair supplier or service provider conduct in the provision of goods and services. The Act sets out procedures for the handling of complaints. Goods as defines by this Act includes all tangible items or articles acquired or used by a consumer including- (a) ships, aircraft and other vehicles; (b) animals (including fish); (c) minerals, trees and crops, whether on, under or attached to land or not; (d) gas, electricity, water, telecommunication.

Policy: Development, Management and Utilization of Community Watersheds Proclamation No. 1223 of 2020
Policy_Content: The Proclamation applies to community watersheds found in the country and defines community watershed as a geographical area, described by the watershed limits of water system including surface and underground water flowing into a common terminus and with the average size of about 500 hectares. The Proclamation develops community watershed by implementing measures to harmonize the use of soil, water and vegetation in a way that conserves these resources and maximize their productivity in the community watershed. Its objectives include: Reducing the vulnerability of the society to drought and enhancing their resilience capacity by preventing environmental and natural resource degradation, protecting biodiversity, developing water resources, reducing greenhouse gas emissions; Enhancing land productivity; increasing the products and productivity of peasants and pastoralists; ensuring food security and job creation through sustainable community watershed protection, development and utilization; Establishing a system which enables the community watershed users to protect, develop, administer and use natural resources with a sense of ownership, with a view to increasing the community watershed users’ capacity. The Proclamation provides that the principles of participation and adherence to the land use plan shall be applied in the preparation of community watershed plan, among others. The Proclamation further advocates for the establishment of cooperative society of community watershed users. Gender balance shall be ensured in any watershed management and utilization process. The Proclamation provides that private or communal holders within a watershed shall have the duty to undertake soil and water conservation works, rehabilitation and maintenance to prevent soil erosion and maintain soil fertility, as well as  control and protect animal roaming in order to prevent harm to the watershed development works that have been undertaken, maintain fertility and health of soil by planting and protecting forests, forage trees, and plant species which enhance soil fertility on the boundaries of his farmlands and on the farmlands, and on the sides of walkways within the watershed, among others.

Policy: Law No. 10/2020 approving the Disaster Risk Management Act.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 56 articles divided into five Chapters and one Annex, establishes the Legal Regime for Disaster Risk Management and Reduction, comprising the following sectors: risk reduction, disaster management, sustainable recovery for the construction of human, infrastructural and ecosystem resilience, as well as the adaptation to climate change. Actions related to disaster risk management and reduction must be carried out in a decentralized manner. This Law applies to public administration bodies and institutions, to citizens and to legal persons, public or private, who, in the performance of their duties, contribute to the management and reduction of disaster risk and the building of resilience to extreme events. The Law is divided in the following Chapters: General provisions (Chap. I); Disaster Risk Management Bodies (Chap. II); Disaster Risk Reduction and Management and Resilience Building (Chap. III); Inspection, Offences and Penalties (Chap. IV); Final provisions (V).

Policy: Crops (Nuts and Oil Crops) Regulations, 2020 ((L.N. No. 164 of 2020).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made in accordance with section 40 of the Crops Act, 2013, with the purpose to guide the development, promotion, and regulation of scheduled nuts and oil crops for the benefit of the growers and other stakeholders in the nuts and oil crops industry. Specifically, the Regulations aim to  provide for the production, harvesting, processing and marketing of nuts and oil crops; promotion of best practices in the sub sector; registration and licensing of all players along the value chain; the recommendation of general industry agreements or contracts; the development and enforcement of quality and safety standards for compliance; the collection, collation, maintenance and management of statistical data related to the sub sector; the imposition and administration of levies; and the regulation of the sub sector. The Regulations provide extensively for the registration and licensing of small growers associations, plantation growers, importers and exporters, etc. It further provides for the inspection of production and manufacturing facilities and the sampling and testing of produce.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Policy: Methodological recommendations for conducting a scientific anti-corruption assessment of draft normative legal acts.
Policy_Content: These Methodological recommendations for conducting a scientific anti-corruption assessment of draft normative legal acts are intended for guidance of experts in the conduct of scientific anti-corruption examination of draft normative legal acts. Scientific anti-corruption expertise shall be intended research of draft regulatory legal acts in order to revealing corruption-related norms in them with the issuance of a scientific opinion anti-corruption expertise. Anti-corruption expertise is carried out on the basis of the following principles: (a) the openness of the conclusions of the anti-corruption expertise; (b) independence and objectivity of experts in the process of conducting anti-corruption expertise; (c) avoiding favoritism towards project developers of regulatory legal act and other interested parties. In the process of preparing for the anti-corruption expertise the expert analyzes: (a) legislation concerning the draft normative legal act; (b) the concept of the draft law (if any); (c) an explanatory note (if any); (d) the text of the draft regulatory legal act; (e) a comparative table to the draft regulatory legal act when amendments and additions to the current regulatory legal acts; and (f) other available information regarding the draft regulatory legal act. The conclusion of the anti-corruption expertise contains the following sections: (a) general provisions, which include the data of an expert, developer, subject and purpose of scientific anti-corruption expertise, project name regulatory legal act, its purpose and structure; (b) a description of the problematic issues to be solved by the project regulatory legal act; (c) a description of the revealed norms of corruption; (d) assessment of the consequences of the adoption of the norm of the draft regulatory legal act regarding the possibility of committing corruption offenses; and (e) proposals for the elimination of the identified corruption-related norms, including the number of recommendations in the form of legal norms that prevent the commission corruption offenses.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: These Methodical Recommendations enter into force on the date of signature.

Policy: Government Resolution No. 28/2020 approving Short-term Measures to Mitigate the Impacts of the Economic Crisis Resulting from the Covid-19 Pandemic in the context of the Economic Recovery Plan.
Policy_Content: This Government Resolution approves, under article 115 of the Constitution of the Republic, the following short-term measures to mitigate the economic and social impacts of the crisis caused by the pandemic of COVID-19: a) Assignment of a specific set of food and personal hygiene goods essential items, called “basic basket”, or, alternatively, of a shopping voucher attached to the corresponding goods to be granted to all citizens or residents in Timor-Leste; b) Support for companies and other employers in the private sector, through the creation of a monthly subsidy of a monetary nature; c) Exemption from the duty to pay social contributions by employers, related to the portion they are responsible for, for a period of six months; d) Support for workers in the informal sector, through the creation of a subsidy to be granted to self-employed workers and all the informal labor workers who are not yet registered with Social Security, etc.

Policy: Resolución Nº 7 - Crea el "Plan LEC - Emergencia" con el fin de atender los efectos adversos generados a la actividad agropecuaria por el Covid-19.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución de la Comisión Nacional de Crédito Agropecuario (CNCA) crea el "Plan LEC - Emergencia", con el fin de atender los efectos adversos generados a la actividad agropecuaria por el Covid-19, mediante Líneas Especiales de Crédito (LEC) provenientes del Fondo de Mitigación de Emergencias (FOME). Este Plan está dirigido a los productores de alimentos, en los diversos eslabones de la cadena de valor, afectados como consecuencia del coronavirus Covid-19 y las afectaciones económicas, logísticas y de transporte que este ha ocasionado, así mismo, para hacer frente a las contingencias, como la necesidad de implementar los protocolos de bioseguridad para la prevención del contagio de dicho coronavirus, los recursos para el otorgamiento de los subsidios provendrán del Fondo de Mitigación de Emergencias (FOME) y otras fuentes del Presupuesto General de la Nación. Las LEC-Emergencia están sujetas a las reglas previstas en la presente Resolución y a lo establecido en la Resolución Nº 3 de 2016 y aquellas que la modifiquen y/o sustituyan.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG635/2020 validating the Regulation on the use of groundwater for drip irrigation of agricultural land under horticultural crops.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the use of groundwater for drip irrigation of agricultural land under horticultural crops establishes the procedure for providing groundwater use rights for drip irrigation of agricultural lands under horticultural crops, technical regulations for determining the suitability of soil and groundwater quality used for irrigation. The use of groundwater for drip irrigation of agricultural land under horticultural crops shall be authorized subject to the following aggregate conditions: (a) in the area of the location of agricultural land, there are no necessary sources of surface water for irrigation, but there are sufficient reserves of groundwater, which do not lead to a decrease in national security and reliability and do not affect sustainable supply of the population with drinking water, this fact is confirmed by the conclusion, issued by the Agency "Apele Moldovei", and an opinion issued by the Agency for Geology and Mineral Resources; (b) the technical conditions for the quality of groundwater do not exceed the indicators, established in tables 2 and 3 of the Annex, which is established by soil suitability study report issued by scientific institutions in the field of soil with an accredited laboratory; and (c) soil is suitable for irrigation in accordance with the parameters specified in tables 1, 4-7 contained in the Annex to this Regulation, which is confirmed by the research report on soil suitability, issued by scientific institutions in the field of soil, having accredited laboratory.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants, Water

Policy: Royal Decree No.106/2020 establishing the Environment Authority, determining its competences, and adopting its Organizational Structure.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 9 articles and 2 Annexes aims at establishing a public authority named the Environment Authority and subordinate to the Council of Ministers. The Authority has, among others, the following main tasks (i) propose policies, strategic plans, and requirements related to environmental protection and sustainability, pollution control, and nature conservation, and follow-up their implementation, evaluation, and development; (ii) secure the safety of the environment, combat pollution and preserve the various ecosystems; (iii) protect wildlife, preserve nature, preserve renewable resources, and work on using them in a sustainable manner; (iv) contribute to the development of scientific research horizons in the environmental fields, exchange experiences, and collect scientific data; (v) work on spreading awareness and instilling the concepts of the requirements of dealing with the environment among all segments of society, and consolidating the principles of preserving the environment and its natural resources; (vi)  prepare draft laws and royal decrees related to the authority’s competencies; (vii) strengthen and develop cooperation in the competencies related to the authority with other concerned parties in countries and specialized regional and international organizations and institutions; (viii) work to implement the decisions emanating from international agreements related to the Authority to which the Sultanate is a party. All allocations, assets, rights, obligations, and holdings of the Ministry of Environment and Climate Affairs relating to the environment are hereby transferred to the Environment Authority (art.5). The phrase “Ministry of Environment and Climate Affairs” wherever it occurs concerning the environment is hereby replaced with the phrase “Environment Authority” (art.7).

Policy: Royal Decree No.92/2020 amending the name of the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries to the Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Water Resources, defining its functions and approving its organizational structure.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 7 articles and 2 Annexes aims at modifying the name of the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries and expanding its mandate to cover water resources. Its functions are defined in Annex 1, main of them are (i) establish the policies, plans and programs for the development and exploitation of agricultural, animal and water resources, food security, and submit them to the Council of Ministers for approval; (ii) prepare laws and regulations, decrees and resolutions relating to the management of resources within its competence; (iii) in coordination with the competent ministries, it deals with regulating investments in the related sectors; (iv) carry out research and sector studies; (v) prepare guidance and refresher programs for farmers, breeders and fishermen; (vi) develop smart water management for irrigation, its sustainable use, agricultural development, and combat desertification; (vii) increase disease prevention in animal resources and protect them from mismanagement; (viii) protect living water resources from misuse by defining the methods and means whose use is permitted for fishing; (ix) develop aquaculture and facilitate its sustainability; (x) increase the safety and quality of agricultural, animal and fish products; (xi) manage the administration and marketing of agricultural, animal and fish products; (xii) create and improve the management of marine fishing ports; (xiii) improve the scope of food security, from a legislative, organizational point of view, together with cooperation with the private sector and NGOs and the management of food stocks.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 021-2020-EM — Modifica el Decreto Supremo Nº 039-2016-EM, Reglamento de la Ley Nº 30321, Ley de creación del Fondo de Contingencia para Remediación Ambiental.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo modifica el Reglamento de la Ley que crea el Fondo de Contingencia para Remediación Ambiental, a fin de optimizar y agilizar el procedimiento para la remediación ambiental de los sitios impactados. A tal propósito, se actualizan las funciones de la Autoridad sectorial competente a velar por la adecuada remediación de sitios impactados a cargo del Estado, desarrollando las siguientes funciones: 1) Realizar acciones de acompañamiento a la Empresa Consultora durante la elaboración del Plan de Rehabilitación, en aquellos casos en que la remediación ambiental se encuentre a cargo del Estado y de manera facultativa en los casos de Planes de Rehabilitación a cargo de una Empresa Responsable; 2) Evaluar y aprobar el Plan de Rehabilitación; 3) Realizar acciones de acompañamiento a la Empresa Remediadora durante la ejecución del Plan de Rehabilitación, en aquellos casos en que la remediación ambiental se encuentre a cargo del Estado; 4) Emitir opinión técnica sobre los Términos de Referencia para la contratación de la Empresa Consultora y la Empresa Remediadora de acuerdo a los Contenidos de los Planes de Rehabilitación; 5) Otorgar la conformidad técnica a los entregables a cargo de la Empresa Consultora y Empresa Remediadora que sirva de base para la emisión de las conformidades de pago que emita PROFONANPE; 6) Emitir la conformidad al expediente técnico de ingeniería de detalle para la ejecución de la remediación aprobada en el Plan de Rehabilitación; 7) Tramitar la obtención de los permisos y otras autorizaciones que sean requeridos en la elaboración y ejecución del Plan de Rehabilitación; 8) Administrar la base de datos georreferenciada, de acceso público, sobre los sitios impactados y las acciones que se ejecuten respecto de los mismos; 9) Elaborar, suscribir y gestionar los convenios que fueran necesarios para la transferencia de recursos financieros con el PROFONANPE; 10) Informar a la Junta de Administración los sitios impactados que sean asumidos por las Empresas Responsables, así como los avances en el ejercicio de las funciones a su cargo.

Policy: Royal Decree 105/2020 establishing the Public Authority for Special Economic Zones and Free Zones and determining its Competences.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 11 articles and 1 Annex aims at establishing the Public Authority for Special Economic Zones and Free Zones, subordinate to the Council of Ministers. The Authority, among others, has the following main tasks (i) suggest policies and strategic plans in a way that contributes to achieving the development plans of the State; (ii) implement, follow-up, and evaluate the approved strategic policies and plans; (iii) prepare studies, plans and programs related to the Authority's competencies; (iv) supervise the Special Economic Zones and Free Zones; (v) propose their establishment and take procedures for issuing a Royal Decree establishing them, determining their location and limits, and the incentives, benefits, and facilities granted to both the operating entity and the operating company; (vi) regulate the investment environment; (vii) decide the usufruct right on state-owned lands located in the special economic zones and free zones (viii) regulate the application of the one-stop system; (ix) issue all types of licenses, approvals, and certificates related to the exercise of economic activities; (x) provide services and establish the necessary public utilities; (xi) determine the activities and projects that can be practiced in the special economic zones and free zones; (xii) approve concession agreements; (xiii) coordinate with the competent authorities to provide security and emergency services; (xiv) lay down the rules regulating the movement of goods and the movement of people to and from special economic zones and free zones.

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 44/2020 approving the Regulation of the Ministry of Land and Environment.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order approves the Regulation of the Ministry of Land and Environment. The Ministry of Land and Environment is the central organ of the State apparatus which, in accordance with the principles, objectives and tasks defined by the Government, directs, plans and coordinates, controls and ensures the implementation of policies in the domains of Land administration and management and Geomatics, Forests and Wildlife, Environment, Climate Change and Conservation Areas. The Ministry of Land and Environment has the following attributions: a) Planning and territorial planning for the country's sustainable development; b) Formulation of proposals for the implementation of policies, legislation and integrated development strategies for land, environment and climate change, conservation areas, forests and wildlife; c) Land administration and management; d) Administration, management and sustainable use of forests and wildlife; e) Administration and management of the national network of conservation areas; f) Promotion of knowledge development in the field of land and environment; g) Warranty, maintenance and development in the environmental area; h) Definition and implementation of education, awareness and dissemination strategies; i) Intersectoral coordination and sustainable use of available resources for sustainable development.

Policy: Law No. 133 “On water disposal and treatment facilities of the Issyk-Kul Biosphere Territory.”
Policy_Content: This Law is aimed at realizing the rights of citizens to a favorable life and healthy ecological environment, preservation of a unique ecological system, biosphere territory "Issyk-Kol" ("Issyk-Kul"), taking into account the inclusion of the biosphere reserve "Issyk-Kol" ("Issyk-Kul") into the Planetary Network of Biosphere Reserves of  UN Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO), created as a territory for the preservation of objects of the world historical and cultural heritage and unique ecosystems, with the consideration of the status of a protected natural area of national significance, the importance of protecting and preserving flora and fauna, with a view of reducing adverse effects of wastewater on the environment, preventing pollution of the ecosystem of Issyk-Kul lake as a result of the implementation of economic, commercial, recreational and other activities related to the direct discharge of household and other wastewater into Issyk-Kul lake. Inhabited areas, recreation facilities, industrial facilities, public catering facilities within the zone of the biosphere territory "Ysyk-Kol" ("Issyk-Kul") must be provided with water disposal (sewerage) and (or) wastewater treatment facilities.

Policy: Ley Núm. 107 de 14 de agosto de 2020, según enmendada- Código Municipal de Puerto Rico.
Policy_Content: La presente ley crea el Código Municipal de Puerto Rico con el fin integrar, organizar y actualizar las leyes que disponen sobre la organización, administración y funcionamiento de los Municipios; y añadir nuevos modelos procesales para la consecución de mayor autonomía para estos.El Código es una legislación de avanzada, que se compone de ocho (8) libros, que a su vez se subdividen en capítulos y artículos. El Libro I, se titula “Gobierno Municipal” e incluye las normas, reglas y leyes concernientes a los poderes y facultades de la figura del Alcalde como representante del poder ejecutivo y a los poderes y facultades de la Legislatura Municipal. El Libro II, se refiere a todo lo relacionado a la “Administración Municipal” y contiene aquellas disposiciones relacionadas a la planificación, organización y control de los recursos que dispone el municipio. A su vez, el Libro II se divide en: “Procesos Municipales” y “Gerencia Financiera”. En el Libro III dispone sobre los “Servicios Municipales”, y se agrupan aquellas actividades de importancia trascendental y de utilidad pública que el gobierno municipal debe realizar y cuya interrupción afectaría adversamente el bienestar y estabilidad de sus residentes. El Libro III se subdivide en cuatro (4) partes que agrupan temas de interés municipal y ciudadano, tales como: “Tránsito y Obras Públicas”; “Salud y Seguridad Pública”; “Recreación y Deportes”; y “Educación”. El Libro IV recoge los “Procesos Municipales y Gestión Comunitaria”, que nos dirige a los procedimientos municipales específicamente vinculantes al desarrollo de las comunidades y la participación ciudadana. En el Libro V se establece el tema de “Desarrollo Económico” que incluye las normas, reglas y leyes concernientes a la capacidad de los gobiernos municipales para auspiciar, promover y mercadear el establecimiento de negocios e industrias, y fomentar el desarrollo turístico, con el propósito de crear nuevos empleos y mejorar la salud fiscal en general. El tema de “Planificación y Ordenamiento Territorial” se agrupa en el Libro VI que incluye todo lo concerniente al uso sostenible de los terrenos municipales, tomando en consideración los aspectos sociales, culturales y económicos que componen su jurisdicción geográfica. Por último, el Libro VII, titulado “Hacienda Municipal”, establece las normas, reglas y leyes relacionadas a los ingresos y financiamiento para la operación de los municipios.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1126 - Renueva el estado de excepción por calamidad pública en todo el territorio nacional, por la presencia de la COVID-19 en el Ecuador.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto renueva el estado de excepción por calamidad pública en todo el territorio nacional, por la presencia de la COVID-19 en el Ecuador, a fin de poder continuar con el control de la enfermedad a través de medidas excepcionales necesarias para mitigar su contagio masivo en el Estado ecuatoriano. Se dispone la movilización en todo el territorio nacional, de tal manera que, respecto de la presencia de la COVID-19 en el país, todas las entidades de la Administración Pública Central e Institucional trabajen conjuntamente para poder mantener las medidas de prevención necesarias frente a la COVID-19, y en especial el. Ministerio de Salud Pública y el Servicio Nacional de Gestión de Riesgos y Emergencia coordinen de modo permanente acciones orientadas a atender y mitigar los efectos del coronavirus en el Ecuador. De la movilización de las Fuerzas Armadas, reafírmese que su participación en el restablecimiento del orden público es complementaria a las acciones de la Policía Nacional en cumplimiento del marco legislativo vigente en materia de Seguridad Pública y del Estado y que su participación específica estará relacionada con la colaboración en el control de las limitaciones de derechos dispuestas.

Policy: Joint Order No. 41/2020 approving the Coastal Zone and Adjacent Sea Territorial Planning of the Boa Vista Island.
Policy_Content: This Joint Order, consisting of 87 articles divided into six Titles and several Annexes, approves the Coastal Zone and Adjacent Sea Territorial Planning (POOCM) on the island of Boa Vista, under the terms of Decree-Law No. 43/2010 of 27 September on the National Regulation of Territorial and Urban Planning (RNOTPU) and Decree-Law No. 14/2016 of 1 March, regulating the process of preparing and implementing the Territorial Plans for the Coastal Zone and the Adjacent Sea. The POOC_M's scope of intervention covers, on the island of Boa Vista, a land area and an adjacent maritime area, according to article 16. This POOC_M is a territorial management instrument of a special and regulatory nature under the terms established in article 63 of Decree-Law No. 43/2010 of 27 September, as amended. The POOC_M of Boa Vista has as its main objective the integrated management of the territory and the coastal zone, establishing rules to which the occupation, use and transformation of the land covered by its scope and the regime for the protection of natural resources and values must obey.

Policy: Order No. 485 of the Ministry of Agriculture validating the Regulation on the procedure for accounting of reclamation protective forest plantations, provision of information subject to accounting, composition thereof and form of submittal.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for accounting of reclamation protective forest plantations, provision of information subject to accounting, composition thereof and form of submittal. Ministry of Agriculture and authorized regional bodies in the field of land reclamation shall perform accounting in accordance with data submitted by owners of land plots on which ameliorative protective forest plantations are located and in accordance with cadastral data, monitoring data of reclaimed land and other sources of information. Accounting shall be applicable to: (a) protective plantations located on public land pertaining to state property of the Russian Federation; (b) protective plantations located on public land pertaining to state property of the regions of the Russian Federation; (c) protective plantations located on municipal land or on land with undelimited ownership; and (d) protective plantations located on private land.
