Policy: Order No. 187 of the Ministry of Ecology, Geology and Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the provision of public services in the field of licensing export of wildlife and forestry.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates provision of public services in the field of licensing export of wildlife and forestry products related to licensing of export of wild fauna species, including rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species recorded in the Red Book of the Republic of Kazakhstan, some wild flora species and medicinal plants. The aforesaid public service shall be provided by the Committee on Forestry and Wildlife subordinated to the Ministry of Ecology, Geology and Natural Resources. In order to obtain license the applicant shall submit the following documentation: (a) electronic copy of foreign trade agreement (contract), application and (or) additions to it (for a one-time license), and in the absence of foreign trade agreement (contract) - a copy of another document confirming the intentions of the parties; (b) electronic copy of the license to carry out the licensed activity or information on the existence of a license to carry out the licensed activities, if this type of activity is related to the turnover of goods, in relation to which licensing was introduced on the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan; (c) an electronic copy of the document confirming payment to the state budget of licensing fees, except in cases of payments through the e-government payment gateway; and (d) electronic copy of documents on compliance with qualification requirements according to this Regulation.  In order to renew license and (or) annexes to license the applicant shall submit the following documentation: (a) electronic copy of the document confirming payment of the licensing fee, except in cases of payments through the e-government payment gateway; (b) electronic copy of documents containing information about changes, which served as the basis for the renewal of the license and (or) annexes to licenses, except for documents the information from which is contained in state information systems; (c) list of basic requirements for the provision of public service, including characteristics of the process, form, content and result of rendering, as well as other information and data with the consideration of the peculiarities of the provision of public services set out in the standard of the state service "Issuance of the license for export of wild live animals, separate wild plants and wild medicinal plants" according to this Regulation.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Resolución  Nº 177/2020 – Apruébase el “Programa Fomento de Unidades de Producción y Distribución Agroecológicas”.
Policy_Content: La Autoridad de Cuenca Matanza Riachuelo (ACUMAR) fue creada mediante Ley Nº 26.168 y busca impulsar líneas de articulación que tiendan a lograr la adecuación ambiental de los sectores de la producción y de las prácticas sociales y económicas que tienen lugar en la Cuenca Matanza Riachuelo. La presente Resolución ACUMAR, habida cuenta que el uso masivo de agroquímicos propio de la explotación agropecuaria extensiva ha dado lugar a diversas problemáticas ambientales y de salubridad, crea un programa con el objetivo de impulsar el desarrollo de la agroecología, como modelo de producción agropecuario sostenible que genere empleo digno, alimentos sanos y soberanos. El Programa incluye los siguientes componentes: a) Actividades de Promoción; b) Fortalecimiento de las capacidades de las unidades de producción y distribución agroecológica; y c) Extensión y escalamiento; todos ellos según las características y condiciones estipuladas en el Anexo I. Los objetivos específicos que persigue el Programa son: a) Desarrollar una política que aborde las distintas problemáticas que se derivan de los sistemas agrícolas predominantes que se desarrollan en la Cuenca; b) Impulsar, promover y fortalecer experiencias agroecológicas, así como la participación integrada de planes, programas, acciones provenientes de diversos actores gubernamentales, institucionales y sociales; c) Propiciar las buenas prácticas ambientales, procurando el menor uso de productos de síntesis química y contribuyendo así a la obtención de alimentos seguros, sano y soberanos para los y las habitantes; d) Facilitar ámbitos de acceso a las herramientas, técnicas y de conocimiento, necesarias para los procesos de transición hacia la producción agroecológica; e) Fortalecer las experiencias agroecológicas ya existentes en los Municipios y Comunas de la Cuenca; f) Promover procesos participativos e innovaciones institucionales para el intercambio de conocimientos; g) Impulsar el consumo consciente; h) Asistir en la promoción y fortalecimiento de los circuitos de comercialización cortos que unen productores y consumidores locales; i) Promover la equidad, en especial de jóvenes y mujeres, en estos procesos.

Policy: Plan National de Lutte contre la Secheresse au Burundi (PNS Burundi).
Policy_Content: Le plan national sécheresse est un Plan national cross sectoriel du Burundi, pour la période 2020-2030, visant à mettre en place un système fiable et fonctionnel pour faire face au problème de la sécheresse et pour réduire la vulnérabilité du pays à la sécheresse en tenant compte des groupes vulnérables y compris les femmes et les enfants. Le Plan vise particulièrement à : (i) mettre en place des systèmes de surveillance de la sécheresse et d'alerte précoce ; (ii) évaluer la vulnérabilité et les risques liés à la sécheresse ; et (iii) mettre en oeuvre des mesures pour mieux répondre à la sécheresse et limiter ses impacts. En bref, il se voit préparer les personnes, les communautés et les écosystèmes à une résilience efficace. De façon plus spécifique, le plan national sécheresse permettra d' identifier les facteurs clés de vulnérabilité actuelle et future dans différents secteurs et prioritiser les options d'atténuation et d'adaptation à mettre en oeuvre ; de proposer des investissements structurants nécessaires à l'amélioration des capacités d'adaptation et de résilience des communautés en particulier les femmes et les enfants et autres groupes vulnérables afin de les protéger contre les impacts actuels et futurs de la sécheresse ; de proposer un cadre politique et institutionnel approprié pour une gestion efficace de la sécheresse, un accès des femmes dans les instances de décision et les mécanismes de gouvernance économique, politique y compris la paix et la sécurité.

Policy: Law No. 1714 “On combating corruption.”
Policy_Content: This Law defines the organizational and legal framework for combating corruption and is aimed at protecting human and civil rights and freedoms, the interests of the state and society, ensuring national security, the normal activities of state bodies and impartiality in the public service. Corruption shall be intended an act (action or inaction) committed by a person authorized to perform public functions, or persons equated thereto, using their position and opportunities, in their own interests or in the interests of another person for illegal receipt of material and non-material benefits, in their favor or in favor of  others, as well as personally or indirectly provide material and non-material benefits, advantages or other benefits to the subjects of offenses related to corruption, in order to induce them or reward them for committing such actions in favor of natural persons or legal entities. Anti-corruption shall be intended activities of anti-corruption entities in the field of suppression, detection, disclosure, inquiry and investigation of offenses related to corruption, and bringing to justice the subjects of offenses related to corruption, elimination of the causes and conditions for the occurrence of corruption and the consequences of corruption offenses. This Law applies to the subjects of offenses related to corruption, unless otherwise provided in international legal acts recognized by Tajikistan. Anti-corruption activities shall be carried out on the basis of the following principles: (a) legality; (b) justice; (c) priority of human and civil rights and freedoms; (d) equality of all before the law; (e) transparency and publicity; (f) inevitability of responsibility for committing offenses related to corruption; (g) suppression and termination of the consequences of offenses related to corruption; (h) ensuring personal safety and legal guarantees of persons assisting in anti-corruption; and (i) cooperation of state bodies with civil society institutions. Subjects directly countering corruption are: (a) Agency for State Financial Control and Combating Corruption of the Republic of Tajikistan; (b) General Prosecutor's Office of the Republic of Tajikistan; (c) Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Republic of Tajikistan; (d) Ministry of Defense of the Republic of Tajikistan; (e) State Committee for National Security of the Republic of Tajikistan; (f) Agency for Drug Control under the President of the Republic of Tajikistan; (g) National Guard of the Republic of Tajikistan; (h) Customs Service under the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan; and (i) courts of the Republic of Tajikistan. Corruption prevention is one of the anti-corruption measures and is implemented in the following ways: (a) anti-corruption campaigning and propaganda; (b) anti-corruption training and education; (c) analysis of corruption risks; (d) anti-corruption monitoring; (e) anti-corruption expertise of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts; (f) measures of state financial control; (g) special requirements for applicants for public office and persons authorized for the performance of state duties; (h) obstacles to appointment or election to public office and office equated thereto; and (i) introduction of restrictions in the performance of duties of public office and positions equated thereto.
Subject: General

Policy: Order No. 576 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the Koigorodsky National Park.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the Koigorodsky National Park located in the Republic of Komi. Koigorodsky National Park shall perform the following tasks: (a) preservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural plots and objects; (b) preservation of historical and cultural sites; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) creation of conditions for regulated tourism and recreation; (e) implementation of scientific (research) activities in the field of environmental protection in order to develop measures for the preservation and development of natural potential and recreational potential of the Russian Federation; (f) implementation of state ecological monitoring; and (g) restoration of damaged natural and historical and cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the Koigorodsky National Park shall be prohibited any activity contrary to the tasks of national park and could damage natural complexes and objects, wild fauna species and objects of historical and cultural heritage, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) modification of hydrogeological regime and soil disturbance; (c) allotment of land plots for horticulture and peri-urban agriculture; (d) construction of main roads, pipelines, power lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for objects of the tourist industry, museums and information centers, objects associated with the functioning of the national park and residential areas located within the boundaries of the national park; (e) timber extraction, except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs; (f) procurement of soft resin and edible non-timber products; (g) commercial, sport and amateurish hunting; (h) industrial fisheries, fisheries for aquaculture (fishfarming) and aquaculture (fishfarming); (i) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora; (j) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical specimens except for scientific research purposes envisaged by schedules; (k) introduction of live organisms for acclimatization purposes; (l) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (m) logging along watercourses and waterbodies; (n) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and fires outside specially reserved areas; (o) unauthorized archaeological excavations, collection and export objects of historical and cultural heritage; (p) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, hunting gear, as well as with wildlife products, except for authorized officials; (q) explosive works; (r) burning of vegetation; (s) clear cutting; (t) waste disposal; (u) washing, movement and parking of motor vehicles outside common access roads; (v) destruction and damaging of noticeboards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and equipped ecological paths and recreation areas; (w) ploughing up, application of toxic chemicals, plant protection means, fertilizers and growth stimulators; (x) flight of aircraft below 500 meters over the territory national park without the approval of the administration of national park; and (y) haymaking and stay with dogs (except for service dogs), keeping unleashed dogs and training of dogs.

Policy_Content: This Act establishes the National Public Health Institute of South Africa and, among other things; promote cooperation between the Republic and other countries with regard to epidemiological surveillance and management of diseases, exposures and injuries; coordinate, develop and maintain surveillance systems to collect, analyse and interpret public, occupational and environmental health data in order to guide health interventions; use surveillance data and other sources of information, where appropriate, to advise on the setting of health policies, priorities and planning; use public, occupational and environmental health information for monitoring and evaluation of policies and interventions;  coordinate reference laboratory and referral services; provide leadership and direction to provinces and local authorities in respect of disease and injury surveillance and outbreak response; strengthen capacity in public, occupational and environmental health surveillance in order to reduce the burden of disease and injury; strengthen the capacity of the workforce in occupational and environmental health by developing the curriculum for occupational and environmental health; and strengthen cross-border, regional and international collaboration on communicable diseases, non-communicable diseases, occupational health and safety. The Act provides for the composition, governance and control of the Institute.

Policy: Ordinance № 2 of 5 August 2020 on the implementation of measure 21 "Extraordinary temporary support for farmers and small and medium-sized enterprises that are particularly affected by crisis caused by COVID-19" of the Rural Development Programme for the period 2014-2020.
Policy_Content: This Ordinance, as in accordance with the terms of national Law on support to farmers, lays down the conditions and procedure for the implementation of measure number 21 "Extraordinary temporary support for farmers and small and medium-sized enterprises particularly affected by the crisis caused by COVID-19" part of the Rural Development Programme for the period 2014 - 2020, and co-financed by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD). Farmers, micro, small and medium-sized enterprises and producer groups and organizations, which are particularly affected by the crisis caused by COVID-19, shall be supported, and the support will achieve the following objectives: 1. guaranteeing the competitiveness of agriculture and the viability of agricultural holdings; 2. ensuring continuity of the agricultural activities and of the activity of the small enterprises, engaged in processing, marketing or development of agricultural products; 3. preserving the health of those employed in agriculture.

Su artículo primero establece que, hasta el 31 de diciembre de 2021, las empresas proveedoras de servicios sanitarios, empresas y cooperativas de distribución de electricidad y las empresas de distribución de gas de red no podrán cortar el suministro por mora en el pago a los usuarios,  que se indican, incluyendo a los usuarios residenciales o domiciliarios. Policy: Order No. 562 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the Vasyugan State Nature Reserve.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve "Magadansky" shall be constituted in Tomsk region with a view of performing the following tasks: (a) protection of natural areas for the purpose of conservation of biological diversity and conservation in the natural state of protected natural complexes and objects; (b) organization and conduct of scientific research; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) ecological education and promotion of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in training of scientific research staff and environmental protection personnel. Any activity contrasting the statute of the reserve shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve, including: (a) commercial, amateurish and sport hunting; (b) industrial fisheries, fisheries for aquaculture (fishfarming) and aquaculture (fishfarming); (c) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, hunting gear, as well as with wildlife products, except for authorized officials; (d) stay with fishing gear and catch, except for authorized officials; (e) exploration and mining; (f) soil disturbance; (g) modification of hydrological regime of soil; (h) procurement of soft resin, clear cutting, procurement of non-timber forest resources and medicinal plants, except for cases envisaged by this Regulation; (i) logging of timber on waterways; (f) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (j) placement of hives and apiaries; (k) ploughing up, except for forest fire prevention measures; (l) haymaking, except as fire prevention measures; (m) construction, reconstruction, repair and operation of capital construction facilities, including line structures, not related to the fulfilment of tasks and the functioning of the reserve; (n) explosive works; (o) burning of vegetation; (p) logging along watercourses and waterbodies; (q) allotment of land plots for housing construction, gardening and horticulture; (r) introduction of wild fauna and wild flora species for acclimatization purposes; (s) application of pesticides, mineral fertilizers and chemical plant protection products and growth stimulants, the use of toxic chemicals for the protection of forests, including for scientific purposes; (t) waste disposal; (u) passage and parking of motor vehicles outside common access roads, navigation of vessels outside watercourses of common access; (v) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical specimens; (w) stay with dogs, except for service dogs, keeping unleashed dogs and training of dogs; (x) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; (y) destruction and damaging of noticeboards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and equipped ecological paths and recreation areas; and (z) disturbance of wild animal species and feeding thereof by visitors.

Policy: Resource Management (National Environmental Standards for Freshwater) Regulations 2020 (LI 2020/174).
Policy_Content: The Regulations are organised in 4 Parts. Part 1 entails preliminary provisions. Part 2 lays down standards for farming activities; it applies just to farms of a certain size and the listed farming activities are categorised into permitted, discretionary and non-complying activities. The activities considered under this part concern feedlots and stockholding areas (Subpart 1), agricultural intensification as conversions of plantation forestry to pastoral land use, conversions of land on farm to dairy farm land, irrigation of dairy farm land, use of land as dairy support land (Subpart 2 – these are temporary provisions and this subpart is revoked on 1 January 2025), intensive winter grazing activities (Subpart 3 – some of which are revoked on 1 January 2025), application of synthetic nitrogen fertiliser to pastoral land (Subpart 4 – further monitoring and information is required for whom operates a dairy farm).

Policy: National Policy Statement for Freshwater Management 2020.
Policy_Content: The National Policy Statement for Freshwater Management 2020 is based on the “Te Mana o te Wai” concept of restoring and preserving the balance between the water, the wider environment, and the community. National Policy Statement’s objective follow the hierarchy of obligations of the “Te Mana o te Wai” concept that is to ensure that natural and physical resources are managed in a way that prioritises: (a) first, the health and well-being of water bodies and freshwater ecosystems (b) second, the health needs of people (such as drinking water) (c) third, the ability of people and communities to provide for their social, economic, and cultural well-being, now and in the future. Moreover, “Te Mana o te Wai” as a fundamental concept, goes beyond the specific aspects of freshwater management referred to in this National Policy Statement and is relevant to all freshwater management issues (Part 2).

Policy: Law No. 104 “On cultivation of nut plantations in the Kyrgyz Republic.”
Policy_Content: This Law regulates activities related to the cultivation of walnut plantations on land outside the territory of the state forest fund, including the use of walnut fruits, wood, production and sale of nut products, purchase, procurement, manufacturing of products, felling, and growing planting material. Conservation, development and growth of the production potential of walnut plantations shall be regulated by authorized bodies established by the Government of Kyrgyz Republic. Activities related to the cultivation of the walnut plantation and production of nuts, trade, cultivation of planting material on land located in the state or municipal property, shall be performed by agreement with state bodies, local self-government bodies in accordance with the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic on the effective use of land plot and only for its intended purpose. Walnut plantations located on land of state property shall be the property of the state. Walnut plantations located on land of municipal property, shall be the property of local self-government.  Walnut plantations located on private land shall be property of natural persons and (or) legal entities - owners of land plots.

Policy: Beverage Containers Recycling Regulations, 2020
Policy_Content: The objective of these regulations is to enhance the circular economy by making provision for the establishment and operation of a beverage container refund scheme, enhance the collection and recycling of beverage containers, increase national recycling efforts, reduce litter. These regulations implement the provisions of Directive 94/62/EC on packaging and packaging waste with respect to beverage containers, but they do not exempt producers from their obligations under the Waste Management (Packaging and Packaging Waste) Regulations for any beverages or beverage containers or other forms of packaging that are not covered under these regulations. The regulations are composed of eight parts, organized in 44 articles, plus five schedules. After providing for the definitions in the first part, the Regulations make provisions for the licence necessary to operate beverage container refund system scheme (part II). The third part describe the scheme, according to which whoever intends to make available, on the market any beverage container shall register with the licensed operator and shall register any such beverage container by providing the licensed operator with all the details that it may require for the purposes of the operation of the Scheme. The fourth part provides for the exemption from the Scheme for refillable containers. Part five sets rules for Return of beverage containers to retailers operating redemption locations and catering on behalf of the licensed operator or the producer. Part six is dedicated to enforcement and penalties. Part seven provides for the submission of an annual report by the Resource, Recovery and Recycling Agency to the Minister. Part eight brings various provisions (miscellaneous). The schedules follow, concerning the beverages falling within the scope of the regulations, the container specifications, the minimum deposit value for containers, the registration fee for every beverage type intended to be placed on the market and the collection targets.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Ley Nº 21.252 - Establece un financiamiento con aporte fiscal para la protección de los ingresos de la clase media en los casos que indica.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece, con motivo de la propagación de la enfermedad denominada COVID-19, un financiamiento con aporte fiscal para la protección de los ingresos de las personas que cumplan los requisitos establecidos en el Artículo 2. El financiamiento contemplado en la Ley se divide en dos tipos. El primero se denomina "Aporte Fiscal" y consiste en un financiamiento pagadero por una sola vez y sin la obligación de reintegrarlo, que fluctúa entre $100.000 y $500.000, según el ingreso promedio mensual del beneficiario (Artículo 4). El segundo se denomina "el beneficio" y consiste en un monto en dinero mensual, que podrá ser solicitado por un máximo de tres meses, continuos o discontinuos, durante un período de cinco meses a contar del 8 de agosto de 2020, y que se devolverá al Fisco a través del Servicio de Tesorerías, en cuatro cuotas anuales y sucesivas, sin multas ni intereses (Artículos 5-7). Su monto se calculará mensualmente, y ascenderá al 70% del resultado positivo de la diferencia entre el Ingreso Promedio Mensual y el Ingreso Mensual, según la definición de estos términos contemplada en el Artículo 3 (Artículo 5).

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 562 validating Flood Risk Management Plan.
Policy_Content: Flood Risk Management Plan is a nationwide policy document covering the basins of Dniester, Prut and Black Sea. Dam failure is a potentially serious cause of flooding where there is a risk of “cascade failure”. The flood wave caused by the break of the first dam travels downstream and causes other dams to break. A related problem is the siltation of reservoirs. This negatively affects not only the volume of water available in the storage facilities, but also the hydraulic regime downstream.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG586/2020 validating the Regulation on the management of batteries and accumulators and waste batteries and accumulators.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the management of batteries and accumulators and waste batteries and accumulators regulates the categories of waste batteries and batteries listed in Annex No. 1, in order to prevent or reduce impact on the environment and public health, thereby contributing to sustainable development of society. This Regulation establishes the conditions for the protection of the health of all those involved in life cycle of batteries and accumulators, i.e., manufacturers, importers, distributors, consumers and economic agents directly involved in collection, processing, recycling and environmentally friendly waste disposal of batteries and accumulators, by preventing or reducing negative consequences of waste generation and management, also by increasing the efficiency of waste use. This Regulation sets out the requirements for placing on the market of batteries and accumulators, and specific rules for collection, handling, recycling and disposal of waste batteries and accumulators, in particular the ban on placing on the market of batteries and accumulators containing hazardous chemicals. Manufacturers, importers, distributors, consumers and economic agents take the necessary measures to optimize the separate collection of used batteries and accumulators, minimizing the disposal of batteries and accumulators in the form of mixed municipal waste, also in order to achieve a high level of recycling for all waste batteries and accumulators, thereby contributing to the implementation of the principle of extended manufacturer's responsibility.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG561/2020 validating the Regulation on packaging materials and packaging waste.
Policy_Content: The Regulation on packaging materials and packaging waste regulates handling of packaging materials and packaging waste related management and prevention or reduction of environmental impact while providing a high level of protection of the environment, the functioning of the market and the elimination of barriers to trade, preventing distortion or restriction of competition. This Regulation sets out priority measures aimed at prevention of packaging waste, as well as principles for reducing the final disposal of packaging waste through reuse, recycling and development. The requirements of this Regulation apply to all types of packaging, used on the market, no matter what material they were made of, how used or where they come from: industry, offices, shops, services, households of the population or any other type of activity, as well as all packaging waste, regardless of its origin. Targets for recovery and recycling of packaging waste shall be as follows: (a) development of at least 50% of the mass of packaging waste; (b) processing of at least 45% of the total mass of packaging materials contained in packaging waste, with the achievement of the following minimum recycling values for each type of material contained in packaging waste: (1) 45% by weight for glass; (2) 50% weight for paper / board; (3) 40% by weight for metal; (4) 10% wood mass; and (5) 20% weight for plastic, including only recycled plastic.

Policy: Law on innovation activity.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the organization, conditions, manner of financing and encouraging of innovation activities, aimed to improve the national innovation system through the development of innovation capacity and innovation infrastructure, for the needs of economic development of Montenegro, as well as other issues of importance for innovation. Innovation activity means a set of activities of the state and local self-government, business sector, scientific and academic community, civil sector and citizens, whose goal is modernization of the economy, development and application of product and process innovations, use of innovative production technologies, introduction of new business models, etc., as well as capacity development and infrastructure for such activities. Innovative activities performed by subjects of innovation activity for the purpose of innovation creation are: research and development; engineering, design and other creative activities; marketing and branding; activities related to the creation and protection of intellectual property; education and training of employees for the use of innovations; software and database development; purchase, lease or acquisition of fixed assets - facilities and specialized equipment or own production of these goods in order to create innovations; innovation management; other activities to create innovation.

Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Law on incentives for development research and innovation.
Policy_Content: This Law prescribes the conditions for acquiring the status of a beneficiary of the right to incentives measures for research and innovation development, conditions for approving, renewing and revoking the status of beneficiaries of incentive measures, types of incentive measures, as well as other issues of importance for the implementation of incentive measures. Incentives for the development of research and innovation are measures that encourage the performance of scientific research and innovation activities, as well as investment in these activities. Incentive measures are aimed at stimulating economic growth, technological development, innovation and entrepreneurship through employment, especially of young, highly qualified persons, strengthening of existing innovative companies and creation of startups and spinoff, export promotion, especially in the medium and high technology sectors, services based on knowledge, as well as creating a more favorable environment for scientific research and innovation activity in general. Beneficiaries of the right to incentive measures may be domestic and foreign legal and natural persons who perform scientific research and innovation activities in Montenegro, as well as other legal and natural persons who invest funds or are otherwise related to these activities, in accordance with conditions prescribed by this Law and the Law governing state aid.

Policy: Order No. 494 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on harvesting of food forest resources and collection of medicinal plants.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates relations arising in the process of harvesting of food forest resources and collection of medicinal plants, except for the harvesting and collection of these types of resources for individual personal needs of citizens. Harvesting of food forest resources and collection of medicinal plants shall be considered entrepreneurial activities associated with the removal, storage and transportation of such forest resources from the forest. Food forest resources harvested in accordance with the Forest Code of the Russian Federation, shall be intended wild-growing fruits, berries, nuts, mushrooms, seeds, birch sap and similar forest resources. Citizens and legal entities shall carry out harvesting of food forest resources and collection of medicinal plants on the basis of contracts of lease of forest plots. Citizens, legal entities that are granted the right to use forests for harvesting of food forest resources and collection of medicinal plants, must use methods and technologies that exclude depletion of the available resources. Harvesting and collection of protected mushrooms and wild growing plant species, and also of prohibited mushrooms and plant species shall be prohibited.

Harvesting and collection of non-timber forest resources shall be considered entrepreneurial activities associated with the removal, storage and transportation of such forest resources from the forest. Non-timber forest resources include stumps, birch bark, bark of trees and bushes, brushwood, dead wood, twigs, spruce, fir, pine paws, fur-trees or other conifers for New Year's holidays, moss, forest litter, reeds, cane, and similar forest resources. Citizens and legal entities shall carry out harvesting and collection of non-timber forest resources on the basis of contracts of lease of forest plots. Citizens and legal entities performing harvesting and collect ion of non-timber forest resources must comply with forest fire safety requirements and submit annually forest declaration and report on forest management.

Policy: Ley 3/2020, de 27 de julio, de recuperación y protección del Mar Menor.
Policy_Content: El  objeto  de  esta  ley  es  la  protección,  recuperación,  desarrollo  y  revalorización de la riqueza biológica, ambiental, económica, social y cultural del Mar Menor, y la articulación de las distintas políticas públicas atribuidas a la Comunidad Autónoma de la Región de Murcia que inciden sobre el Mar Menor, para que su ejercicio se realice de manera integral y sostenible. Esta ley se propone adoptar medidas normativas urgentes y extraordinarias orientadas a que el Mar Menor, como ecosistema natural, recupere y mantenga un buen estado ambiental. Se inserta, pues, dentro de la obligación que tienen todos los poderes públicos de defender y restaurar el medio ambiente, impuesta por el artículo 45 de la Constitución. La  estructura  de  esta  nueva  norma  comprende  once  capítulos,  doce  disposiciones adicionales, ocho disposiciones transitorias, una disposición derogatoria y nueve disposiciones finales.

Policy: Ley Nº 2041 - Ley por medio de la cual se garantiza el derecho de las personas a desarrollarse física e intelectualmente en un ambiente libre de plomo, fijando límites para su contenido en productos comercializados en el país.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto garantizar el desarrollo físico, intelectual y en general la salud de las personas, en especial la de los niños y niñas residentes en el territorio nacional, en un ambiente libre de plomo (Pb) mediante la fijación de lineamientos generales que conlleven a prevenir la contaminación. intoxicación y enfermedades derivadas de la exposición al metal. La fijación de los lineamientos se hará bajo la guía de las recomendaciones realizadas por la OCDE, la OMS y en el cumplimiento de los convenios de la OIT sobre seguridad y salud en el trabajo. Se declara de interés general la regulación que permita controlar en una forma integral la intoxicación de las personas, en especial de niños, niñas y adolescentes por plomo.

Policy: Order No. 487 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on forest management for scientific research and educational purposes.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates relations originating in the process of forest management for scientific research and educational activities. Forest management for scientific research purposes envisages performance of experimental or theoretical research activities aimed at obtaining new knowledge on ecological system of forests, conducting applied scientific research, aimed at applying this knowledge to achieve practical goals and solving specific tasks in the field of use, guardianship, protection and reforestation. Forest management for educational purposes envisages creation and use of test grounds in forest areas, pilot sites for studying the nature of the forest, training in forest inventory methods, timber extraction technologies, works on protection, afforestation and reforestation, and other arrangements in the field of study, use, protection, reproduction of forests, other components of forest ecosystems, objects of the necessary forest infrastructure to be put into practice by the trainees studying special knowledge and skills.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley autoriza al Gobierno nacional para financiar con aportes del Presupuesto General de la Nación y el Sistema General de Regalías, la participación de las entidades territoriales en los proyectos de generación, distribución, comercialización y autogeneración a pequeña escala y generación distribuida con Fuentes No Convencionales de Energía Renovable (FNCER) que se enumeran a continuación: la biomasa, los aprovechamientos hidroeléctricos, la eólica, la geotérmica, la solar, los mares y el aprovechamiento energético de residuos. Además de otras fuentes que podrán ser consideradas según lo determina la Unidad de Planeación Minero Energética (UPME). Los proyectos de generación, distribución y comercialización de energías alternativas renovables tendrán como prioridad el sector rural y deben contemplar los lineamientos de política energética establecidos en la Ley Nº 1715 de 2014 y el apoyo institucional contemplado en la misma Ley.

Policy: Law No. 155 amending and supplementing the Law on electricity and natural gas no. 123/2012 and regarding the modification and completion of other normative acts.
Policy_Content: This Law sets out the regulatory framework for the conduct of business in the sector of electricity and thermal energy produced in cogeneration, in order to make optimal use of primary energy resources and achieve the objectives of energy security, competitiveness and sustainable development in terms of accessibility, availability and affordability of prices and in compliance with safety, quality and environmental protection. Energy storage shall be intended the process of transforming electricity into a form of energy that can be stored in order to postpone its use for a time after the generation and subsequent conversion of that energy into electricity or its use in another energy sector. The national energy strategy shall define the medium and long-term objectives of the electricity sector and the most efficient ways of achieving them, with a view to ensure sustainable development of the national economy and the satisfaction of energy needs and a civilized standard of living, in terms of quality, both now and in the medium and long term, at an affordable price. The energy strategy is developed by the relevant ministry in consultation with representatives of the energy industry, non-governmental organizations, social partners and representatives of the business environment, is promoted by a draft law by the Government and approved by Parliament. Energy strategy is revised periodically at the initiative of the ministry, without prejudice to the specific stability and predictability of such a document, which after revision will be approved in accordance with the procedure established by acting legislation. Energy policy must envisage: (a) establishment of the appropriate institutional framework, by defining the bodies and authorities competent to implement energy policy; (b) ensuring the legal framework necessary for the safe and stable functioning of Southern Energy Network (SEN); (c) ensuring security of fuel and electricity supply and safety in the operation of Southern Energy Network (SEN); (d) ensuring the protection of the environment, the ecological reconstruction of sites affected by energy activities; (e) transparency of fuel and energy prices and tariffs; (f) increasing energy efficiency; (g) promoting energy from renewable sources, from unconventional sources, high efficiency cogeneration and energy storage, with priority given to electricity supply for isolated settlements; and (h) development of international energy cooperation, participation in regional markets and European electricity market, in order to achieve unified energy market at the level of the European Union and ensure safe and secure of Southern Energy Network (SEN). The commercial exploitation of energy production capacity may be carried out without a license granted by National Energy Regulatory Authority (ANRE) in accordance with the provisions of this Law, by: (a) holder of electricity generation capacities that can be switched on without voltage from Southern Energy Network (SEN), self-starting units and which are used thereby for the purpose of safely supplying electricity to his own equipment or installations; and (b) holder of capacities for the production of electricity, including electricity and heat produced in cogeneration power plants, connected to the electricity grid, with a total electricity capacity of less than 1 MW.

Policy: Disposición  Nº 1/2020 – Impleméntese el Programa de involucramiento de jóvenes y adolescentes al desarrollo sostenible “Haciendo lío por nuestra tierra”.
Policy_Content: Por medio de esta Resolución la Subsecretaría Interjurisdiccional e Interinstitucional del Ministerio de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible implementa el Programa denominado “Haciendo lío por nuestra tierra”, que es un instrumento de involucramiento de jóvenes y adolescentes al desarrollo sostenible el cual se inserta dentro del Plan Integral “Casa Común”, orientado a articular acciones, actores públicos, privados y de la sociedad civil, temáticas y necesidades que conlleven a alcanzar una ciudad sostenible. Concretamente el programa referido busca generar espacios de participación ciudadana especialmente orientados a la población joven, para contribuir al fortalecimiento de la capacidad local en conocimiento y promoción en materia ambiental, acompañando el desarrollo de proyectos socios ambientales por parte de organizaciones de la sociedad civil. Entre sus objetivos está el de capacitar a jóvenes de entre 18 y 24 años como promotores ambientales con un concepto holístico de desarrollo sostenible, y sensibilizarlos sobre diversos temas ambientales para impulsar su inserción laboral en el campo del empleo verde, específicamente en la promoción ambiental de programas de entidades gubernamentales, organizaciones civiles y cooperativas. La Resolución incluye los siguientes tres Anexos: I) Lineamientos del Programa (con especial hincapié en los objetivos y alcance de los proyectos, su financiamiento, instrumentación y articulación institucional, Plan de capacitación y el perfil de egreso de los participantes); II) Carta de Adhesión al Programa; III) Formulario de inscripción.

Policy: Law No. 86 “On bioethanol.”
Policy_Content: This Law sets out the principles of public policy and legal basis for the production and turnover of bioethanol in the Kyrgyz Republic. Bioethanol shall be intended dehydrated ethyl alcohol produced from raw materials of biological origin, intended for mandatory mixing with petroleum products (compounding). The main principles of state policy in the field of production and turnover of bioethanol shall be as follows: (a) assistance in the development and use of various types of raw materials for bioethanol production in order to save fuel and energy resources and reducing the dependence of the Kyrgyz Republic on their imports; (b) a gradual increase in the normatively defined share of production, use of bioethanol and blended motor fuels in the order determined by the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic; (c) reducing the negative impact on the environment due to the use as raw materials for production of bioethanol of agricultural waste, waste of food and processing industries, compliance with environmental safety of production, transportation, storage and consumption of bioethanol; (d)  promoting economic and environmental benefits among the population originating from the use of bioethanol; and (e) development of international scientific and technical cooperation, using the possibilities of world science and technology in the field of production and turnover of bioethanol. Business entities that carry out activities in the field of production and turnover of bioethanol are subject to entry into the state register of bioethanol producers in the order established by the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic.  Maintaining the state register of bioethanol producers shall be carried out by an authorized body determined by the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic. Bioethanol production is carried out: (a) in the presence of a production certificate and control metering devices, providing automated transfer of information on volumes of bioethanol production to the authorized body in the field of production of bioethanol; and (b) at a bioethanol plant owned by the manufacturer of bioethanol as property. In the process of bioethanol production shall be prohibited: (a) use of food raw materials for subsequent processing into bioethanol in volume exceeding the quota established by the authorized body in the field of bioethanol production; (b) use of wheat of 1 and 2 classes as food raw material; (c) production and turnover of alcoholic beverages; and (d) acceptance for processing of raw materials that are genetically modified or containing a genetically modified source.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 29/2020 creating the Electricity Public Company named "Eletricidade de Timor-Leste" approving the respective Statutes.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 42 articles divided into three Chapters and one Annex, creates the Electricity Public Company named "Eletricidade de Timor-Leste" (EDTL, EP) and approves its Statutes. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Public Company entitled to propose, monitor and ensure the execution of the national energy sector policy, ensuring sustainable and integrated management of the production, transmission, distribution and sale of electricity, namely through the establishment and provision of public electrical energy supply services. EDTL, E.P., also carries out the following duties: a) Support the Government in the definition of the energy resources policy; b) Propose to the Government the approval of the National Electrification Plan; c) Propose the creation and maintain the registration of spaces-channels, easement zones and non-edificandi bands of the National Electricity System; d) Promote the efficient use of electric energy; e) Ensure the public service supply of electricity for consumption, through the operation and management of the National Electricity System throughout the national territory; f) Promote a continuous quality improvement of electricity supply, through plans and programmes; g) Implement an integrated system between the various electricity supply infrastructures; etc. The Decree-Law is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Special provisions (Chap. II); Final provisions (Chap. III). The Annex lays down the Statute of the Company.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 448 “On implementation of hydrocarbon production mechanism based on contracts with undistributed risks.”
Policy_Content: The Government decrees as follows: (a) mining (extraction) shall be based on contractual arrangement with undistributed risks, as set out herein by decree, applies to public enterprises and legal entities with the State's share of the authorized capital in the amount of 50 and more percent, as well as legal entities, in the authorized capital of which 50 percent or more are owned by a legal entity with a State share of 50 per cent or more; (b) list of hydrocarbon deposits where the increase of hydrocarbons extraction is planned with the involvement of contractors on contract-based hydrocarbon production with undistributed risks, shall be formed on a regular basis by the Ministry of Energy of the Republic of Uzbekistan in accordance with the proposals of subsoil users and coordinated with the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan; (c) contract is an agreement that provides for performance by the contractor, as determined by a competitive bidding process, at its own expense and at its own risk of works (services) to increase production of hydrocarbons with the acquisition of rights to a portion of the increase in volumes of hydrocarbons as a contractor's cost recovery and the reward which is owed to him; (d) the incremented volume of hydrocarbons is calculated as the difference between actual production volume and estimated base production volume; and (e) contracts may be concluded for one or more hydrocarbon deposits for up to 10 years with possible additional extensions up to 5 years by mutual consent of the subsoil user and the contractor.

Policy: Border Management Authority Act, No. 2 of 2020
Policy_Content: The Act establishes the Border Management Authority as a public entity and an armed service, to function within the border law enforcement area and at ports of entry. The functions of the Authority include to facilitate and manage the legitimate movement of persons and goods within the border law enforcement area and ports of entry and cooperate and coordinate its border law enforcement functions with other organs of the state, border communities or any other persons. The Act aims to establish the Authority to achieve integrated border law enforcement and cooperation on and coordination of border management matters. The Act has extensive provisions on the composition of the Authority and the functions and terms of office of key officers. The Authority has powers of entry, search, seizure, arrest and detention, on reasonable grounds.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Creation and Management of Erusheti Protected Areas (No. 7055-RS of 2020)
Policy_Content: This Law governs the main legal relations in connection with the creation and management of the Erusheti protected areas. The Law consists of nine articles: Scope of regulation of this Law (1); Main goals and objectives of this Law (2); Categories of the Erusheti protected areas (3); Location and surface area of the Erusheti National Park (4); Location of the Erusheti Multipurpose Use Area (auxiliary zone) and the list of settled areas (villages) (5); Regime for the protection and use of the Erusheti National Park (6); State management of the Erusheti protected areas (7); Land-use and mineral extraction issues in connection with the creation of the Erusheti National Park (8); and Entry into force of this Law (9). This and other laws and regulations of Georgia govern the protection and use of land, water, forest and other natural resources, and historical-cultural monuments of the Erusheti protected areas. The Law aims: to promote the protection, restoration and prudent use of the natural and modified areas of the Erusheti National Park in order to ensure the continuous development of natural processes; to ensure the protection and restoration of the Erusheti National Park natural ecosystems, landscapes, fauna and flora, and the genetic resources of endangered wildlife and wild plants, in particular the ones included in the Georgian Red List and the Global Red List; to ensure the establishment of mechanisms for the creation of favorable conditions for recreation in the natural environment and historical-cultural environment of Erusheti National Park, health care and sustainable development of ecotourism; to ensure the protection, restoration and reasonable use of land, water, wildlife and other natural resources belonging to the Erusheti National Park; to ensure the creation of favorable conditions for education and scientific research in the Erusheti National Park, the protection, restoration and monitoring of the natural, bio-ecological regime; to provide protection against degradation and destruction due to anthropogenic impact of unique and rare, organic or inorganic natural formations and individual natural components; and to promote the preservation and development of folklore traditions in the Erusheti National Park and the Erusheti Multipurpose Use Area (auxiliary zone).

Policy: Resolution No. D1-528 validating the Regulation on issuance, amendments and cancellation of permits for integrated pollution prevention and control.
Policy_Content: An operator operating an installation described in this Regulation including a combustion plant, a waste incineration plant and/or a general waste incineration plant must have a permit. A permit may be issued for one installation or part thereof or for several of the same operator's installations or parts thereof located on the same site (site, with adjacent plots or plots separated only by engineering infrastructure). For two installations with the permit for more installations or parts thereof must include conditions to ensure that: (a) each plant or part thereof complies with the requirements of this Regulation. The permit shall include the name of the whole installation or several installations, design capacity, owner/manager, legal rights and responsibilities of the operator(s). A permit shall be issued for an indefinite period. A permit shall be issued or amended only after a selection of the planned economic activity has been made due to environmental impact assessment. Basic principles determining permit terms and conditions shall be as follows: (a) installation must be operated without violating the established environmental quality standards and comply with environmental protection and public health safety legislation; (b) pollution prevention principle must be applied; (c) efficient and rational use of natural resources and energy efficiency; (d) waste prevention, recycling and re-use of waste; (e) assessment of accidents and application of necessary measures to prevent them; (f) in the event of definitive cessation of activities, application of necessary measures to avoid any risk of pollution and restoration of the initial conditions of the operational site; and (g) reduction of the use of hazardous substances and gradual replacement thereof with less hazardous substances. Pollution reports must determine the state of soil. If the operator is not required to prepare a pollution status report, upon definite cessation of activities, he must carry out a preliminary ecogeological study and, if necessary, take actions necessary to eliminate, control, limit the spread or reduce hazardous substances, in order to prevent significant risk to human health or the environment due to soil pollution or groundwater pollution. Soil pollution report must indicate the possible reasons for pollution on soil surface and in the deeper layers of the soil.

Policy: Regional Law No. 626-ZRT “On guarantees of the rights of indigenous peoples living on the regional territory.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes powers of the regional state authorities, local self-government bodies of municipal units on the regional territory for the protection of the original places of living, traditional way of life, economic activities and traditional practices of indigenous small-numbered indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation on the regional territory. Indigenous small-numbered indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation living on the regional territory shall be intended peoples living in the Republic of Tuva in the territories of traditional settlement of their ancestors, preserving the traditional way of life, economic activities and practices, numbering less than 50 thousand of people who consider themselves independent ethnic communities. Traditional activities and practices of indigenous small-numbered indigenous peoples shall be intended activities based on national traditions of the development of the environment and long-term, ecologically balanced use of basically renewable natural resources without undermining the ability to sustainably reproduction. This Regional Law guarantees: (a) allotment to small-numbered indigenous peoples of the territories of their traditional living and traditional economic activities within the boundaries sufficient to ensure the original development, preservation of environment and guaranteed reproduction of consumed natural resources; (b) creation of the necessary conditions for the preservation of national culture, economic, political and social development of small-numbered indigenous peoples; (c) realization of the rights of small-numbered indigenous peoples; (d)  respect for the national dignity of small-numbered indigenous peoples, their culture, language, traditions, as well as customs that comply with federal and regional legislation; (e) functioning of the associations of small-numbered indigenous peoples; and (f) liability of organizations, officials and citizens violating the rights and legitimate interests of small-numbered indigenous peoples. This Regional Law envisages state financial, social and information support of small-numbered indigenous peoples.

Policy: Regulation on the conditions for the development of a project for the conversion of non-arable land into arable agricultural land.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with the Serbian Law on Agricultural Land, prescribes the detailed conditions to be met by a company, ie an enterprise or other legal entity when engaged in the process of the preparation of a project for the conversion of uncultivable or non-arable land parcels into arable agricultural land on the territory of the Republic of Serbia. The project of conversion of uncultivated into arable agricultural land is a document containing: general characteristics of the area for conversion of uncultivated agricultural land into arable (climatic, pedological, hydrographic), obtained by field reconnaissance, field testing of land, ie opening pedological profile, soil sampling, description of external and internal morphology of pedological profile) and examination of the required physical, water-air, chemical and biological characteristics of the soil; state of agricultural production; documentation on owners and users of agricultural land (transcripts of real estate sheets, ie possession sheets or land registry entries, copy of cadastral plan); project solution for conversion of uncultivated agricultural land into arable land (technical landscaping, hydro-technical works, agro-technical works); deadlines for individual phases of works and bill of quantities and estimate of works which provide optimal conditions for growing a particular plant species in a way that is safe and appropriate for the use of agricultural land in terms of risk of increased erosion intensity and geological hazard, endangering soil quality, with compliance with restrictions in the areas of protection prescribed by the law governing nature protection.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG505/2020 validating the Regulation on export and import of hazardous chemicals.
Policy_Content: This Regulation has the following objectives: (a) creation of a mechanism for the application of the Rotterdam Convention on the Procedure of prior informed consent for selected hazardous chemicals, hazardous substances and pesticides in international trade, to which the Republic of Moldova is a party; (b) establishing a procedure for export notification and obtaining preliminary informed consent for the export of hazardous chemical products that are prohibited or are subject to strict restrictions in the Republic of Moldova; (c) promoting collective responsibility and joint efforts in the field of international traffic in hazardous chemicals to protect human health and the environment from possible harm; and (d) correct, from an environmental point of view, use of hazardous chemical products. This Regulation ensures compliance with the classification provisions, packaging and labelling of chemical products hazardous to humans and/or the environment, when exporting and importing them, except in a situation where these provisions are contrary to any specific requirements of the respective parties or countries. This Regulation shall be applicable to: (a) hazardous chemical products that are the subject of the procedure 0f prior informed consent in accordance with the Convention, as per Annex No. 1; (b) hazardous chemical products that are prohibited or subject to strict restrictions according to Annex No. 1; and (c) exported and imported hazardous chemical products, in relation to their classification, packaging and labelling. Exporter who intends to export from the Republic of Moldova for the first time a chemical product specified in section 1 of Annex No. 1, to a party or another country, must notify the designated national authority no later than 35 days before planned export of a chemical product. The exporter then notifies the designated national authority for the first export of a chemical of this type, every calendar year, no later than 35 days before the date of export. The designated national authority receives guidance documents from the Secretariat on the decision on import of chemical products specified in section 3 of Annex No. 1. After approval or adoption of decision guidance documents from the Secretariat, the designated national authority informs the Secretariat of its decision on the future import of the chemical products in question within 9 months from the date of shipment by the Secretariat of the guidance document on decision-making.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG506/2020 validating the Regulation on  on the primary response mechanism to nuclear or radiological events, associated with ownerless radioactive sources.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Regulation is to establish a unified approach to prevention, risk assessment, investigation, intervention and enforcement in the event of nuclear and radiological events associated with unauthorized storage of radioactive or nuclear materials, as well as the discovery of ownerless radioactive sources. The purpose of this Regulation is to establish the roles and responsibilities of the parties directly involved in day-to-day operations, maintenance and management of equipment for detection and identification of primary ionizing radiation. These include monitoring, detection, alarm, response, reporting, submission to the interested authorities of the conclusions of nuclear expertise, training and support activities. This Regulation is based on a predetermined intervention in which intervention levels are expressed as predictable doses for the participating parties’ response, and does not apply to situations of major radiological accidents for which it is necessary to declare the state of radiation accidents or an emergency. This Regulation applies to all incidents related to unauthorized possession and illicit trafficking of nuclear or radioactive materials and detection of ownerless radioactive sources, including: (a) unauthorized possession, use or transfer of radioactive or nuclear materials, especially with criminal intent, possible or proven; (b) selling, buying or attempting to sell, or unauthorized purchase of radioactive or nuclear materials; (c) selling, buying or attempting to sell or buy a misleading material suspected of being radioactive or nuclear material; and (d) threats, fraud or theft related to the smuggling of radioactive or nuclear materials and other illegal actions or omissions with radioactive or nuclear materials. This Regulation is aimed at detecting and/or preventing emergencies arising as a result of events (incidents), related to illicit traffic in radioactive or nuclear materials and detection of ownerless radioactive sources by: (a) identification of radiological risks at the national level; (b) monitoring of potential sources generating nuclear or radiological incidents; and (c) evaluation of information and analysis of the initial situation.

Policy: Korean New Deal: National Strategy for a Great Transformation.
Policy_Content: This Korean New Deal is a national development strategy, aiming to support the  country’s recovery from the pandemic crisis and lead the global action against structural changes.   The Policy sets up  three main objectives: 1. to minimize the economic shock by creating jobs; 2. to support the Korean economy’s quick return to its normal growth path by building the necessary infrastructure for a digital and green economy that will restore investments and support job creation; 3.   to adapt to the structural changes and to lead the global community in the post COVID-19 era. The Korean New Deal has three main pillars, including: two main policies – the Digital New Deal and the Green New Deal – and an overarching policy to strengthen the employment and social safety net.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Reglamento de Propiedad Intelectual del Instituto Nacional de Innovación Agraria (INIA) y conforma el Comité de Propiedad Intelectual del Instituto Nacional de Innovación Agraria (INIA). El Reglamento de Propiedad Intelectual del Instituto Nacional de Innovación Agraria (INIA), tienen como objetivo general regular los aspectos relacionados a la protección y gestión de la propiedad intelectual, así como la transferencia del conocimiento generado por el INIA, de manera autónoma o en colaboración con terceros. Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some relations in the field of manufacturing of organic production, with a view of creating favorable conditions for the development of organic production, including small forms of farming, conservation of natural resources, increase of ecofriendly products, and quality and safety of foodstuffs. It shall not be applicable to medicinal plants, forest seeds, wildlife products and fishing (except for aquaculture). This Regional Law establishes the powers of the regional state authorities in the aforesaid field, and also determines the directions of state support for agricultural producers in the development of organic production. Manufacturers of organic producers shall be intended legal and physical persons who carry out production, storage, labelling, transportation and trade of organic products and are included in unified state register of organic producers. State support for organic production shall be provided within the funds of the regional state budget stipulated by the regional law on the regional budget for the relevant fiscal year and planning period.

Policy: Regional Law No. 78-OZ “On some issues of conducting gardening and horticulture by citizens for individual proper needs.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some relations of conducting gardening and horticulture by citizens for individual proper needs and determines the forms of state support and horticulture. The main objectives of state support of gardening and horticulture shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the implementation of the rights of citizens in the field of gardening and horticulture; and (b) ensuring favorable conditions for the development of gardening and horticulture. The basic principles of state support for gardening and horticulture shall be as follows: (a) responsibility of the regional state authorities for ensuring favorable conditions for the development of gardening and horticulture; (b) ensuring equal access to obtaining state support of gardening and horticulture in accordance with the terms and conditions of its provision; and (c) targeting and targeted use of state funds for support of gardening and horticulture.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1039 validating the Regulation on determining fees for natural persons not living in settlements located within the boundaries of protected areas, for visiting protected areas and establishing cases of exemption from collection of fees.
Policy_Content: This establishes the procedure for determining fees for natural persons not living in settlements located within the boundaries of protected areas, for visiting protected areas and establishing cases of exemption from collection of fees. The amount of the fee is set for each protected natural territory. For visits by natural persons to protected natural areas of federal significance the amount of payment is set by federal state budgetary institutions, managing the relevant protected natural areas of federal significance, in agreement with authorized federal executive body, administering such institutions. Payment for visiting dendrological parks and botanical gardens, which are managed by federal executive bodies authorized by the Government of the Russian Federation by federal executive authorities and by state institutions under their jurisdiction, as well as state scientific organizations and state educational organizations of higher education, shall be established by such organizations in coordination with federal executive bodies in charge of them. For visits of natural persons to protected natural areas of regional significance the amount of fee shall be set by supreme executive body of state power of the subject (region) of the Russian Federation. For visits of natural persons to protected natural areas of local significance the amount of fee shall be set by the relevant local government bodies responsible for such protected natural areas.

Policy: Game and Feral Animal Control Amendment (COVID-19 Extension of Licences) Regulation 2020.
Policy_Content: The Regulation amends the Game and Feral Animal Control Regulation 2012; the object of this Regulation is to extend, by 1 month, the period for which a current restricted game hunting licence remains in force. The extension applies only if the holder of the licence held a restricted game hunting licence in force at any time between 6 April 2020 and 6 May 2020, during which time permission to hunt game animals in State forests was not given because of the COVID-19 pandemic. This Regulation also allows game hunting licences to be granted for any period up to a maximum of 5 years, rather than only for specified periods of 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5 years, and makes a consequential amendment to the fees payable in respect of game hunting licence applications

Policy: Waste Sector Green Growth Action National Action Plan 2021-2025 (GG-NAP).
Policy_Content: This Green Growth National Action Plan (GG-NAP) for the waste sector is a part of the Jordanian agenda, including five other Action Plans, aiming at implementing the National Green Growth Plan (NGGP) in the main six green growth sectors (the others are Agriculture, Energy, Tourism, Transport, and Water). This GG-NAP identifies 14 sector sub-objectives that serve to mainstream the overarching green growth objectives into waste sector policies and investments. In particular, the five national green growth objectives (1. Enhanced Natural Capital; 2. Sustainable Economic Growth; 3. Social Development and Poverty Reduction; 4. Resource Efficiency; and 5. Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation) are translated into the following 14 sector sub-objectives (i) minimize the emission of pollutants (gaseous, liquid, and solid) through the final disposal of waste; (ii) ensure adequate collection and treatment of hazardous wastes; (iii) reduce the adverse impacts of waste and landfills on the ecosystems; (iv) support the development of SMEs and access to sustainable waste services; (v) increase private sector investment and innovation in the waste value chain; (vi) promote awareness and behavior change in government, business, and society towards a circular economy; (vii) increase the government’s capacity to implement evidence-based policies and incentives; (viii) increase the number of inclusive decent, green jobs in the waste sector; (ix) enhance the rate of labor market formalization of the waste sector to enhance economic inclusion and protection of workers; (x) mainstream the concepts of reduction in waste generation, recycling, and re-use; (xi) increase the amount of waste diverted from landfills toward recycling and re-use; (xii) promote innovation in technology and processes; (xiii) reduce greenhouse gas emissions from landfills and dumpsites, particularly methane gas resulting from decomposed organic matter; and (xiv) improve the resilience of waste management and treatment infrastructure to climaterelated disasters (such as floods). For the purpose of this Action Plan, actions are presented in three ways: as enabling actions, as an investment, and as a combination of the two.

Policy: Decree № 151 of 3 July 2020 determining the terms and conditions for payment of funds for maintaining the employment of employees after the state of emergency declared by a decision of the National Assembly of 13 March 2020 and the extraordinary epidemic situation , announced by Decision № 325 and extended by Decision № 378 of the Council of Ministers of 2020.
Policy_Content: This Decree sets all necessary provisions aimed to guarantee the employment continuity and social/labor support as for the payment of funds for maintaining the employment of employees after the state of emergency declared by a decision of the National Assembly of 13 March 2020 and the extraordinary epidemic situation (Covid-19). Article 1 sets the list of eligible workers (also in relation to the provisions of the national Labor Code). The funds for preservation of employment shall amount to 60 per cent of the amount of the insurance income for May 2020 and of the due insurance contributions at the expense of the employer of each worker or employee under para. 1, provided by the order of art. 4, para. 1, item 1 of the Social Insurance Code. When the employer receives financing for the same expenses from the European Structural and Investment Funds or from the state budget, as compensation for services assigned by the state, the total amount of provided funds is up to 80 percent of the insurance income for May 2020 and the due insurance contributions at the expense of the employer.

Policy: Agriculture Sector Green Growth Action National Action Plan 2021-2025 (GG-NAP).
Policy_Content: This Green Growth National Action Plan (GG-NAP) for the agriculture sector is a part of the Jordanian agenda, including five other Action Plans, aiming at implementing the National Green Growth Plan (NGGP) in the main six green growth sectors (the others are Energy, Tourism, Transport, Water, and Waste). This GG-NAP identifies 17 sector sub-objectives that serve to mainstream the overarching green growth objectives into agriculture sector policies and investments, taking into consideration the close linkage between the agriculture sector and the other sectors. In particular, the five national green growth objectives (1. Enhanced Natural Capital; 2. Sustainable Economic Growth; 3. Social Development and Poverty Reduction; 4. Resource Efficiency; and 5. Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation) are translated into the following 17 sector sub-objectives (i) reduce air, soil and water pollution resulting from agriculture and food production processes; (ii) increase the area of degraded lands for restoration in the rangelands ecosystem; (iii) protect the area of forested land and increase the rate of afforestation and reforestation; (iv) increase transparency and the use of evidence-informed decision making by public and private sector agriculture stakeholders; (v) improve the quantity and quality of agricultural product such that it is in line with international standards; (vi) enhance the quantity and quality of public-private-civil society exchange; (vii) increase public and private investment in technology and systems for modernizing and greening farm agricultural processes; (viii) improve the skills and capacity of farmers, rural communities, youth and women to undertake sustainable agriculture; (ix) increase remunerative and socially inclusive rural employment by supporting vulnerable members of society; (x) reduce the impact of environmental and economic shocks on the most vulnerable members of society (particularly farmers, women, youth, and rural communities); (xi) increase the practice of water re-use of treated wastewater for agricultural purposes; (xii) increase the amount of agriculture sector’s waste biomass used as a resource; (xiii) increase use of resource efficient technology to reduce consumption and cost of water, energy, and waste management on farms and in agro-processing; (xiv) increase use of high-yield, drought and salinity-resistant plant varieties; (xv) develop and implement policy and fiscal tools that encourage the take-up of adaptive techniques and technologies; (xvi) introduce the concept of climate smart agriculture on farms; and (xvii) increase carbon sequestration capacity of Jordan’s land and forest.
