Policy: Water Sector Green Growth Action National Action Plan 2021-2025 (GG-NAP).
Policy_Content: This Green Growth National Action Plan (GG-NAP) for the water sector is a part of the Jordanian agenda, including five other Action Plans, aiming at implementing the National Green Growth Plan (NGGP) in the main six green growth sectors (the others are Agriculture, Energy, Tourism, Transport, and Waste). This GG-NAP identifies 16 sector sub-objectives that serve to mainstream the overarching green growth objectives into water sector policies and investments, taking into consideration the close linkage between the water sector and the other sectors. In particular, the five national green growth objectives (1. Enhanced Natural Capital; 2. Sustainable Economic Growth; 3. Social Development and Poverty Reduction; 4. Resource Efficiency; and 5. Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation) are translated into the following 16 sector sub-objectives (i) augmenting water supply for priority economic activities through decentralized infrastructure solutions, such as rainwater harvesting (RWH) or reclaimed wastewater; (ii) ensuring a reliable supply of water to protect and restore critical water-related ecosystems, including forests, wetlands, rivers, aquifers, and lakes; (iii) improving the quality of surface and groundwater by enforcing laws to prevent dumping/pollution, and/or offering incentives for clean-ups/restoration; (iv) introducing demand management measures such as efficiency improvements, loss reduction, water reallocation, and incentive structures to save/conserve water; (v) strengthening the capacity of the public sector in managing water sustainably and efficiently; (vi) improving the sector’s financial sustainability through measures including NRW reduction, revised water tariffs, innovative and market based-business models; (vii) ensuring equitable, reliable, and affordable access to clean water and sanitation services for all; (viii) building resilience to climate-change-related water challenges among vulnerable groups; (ix) supporting and strengthening the participation of local communities, women, and marginalized groups in improving water management; (x) increasing water-use efficiency across all sectors including agriculture, industries, and municipal sectors; (xi) reducing water losses in municipal water services and in conveyance systems to improve their efficiency in delivery; (xii) improving EE in water operations such as water and WWT and pumping systems; (xiii) increasing the quantity of water and wastewater treated for further recycling and reuse; (xiv) improve drought resilience by expanding decentralized supply and introducing demand management measures across sectors; (xv) improve flood resilience through flood risk management measures, through appropriate flood mitigation infrastructure and measures to respond effectively to floods; (xvi) reducing GHG emissions in the water sector through the use of RE and EE in water production and distribution systems. The Plan provides for two types of interventions (i) Enabling Action, to enable stakeholders (government and/or others) to be more prepared for future green growth policy or investment implementation; and (ii) Investments, leading to investment in a specific project that will support the achievement of one or more of the sector green growth sub-objectives.

Policy: Public Enterprises Privatization Proclamation, No. 1206 of 2020
Policy_Content: According to this Proclamation, privatization is a transaction that results in either the sale of assets or share capital of a public enterprise in full or in part to private ownership and control. The objectives of privatization include: To improve the efficiency of Public Enterprises, enhance their competitiveness, attract technical expertise and skill sets, and improve access to capital; To generate revenue and enhance the provision of development finance in order to promote financing activities undertaken by the Government; To promote the Country's economic development by enhancing the policy environment for private investment and encouraging the expansion of the private sector. The Proclamation considers extensively pre-privatization activities, public enterprise restructuring and other activities prior to privatization. Essentially, the Proclamation provides for the procedure of conversion of a public enterprise to a share company, valuation of public enterprises and issues relating to post-privatization.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 372 validating the Regulation for import of live quarantine species, soil and land for scientific research.
Policy_Content: This Regulation governs live quarantine species, soil and land and shall be applicable to the following species: (a) live quarantine species of acarids, nematodes and insects; (b) live quarantine phytopathogenic bacteria, viruses; and (c) soil and land. Import of the aforesaid species into the territory of the Kyrgyz Republic for carrying out scientific research shall be authorized to scientific organizations, the statutory goals of which provide for the implementation of scientific and (or) scientific and technical activities. This Regulation shall not be applicable to species imported into the Kyrgyz Republic for research purposes from the Member States of Eurasian Economic Union. Import of the aforesaid species shall be authorized in the presence of import permit issued by the competent authorized state institution. The permit is terminated in the following cases: (a) after the expiration of the period for which it was issued; (b) in case of liquidation (reorganization) of a scientific organization; and (c) upon revealing, after the issuance of a permit, inaccurate information in documents submitted to obtain it. Annexes contain the form of import permit, application form for obtaining it and act for checking sites of scientific research institutions of living quarantine objects, soils and land for compliance with isolation conditions.

Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for rendering public service "Issuance of licenses for manufacturing, processing, purchase, storage, sale, use, destruction of poisons”. The license to carry out activities for manufacturing, processing, purchase, storage, sale, use, destruction of poisons, includes the following subspecies of activity: (a) manufacturing, processing, storage, sale, destruction of poisons; (b) purchase, storage, sale, use of poisons; and (c) purchase, storage, sale of poisons. State service shall be provided by the Committee of Industrial Development and Industrial Safety subordinated to the Ministry of Industry and Infrastructural Development of the Republic of Kazakhstan. State service shall be provided in accordance with standard requirements contained in the Annex 1. Annex 2 contains application form. Annex 3 contains application of physical person for renewal (re-issuance) of license. Annex 4 contains application of legal person for renewal (re-issuance) of license. Annex 5 contains the form of license.

Policy: Loi nº 33-2020 du 8 juillet portant Code forestier.
Policy_Content: La présente loi, portant Code forestier du Congo, a pour objet de fixer les principes fondamentaux d’organisation et de gestion du domaine forestier national ainsi que les règles d’exploitation et de commercialisation, applicables aux produits forestiers. Toutes les forêts du territoire national entrent dans le champ d’application de la présente loi. Cette loi est formée par 260 articles répartis en 13 titres, à savoir: dispositions générales (I); domaine forestier de l'Etat (II); gestion du domaine forestier national (III); exploitation économique du domaine forestier de l'état et de la transformation des bois (IV); commercialisation des produits forestiers (V); contenu local (VI); accès aux ressources génétiques forestières de tu partage des avantages issus de leur exploitation (VII); reforestation ou reboisement (VIII); afforestation et reforestation (IX); de la lutte contre les changements climatiques et du paiement pour services environnementaux (X); du corps des agents de l'administration forestière (XI); des infractions et des pénalités (XII) et dispositions diverses, transitoires et finales (XIII).
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Law No. 194-OZ “On state support for agricultural development.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of state support for agricultural development in the regional territory, establishes the main directions and measures of state support thereof. State support for agricultural development shall be intended a set of economic, organizational, legal measures aimed at creating an enabling environment for the development of agriculture. The main directions and measures of state support shall be implemented in accordance with regional state program. The main objectives of state support for agriculture shall be as follows: (a) formation of an efficiently functioning market of agricultural commodities, raw materials and food; (b) ensuring food security and improvement of food supply to the regional population; (c) creating a favorable investment climate in the field of agriculture; (d) increasing competitiveness and ensuring financial stability of producers of agricultural commodities, raw materials and foodstuffs; (e) increase of production potential agricultural commodity producers and other subjects of state support for agriculture; and (f) ensuring sustainable development of rural areas.

Policy: Regional Law No. 32-RZ “On the development of apiculture.”
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to promote apiculture in the regional territory and increase of the productivity of apiculture as a sub-sector of agriculture. The main objectives of beekeeping development in the region shall be support and stimulation of activities of natural persons and legal entities, operating in the field of apiculture, creating conditions to meet the needs of the population in apiculture products. The main objectives of apiculture development shall be as follows: (a) increase the volume of production, processing and sale of products of apiculture; (b) ensuring the protection of rights of natural persons and legal entities engaged in apiculture activities; (c) increase in the number of natural  and legal entities carrying out apiculture activities in the region, creation of new jobs in the field of apiculture; (d) development of self-employment of the population through stimulation of apiculture; (e) assistance in professional training of specialists in the field of apiculture; and (f) promotion of international and interregional cooperation in the field of apiculture.

Policy: Environmental Health Services (Control of Plastic Pollution) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 106 of 2020).
Policy_Content: The Minister, in the exercise of powers conferred by section 17 of the Environmental Health Services Act makes these Regulations able to control plastic pollution. An environmental health officer has the power to control if the business is in compliance with the provision of these regulations. If the officer, after having inspected premises of a business pursuant to section 10 of the Environmental Protection (Control of Plastic Pollution) Act 2019 has reason to believe that the the business has failed to comply with any provision of that Act, the officer may issue a notice of non-compliance as shown in the Schedule attached to these regulations.

Policy: Programa Sectorial de Energía 2020-2024 derivado del Plan Nacional de Desarrollo 2019-2024.
Policy_Content: El  presente Programa Sectorial de Energía está enfocado a definir acciones enfocadas al mejoramiento de la productividad, restitución de reservas de hidrocarburos, diversificación de fuentes de combustibles, reducción progresiva de impactos ambientales de la producción y consumo de energía, mayor participación de las energías renovables en el balance energético nacional, ahorro de energía y mayor eficiencia de su producción y uso, fortalecimiento de las EPE y apoyo a la investigación y desarrollo tecnológico nacionales para el período 2020-2024. Se plantean 6 objetivos prioritarios: 1. alcanzar y mantener la autosuficiencia energética sostenible para satisfacer la demanda energética de la población con producción nacional; 2. fortalecer a las empresas productivas del Estado mexicano como garantes de la seguridad y soberanía energética, y palanca del desarrollo nacional, para detonar un efecto multiplicador en el sector privado; 3. organizar las capacidades científicas, tecnológicas e industriales que sean necesarias para la transición energética de México a lo largo del siglo XXI; 4. elevar el nivel de eficiencia y sustentabilidad en la producción y uso de las energías en el territorio nacional; 5. asegurar el acceso universal a las energías, para que toda la sociedad mexicana disponga de las mismas para su desarrollo; y 6. fortalecer al sector energético nacional para que constituya la base que impulse el desarrollo del país como potencia capaz de satisfacer sus necesidades básicas con sus recursos, a través de las empresas productivas del Estado, las sociales y privadas.

Policy: Resolution No. 28/2020 authorizing the creation of an Exceptional Emergency Programme for Response to the COVID-19 Shock.
Policy_Content: This Resolution authorizes the creation of an exceptional emergency programme to respond to the COVID-19 shock, within the current “Vulnerable Families Programme”, aimed at ensuring food security for families directly or indirectly affected by the crisis. This Programme covers both the current beneficiaries of the “Vulnerable Family Programme”, as well as people in situations of vulnerability due to the COVID-19 pandemic, reaching approximately 20,000 households. The programme has a temporary validity, being able to run between 6 to 12 months. The estimated transfer amount for each aggregate family is USD 45 monthly.

Policy: Real Decreto 646/2020, de 7 de julio, por el que se regula la eliminación de residuos mediante depósito en vertedero.
Policy_Content: Este real decreto tiene por objeto: a) establecer un marco jurídico y técnico adecuado para las actividades de eliminación de residuos mediante depósito en vertederos de conformidad con la Ley 22/2011, de 28 de julio, de residuos y suelos contaminados al tiempo que regula las características de los vertederos y su correcta gestión y explotación; b) garantizar una reducción progresiva de los residuos depositados en vertedero, especialmente de aquellos que son aptos para su preparación para la reutilización, reciclado y valorización, mediante el establecimiento de requisitos técnicos y operativos rigurosos aplicables tanto a los residuos como a los vertederos; y c) establecer medidas y procedimientos para prevenir, reducir e impedir, tanto como sea posible, los efectos negativos en el medio ambiente relacionados con el vertido de residuos, en particular, la contaminación de las aguas superficiales y subterráneas, del suelo y del aire, y la emisión de gases de efecto invernadero, así como cualquier riesgo derivado para la salud de las personas. Todo ello tanto durante la fase de explotación de los vertederos como una vez ha concluido la vida útil de estos. El fin último de esta norma consiste en avanzar hacia una economía circular, y cumplir con la jerarquía de residuos y con los requisitos de eliminación establecidos en los artículos 8 y 23 de la Ley 22/2011, de 28 de julio.

Policy: Law No. 14.021 providing for social protection measures to prevent the contagion and dissemination of Covid-19 in indigenous territories; creating the Emergency Plan to Fight Covid-19 in indigenous territories; establishing measures to support quilombola communities, artisanal fisherfolks and other traditional peoples and communities to face Covid-19.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of six Chapters, provides for social protection measures to prevent the contagion and dissemination of Covid-19 in indigenous territories; creates the Emergency Plan to Fight Covid-19 in indigenous territories; and establishes measures to support quilombola communities, artisanal fisherfolks and other traditional peoples and communities to face Covid-19. In particular, it establishes sanitary and epidemiological surveillance measures to prevent the contagion and spread of Covid-19 in indigenous territories, provides for food security actions, provides for actions related to isolated indigenous peoples during the Covid-19 period, stipulates measures to support quilombola communities, artisanal fisherfolks and other traditional peoples and communities, in order to ensure the provision of additional resources in emergency situations. The provisions of this Law cover: isolated and recently contacted indigenous people; indigenous villages; indigenous people living outside indigenous lands, in urban or rural areas; indigenous peoples and groups that are in the country in a situation of migration or temporary transnational mobility; quilombolas; quilombolas who, due to studies, academic activities or the treatment of their health, are residing outside quilombola communities; artisanal fisherfolks; other traditional peoples and communities. The Law is divided as follows: Preliminary provisions (Chap. I); Emergency Plan to Fight Covid-19 in indigenous territories (Chap. II); Food and Nutritional Security (Chap. III); Isolated and recently contacted indigenous people (Chap. IV); Assistance to quilombola Communities, Artisanal Fisherfolks and to other traditional peoples and communities to face Covid-19 (Chap. V); Final provisions (Chap. VI).

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se establecen los Lineamientos para la constitución, actualización, autenticidad, inalterabilidad, seguridad y difusión de la información del Padrón de Beneficiarios.
Policy_Content: De conformidad con el artículo 16 del Reglamento de la Ley General de Desarrollo Social, por el presente Acuerdo la Secretaría de Bienestar establece los Lineamientos relativos a la constitución, actualización, autenticidad, inalterabilidad, seguridad y difusión de la información del Padrón de Beneficiarios. Los Lineamientos son de observancia general para las dependencias y entidades de la Administración Pública Federal que operen o ejecuten Programas de Desarrollo Social. El Padrón de Beneficiarios tiene por objeto, entre otros aspectos: 1. Conocer las características demográficas y socioeconómicas de los beneficiarios de los Programas de Desarrollo Social; 2. Homologar y simplificar la operación de los Programas de Desarrollo Social; 3. Hacer eficiente el otorgamiento de servicios y subsidios; 4. Obtener información para el seguimiento y evaluación de los Programas de Desarrollo Social; 5. Garantizar el cumplimiento de los criterios y requisitos de elegibilidad previstos en los Programas de Desarrollo Social para evitar la duplicidad en la asignación de apoyos o servicios dentro de un mismo Programa; 6. Verificar que las personas que reciban los apoyos o servicios, correspondan con la población objetivo definida en las reglas de operación de cada Programa de Desarrollo Social; 7. Determinar la cobertura poblacional y territorial de los programas de Desarrollo Social, para apoyar con mayor efectividad el desarrollo de los beneficiarios.

Policy: “On health and healthcare” (Code of the Republic of Kazakhstan No. 360-VI).
Policy_Content: This Code regulates public relations in the field of healthcare with a view of realization of constitutional right of citizens of the Republic of to the protection of health. The purpose of the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan in the field of healthcare shall be to ensure that citizens exercise their right to healthcare, including accessible and quality medical care to preserve and strengthen the health of the population of the Republic of Kazakhstan. The objective of the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan in the field of healthcare shall be to create legal conditions aimed at improving the health of the citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Competent public authority in the field of healthcare shall organize the formation of a healthy lifestyle and healthy nutrition. Competent public authority in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population shall performs the following functions: (a) implementation of state policy in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population; (b) determines the procedure for maintaining a register of potentially hazardous chemical, biological substances prohibited for use in the Republic of Kazakhstan; (c) determines the class of hazard of waste according to the degree of their impact on humans and the environment (according to the degree of toxicity); (d) issues sanitary and epidemiological conclusions on the compliance of the object of state sanitary and epidemiological control and supervision, project normative documentation on maximum permissible emissions and maximum permissible discharges of harmful substances into the environment; (e) determines the procedure for assigning registration numbers to the food processing facilities subject to state control and supervision in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population, and the maintenance of the aforesaid register; (f) performs radiation monitoring; (g) performs state control and supervision of products subject to state sanitary and epidemiological control and supervision, including foodstuffs; and (h) develops and approves a list of certain types of foodstuffs subject to state control and supervision in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population, production of which requires the use of non-iodinated salt. Local government shall perform the following functions: (a) organize the provision of preschool organizations, educational organizations, healthcare and social welfare organizations with iodized salt and other foodstuffs enriched with iodine compounds; and (b) organize hygienic education, promotion and formation of a healthy lifestyle and healthy nutrition. Sanitary-epidemiological conclusion is issued by the state body in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population on the basis of results of preventive control and (or) sanitary and epidemiological expertise on materials related to chemical, biological, toxicological, radiological impact on soil, water bodies and atmospheric air. Public officials exercising control and supervision in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population shall have the right to: (a) prohibit import, use and trade of falsified, expired products and in the absence of state registration of products; (b) prohibit use of prohibited food additives, ingredients and raw materials; and (c) approval of shelf life and storage conditions of foodstuffs. Citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan shall have the right to dietary feeding in case of a patient undergoing treatment in an inpatient care. Sanitary rules establish sanitary and epidemiological requirements for facilities subject to state control and supervision in the field of sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population, and contain requirements for: (a) water supply and sewerage; (b) conditions of processing, packaging, transportation, storage, trade and disposal of foodstuffs. This Code contains 7 Sections divided into 275 Articles. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 regards protection of public health. Section 3 regards organization of medical assistance. Section 4 regards educational and scientific research activities in the field of healthcare. Section 5 deals with pharmaceutical activities and circulation of medicinal products and medical devices. Section 6 regards human resources policy in the field of healthcare. Section 7 lays down final provisions.

Policy: Programa Sectorial de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales 2020-2024 (PROMARNAT).
Policy_Content: El Programa Sectorial de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales 2020-2024 (PROMARNAT), tiene como Objetivos prioritarios: 1) Promover la conservación, protección, restauración y aprovechamiento sustentable de los ecosistemas y su biodiversidad con enfoque territorial y de derechos humanos, considerando las regiones bioculturales, a fin de mantener ecosistemas funcionales que son la base del bienestar de la población; 2) Fortalecer la acción climática a fin de transitar hacia una economía baja en carbono y una población, ecosistemas, sistemas productivos e infraestructura estratégica resilientes, con el apoyo de los conocimientos científicos, tradicionales y tecnológicos disponibles; 3) Promover al agua como pilar de bienestar, manejada por instituciones transparentes, confiables, eficientes y eficaces que velen por un medio ambiente sano y donde una sociedad participativa se involucre en su gestión; 4) Promover un entorno libre de contaminación del agua, el aire y el suelo que contribuya al ejercicio pleno del derecho a un medio ambiente sano; 5) Fortalecer la gobernanza ambiental, a través de la participación ciudadana libre, efectiva, significativa y corresponsable en las decisiones de política pública, asegurando el acceso a la justicia ambiental con enfoque territorial y de derechos humanos y promoviendo la educación y cultura ambiental.

Policy: Commission Implementing Regulation 2020/977 derogating from Regulations (EC) No 889/2008 and (EC) No 1235/2008 as regards controls on the production of organic products due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Policy_Content: This Regulation derogates the controls on the production of organic products for low risk operators taking into account the restriction of movement currently applied by Member States due to the COVID-19 pandemic. To this end, physical inspections for the purpose of annual inspections and renewal of documentary evidence of organic operators may be substituted by documentary checks and by any available means of distance communication for low risk operators, as determined by the risk assessment procedure of the competent authority. The measures provided for in this Regulation are in accordance with the opinion of the Committee on Organic Production.

Policy: Resolution No. 28/2020 approving the Regulation of the Integrated Development Agency of the North (ADIN).
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Regulation of the Integrated Development Agency of the North (ADIN). ADIN is a public institution for the promotion of actions aimed at the socio-economic development of the provinces of Niassa, Cabo Delgado and Nampula. ADIN carries out its activities in the northern region and has its headquarters in the Province of Cabo Delgado. ADIN aims at improving the integrated socio-economic development of the northern region. ADIN has the following duties: a) Inter-institutional coordination to boost the region's integrated socio-economic development; b) Management of development programmes; c) Promotion of business, investment and employment; d) Mobilization of internal and external resources to carry out its duties and competences; e) Promotion of assistance actions to populations affected by extreme events; and f) Promotion of socio-cultural and sports initiatives for greater harmony and social cohesion.

Policy: Global Human Rights Sanctions Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 680 of 2020).
Policy_Content: The Regulations are organised VII Parts and 2 Schedules. The purposes of the Regulations (regulation 4) are to establish a sanction regime to deter, and provide accountability for, activities which, if carried out by or on behalf of a State within the territory of that State, would amount to a serious violation by that State of an individual's (a) right to life, (b) right not to be subjected to torture or cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment, or (c) right to be free from slavery, not to be held in servitude or required to perform forced or compulsory labour. Under this definition fall as well activities carried out outside the United Kingdom by any person, or in the United Kingdom by a person who is not a United Kingdom person. “Activity” includes an omission.

Policy: Regulation No.68 of 2020 - Hazardous Materials and Waste Management System issued in accordance with Articles 6 and 7 of Environmental Protection Law No.6 of 2017.
Policy_Content: This Regulation consists of 14 articles and 3 Annexes. It is established at the Ministry of Environment a Technical Committee for the Management of Hazardous Substances and Waste including, among others, representatives of the Ministry of Water and Irrigation, Ministry of Agriculture, and Ministry of Health. The Committee, which reports to the Minister, has the following main tasks (i) to classify the prohibited and restricted dangerous substances, and their waste; (ii) establish principles, conditions, and methods for the transport, collection, storage, treatment, and disposal of waste of hazardous substances; (iii) prepare models for the permits, and duration, for the collection and circulation of hazardous substances and their waste; (iv) prepare the technical requirements for testing sites for the treatment, management, and disposal of hazardous substances. The Regulation prohibits to deal with hazardous substances, including medical waste, and waste without a permit. Article 8 lists the prohiited actions related to hazardous substances and waste, such as import, circulation, throwing on the ground, in water, or in the air. Article 9 indicates the duties of operators in the sector of the circulation of dangerous substances. While article 10 delas with the operators in the field of their collection, storage, transport and treatment.

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se crea el Comité Sectorial de Recursos Genéticos para la Alimentación y la Agricultura.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo establece el Comité Sectorial de Recursos Genéticos para la Alimentación y la Agricultura, con el fin de promover la conservación, manejo, distribución justa y equitativa de los beneficios y aprovechamiento sostenible de estos recursos genéticos, mediante la coordinación interinstitucional e interdisciplinaria en el sector. Se entiende por Recursos Genéticos para la Alimentación y la Agricultura (RGAA) cualquier material genético que contenga unidades funcionales de la herencia, de origen agrícola, pecuario, forestal, acuícola, microbiano e invertebrados, con valor real o potencial para la alimentación y la agricultura.

Policy: Law No. ZRU-626 “On geodetic and cartographic activity.”
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law is to regulate relations in the field of geodetic and cartographic activities. Geodetic and cartographic activities - scientific, production and management activities aimed at determining the parameters of the figure, the external gravitational field of the Earth, coordinates of the Earth's surface points and their changes in time, the creation, development and maintenance of the state geodetic, gravimetric and leveling networks, a network of permanent satellite observation stations, the creation and updating of topographic, thematic maps, plans and cartographic basis for the state cadastre and databases of geospatial and geoinformation systems. The main principles of geodetic and cartographic activities are as follows: (a) systematization and continuity of geodetic and cartographic activities; (b) completeness, reliability and relevance of geodetic and cartographic materials (data); (c) uniformity of measurements when performing geodetic and cartographic activities; and (d) unification of conventional signs and uniform use of names of geographical objects in creation and updating of maps and plans. The main directions of the state policy in the field of geodesic and cartographic activities are: (a) development and implementation of state and other programs in the field of geodetic and cartographic activities; (b) development and improvement of the unified state system of geodetic coordinates, altitudes, gravimetric measurements; (c) coordination of activities of state and economic management bodies, local authorities, legal entities related to geodetic and cartographic works; (d) state geodetic supervision over compliance with license requirements and conditions, rules for using geodetic and cartographic materials (data); (e) ensuring accounting of geodetic and cartographic works, geodetic points; and (f) development of international cooperation. This Law contains 8 Chapters divided into 48 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards state regulations in the field of geodetic and cartographic activity. Chapter 3 regards geodetic and cartographic works. Chapter 4 establishes terms and requirements for the performance of geodetic and cartographic activity. Chapter 5 regards geodetic and cartographic production. Chapter 6 regards accounting in the field of geodetic and cartographic activity. Chapter 7 regards geodetic and cartographic supervision. Chapter 8 lays down final provisions.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regional Law No. 187-ZO “On state social assistance.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations arising in the process of allocation out of the regional state budget of state social assistance to low-income families and low-income lonely persons residing on the regional territory. State social assistance shall be granted to low-income families and low-income lonely persons whose income per capita does not exceed minimum subsistence level set for the region. Provision of state social assistance is carried out in the form of: (a) a one-time social benefit; and (b) social benefits based on a social contract. State social assistance in the form of a one-time social allowances are provided in an amount that cannot be less than 500 rubles or more than three times the subsistence level per capita in the  region established in accordance with the regional legislation. State social assistance on the basis of a social contract in the form of social benefits provided in the amount of not more than 80,000 rubles per year. State social assistance on the basis of a social contract shall be granted for a period from three months to one year based on the content of the program of social adaptation. This period can be extended for a period of up to 12 months on the  grounds established by the Regional Government.
Subject: General

Policy: Water Law 2020.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 77 articles divided in XVII Chapters aims at (i) ensuring the sustainability of water, preserving, protecting, and developing its resources; (ii) ensure access to clean and safe water suitable for use and in conformity with the standard specifications stipulated by law providing adequate water supplies for the agricultural sector; (iii) enhancing the participation of the private sector in developing water projects, and enhancing effective governance; and (iv) providing water supply to all consumers in a fair, balanced, safe, clean manner at competitive prices, in accordance with the standards and plans set by the Ministry of Environment, Water, and Agriculture. Chapter IV clarifies that all surface water and renewable and nonrenewable groundwater is public property, and subject to the present Law. With the exception of seawater, no one may use or develop any water source without a license from the Ministry of Environment, Water, and Agriculture. A license to exploit water sources may not be transferred with ownership of the relevant land without the ministry’s approval. Water use and allocation shall be according to the priorities established at article 12, respectively (1) basic human needs; (2) watering animals; and (3) agricultural, urban and industrial demand, and the minimum environmental balance. The priorities in this case are determined by a decision of the Ministerial Committee based on the proposal of the Ministry.

Policy: Decree on air pollutant levels.
Policy_Content: This Decree prescribes limit values  and target values  for individual air pollutants, long-term targets and target values for ground-level ozone in the air, and depending on the properties of the pollutant, prescribes upper and lower assessment thresholds, target values, average exposure indicator for particulate matter, target exposure reduction at national level, exposure concentration, critical levels, alert threshold, notification threshold and specific human health measures to be taken when they occur, and deadlines for gradual reduction tolerance limits and to achieve target values for ground-level ozone. This text further determines limit values for the protection of human health, quality of life (odor contamination), protection of vegetation and ecosystems, distribution and number of measuring points on which the average exposure indicator are adequately reflecting the general exposure of the population. Adopted European Union documents are listed in article 2.

Policy: Order MMA No. 288 creating the National Programme for Environmental Services Payment (Floresta+), under the Ministry of the Environment.
Policy_Content: This Order creates, within the Ministry of the Environment, the National Programme for Environmental Services Payments (Floresta+). Floresta+ will promote: the private market for environmental services payments in areas maintained with native forests; and the articulation of public policies for the conservation and protection of native forests and climate change. Environmental services are understood as a set of activities for the improvement and conservation of native forests in all biomes, pursuant to Law No. 12.651 of 25 May 2012 on the Forest Code. The guidelines of the Floresta+ are as follows: I - encourage any retribution for activities to improve, conserve and protect native forests; and II - encourage actions to prevent deforestation, degradation and forest fires through private financial incentives. Floresta+ strategic objectives are: I - establish partnerships with agencies and public or private, national or international entities, with a view to supporting payment projects for environmental services; II - foster sectoral agreements to generate demand for environmental services; III - promote international cooperation for the promotion and payment of environmental services; IV - promote the capture of international funds from payments for results to promote public policies in order to strengthen the market for payments for environmental services; V - promote good methodological practices for valuation, certification and monitoring of environmental services; VI - promote the registration and integration of data from environmental services projects; VII - promote a digital tool for the payment of environmental services; VIII - promote payment projects for environmental services; IX - implement the pilot project of payments for environmental services "Floresta+" in the Legal Amazon with resources from Payments for REDD+ results.

Policy: Decision on the adoption of the Programme for the allocation of state aid to the maritime sector, transport, transport infrastructure and related activities in the current pandemic of COVID-19.
Policy_Content: This Decision, based on the provisions of the Croatian Law on small business encouragement, adopts the Programme for the allocation of state aid to the maritime sector, transport, transport infrastructure and related activities in the current pandemic of COVID 19, approved by the European Commission on 30 June 2020, and in accordance with the Commission Communication - Temporary Framework for state aid measures to support the economy in the current COVID-19 pandemic of 19 March 2020 and its amendments of 3 April 2020 and 8 May 2020. In exceptional circumstances and significantly worsened business conditions caused by the COVID pandemic 19, the measures contained in this Programme aim to provide financial support to entrepreneurs engaged in maritime, transport, transport infrastructure and related activities to mitigate the effects of this crisis on their business. The emphasis is on measures aimed at ensuring liquidity and providing access to finance for the functioning of this sector and ensuring transport connectivity and smooth traffic, both within the Republic of Croatia and abroad during and after the end of the COVID pandemic 19 and creating conditions for faster recovery from current crises.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the procedure the gratuitous acquisition of property of common use located within the boundaries of the territory of gardening or horticulture, into regional state ownership or municipal property, if such property may pertain to state or municipal property. Gratuitous acquisition in the state or municipal ownership of common property shall be carried out on the basis of a decision of the authorized body of the regional executive power for management and disposal of state property or of local government, which has the authority to make a decision on the acquisition of property in municipal ownership. Application for the transfer of property of common use free of charge in state or municipal property shall be submitted by horticultural or gardening non-profit partnership to the inter-departmental commission in accordance with the validated form. Application shall contain the list of property of common use and technical documentation related thereto.

Policy: Plan National Sécheresse du Mali 2021-2025.
Policy_Content: Le Plan National Sécheresse du Mali vise à doter le pays d’outils institutionnels et juridiques efficaces pour mieux faire face aux aléas naturels afin de réduire la vulnérabilité du pays à la sécheresse en vue de mettre en place un système intégré de détection et de gestion de la sécheresse faisant appel à toutes les compétences requises en veillant à l’égalité des sexes et l’équité du genre. Il contribuera à faire l’état des lieux du phénomène et de ses impacts et de préparer les stratégies de réponses en conséquence. Les objectifs spécifiques du PNS-MALI sont prioritairement axés sur les trois piliers qui sont: mettre en place des systèmes de surveillance de la sécheresse et d'alerte précoce; évaluer la vulnérabilité et les risques liés à la sécheresse; et mettre en oeuvre des mesures pour mieux répondre à la sécheresse et limiter ses impacts.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 31/2020 approving the information regime for timber logging, thinning or uprooting trees and the traceability of the wood material.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 14 articles,   approves the information regime for timber logging, thinning or uprooting trees and the traceability of the wood material. In particular, it establishes the mandatory declaration of cutting, extraordinary cutting, thinning or uprooting of trees of forest species, hereinafter referred to as the tree cutting manifesto (MCA), in mainland Portugal, which are intended for marketing and self-consumption for industrial transformation, as well as the traceability of the wood material destined for the first processing industry and for export. This Decree-Law applies to forestry operators who extract forestry species and who place wood on the national market for commercialization and self-consumption for industrial transformation, and to other operators involved in the acquisition of trees and their wood material. It also applies to operators that carry out transport, storage and the first processing of the wood material destined for the industry, and also to the export of the wood material. The above mentioned activities are exempt from MCA, when they are intended exclusively for self-consumption, with the exception of cases of self-consumption for industrial transformation; or the number of trees is less than or equal to 10.

Policy: Arrêté du 30 juin 2020 définissant les travaux de restauration des fonctionnalités naturelles des milieux aquatiques relevant de la rubrique 3.3.5.0 de la nomenclature annexée à l'article R. 214-1 du code de l'environnement
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté définit les travaux de restauration des fonctionnalités naturelles des milieux aquatiques relevant de la rubrique 3.3.5.0 de la nomenclature annexée à l'article R. 214-1 du code de l'environnement. Les travaux de restauration des fonctionnalités naturelles des milieux aquatiques relevant de la rubrique 3.3.5.0 de la nomenclature annexée à l'article R. 214-1 du code de l'environnement sont les suivants : arasement ou dérasement d'ouvrage en lit mineur ; désendiguement ; déplacement du lit mineur pour améliorer la fonctionnalité du cours d'eau ou rétablissement du cours d'eau dans son lit d'origine ; restauration de zones humides ; mise en dérivation ou suppression d'étangs existants ; remodelage fonctionnel ou revégétalisation de berges ; reméandrage ou remodelage hydromorphologique ; recharge sédimentaire du lit mineur ; remise à ciel ouvert de cours d'eau couverts ; restauration de zones naturelles d'expansion des crues ; opération de restauration des fonctionnalités naturelles des milieux aquatiques prévue dans l'un des documents de gestion suivants, approuvés par l'autorité administrative : a) un schéma directeur d'aménagement et de gestion des eaux (SDAGE) visé à l'article L. 212-1 du code de l'environnement ; b) un schéma d'aménagement et de gestion des eaux (SAGE) visé à l'article L. 212-3 du code de l'environnement ; c) un document d'objectifs de site Natura 2000 (DOCOB) visé à l'article L. 414-2 du code de l'environnement ; d) une charte de parc naturel régional visée à l'article L. 333-1 du code de l'environnement ; e) une charte de parc national visée à l'article L. 331-3 du code de l'environnement ; f) un plan de gestion de réserve naturelle nationale, régionale ou de Corse, visé respectivement aux articles R. 332-22, R. 332-43, R. 332-60 du code de l'environnement ; g) un plan d'action quinquennal d'un conservatoire d'espace naturel, visé aux articles D. 414-30 et D. 414-31 du code de l'environnement ; h) Un plan de gestion des risques d'inondation (PGRI) visé à l'article L. 566-7 du code de l'environnement ; Policy: Order No. 367 of the Ministry of Agriculture validating the Regulation on maintenance of ameliorative protective forest plantations and the particulars of application of measures to preserve them.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes composition of activities related to keeping and maintenance of ameliorative protective forest plantations and the particulars of application of measures to preserve them. The obligation to maintain plantations in proper state that ensures the performance of their useful functions, and performance of measures to preserve them, including guardianship, protection and reproduction of plantations, shall be responsibility of rightholders of plots on land on which they are growing. Maintenance of plantations in good condition, including measures for the conservation of plantations are organized in relation to: (a) plantations located on land plots pertaining to state ownership of the Russian Federation and not transferred for use to third parties - by the Ministry of Agriculture of Russia; (b) plantations located on land plots pertaining to state ownership of the constituent entities (regions) of the Russian Federation and not transferred for use to third parties, - corresponding executive authorities of the constituent entities (regions) of the Russian Federation; c) plantations located on land plots pertaining to municipal ownership of the Russian Federation, or on land plots for which state ownership is not delimited, not transferred for use to third parties - by local self-government; and (d) plantations located on land plots pertaining to private ownership, as well as on land plots pertaining to state and municipal ownership or state ownership of which is not delimited, allotted for use to third parties, - by rightholders of land plots. In order to keep plantations in good condition the following activities shall be performed: (a) survey of plantations; (b) reproduction of plantations; and (c) care for plantations.

Policy: Order No. 404 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating requirements for a land plot and (or) a forest plot intended for amateurish and sport hunting in relation to hunting resources in semi-free conditions and artificially created habitat.
Policy_Content: This Order validates requirements for a land plot and (or) a forest plot intended for amateurish and sport hunting in relation to hunting resources in semi-free conditions and artificially created habitat. Minimum land area for game intended for amateurish and sport hunting in relation to hunting resources in semi-free conditions and artificially created habitat shall be as follows: (a) 50 ha for mammals; and (b) 5 ha for birds. The boundaries of the plot must be marked in a way ensuring identification of hunting ground. The site should provide for the possibility of using by game of natural or artificial shelters (availability of tree and shrub vegetation, elements of relief and landscape, artificial reconstructive vegetation and (or) other shelters).

Policy: Resolución Nº 448-2020-MINSA — Lineamientos para la vigilancia, prevención y control de la salud de los trabajadores con riesgo de exposición a COVID-19.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para la vigilancia, prevención y control de la salud de los trabajadores con riesgo de exposición a COVID-19, así como los lineamientos para su regreso y reincorporación al trabajo. Asimismo, se proponen garantizar la sostenibilidad de las medidas adoptadas para evitar la transmisibilidad de COVID-19. Los Lineamientos tiene los siguientes Objetivos específicos: 1) Establecer lineamientos para la vigilancia, prevención y control de la salud de los trabajadores que realizan actividades durante la pandemia por la COVID19; 2) Establecer lineamientos para el regreso y reincorporación al trabajo; 3) Garantizar la sostenibilidad de las medidas de vigilancia, prevención y control adoptadas para evitar la transmisibilidad de la COVID-19. Estos Lineamientos se aplican a todos los centros de trabajo de los diferentes sectores económicos o productivos, a las instituciones públicas y privadas, para el reinicio de sus actividades y para las que vienen realizando la prestación de servicios o bienes esenciales durante el estado de emergencia conforme lo establecido por el Poder Ejecutivo.

Policy: Arrêté interministériel n°2020-0166/MCIA/MCAT/MATDC/MSECU/MS portant conditions de reprise des activités de restauration, maquis, bars, buvettes, grillades de viandes salles de jeux, de spectacles, de cinémas pendant la période de lutte contre le COVID-19
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté détermine conditions de reprise des activités de restauration, maquis, bars, buvettes, grillades de viandes salles de jeux, de spectacles, de cinémas pendant la période de lutte contre le COVID-19. Les conditions de reprise sont fixées ainsi qu’il suit dans le domaine de la restauration : exiger le port du masque à toute personne souhaitant avoir accès au lieu ; mettre à disposition des lave mains avec du savon ou désinfectant à chaque entrée ; procéder à la prise de la température de chaque client par thermo flash ; utiliser des couverts et verres jetables ou laver les couverts à chaud ; rendre le port de masques et de gants obligatoire pour le personnel en contact avec la clientèle ; privilégier les plats à emporter ; limiter le nombre de personnes présentes simultanément à l’intérieur des restaurants ; tenir compte de la distance à observer dans la mise en place des tables (au moins 1 m entre les clients) ; procéder à la désinfection des tables après usage ; installer les sèche-mains ou des mouchoirs à usage unique dans les toilettes. Les conditions de reprise sont fixées ainsi qu’il suit dans le domaine de grillades de viande : mettre à disposition un dispositif de lavage des mains pour les clients souhaitant consommer sur place ; exiger le port du masque aux clients ; rendre le port de masques de protection et de gants obligatoire pour les grilleurs et les serveurs ; respecter la distanciation recommandée (au moins 1 m entre les clients) ; et encourager les clients à emporter leurs commandes.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 29/2020 creating the support programme for simple rural land consolidation, called “Parcelling to Order”.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 15 articles,   creates the support programme for simple rural land consolidation, called “Parcelling to Order”. The Programme aims to promote simple rural consolidation with a view to increasing the physical and economic dimension of rustic buildings. “Parcelling to Order” is intended to support simple rural land reparcelling actions, carried out under article 7 of Law No. 111/2015 of 27 August, in vulnerable territories defined under the terms of the regime applicable to the reconversion of the landscape, up to the maximum resizing surface, fixed by Order No. 219/2016 of 9 August, in its current wording. In the case of forestry lands, the maximum area fixed for rainfed land is considered. The “Parcelling to Order” is financed by the Permanent Forest Fund (FFP), which ensure the financial charges resulting from the application of this Decree-Law. The annual allocation for each support is fixed by order of the member of Government responsible for the FFP, according to the budget allocation available for that purpose and transferred to the Agriculture and Fisheries Financing Institute, I. P. (IFAP, I.P.).

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4750 “On measures for the improvement of the system of testing and certification of agricultural and drainage equipment.”
Policy_Content: The President, with a view of large-scale introduction of effective methods of providing modern agricultural machinery, such as testing and measurement, as well as state support for testing and certification of agricultural machinery based on the soil and climatic conditions of the regions, decrees to determine the main directions of reforming the testing system for agricultural and land reclamation equipment and technologies as follows: (a) bringing normative legal acts on the technical regulation of testing resource-saving modern agricultural and land reclamation equipment and technologies in accordance with international standards; (b) conducting relevant tests to verify the efficiency and reliability of agricultural and land reclamation equipment, units and components for them in the soil and climatic conditions of the regions of the country; (c) supporting innovative methods, programs and promising ideas that contribute to the development of agriculture, the widespread introduction of effective scientific developments in the activities of domestic manufacturers of agricultural and reclamation equipment, its units and parts; and (d) further strengthening the material and technical base of laboratories conducting tests of agricultural and land reclamation equipment, creating favorable conditions for attracting highly qualified specialists to the field. Beginning from 1 January 2021, in order to check the effectiveness of use and indicators of reliability (quality) of imported and domestic agricultural and reclamation equipment in soil climatic conditions of the regions, all types of agricultural and land reclamation equipment, units and accessories must pass mandatory testing. At the same time, agricultural and land reclamation equipment, units and components for them must be supplied by domestic and foreign manufacturers, and importers.

Policy: Resolution of the Council of Ministers No. 52-A/2020 creating the Healthy Environment Programme.
Policy_Content: In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, it is important to highlight the need to promote health resilience and improve social cohesion, habitat, environmental conditions and the quality of life of local communities. Thus, this Resolution creates the Healthy Environment Programme, as a participatory instrument that promotes health, social, economic, environmental and urban initiatives among the local communities most affected by the pandemic, or other factors affecting their health and well-being. The Programme aims at promoting partnerships and local interventions for the health and quality of life of territorial communities, through the support for projects presented by associations, collectives, non-governmental organizations, civic movements and residents' organizations, in collaboration with municipalities and health authorities. The Programme has the following objectives: a) create a favorable climate for the initiative and capacity building of local communities, providing institutional support for the self-organization of the population and their participation in the improvement of their living and health conditions; b) transform social capital, active citizenship and networking into living and influential forces in local development, enabling fast and effective interventions that create more resilient, inclusive and healthy communities; c) create conditions for the construction of safe, inclusive and healthy public spaces, promoting participatory design and management and promoting environmental protection; d) contribute to a positive image of the most deprived or excluded communities, enhancing their integration, eliminating barriers and discrimination in access to goods and services.

Policy: Ley Nº 31027 - Modifica el Decreto Legislativo Nº 1156, que dicta medidas destinadas a garantizar el servicio público de salud en los casos en que exista un riesgo elevado o daño a la salud y la vida de las poblaciones.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto incorporar medidas complementarias para garantizar el servicio público de salud ante situaciones de emergencia sanitaria, y a tal fin modifica el Decreto Legislativo que tiene como objeto dictar medidas destinadas a garantizar el servicio público de salud en los casos en que exista un riesgo elevado o daño a la salud y la vida de las poblaciones en el ámbito nacional, regional o local. Respecto a la intervención del Ministerio de Salud en casos de declaración de Emergencia Sanitaria en el ámbito regional y local, se dispone que durante la declaratoria de Emergencia Sanitaria los equipos biomédicos e infraestructura de los centros y establecimientos de salud privados serán puestos a disposición del Ministerio de Salud (MINSA) en calidad de ente rector del Sistema Nacional de Salud, que definirá los planes de acción para disminuir el riesgo elevado o daño a la salud y la vida de las poblaciones, así como las acciones necesarias para cubrir los costos, debidamente sustentados y acreditados, que se incurran por el mantenimiento de los equipos, insumos y medicamentos por parte de este sector, con el presupuesto asignado para la emergencia sanitaria, priorizando los lugares del país donde se detecten los mayores índices de riesgo y letalidad.

Policy: Economic Sustainability Plan, 2020.
Policy_Content: Due to the health and economic emergencies caused by the Covid-19 pandemic, the Economic Sustainability Committee was established on 30 March 2020 with the following terms of reference: develop a clear Economic Sustainability Plan in response to the challenges posed by the pandemic; identify fiscal measures for enhancing distributable oil and gas revenue; increase non-oil revenues and reduce non-essential spending towards securing sufficient resources to fund the Plan; propose monetary policy measures in support of the Plan; provide a fiscal/monetary stimulus package, including support to private businesses (with emphasis on strategic sectors most affected by the pandemic) and vulnerable segments of the population; articulate specific measures to support the States and FCT; propose a clear-cut strategy to keep existing jobs and create opportunities for new ones; and identify measures that may require legislative support to deliver the Plan.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2020/872 of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EU) No. 1305/2013 as regards a specific measure to provide exceptional temporary support under the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) in response to the COVID-19 outbreak.
Policy_Content: This Regulation supplements Regulation (EU) No. 1305/2013 on support for rural development by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) by inserting new article 399, which lays down exceptional temporary support to farmers and SMEs particularly affected by the COVID-19 crisis. Support shall be granted to farmers, as well as to SMEs active in processing, marketing or development of agricultural products covered by Annex I to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union or cotton, except fishery products. The support shall take the form of a lump sum payment to be paid by 30 June 2021. The subsequent reimbursement by the Commission shall be made in accordance with budget appropriations and subject to available funding. The level of payment may be differentiated by categories of beneficiaries, in accordance with objective and non-discriminatory criteria.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG425/2020 validating the Regulation on public institution "Agency for the Development and Modernization of Agriculture".
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes that public institution "Agency for the Development and Modernization of Agriculture" is a self-governing (autonomous) public institution pertaining to the sphere of competence of the Ministry of Agriculture, Regional Development and Environment. The mission of the Agency is to manage the assets transferred by the Founder, donor assistance and/or loans from financing parties allocated to the Agency for management, for the implementation of measures for the technical equipment of agriculture, based on state policy for the modernization of the agricultural sector, and needs and requests of agricultural producers in the Republic of Moldova. The purpose of the Agency is to facilitate farmers' access to modern agricultural machinery and equipment through purchase and sale, including by installments, to ensure the growth of competitive agri-food products and create alternative proposal/solutions for the modernization of agriculture, by providing advice and expertise, training, assistance in planning a business in agri-food sector. The spheres of competence of the Agency are: (a) obtaining access and introducing funding in the form of donor assistance and/or loans/credits provided by financial international/national organizations, mainly related to equipping domestic agricultural producers with agricultural machinery; (b)  providing assistance to observation missions and funding international organizations, as well as further implementation of the recommendations contained in their reports; and (c) ensuring easy and permanent access of beneficiaries to the conclusion through Agency of contracts for agricultural machinery, depending on their requests.

Policy: Order No. 155-A/2020 establishing exceptional and temporary measures in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, applicable to agricultural producer organizations and their nationally recognized associations.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes exceptional and temporary measures in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, applicable to agricultural producer organizations and their nationally recognized associations. The provisions of article 13 of Order No. 298/2019 of 9 September are not applicable in the year 2020, in accordance with the provisions of article 9 of Order No. 295-A/2018 of 2 November. The Order establishes also the sanctioning regime as follows: 1 - If, in 2020, the agricultural producer organizations or respective association do not respect the minimum number of members due to the COVID-19 pandemic, suspension of payment of public support provided for in article 28 of Order No. 298/2019 and the non-compliance must be reported to the Regional Agriculture and Fisheries Directorates (DRAP) or the competent services of the Autonomous Regions (RA). 2 - If it is not possible for these producer organizations or respective association, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, to comply in 2020 with the corrective measures referred to in article 28 of Order No. 298/2019, the warning or suspension of recognition periods may be extended. 3 - The request for extension must be submitted to the DRAP or the competent services of the RA. 4 - In order to apply the provisions of article 28 of Order No. 298/2019, the year 2020 is not counted in case of non-compliance with criteria related to the minimum value of marketed production.

Policy: Law No. 14.016 providing for combating food waste and donating surplus food for human consumption.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the requirements for combating food waste and donating surplus food for human consumption. It specifies that establishments dedicated to food production and supply, including fresh food, processed products and ready-to-eat meals, are authorized to donate food surplusses that are not marketed and are still suitable for human consumption. The donated products must meet the following criteria: they are not expired and are kept in good storage conditions specified by the manufacturer; their integrity and health safety are not compromised, even if there is damage to their packaging; their nutritional properties and health security have been maintained. The food donation must be made directly, in collaboration with the public authorities, or through food banks, other social assistance charities certified under the law or religious entities and will be free of charge. The beneficiaries of the donation are single persons, families or groups in a situation of vulnerability as regards food or at nutritional risk.

Policy: Decree No. 403 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On measures for the further improvement of the procedure for issuance of subsoil management licenses.”
Policy_Content: This Decree validates the Regulation on the procedure for issuance of licenses for subsoil management, envisaging: (a) the procedure for issuing licenses for the right to use subsoil plots to business entities on the basis of electronic online auction trading; (b) terms and conditions for the use of subsoil plots containing strategic types of minerals; (c) the procedure for registration and issuance of licenses for the right to use subsoil plots, as well as the implementation of state registration of this right; and (d) grounds and procedure for limiting, suspending and terminating the right to use subsoil plots.  This Regulation shall be applicable to allotment of subsoil plots for management, including separate agreements, unless otherwise provided by the legislation on production sharing agreements and concessions. It shall not apply to the issuance of licenses for the right to use subsoil plots containing non-metallic minerals and for the artisanal mining of precious metals. Licenses for the right to use subsoil plots containing strategic types of minerals are granted for: (a) geological study (exploration); (b) mining; (c) use of technogenic mineral formations; (d) construction and operation of underground structures not related to the extraction of minerals; (e) formation of protected geological objects; and (f) collection of samples of gemstone raw materials, paleontological remains and other geological collection materials. Licenses, as a rule, are issued separately for each specific type of subsoil use.

Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MINAGRIP). This Statute, consisting of 25 articles divided into four Chapters and two Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Ministry, entitled to perform the following activities: proposing, formulating, conducting, executing, evaluating, controlling and supervising the Executive's policies in the fields of agriculture, livestock, forests, food security, management and planning of aquatic biological resources, sustainable fishing and aquaculture activities, salt production, etc. In addition, the Ministry is responsible to carry out research, experimentation and technological innovation in the area of the sea, prospecting, use, exploitation and enhancement of aquatic resources, and a sustainable sea economy, in a perspective of sustainable national development. Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-6012 validating the National Strategy of the Republic of Uzbekistan on human rights.
Policy_Content: This is multi-sectoral nationwide policy document. The Republic of Uzbekistan are taking practical measures to harmonize national legislation with international legal standards in the field of human rights. The adoption of a long-term human rights strategy serves for the effective implementation of state policy in this area, the formation of a respectful attitude towards human rights and freedoms, further strengthening the country's authority in the international arena, in particular, improving the position of the Republic of Uzbekistan in economic and political and legal ratings and indices. The President decrees to determine the main areas activity of state bodies and organizations of the Republic of Uzbekistan responsible for the implementation of norms of international human rights treaties: (a) ensuring the unconditional implementation of national action plans ("Road maps") aimed at implementing the recommendations of international organizations for the protection of human rights; (b) identification, analysis, and elimination of causes and conditions, obstructing the implementation of the recommendations of statutory bodies and treaty on human rights committees of the United Nations, through the development and implementation of measures, aimed at improving legislation and law enforcement practice; and (c) implementation of effective cooperation with the Public Chamber under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan and civil society institutions in the field of fulfilling the international obligations of the Republic of Uzbekistan on human rights.

Policy: Executive Order on compensation for fixed costs in the area of ​​the Ministry of the Environment and Food to associations, independent institutions and foundations, etc. with primarily public funding, that are in financial crisis as a result of the Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
Policy_Content: This Order, from the Danish Veterinary and Food Administration, establishes a right to compensation as a contribution to cover fixed costs for associations, self-governing institutions and foundations, etc., in the area of ​​the Ministry of the Environment and Food, where public subsidies for operations amount to half or more of the institution's ordinary operating expenses and is ordinarily expected to do so. The institutions  shall have been registered in the Central Business Register (CVR) no later than 9 March 2020, and must have an expected commercial revenue decline of at least 35 per cent or be prohibited from operating due to Covid-19. The compensation period is from 9 March 2020 to 8 July 2020. Institutions that are prohibited from operating may, however, separately request compensation for the period during which the institution is prohibited from staying open. The Executive Order contains the following Chapter: 1. Scope of the Executive Order; 2. Definitions; 3. Eligible costs; 4. Conditions for receiving compensation; 5. Post-adjustment and repayment of compensation; and 6. Complaint and entry into force.

Policy: Ley Nº 21.243 - Modifica la Ley Nº 21.230, para extender y aumentar el ingreso familiar de emergencia.
Policy_Content: La presente ley tiene por finalidad introducir modificaciones al Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia creado por la ley Nº 21.230, complementando los ingresos actuales de los hogares que se han visto afectados socioeconómicamente por la pandemia COVID-19, en los términos establecidos en dicha ley. Dichas modificaciones buscan beneficiar tanto a los hogares que carecen de ingresos, como también a los que perciben ingresos por montos inferiores a los aportes del Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia. La cobertura del beneficio se amplía al 80 por ciento más vulnerable de la población nacional, y se aumentan los montos de los aportes y la duración de los mismos.

Policy: Ley Nº 21.242 - Establece un beneficio para los trabajadores independientes que indica.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece un beneficio transitorio con motivo de la propagación de la enfermedad denominada COVID-19, en favor de los trabajadores independientes, hasta por un máximo de tres meses, continuos o discontinuos, dentro de los seis meses siguientes a contar del 1 de mayo de 2020. Los requisitos copulativos que deben cumplir los trabajadores y la forma de cálculo del monto, que en ningún caso excederá de $650.000, se describen en los Artículos 2 y 3, respectivamente. El beneficio se reintegrará ante el Servicio de Tesorerías, en cuatro cuotas anuales y sucesivas, sin multas ni intereses. La primera cuota anual corresponderá a un 10% del beneficio total obtenido y cada una de las 3 cuotas anuales restantes, corresponderán a un 30% del beneficio total obtenido (Artículo 6).

Policy: Order No. 148-A/2020 establishing for the national territory the complementary implementing rules to support the wine distillation measures and storage of wine in case of crisis, as provided for in Regulation Commission (EC) 2020/592 of 30 April.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes for the national territory the complementary implementing rules to support the wine distillation measures and storage of wine in case of crisis, as provided for in Regulation Commission (EC) 2020/592 of 30 April. The support scheme aims at the production of alcohol intended for industrial purposes, or for energy purposes, and which has been denatured intended for disinfection products or drugs. The support regime is applicable exclusively to the distillation of wines with a designation of origin (DO) or geographical indication (IG), excluding the category of liqueur wines. Wines declared to be fit for the harvest and production declaration and not yet certified are not covered by the support regime. The distillers registered in the Institute of Vine and Wine (IVV,I.P.), provided that they process the wine delivered for distillation under the terms previously established, may benefit from such support. Support is paid to the distiller, and the beneficiaries must be registered in the identification system with Financing Institute for Agriculture and Fisheries (IFAP,I.P.), and ensure that said registration is up to date.

These activities include: special tax, fiscal and customs regimes, a special administration structure, special labour regimes, among others, aimed at taking advantage of the benefits of Cape Verde and each of the islands, the promotion of economic and business development, namely through attracting investments, promoting exports and promoting private sector development, as well as promoting Cape Verde's insertion in the regional and global economy. Policy: Regional Law No. 489 “On ensuring peace and quiet of citizens.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations for ensuring peace and quiet of citizens. Peace and quiet shall be applicable to the following facilities: (a) residential premises, non-residential premises, common premises in apartment buildings, as well as land plots on which these apartment buildings are located; (b) residential buildings and the land plots on which they are located; (c) horticulture and gardening land plots with residential buildings located thereon; and (d) hostels, hotels, hospitals, dispensaries, sanatoria, rest homes, boarding houses, kindergartens, boarding houses for children, the elderly, the disabled and the land plots on which they are located. Actions (inaction) that disturb peace and quiet of citizens shall be considered: (a) use of TV sets, radio receivers, tape recorders and other sound-producing devices as well as amplifying devices, including those installed on vehicles, which caused a disturbance of rest of citizens and silence from 22 p.m. to 8 a.m.; (b) playing musical instruments, shouting, whistling, singing that caused disturbance of citizens' peace and quiet from 22 p.m. to 8 a.m.; (c) failure by owners (possessors) of vehicles to take measures to timely disabling of unreasonably working sound signals of security alarm of vehicles, which caused a disturbance of rest and quiet of citizens and silence from 22 p.m. to 8 a.m.; (d) use of pyrotechnic means, which caused the disturbance of peace  and quiet of citizens from 22 p.m. to 8 a.m.; (e) performance of repair, construction, unloading and loading works in residential premises, non-residential premises and common areas in apartment buildings, resulting in disturbance of citizens' peace and quiet from 22 p.m. to up to 8 a.m.; and (f) performance of the aforesaid arrangements in residential premises, non-residential premises and common areas in apartment buildings, resulting in disturbed peace of citizens and silence from 22 p.m. to 8 a.m. and from 12 a.m. to 14 p.m., as well as on Sundays and non-working public holidays. The aforesaid offences shall entail administrative proceedings.
