Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-5995 “On additional measures for ensuring the compliance of quality and safety indicators of agricultural products with international standards.”
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes that traditional agriculture, in particular horticulture, fruit growing and vegetable growing, is based on traditional knowledge, giving the possibility of growing organic (environmentally friendly) fruits and vegetables with high nutritional value, unique taste and consumer characteristics without the use of gene modification technologies. The objectives for the promotion  of organic agriculture shall be as follows: (a) use of crop areas that are not contaminated with toxic substances; (b) opportunities to increase income of the population through export of organic products grown by smallholders; (c) opportunities to increase employment of the population through development of agricultural cluster systems, logistics and cooperation in organic production; (d) opportunities to analyze the quality of agricultural commodities through the improvement of laboratories, control systems and certification systems; and (e) promotion of  areas free of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) .  Promotion of organic agriculture is aimed at the achievement of the following results: (a) official (public) guarantee and increase of the volume of organic production, facilitating the entry of producers in foreign markets and expanding the geography of exports; (b) improving the investment attractiveness of agricultural production, implementation of new investment projects and increasing employment of the rural population; (c) strengthening the opportunities for healthy nutrition, improving quality and safety of agricultural and food products, reduction of negative environmental impact; (d) improving soil fertility and preventing soil degradation, preserving biodiversity, ecological ecosystems, and strengthening of certification; and (e) expanding research and development activities and accelerating the training of qualified specialists.

Policy: National Covid-19 Pandemic Multi-Sectoral Response Plan, 2020
Policy_Content: The national response plan ensures that the country emerges from the Covid-19 pandemic with minimal negative impact to the population, health system and the economy. The aim of the plan is to provide a  framework for the government of Nigeria to achieve four major objectives including; to provide a coordinated and effective national and sub-national response to the COVID-19 pandemic; to reduce COVID-19 related morbidity and mortality; to mitigate pandemic-related impacts on critical social, economic and health infrastructure and systems; and to facilitate post-pandemic recovery and rehabilitation operations. In responding to the pandemic, the plan proposes to respond to the emergency through six phases; the preparedness and no cases phase; the mitigation and response to sporadic cases phase; the intensified response to clusters of connected cases phase; the peak of the pandemic due to community transmission phase; post peak phase; and post-pandemic recovery phase. The national response to the pandemic is to be coordinated and directed by the Presidential Task Force, who directly reports to the President. The plan provides extensively for the composition, coordination and hierarchy of the Covid-19 response team who are to function in a joint and linear level from local to state and national levels. The implementation plan is approached from both a national level and sub-national level; at the national level, the presidential task force provides coordination, strategy and policy guidance and the Federal Ministry of Health is in charge of case management as well as isolation and treatment centers, research, communication and healthcare at point of entry, among other things, while at the sub-national level, each state and the Federal Capital Territory is to constitute a task force to provide overall coordination of the response, the states also follow a pattern that mirrors the national level. The federal government is charged with providing resources for the preparedness and response operations of state and national level entities while the monitoring and evaluation framework is spearheaded by the presidential task force.

Policy: Resolution No. 33/2020 approving the Mangrove Management Strategy 2020-2024.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Mangrove Management Strategy 2020-2024. This Strategy defines the coordination mechanisms for mangrove management at different levels of the State's territorial organization in order to ensure its preservation. This Strategy consists of a set of changing actions to be undertaken, in a coordinated and integrated manner, at various levels, based on values and principles to achieve the global goal. The Strategy identifies priorities to be considered and national qualitative targets to be achieved in relation to mangrove management in Mozambique, in an effective and inclusive action by all stakeholders in the mangrove ecosystem, towards its sustainable use. This Strategy is based on the values and principles of environmental conservation and sustainable use of natural resources, as described below: Sustainability: rational use of mangrove and associated resources in the constant balance between biodiversity conservation and the country's economic and social development needs; Equity: sustainable mangrove management with fair distribution of the benefits from this resource, to contribute to the well-being of communities, overcome inequalities in terms of gender, age and socioeconomic groups and promote equal opportunities for all stakeholders; Participation: the mangrove management system promotes the integration and coordination of actions by all stakeholders.

Policy: Order No. 280 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on National Park "Zigalga".
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on National Park "Zigalga" located in Chelyabinsk region. National Park "Zigalga" shall perform the following tasks: (a) preservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural plots and objects; (b) preservation of historical and cultural sites; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) creation of conditions for regulated tourism and recreation; (e) implementation of scientific (research) activities in the field of environmental protection in order to develop measures for the preservation and development of natural potential and recreational potential of the Russian Federation; (f) implementation of state ecological monitoring; and (g) restoration of damaged natural and historical and cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of National Park "Zigalga"shall be prohibited any activity contrary to the tasks of national park and could damage natural complexes and objects, wild fauna species and objects of historical and cultural heritage, including: (a) commercial, amateur and sport hunting; (b) commercial fishing, fishing for aquaculture (fishfarming) purpose, aquaculture (fish farming); (c) individual housing construction, residential construction, construction of trunk roads, pipelines, power lines and other communication lines; (d) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, traps and other hunting gear, with captured wild fauna species and wildlife products, with the exception of cases related to measures for state supervision in the field of protection and use of protected natural areas of federal significance, federal state supervision in the field of protection, reproduction and management of wild fauna species, and scientific research activities of authorized staff; (e) stay with fishing gear; (f) exploration and mining; (g) disturbance of soil layer; (h) modification of hydrological regime; (i) procurement of soft resin and non-timber edible products; (j) timber extraction, except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs; (k) disturbance of habitats of wild fauna species; (l) transit and grazing of farm animals; (m) rafting of timber on waterways; (n) plowing of land and haymaking  (except for forest fire prevention); (o) blasting operations; (p) introduction of alien species; (q) storage and application of pesticides, mineral fertilizers and toxic chemicals; (r) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical samples; (s) stay with dogs; (t) clear cutting of forest species, except for sanitary felling; (u)  destruction and damage of notices, barriers, stands, border poles and other information signs; (v) unauthorized archeological activity; (w) disturbance of habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; and (x) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 500 meters over the territory of national park without prior authorization of the authorized institution.

Policy: Fisheries Management Order regarding At-Sea Observers on board fishing vessels

Policy: Directives Relating to Fishing Industry: Stage 2: State of Emergency- Covid-19 Regulations
Policy_Content: These directives are issued by the Minister of Fisheries and Marine Resources under the regulation 15(1) and (3) of the Stage 2: State of Emergency-COVID-19 Regulations. The Directives provide that activities related to fishing like fish production and value chain activities necessary for the harvesting and processing of fish and fish products as well as fishing by a fishing vessel, shall be under adherence of social distancing and minimal contact between persons. The Directives further provide that the head of  a fish processing plant shall implement actions and policies of the government so as to curb the spread of Covid-19; these include, to ensure that hand sanitization takes place in the plant, contractors are screened and hand sanitized before entry into the plant, temperature readings of everyone entering the plant, employees to implement these measures are provided with protective clothing, visitors are not allowed into the plant and deliveries at the fish processing plant are sent to a designated central point so as to minimize contact with employees. The directives also provide for hygiene at the plants, the importance of information and sensitization of employees about Covid-19, the utilization of on-site health facilities, etc. There are identical rules for fish shops. The Directives further provide authorization for a health official to have unrestricted access to a fishing vessel, a processing plant, an on-site health facility or a fish shop to ensure compliance with the directives. Contravention of the directives leads to monetary penalty or a prison sentence of 6 months
Subject: Fisheries, General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2020/1068 amending Annexes I and V to Regulation (EU) No 649/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the export and import of hazardous chemicals.

The amended Annex I lays down the list of chemicals that are subject to export notification procedure and qualifying for Prior Informed Consent notification. Moreover, the Annex II amends the Part 2 of Annex V of the Regulation (EU) No. 649/2012 by adding some chemicals other than persistent organic pollutants as listed in Annexes A and B to the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants.

Policy: Organic Production Regulation Law No. 158 of 2020.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 29 articles aims at (i) protecting Lebanese production and creating value-added and competitive products that provide food safety and security standards; (ii)  putting special Lebanese standards into practice so that it becomes possible to monitor the product, protect the consumer and ensure that the offered product meets all the conditions required for organic production; (iii) creating a control system on the production stages and marketing. The organic production system of Lebanon is designed with the aim of achieving the following (i) promotion of biodiversity; (ii) increasing the biological activity of the soil; (iii) maintaining soil fertility; (iv) making use of non-polluting waste of plant and animal origin to reduce the use of non-renewable resources; (v) promoting reliance on renewable resources in local farming systems; (vi) encouraging the correct use of soil, water, and air; (vii) establishing it on any existing farm through a transition period whose duration is determined according to elements related to the site (history of the land, type of crops, animals raised). The provisions of this Law are subject to the production, manufacture, sale, import and export of agricultural products that bear, or are prepared to carry, on their packages data indicating that they are organically produced.

Policy_Content: The Regulations prescribe the procedures for granting, monitoring and administering state aid in the form of a short-term loan in order to reduce the negative impact of the spread of Covid-19 on the production process of primary agricultural products. A short-term loan to a producer of agricultural primary products shall be granted by the Rural Support Service in compliance with the provisions of these Regulations. Policy: Government Decree on temporary support for companies in primary agricultural production (No. 370 of 2020).
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down rules on temporary subsidies to undertakings  in primary agricultural production in accordance with the state budget. Support referred to in this Regulation may be granted up to a maximum of EUR 5 million. Its objective is to ensure the liquidity of companies producing goods listed in Annex I of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union, with the exception of fisheries and aquaculture products, due to significant market and production disruptions caused by the Covid-19 pandemic. The aid is granted as a temporary State aid in accordance with Commission Communication C (2020) 1863. The support can be granted for expenses that are deemed necessary to ensure the continuation of business operations in the form of general support for a period of no more than six months beginning no earlier than 16 March 2020. Covered expenses include: (1) salary expenses; (2) rental costs and property expenses; (3) expenditure on the hiring of external services and experts; (4) other expenses deemed necessary to ensure continued business operations. Beneficiaries include those engaged in: (1) agricultural production whose market has declined substantially or ceased completely as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic and no alternative market exists for the product; and (2) direct sales of self-produced products whose sale is hindered due to the Covid-19 pandemic and no alternative market exists for the product. Other conditions for for beneficiaries are also established. The responsible authority is the Centre for Economic Development, Transport and the Environment. The minimum amount of the subsidy is € 5,000 and the maximum amount is € 10,000.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 18 May 2020 and is valid until 31 December 2020.

Policy: Government Decree on subsidies granted to companies in the fisheries sector on the basis of a deteriorating economic situation (No. 369 of 2020).
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down rules for the granting of a subsidy to undertakings in the fisheries sector on the basis of a temporary deterioration in the economic situation. Its objective is to ensure the liquidity of companies in the fisheries sector as a result of significant market and production disruptions due to the Covid-19 pandemic, through temporary State aid in accordance with Commission Communication C (2020) 1863. The support may be granted for expenses deemed necessary to ensure that businesses continue operating, in the form of general support for a maximum period of six months beginning no earlier than 19 March 2020. Covered expenses include: (1) expenditures on the hiring of external services and experts; (2) salaries and personnel costs; (3) rental and property costs; (4) other expenses deemed necessary to ensure continued business operations. Beneficiaries include commercial fishermen and companies engaged in fish farming, fish processing or wholesale or retail trade of fish, as indicated by the Regulation. Responsible authorities are the Centre for Economic Development, Transport and the Environment in Southwest Finland, Northern Savonia, and Lapland, together with the Development and Administration Centres of the Centre for Economic Development, Transport and the Environment and the Employment and Business Agencies. The minimum amount of the subsidy is € 3,000 and the maximum amount is € 10,000.
Subject: Fisheries, General

Policy: Directions Regarding Measures to Address, Prevent and Combat the Spread of COVID-19 Relating to the Freshwater and Marine Fishing Sectors (G.N. Notice 538 of 2020).
Policy_Content: These Directions of the Minister of Forestry, Fisheries and the Environment are issued in terms of regulation 4(10) of the Regulations issued by the Minister of Co-operative Governance and Traditional Affairs in terms of section 27(2) of the Disaster Management Act, 2002. The purpose of these Directions is to curtail the threat posed by the COVID-19 pandemic and to alleviate, contain and minimise the effects of the national state of disaster, and in particular, to provide directions to the freshwater and marine fishing sectors in terms of the alleviation provided in Part A of Table 1 of the Regulations as it pertains to fishing activities (Part A of Table 1 of the Regulations authorises fishing to take place subject to any directions which may be issued by the Cabinet Member responsible for Forestry, Fisheries and the Environment). These Directions apply to— mariculture, commercial and small-scale fishing rights, permits and exemptions; commercial and small-scale fishing vessel licences; fish-processing establishments’ rights, permits and exemptions; permits or exemptions to import or export fish; and recreational fishers. recreational fishing is not allowed. Timeframes as contained in any permit, exemption or licence, or any condition with respect to such permit, exemption or licence, including— timeframes with regard to validity periods as outlined in the Fisheries COVID-19 Public Notice titled "Exemption in terms of section 81 of the Marine Living Resources Act, 1998 (Act No. 18 of 1998) to all holders of licences, permits, and authorisations issued in terms of the Marine Living Resources Act, 1998 (Act No. 18 of 1998) to operate without permits tor the next ninety (90) days”; and the second Fisheries COVID-19 Public Notice titled “Exemptions issued to all fishing sectors in terms of section 81 of the Marine Living Resources Act, 1998 (Act No. 18 of 1998)" issued by the Department on 24 and 26 March 2020 respectively, which have lapsed during the lockdown period of the national state of disaster declared for the COVID-19 pandemic, or which will lapse during the Alert Level 4 period, are hereby extended, or deemed to be extended, until the termination of Alert Level 4 in accordance with the Regulations.

Policy: Ley Nº 21.230 - Concede un Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia
Policy_Content: La presente Ley concede un Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia  para apoyar aquellos hogares cuyos ingresos sean mayoritariamente informales y que se vean afectados por la pandemia derivada del Covid-19. La Ley consta de cuatro títulos: I. Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia; II. Otorgamiento, solicitud y pago del Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia; III. Proceso de reclamación y percepción indebida del Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia; IV. Otras disposiciones. El Ingreso Familiar de Emergencia está compuesto por un máximo de tres aportes extraordinarios de cargo fiscal, pagaderos mensualmente y en forma decreciente, para los hogares que cumplan los  requisitos que la Ley establece.

Policy: Regional Law No. 526-OZ “On ensuring fertility of agricultural land.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land and establishes powers of regional state bodies in the field of ensuring fertility of agricultural land. The main directions of ensuring fertility of agricultural land shall be as follows: (a) participation in the implementation of state programs of the Russian Federation for ensuring fertility of agricultural land; (b) development and implementation of regional state programs containing measures for fertility of agricultural land, envisaging state support of ensuring fertility of agricultural land; (c) state regulation of fertility of agricultural land; (d) performance of agrotechnical, agrochemical, land reclamation, phytosanitary and anti-erosion measures in order to ensure fertility of agricultural land; and  (e) other directions established by the Federal Law. Possessors, owners, users, including tenants, of land plots shall have the right to perform agrotechnical, agrochemical, land reclamation, phytosanitary and anti-erosion reproductive measures for restoration of agricultural land fertility; receive information from executive bodies of the regional authorities in accordance with the established procedure related to the state of soil fertility on their land and the dynamics of its condition.

Policy: Regulation on the prevention of and compensation for impacts on nature and landscape within the jurisdiction of the Federal Administration (Federal Compensation Regulation).
Policy_Content: This Regulation implements provisions of the  provisions of the third Chapter of the Federal Nature Conservation Act (amended last 4 March 2020) insofar as the obligations of that Chapter fall within the competence of federal authorities.  The Regulation specifies in particular obligations in the sphere of: 1. prevention of harm to nature and landscape according to § 15 paragraph 1 sentence 1 of the Act; 2. the content, type and scope of compensatory and replacement measures in accordance with § 15 paragraph 2 of the Act; and 3. the amount of the compensation payment according to § 15 paragraph 6 of the Federal Nature Conservation Act and the procedure for collecting it. Compensation for harm to nature can also be based on the Water Resources Management Act. The Regulation formulates a general duty to cause harm to nature and requires reasonable alternatives to be used when possible so as to avoid harm to nature.

Policy: Memorandum Circular No. 15, Series of 2020 on the Guidelines on Food Safety for Philippine Agricultural and Fishery Sectors During Covid 19 Pandemic.
Policy_Content: The Department of Agriculture sets guidelines that shall protect against transmission of the deadly virus and shall promote food safety practices in the production, processing, handling, packaging and delivery of consumption goods. Food safety, hygiene and quality standards and practices shall apply to preparations or operations on farm, post-harvest, transport a nd delivery, food retail, canteens, food handling and packaging, and in households. The strict implementation of hygienic practices provided in relevant on-farm food safety standards such as Good Agricultural Practices (GAP), Good Animal Husbandry Practices (GAHP) and Good Aquaculture Practices (GAqP), and in Good Hygienic Practices (GHP) and Good Manufacturing Practices will help minimize the spread of COVID-19 among the food workers. The measures below provide general guidelines which are applicable to all food workers and food business operators in the agricultural and fishery sectors: 1. Reduce transmission among employees; 2. Maintain healthy business operations; 3. Maintain a healthy work environment. The Specific Process Steps are: 1. On-farm Practices (livestock, poultry, and aquaculture farms should implement strict biosecurity measures prior to farm entry to ensure safety to both the farm workers and the animals); 2. Post-harvest Practices; 3. Transport and delivery; 4. Food Retail premises; 5. Food canteens; 6. Food Packaging; and 7. Consumers.

Policy: Decree No. 282 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On improvement of the functioning of the Center for testing of agricultural crops and setting up the National genetic bank of agricultural crops.”
Policy_Content: The Cabinet of Ministers decrees to set up National Gene Bank to improve services in the field, as well as to introduce technology for storage and protection of domestic and foreign agricultural plant species in genetic banks, taking into account international standards for plant genetic resources. The main directions of reforming the system of testing services for agricultural crop (plant) varieties shall be identified as follows: (a) bringing the testing of crop (plant) varieties and hybrids of agricultural crops, fruit and ornamental seedlings to the level of international standards, improving the services provided in the field of testing of agricultural crop (plant) varieties; (b) examination of patentability of selection achievements of agricultural crops; (c) introduction of resource-saving and innovative technologies in the testing of agricultural crop (plant) varieties; (d) increase of the efficiency of use of land resources allocated for testing stations and plots of agricultural crops; (e) strengthening the material and technical base of laboratories for quality analysis of agricultural crop (plant) varieties and testing stations and plots under agricultural crop (plant) varieties, creating favorable conditions for attracting highly qualified personnel to agricultural sector; and (f) establishing cooperation with relevant international organizations in the field.

Policy: Ordinance No. V-1141 of the Minister of Health on control of disease caused by COVID-19 (coronavirus infection).
Policy_Content: The Minister orders to oblige catering establishments, restaurants, cafes, bars, nightclubs and other places of entertainment: (a) to limit working hours from 8 to 22 hours; the working time limit does not apply to: (1) food delivery and take away services; and (2) catering in open spaces. Visitor flows shall be limited by ensuring that: (a) each visitor in the visitor service room would be allocated at least 10 sq. m. m .; (b) visitors who buy food to take away or order food to eat on the spot should keep a safe distance of at least 1 meter from each other in queues at the checkout; (c) the distance between the tables would be such that visitors sitting at different tables would be at least 2 meters apart; (d) only visitors wearing protective equipment (face masks, respirators or other means) covering the nose and mouth would be admitted to the premises of the public catering establishment.

Policy: Decree No. V-1142 of the Minister of Health on management outpatients of social service institutions, communities and patients of communal healthcare facilities for childcare.
Policy_Content: The Minister decrees that if catering is organized for the recipients of the service, priority shall be given to the organization of catering in the premises where the classes are held for children. If this is not possible and meals can only be arranged in the common dining rooms, recipients must go in groups of one according to a pre-arranged meal schedule. Buffet meals, where food is provided by the recipients themselves, cannot be arranged. After each group, the common catering room must be ventilated and cleaned.

Policy: Commission Decision in response to COVID-19 regarding suspension of requirement for at-sea transhipment observers until 31 May 2020 (Circular No. 2020/38).
Policy_Content: This Circular of the WCPFC Chair states the endorsement of the Commission of suspension until 31 May 2020 of measures regarding transshipment observers (requirements in paragraph 13 of CMM 2009-06).  Paragraphs 14, 15 and 16 of CMM 2009-06 will be also suspended during the same period when a vessel is not carrying an observer.  Concerned flag CCMs shall indicate, when they send the Transhipment Declaration referred to in paragraph 35(iv) of CMM 2009-06 to the Executive Director, whether the particular at-sea transhipment had occurred under this temporary suspension. CCMs shall ensure that their vessels comply with all other binding requirements established under the Convention and Commission decisions using all MCS tools available, including but not limited to verification of catch and effort and logbook data, VMS and AIS (when available) monitoring and examination of other relevant information such as landing and transhipment data. CCMs whose vessels are subject to this temporary arrangement are encouraged, to the extent practicable and in accordance with their domestic rules and regulations, to implement additional MCS measures and to follow-up these transhipments through inspection or observation or monitor these transhipments electronically if available during the application of the arrangements In doing so, the requirements of a coastal State are to be adhered to by all vessels within that coastal State’s jurisdiction.

Policy: Arrêté n° 051/PM du 12 mai 2020 portant mise en place du Centre de Coordination des Opérations d'Urgences de Santé Publique.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté a pour objet la mise en place auprès du Ministre chargé de la santé publique, un Centre de Coordination des Opérations d'Urgences de Santé Publique, en abrégé (CCOUSP). Le Centre est une instance de coordination des opérations de riposte aux situations d'urgence de santé publique. Il est notamment chargé: d'assurer la mise en oeuvre des plans de riposte aux urgences de santé publique; d'élaborer, mettre en oeuvre et actualiser le programme des exercices de simulation pour la préparation de la riposte aux urgences de santé publique;  d'assurer la disponibilité immédiate des ressources nécessaires aux interventions d'urgence de santé publique; de préparer le système d'alerte, de veille sanitaire et de réponse; d'assurer le renforcement des capacités des acteurs impliqués dans la gestion des urgences de santé publique; d'élaborer, diffuser et mettre en oeuvre les procédures opérationnelles standardisées de gestion sanitaire des urgences de santé publique; d'assurer la liaison avec la protection civile, en cas d'urgence de santé publique, de veiller à l'approvisionnement d'urgence en matériel médico-sanitaire.
Subject: Environment gen., General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Regulation on incentives for the improvement of the system of creation and transfer of knowledge through the development of technical-technological, applied, development and innovative projects in agriculture and rural development.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with the provisions of the Serbian Law on incentives in agriculture and rural development, determines the types of incentives for improving the system of creation and transfer of knowledge through the development of technical-technological, applied, development and innovative projects in agriculture and rural development. This text determines the necessary conditions, manner of exercising the right to incentives and maximum amounts of incentives per user single user and for each type of individual measure. These incentives shall include: 1) incentives for the implementation of technical-technological, applied, development and innovative projects in agriculture and rural development; 2) incentives related to the development of forecasting and reporting activities in the field of plant protection; 3) incentives related to the development of an applied project for the improvement of milk quality in the field of animal husbandry. Incentives for the implementation of technical-technological, applied, development and innovative projects in agriculture and rural development include support for projects related to the improvement of professional knowledge in the field of: 1) field and vegetable crops; 2) fruit growing and viticulture; 3) animal husbandry; 4) organic production; 5) use of renewable energy sources in agriculture; 6) forestry; 7) agroeconomics; 8) rural development; 9) food for the future, in accordance with the Smart Specialization Strategy in the Republic of Serbia for the period from 2020 until 2027 (published in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Serbia 21/2020).

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 160 “On lease payment for public land plots.”
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, with a view of improvement of the collection of lease payments for public land plots, establishes as follows: (a) the amount of annual lease payment for a plot of public land shall be determined by local government and administration of free economic zone, if not otherwise establishes by this Presidential Decree and other Presidential Legislative Acts in the following cases – 1) lease; 2) extension of the period of lease; 3) modification of lease contract; and 3) conclusion of lease contract with the winners of a tender; (b) the amount of annual rent is determined based on the cadastre value with the application of the coefficients (Annex 1) depending upon the type of functional use of the land plot (type of evaluation zone)  (Annex 2), unless otherwise provided by this Presidential Decree; (c) payers of lease for public land plots enjoy the rights and fulfil the obligations established for taxpayers; (d) tax authorities exercise control over compliance with the procedure for calculation and payment of lease by legal entities and completeness and timeliness of payment of lease by citizens and individual entrepreneurs; (e) non-payment or incomplete payment of lease, late payment of lease shall be liable to legal and administrative proceedings.

Policy: Cement Regulations, No. 45 of 2020
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made in accordance with Section 34(1)(a) of the Standards Act, No. 18 of 2005. The purpose of the Regulations include;  (a) lay down product characteristics or their related processes and production methods, including the applicable administrative provisions with which compliance is mandatory; (b) include the terminology, symbols, packaging, marking or labelling requirements as they apply to a product, process or production process; and (c) compel an importer or intermediary to meet the requirements of an intermediary as defined in Clause 9 of NAMS/EN 197-2 which deals with the requirements for dispatching centres. Certain requirements are made for a person who trades in cement or imports same, some other requirements provide that the importer or manufacturer must apply to the regulator for the certification of each cement type and strength class. The Regulations also make requirements for the registration of manufacturing facilities, including requirements for manufacturers inside and outside Namibia.

Policy: Loi n°1/12 du 12 mai 2020 portant Code de la protection sociale.
Policy_Content: Cette loi institue un Code de la protection sociale au Burundi. Le système de protection sociale couvre la population contre les risques économiques et sociaux déterminés par les pouvoirs publics conformément aux normes internationales. Conformément aux articles 4 et 5 de la loi, toute personne a le droit à la protection sociale, à la satisfaction des droits économiques et au libre développement de sa responsabilité, grâce à l'effort national et à la coopération internationale; et au niveau de vie suffisant pour assurer sa santé, son bien-être et ceux de sa famille notamment, par l'alimentation, l'habillement et le logement décent. Cette loi est formée par 236 articles répartis en 4 titres, à savoir: dispositions générales (I); (II) protection générale et promotion de la santé publique; de la protection sociale non contributive (III); et des dispositions relatives au contrôle, à la régulation, aux sanctions et au contentieux de la protection sociale (IV).

Policy: Regulation on the presentation of the cadastral survey study for public inspection.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with the provisions of the Croatian Law on state survey and real estate cadastre, prescribes the manner for exposing to public inspection the data collected and processed by cadastral survey (exposure to public inspection of cadastral data). The public inspection of cadastral data shall be carried out by a commission of the State Geodetic Administration (Commission), appointed by a decision of the Director General of the State Geodetic Administration, at the proposal of the head of the regional cadastre office. Exposure to public inspection of cadastral data shall be carried out, as a rule, in the area where the cadastral survey was carried out. The place of exposure to public inspection of cadastral data shall be determined in agreement with the competent municipal court and the unit of local self-government in the area of which the exposure is performed. Data on holders of rights to cadastral parcels collected in the cadastral survey are auxiliary data that are used for the purpose of presenting cadastral data to the public and for the purposes of establishing, supplementing and renewing the land register.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 316 “On definition of the procedure for prolongation of measures to ensure sanitary-epidemiological well-being of the population in the subjects of the Russian Federation in connection with the spread of new coronavirus infection (COVID-19).”
Policy_Content: The President, with a view of further ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population in the regions of the Russian Federation in connection with the spread of the new coronavirus infection (COVID-19), decrees to ensure: (a) determination within regional boundaries of territories where, in case of necessity, restrictive measures may be extended for the purpose of ensuring sanitary-epidemiological welfare of the population; (b) suspension (limitation, in accordance with the specifics of the work regime, number of employees) of territorially based business entities and individual entrepreneurs; and (c) application of special mode of movement of persons and vehicles, except for vehicles performing inter-regional transportation. In case of suspension (limitation, restriction) of productive activities employees will maintain their salaries. The aforesaid restrictions (limitation) shall not be applicable to organizations supplying foodstuffs to the population.

Policy: Resolution of the Parliament of the Republic of Lithuania “On European solidarity during COVID-19.”
Policy_Content: The Parliament proposes to increase the efficiency of the management of the EU's external borders and to open the Schengen external borders in a coordinated manner. To ensure the smooth movement of goods within the European Union and to maintain the functioning of the internal market. Strengthen food security by increasing direct payments to farmers and setting up special funds. Strengthen cooperation, coordination, monitoring of the epidemiological situation and sharing of good practice between medical institutions in the EU countries, as well as joint searches for vaccines and antivirals. Policy: Presidential Explanatory Statement related to payments for children in single-parent families and children deprived of parental care to reduce the effects of COVID-19.
Policy_Content: The President, in order to reduce the negative economic and social consequences of the emergency or quarantine declared in the territory of the Republic of Lithuania due to the threat of COVID-19 (coronavirus infection) and to stimulate the economy, recommends to implement a financial instrument for domestic consumption - a lump sum for single-parent families and children deprived of parental care. The risk of poverty and the relatively low average disposable income presuppose the expediency of providing additional income to this group of society during the COVID-19 crisis. Legislative act shall stipulate that a lump-sum benefit is granted and paid by municipal administrations in accordance with the procedure established by the Law on Child Benefits and the Regulations for Granting and Paying Child Benefits approved by the Government.

Policy: Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen).
Policy_Content: These Operational Guidelines are intended to provide specific guidance to managers at State, District, and Gram Panchayat levels. Varius component of Open Defecation Free (ODF) Plus - sustainability of ODF status, bio-degradable waste management, plastic waste management, greywater management, faecal sludge management, and modalities for convergence with other schemes have been outlined extensively. The Phase II of Swachh Bharat Mission Grameen will continue to generate employment and provide impetus to the rural economy through construction of household toilets and community sanitary complexes, as well as infrastructure for Solid and Liquid Waste Management such as compost pits, soak pits, waste stabilisation ponds, material recovery facilities, etc.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-4709 “On additional measures for specialization of the regions in the production of agricultural commodities.”
Policy_Content: The President, in order to diversify agriculture, increase the production of competitive products meeting the requirements of the domestic and foreign markets, by specializing the territory of regions in horticulture, viticulture, vegetable and melon growing, potato growing and the production of other foodstuffs, taking into account their soil and climatic conditions, as well as the widespread introduction of scientific innovations and increasing material interest among product manufacturers, decrees to promote gradual specialization of the national territory in the production of certain types of agricultural commodities, in particular in horticulture and viticulture sectors, related to vegetable, potato, melon cultivation, legumes, legumes and glasshouse horticulture. To exempt for the period from January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2023 from customs duties seeds, seedlings and rootstocks, mineral fertilizers, chemical plant protection products, modern energy-saving greenhouses and components for them, drip and sprinkler irrigation systems and components for them imported from abroad, according to the list contained in the Annex 5. This Presidential Decree validates the procedure for the allocation, at the expense of the Fund for the Development of Horticulture and Greenhouse Economy and the Fund for the Support of Winegrowers and Winemakers, of subsidized funds for the construction of boreholes in order to produce water for intensive orchards and vineyards planted in horticultural farms, as well as pumping stations for the purpose of abstracting water from rivers, canals and other waterbodies.

Policy: Guidelines for Employers and Businesses in Nigeria, 2020
Policy_Content: These Guidelines are issued by the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control as part of a campaign to encourage Nigerians to reduce the spread of the Coronavirus. The Guidelines puts in place measures to safely conduct businesses as the country responds to the pandemic and to assist businesses during the easing of the lockdown. The Guidelines contains provisions on general hygiene, COVID-19 prevention measures, movement, etc. for businesses. It allows businesses to be open to the public, partially open, only perform home delivery services, or totally closed, depending on the necessity of its services. It further provides that employers and businesses should develop practices that enable employees to work remotely, limit customers in the business premises, etc. It also has provisions on what to do where there is a suspicion or confirmed case of COVID-19 in the workplace.

Policy: Public Health [2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV)] (No. 13) Regulations, 2020 (L.N. No. 90 of 2020).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under the Public Health Ordinance, introduce measures to contain the spreading of the COVID-19 virus, such as restriction on the freedom of movement and closure of businesses. They define essential services and provide exemptions from restrictive measures for such services. These include, amongst others, water and sewerage-related services and services relating to food, beverage, agriculture and fisheries (the latter specified in detail). Fishermen and farm workers are specifically exempted. Street vending of food and beverages and all retail food services (including restaurants in-house dining, delivery and take-away services), except discount stores, markets, supermarkets, fruit stalls or shops, vegetable stalls or shops, bakeries and “parlours”, for the provision of food or other necessities of life, shall be closed for operation during the period set out by these Regulations.

Policy: Order No. 112/2020 approving for 2020 the Support Scheme Regulation for the Temporary Cessation of Fishing Activities of Multipurpose Vessels.
Policy_Content: This Order approves for 2020 the Regulation for the Support Scheme for the Temporary Cessation of Fishing Activities of Multipurpose Vessels. This Regulation, consisting of 17 articles and one Annex, establishes, within the framework of the EMFF, a support regime for the temporary cessation of fishing activity by shipowners and fisherfolks of vessels licensed for longline, beam trawling, hooks and/or other fishing gear, called multipurpose. The support provided for in this Regulation is intended to compensate shipowners and fisherfolks for the temporary cessation of the activity of the fleet designated as multipurpose, duly licensed, motivated by the outbreak of the new Coronavirus (COVID-19). Annex specifies the financial compensations to vessel owners.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 1492 - Decreto Legislativo que aprueba disposiciones para la reactivación, continuidad y eficiencia de las operaciones vinculadas a la cadena logística de comercio exterior.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo tiene por objeto establecer disposiciones que permitan la reactivación, continuidad y eficiencia de las operaciones vinculadas a la cadena logística de comercio exterior, a consecuencia de la emergencia sanitaria producida por el COVID-19. Su finalidad es: 1) Promover y asegurar la reactivación, continuidad y eficiencia de las operaciones logísticas del comercio exterior, vinculadas al ingreso y salida de mercancías y medios de transporte de carga desde o hacia el país, lo cual incluye la prestación de servicios de transporte de carga y mercancías vinculados a la cadena logística de comercio exterior, en todos sus modos, así como las actividades conexas al mismo de acuerdo con lo estipulado por el Ministerio de Transportes y Comunicaciones; 2) Procurar la digitalización de los documentos y procesos de las entidades públicas y privadas, para optimizar el tiempo de las operaciones, prevenir y reducir el riesgo de contagio del personal que presta servicios en toda la cadena logística y brindarle mejores condiciones de salubridad; 3) Garantizar la transparencia en los costos de los servicios de la cadena logística de comercio exterior, la cual se ha visto afectada a consecuencia de la emergencia sanitaria nacional ocasionada por el COVID-19.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 1490 - Decreto Legislativo que fortalece los alcances de la telesalud.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo, — considerando que la pandemia ocasionada por el COVID-19 ha demostrado la importancia de utilizar la telesalud para brindar atención, especialmente como medio de reducir el riesgo de contaminación causada por el contacto cercano, y que la telesalud debe trascender la respuesta a la emergencia, fortaleciendo la capacidad de respuesta de nuestro sistema de salud —, tiene por objeto dictar disposiciones destinadas a fortalecer los alcances de la telesalud. El presente Decreto Legislativo modifica e introduce nuevas definiciones; entre ellas la de telesalud: Servicio de salud a distancia prestado por personal de la salud competente, a través de las Tecnologías de la Información y de la Comunicación (TIC), para lograr que estos servicios y sus relacionados, sean accesibles y oportunos a la población. Este servicio se efectúa considerando los siguientes ejes de desarrollo de la telesalud: la prestación de los servicios de salud, la gestión de los servicios de salud; la información, educación y comunicación con pertinencia cultural y lingüística; y el fortalecimiento de capacidades al personal de la salud, entre otros.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 1489 - Decreto Legislativo que establece acciones para la protección de los pueblos indígenas u originarios en el marco de la emergencia sanitaria declarada por el COVID-19.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo tiene por objeto establecer medidas extraordinarias y urgentes dirigidas a brindar atención a pueblos indígenas u originarios, en el marco de la emergencia sanitaria declarada por el COVID-19, con la finalidad de asegurar que el Estado, en sus distintos niveles de gobierno, implemente acciones urgentes y extraordinarias para la atención de los pueblos indígenas u originarios durante la emergencia sanitaria ocasionada por el COVID-19, a efectos de: 1) Garantizar el cumplimiento de los derechos lingüísticos en sus dimensiones individual y colectiva, a través del diseño, la implementación de mecanismos, estrategias y acciones; sobre el uso, preservación, revitalización, desarrollo, recuperación, fomento y difusión de las lenguas indígenas u originarias del Perú; 2) Promover la prestación de servicios públicos en la lengua materna con énfasis en la población perteneciente a un pueblo indígena u originario, tomando en cuenta las necesidades y condiciones específicas de mujeres y hombres de los pueblos indígenas; 3) Asegurar mecanismos de articulación con entidades públicas que destinen servicios para la atención de la población indígena u originaria, con criterios de pertinencia, adecuación cultural y de género, oportunidad, eficiencia y calidad; 4) Salvaguardar la vida, salud e integridad de los pueblos indígenas u originarios, con especial atención en aquellos pueblos que se encuentran en situaciones de aislamiento y en situación de contacto inicial.

Policy: Ordinance No. 124-p validating the standard of work related to the implementation of measures to prevent the spread of new coronavirus infection (COVID-19) in the organization of trade firs (except for non-stationary trade fairs).
Policy_Content: This Ordinance, with a view of prevention of the spread of a new coronavirus infection (COVID-19), establishes that organizational measures related trade fairs must envisage application of the following arrangements: (a) trade fairs shall operate for at maximum six hours in a working day; (b) in the trade pavilion the width of the aisles for visitors at two-way placement of trade rows must be of at least 4.5 m, with unilateral distance at least 2.5 m, the distance between sellers in the trade in rows of at least 5 m or the presence of a gap between the trading places is not less than 2 m; (c) customers must be informed of mandatory compliance with sanitary and epidemiological requirements; and (d) food consumption (eating) at workplace shall be prohibited; food consumption (eating) shall be authorized exclusively in a specially designated room.

Policy: Resolution of the Legislative Assembly of the Autonomous Region of the Azores No. 14/2020/A approving the Global Plan for the gradual resumption of economic activity.
Policy_Content: In the current pandemic situation, the immediate priority is to respond to the public health problem, which requires measures against the functioning of an economy made up of relationships, interactions and connections. The result of this social distance, effective from the point of view of public health, is responsible for the rapid contraction of economic activity, which will lead, in the short term, to a strong recession, insolvencies and unusually high levels of unemployment and, inevitably, to consequent serious social problems. Thus, the Legislative Assembly of the Autonomous Region of the Azores resolves to recommend to the Regional Government of the Azores the following: 1 - With the highest priority, start the elaboration of a Global Plan for the progressive resumption of economic activity, covering all the productive sectors. 2 - The Plan must respect the following assumptions, defined by the WHO, in order to promote a return to normality: a) The transmission is controlled; b) Health systems are equipped with the ability to detect, test, isolate, treat and track all contacts; c) Outbreak risks are minimized in special contexts, such as health facilities and nursing homes; d) Preventive measures are in place in workplaces, educational establishments and others where access by the population is essential; e) The risks of importing the virus can be managed; f) Communities are educated, involved and trained to adjust to the new standards.

Policy: Law No.175 of 2020 on Combating Corruption in the Public Sector and establishing the National Anti-Corruption Commission.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 28 articles divided into IV Sections aims at ensuring that anti-corruption and integrity policies are being set within the State in a coherent and impactful manner. The Law focuses on several points, including corruption crimes, procedures for investigation and prosecution of crimes of corruption, the authority of the National Anti-corruption Commission, and the importance of spreading awareness. The Law defines corruption as “the abuse of power or activity in connection with public money for the purpose of generating illicit personal profits or advantages for his benefit or for the benefit of third parties whether directly or indirectly”. Act of corruption crimes in the public sector includes (i) improper implementation of a public person’s obligations, or obtaining licenses from a public person for a private benefit if its occurrence is contrary to the law; (ii) using public funds, state means and other public persons for a private benefit; and (iii) buying or selling a movable or immovable property through information obtained not available to the public such as the issuance of new laws and regulations that could have an impact on the prices (art.3). Special principles for investigation and prosecution of corruption crimes are dealt with in Chapter II which establishes that investigations and criminal prosecutions for corruption crimes can be carried out without the need to obtain any of the prior permits or licenses noted in the law whenever such prosecution has taken place at the request of the National Anti-Corruption Commission. Criminal prosecution for corruption offenses does not terminate in the event of resignation, dismissal, or retirement from service, or the end of the period of public service (art.4). Article 5 establishes the National Anti-corruption Commission with the aim of (i) combatting, preventing, and exposing corruption; (ii) implementing relevant international agreements and treaties to which Lebanon is a party; and (iii) performing the specific tasks entrusted to it defined in this and other laws. The Commission shall be entrusted with the following functions (i) receive statements relating to corruption, investigate corruption crimes, study them and refer them, when necessary, to other relevant supervisory, disciplinary, and judicial bodies; (ii) monitor corruption status, cost, causes, efforts to combat and prevent corruption, and develop special or periodic reports in these matters; and (iii) may ask any Lebanese or foreign authority to provide it with documents or information it deems useful for the proper exercise of its tasks. (art.18). The National Anti-Corruption Commission shall develop studies and research, issue reports, guides, and specialized publications in the area promoting integrity, anti-corruption, and prevention, as well as create a database for all issued knowledge (art.26).

Policy: Environmental Framework Act (No. 97 of 2020).
Policy_Content: This Act is about the protection and sustainable management of the environment in Suriname and the implementation and carrying into effect of obligations deriving from the membership of Suriname to international agreements, notably the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change, the UN Convention on Biological Diversity, the Paris Agreement and the Stockholm and Rotterdam (Conventions on POPs and PIC respectively). Another important matter is the investigation, prosecution and trial of offences defined in this Act as environmental offences. The Act is composed of 77 articles divided into 11 Chapters: General provisions (I); The National Environment Authority (II); Duty of Care (III); Environmental Strategy (IV); Activities and Environmental Consequences (V); Control of Pollution - Environmental Pollution and Standards (VI); Waste and Hazardous Substances (VII); Legal Protection Mechanisms (VIII); Environmental offences and Sanctions (IX); Provisions on Enforcement and further provisions (X); Transitional and Final Provisions (XI).

Policy: Decreto por el que se reforma y adiciona el artículo 4º de la Constitución Política de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos.
Policy_Content: En virtud del presente Decreto se reforma el párrafo cuarto y se adicionan los párrafos décimo cuarto, décimo quinto y décimo sexto del artículo 4º de la Constitución Política de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos, relativo al derecho a la salud.  La nueva disposición establece que toda Persona tiene derecho a la protección de la salud. La Ley definirá las bases y modalidades para el acceso a los servicios de salud y establecerá la concurrencia de la Federación y las entidades federativas en materia de salubridad general. La Ley también definirá un sistema de salud para el bienestar, con el fin de garantizar la extensión progresiva, cuantitativa y cualitativa de los servicios de salud para la atención integral y gratuita de las personas que no cuenten con seguridad social. Por otro lado, se contempla por parte del Estado la entrega de un apoyo económico a las personas que tengan discapacidad permanente en los términos que fije la Ley. Para recibir esta prestación tendrán prioridad las y los menores de dieciocho años, las y los indígenas y las y los afromexicanos hasta la edad de sesenta y cuatro años y las personas que se encuentren en condición de pobreza.

Policy: Decreto Nº 637 - Declara un Estado de Emergencia Económica, Social y Ecológica en todo el territorio Nacional.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 20-B/2020 establishing an extraordinary and temporary support, through salary compensation, to fisherfolks as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, establishes an extraordinary and temporary support, through salary compensation, to fisherfolks as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. In particular, it establishes an allocation of wage compensation, as follows: to small-scale fishing professionals referred to in Article 3(14) of Regulation (EU) No. 508/2014 of 15 May, on the European Fund for Maritime Affairs and Fisheries, wage compensation is provided, as far as, under the terms of the present legislation: a) the obstacles to the exercise of the work are proven, resulting from a record of loss of fish value equal to or greater than 40% compared to the same period of the previous two years; or b) difficulty in recruiting crews due to hygienic isolation due to the COVID-19 pandemic is proven. The amount of wage compensation to be attributed is calculated according to the criteria provided for in Article 5 of Decree-Law No. 311/99 of 10 August. The provisions of this article also apply, with the necessary adaptations: a) to nurseries, individual holders of aquaculture exploration licenses with production declaration in one of the last two years; b) fishermen licensed for inland fishing and catchers, holders of a valid license, when exercising the activity on an exclusive basis.

Policy: Basic Safety Standards for Ionising Radiation (Amendment) Regulations, 2020.
Policy_Content: These regulations amend the Basic Safety Standards for Ionising Radiation Regulations, 2018. In particular they amend: regulation six concerning the allowed dose constraints for the purpose of prospective optimisation of protection; regulations eight regarding the age limit to be assigned to any exposed work; regulation ten oncerning the protection of pregnant workers; Regulations 14A (on the introduction of a course on radiation protection in the basic curriculum of medical and dental schools) and 14B (on the information to be provided to the employer for ensuring effective and comprehensive protection) are added. Regulation seventeen on the information to be provided to the emergency workers who are identified in an emergency response plan. Regulation 21 is added, concerning the resources to be allocated for the Commission Secretariat to develop expertise. Regulation 32 on the control to be applied to practices which are not exempted from authorisation is revised and 32A is added on registers to be kept by the Secretariat. Regulation 48 on the necessity to annually recalibrate monitoring equipment used for radiological surveillance of the workplace. Regulation 62 on the excess of exposure of spacecraft crew and 64 on the areas within workplaces, where the radon concentration exceed the national reference level. Regulation 65 on health screenings and on medical exposure for medical or biomedical research undertakings. Regulation 66 on the review of the use, by the Commission, of diagnostic reference levels for radio-diagnostic examinations. Regulation 71 on training and recognition requirements for the practitioner, the medical physics expert and the individuals referred to in regulation 69. Regulation 72 on the responsibility to ensure that the equipment is fit for clinical use. Regulation 76 on the calibration of equipment used for dosimetry of patients and acceptance or constancy testing. Regulation 89 on the national radiological protection plan. Regulation 91 on the national radiological protection plan regulating the event of an emergency on or outside Maltese territory A provision is added at regulation 100 concerning the duty of the undertakings to record and take action on any report received from a worker that identifies any radiological safety concern. Regulation 101 on safety assessments under the responsibility of the undertakings. A provision is added on regulation 105 on the possible appointment of a radiation protection expert. Regulation 114 on the necessary licence for any practice involving a high activity source. Regulation 122 providing that the national radiological emergency plan shall take into account the risks identified in the national radiological hazard assessment performed by the Commission. Finally, schedules 4, 10, 11 and seventeen are also revised.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Inspection,Radiation,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Environmental audit,Public health

Policy: Presidential Decree no. 161/20 creating the National Agency for Mineral Resources (ANRM) and approving its Statute.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree creates the National Agency for Mineral Resources (ANRM) and approves its Statute. The Statute, consisting of 44 articles divided into five Chapters and three Annexes, establishes that ANRM is the public agency aimed to regulate, monitor and promote the Mining Sector in Angola. In addition, it is responsible for regulating the participation in the recognition, prospection, exploration, treatment, marketing, export and import of mineral products, as well as for regulation and inspection of mining activities in the country, in order to ensure sustainable management and use of mineral resources. AANRM guarantees compliance with the Mining Code and applicable legislation, by monitoring the exercise of mining rights granted by the State. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Agency, entitled to perform the following activities: Regulating the Mining Sector; Monitoring the geological-mining activities; Instruct processes for granting rights related to mineral resources in the country; Perform public certification and/or dispute functions; Exercise the function of quality control of mineral resources and mineral products; Ensure the rational use of mineral resources in the country, as well as the recovery and sustainability of the environment; Guarantee and promote fair competition and good practices in the Mining Sector; Create technical conditions and quality and safety standards for products and services in the Mining Sector; Assist the competent State bodies in the overall planning of national mining, etc.

El presente Protocolo tiene como finalidad contribuir con la prevención del contagio por COVID 19 en al ámbito laboral, a partir de la emisión de lineamientos generales para la vigilancia de la salud de los trabajadores, y se aplica a las embarcaciones de la flota anchovetera industrial con permiso de pesca vigente, plantas de procesamiento de harina y aceite de pescado con licencia de operación vigente.

Se crea el Registro Nacional para Medidas COVID-19 en el marco de la Emergencia Sanitaria, cuya elaboración, administración y soporte tecnológico se encuentra a cargo del Registro Nacional de Identificación y Estado Civil (RENIEC), en el marco de la Emergencia Sanitaria. El Registro Nacional consolida y sistematiza la relación de hogares a nivel nacional, para la adecuada identificación de aquellos hogares elegibles para los subsidios económicos que se otorgan en el marco de la Emergencia Sanitaria declarada mediante el Decreto Supremo Nº 008-2020-SA, y/o del Estado de Emergencia Nacional declarado mediante el Decreto Supremo Nº 044- 2020-PCM, y sus prórrogas.

Policy: Memorandum Circular No. 16, Series of 2020 on the Guidelines on Financial Grant Assistance to Farmers and Fisherfolk Cooperatives/Associations and Community Based Organizations under the Enhanced "Kadiwa ni Ani at Kita Inclusive Food Supply Chain Program".
Policy_Content: Pursuant to the declaration of State of Emergency under Republic Act No. 11469 ("Bayanihan Act of 2020"), the Department of Agriculture (DA) among others has been tasked to "ensure availability of food by adopting measures as may reasonably be necessary to facilitate and/or minimize disruption to the supply chain, especially for basic commodities and services to the maximum extent possible". These Memorandum Circular establishes the Guidelines on Financial Grant Assistance to Farmers and Fisherfolk Cooperatives/Associations and Community Based Organizations under the Enhanced "Kadiwa ni Ani at Kita Inclusive Food Supply Chain Program". The Program seeks to ensure food commodities available and accessible in high consumer demand areas, particularly among the poor and low-income families, by harnessing private sector participation, capacity enhancement of farmers' cooperatives and associations and engaging community organizations' participation in food supply distribution system.

Policy: Resolution No. 286 of 2020 of Georgian Government on Targeted State Program to Mitigate Damage from Infection (COVID-19) caused by Novel Coronavirus SARS-COV-2
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Targeted State Program to Mitigate Damage from Infection (COVID-19) caused by Novel Coronavirus SARS-COV-2. The program sets out the rules for providing state aid in order to compensate for the damage caused by an epidemic / pandemic caused by the novel coronavirus, the persons eligible for the compensation and the amount of the compensation. The Resolution consists of three articles: General provisions (1); The right to receive compensation and its amount (2); and Administration of the payment of the compensation (3). The program primarily applies to persons on parental leave, socially vulnerable families (the low income families who are eligible for social assistance) and persons with disabilities.
Subject: Food & nutrition, General
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia
